description:
This review's visual equivalent is a little man enthusiastically applauding and about to launch out of his chair.  We made last-minute reservations here, low expectations, and we were immediately thrilled to find ourselves in a sweet, old-school (think in the sense of "friendly" rather than "fusty"), romantic place.  It's narrow and tall, with nooks and a mezzanine, and small attention to detail that make you feel like you're in a friend's home.  The maitre d' was charming and paid us attention; the waiter was equally so.  

I like wine, so we brought a bottle, but it turns out their list (which I didn't see on line) is pretty magnificent.  There's a good mix of the cult and the more mainstream, and everything is really reasonably priced. 

Our meal was great -- a burrata appetizer and a mushroom bisque, steak and a beef bolognese pasta.  Everything was seasoned perfectly, with lingering flavors and great textures and it's, y'know, pricey not insanely expensive.  Go here with someone you love and when you leave you'll still be in love but you'll also love this place.
author: George G.

description:
Seriously underwhelming. 

Kudos to the host-station staff for a warm welcome and for managing table flow expertly -- we were seated immediately. Sadly, this was the high point of the experience for our group. 

Our server was oddly fascinated with the two couples at the table behind us. They seemed neither particularly challenging nor unusual, yet he watched them most of the time he was attending to our table. When he brought our wine, he opened it with his back to us while he chatted with the other customers. That was a first in my experience. Was it because we passed on the bottled water? Perhaps we were less handsome? We may never know, but now we have something to talk about for a while to come. 

It didn't get better. Subsequent visits from our server were an off-putting mix of faux chumminess and complete disinterest. When we tried to order appetizers, his response was a clipped, "Chef prefers to receive the appetizer and entrée orders at the same time" followed immediately by an about-face and speedy exit. This fellow was absolutely not interested in any reaction we may have had to his curt announcement. By the time we realized he had actually declined to take our order, he was on the other side of the room. 

When he did deign to take our order, he'd belt out a rehearsed line with too much volume and zest ("Just to let you know, gentlemen, my favorite is the gnocchi!") while his face and mannerisms conveyed a different message ("get me away from these tap-water-drinking rubes.")

One member of our party dared to point out that his entrée, the duck breast on spaetzle, as well as the plate on which it sat, was cool, he got a pursed-lipped seminar on how duck often is not warm in the center. Fascinating lecture, but the customer was right -- interior, exterior, side elements and plate all had the temperature of a plate left sitting away from the warmer too long while other entrees were completed. Our server warned -- yes, this happened -- that reheating the food would result in it becoming overcooked. The customer patiently explained that other chefs manage to achieve medium-rare duck breast that is not cold to the touch, and that the choice being presented did not seem in keeping with the reputation of Frascati.

However pained he looked to do it, he whisked the plate away. When he returned with the reassembled elements, the impossible had been achieved -- still-rare duck warm on the exterior and spaetzle at an edible temperature. It seems he under-estimated his chef. 

I could go on and on. Heaven knows we did when we decided to pass on dessert ("The cheesecake is my favorite!!!") and make an early exit from a place we'd hoped would be excellent. 

It was far from excellent. The pastas and appetizers were adequate, but nowhere near good enough to erase the effect of genuinely peculiar service. The steak tartare, by the way, tastes like a plate of beets. The beef is 100 percent MIA from the tasting experience. 

So, i'm putting this down as a bit of bad luck -- hitting a good place on a bad night, or just getting a server who is a seriously weak link the the business. Either way, there is no thought of returning.
author: Michael H.

description:
Warm, welcoming and delicious... there is a reason people go to Frascati over and over again! We started with the gnocchi as well as the burrata; both fresh and beautifully presented. I loved my wild caught salmon entree: served poached with a crispy skin. To. Die. For. Also, the banana creme brûlée pana cotta is not to be missed. 

A wonderful meal! I'll be back!
author: Leonie S.

description: Wonderful food and atmosphere. Only 4/5 because it was extremely hot inside of the restaurant, but in all fairness it was a warmer than usual day in SF. Lamb parpaddalle was incredible. Looking forward to returning!
author: Natalie S.

description:
Frascati, on the corner of Hyde and Green, is a cozy, delightful and friendly restaurant. We started the meal with Lobster Bisque with crème fraiche and toasted brioche. Amazingly fresh and great for dipping. Along with Russet Potato Gnocchi with butternut squash, chanterelle mushrooms, sage, parmesan and white truffle oil. No fancier way to eat potatoes, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The main courses were the Roasted Half Chicken with brussel sprouts, cipollini onions, herb bread crumbs, baby spinach, fingerling potatoes and lemon-oregano. Winner-winner hearty chicken dinner. Lol. Pan Seared Bluenose Bass with kabocha squash puree, cauliflower, beet tops, citrus beurre blanc and fine herbs. A delightfully seared and flaky fish. Dessert, the warm white and dark chocolate bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream, caramel and chocolate sauce is an item not to pass up. The crème brulee... you can pass on. Lol. My wife sure knows how to start the celebrations off right. Cheers! #GratefulAndJustPlainFull #AreYouGonnaFinishThat? 
#DoHashtagsWorkHere?
author: Raja R.

description:
I love this restaurant, and was so excited to bring my boyfriend here while visiting SF this weekend! 

Atmosphere/Parking:
Great location right on the corner of Green & Hyde in Russian Hill with a very warm & friendly environment. Parking is NOT good and the restaurant recommends you park at Polk & Broadway in a lot next to Walgreens. It's about 4 blocks away so not too bad, but the walk is uphill and I was hoping to find something closer. We left at 7:35 for an 8pm reservation and spent about 15 minutes looking for parking. Not Frascati's fault that parking is bad, just something to be weary of. 

Service: 
I felt bad we were 15 mins late to our reservation, but Frascati sat us immediately at a nice table for two in the back of the restaurant. Staff was friendly and our waitress was so sweet. The kitchen had leftover gnocchi so they graciously gave us a free plate of it! Great way to start the meal as we were stressed from parking situation and being late to the restaurant. Our waitress was very attentive and their customer service was great. 

Food:
I've been here several times and am a huge fan of the food here and this time did not disappoint! The cheese plate was delicious with 4 different cheeses and condiments such as almonds/walnuts, marmalade, apples, and fresh bread. It was surprisingly delicious and I enjoyed all the cheeses. Great variety of flavors. I had the duck, which was incredible and cooked perfectly. The maple sauce with the duck is amazing. My boyfriend had the lamb pappardelle and loved it. Very meaty - almost like pulled pork consistency and not short on lamb at all. Pasta was homemade and cooked al dente. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals and the experience. Was so glad I chose to eat here again! 

Love the restaurant and the neighborhood - Russian Hill is so cute and quiet. A definite must for anyone visiting the city!
author: Katie R.

description: Good, Italian spot. Intimate atmosphere. Probably not a restaurant you would go to for an every day meal but definitely worth it for a good date night spot. I was here at a work dinner and will definitely be bringing my wife back here.
author: Matt M.

description:
FOOD
- Russet Potato Gnocchi: gnocchi with tomatoes, corn, parmesan and white truffle oil. Lacked flavor and the consistency of the gnocchi was soft. It didn't have that slight chewiness I like. 3/5

- Strawberry Salad: greens, strawberry, smoked duck, ricotta salata cheese, and balsamic vinaigrette: decent salad. Nothing to comment about. 3/5

- Almond Toffee Panna Cotta: By far the winner of the night! I've never had panna cotta before so I don't have anything to compare it to. I just know it was amazing! Probably one of my favorite desserts ever. I could eat this all day! Needless to say, I highly recommend this dessert! 5/5

SERVICE
We were immediately greeted and seated. Our servers were professional and attentive. Great service. 5/5

FINAL THOUGHTS
I wasn't impressed with the food, but boy o boy I was impressed with their dessert! I want to come back just for the panna cotta.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
I picked this place for my 1,000 Yelp review - AND my 2nd anniversary dinner celebration.

While the current Yelp rating is a 4.5, if I had read the reviews more closely I might not have chosen this place.

It has been around for ages (and the clientele surrounding us were all in there 70's (if I am being kind and low-balling it) - so that was sort of a red flag.

The service was fine, the food was just either bland, or in the case of the short rib way too salty, I make a much better short rib at home.

I did love the bread, and the bread pudding dessert. Also the bread salad (I guess we have a theme? - BREAD!)

Since we shared everything (plus a bottle of wine) - it was only $133, which for an anniversary dinner is on the low side.  Glad I checked it off the bucket list, but was fairly disappointed.
author: Amy W.

description: Outstanding neighborhood restaurant! Just a delightful evening with outstanding food & service!
author: John S.

description:
I came to Frascati with my friend. It was our first time visiting the restaurant and have to say, it left us a great memory--Great staff with great recommendations; awesome food & wine; cute environment.

For starter, we ordered gnocchi. I really liked the sweet corn added to the dish--add some flavor and texture contrast.

For the second course, we ordered the octopus salad. This was probably my least favorite dish among the ones we have tried. It was okay but wish the octopus could be more crunchy and the salad could be more well seasoned & flavored. I have had much better octopus salad in other Italian/Mediterranean restaurants.

For the entrees, we ordered Grilled Pork Chop & Maple Leaf Duck Breast (5/5 for both). The pork chop was probably the best I have had for a while in the city. It's super tender and super juicy and super flavorful. Love the sauce accompanied the pork chop! And for the duck, I am always a big fan for duck. Yum!

For dessert, our waiter recommended the bread pudding. My friend and I weren't expecting that much. I am personally not a big fan for bread pudding but since the waiter has made pretty good recommendations so far, we trusted him. However, when we had our first bite, we couldn't stop. This was not a standard bread pudding. It was kinda chewy, crunchy at the same time and the topped ice cream had a vanillay & coffeey taste. Altogether, the dish was not overly sweet and flavors were well-balanced. SO GLAD that we got to try this. AMAZING.

Recommend to check this place out!
author: Clare L.

description:
I came to Frascati with a friend who has been before and was a *huge* advocate of their cheesecake deserts.

Nice upscale atmosphere (great for dates), friendly and attentive staff and good wine selection made for a very pleasant dining experience. We shared a few smaller dishes (all good) to save room for the cheesecake. 

The cheesecake lived up to its reputation. The special was a chocolate and caramel covered cheesecake that was exquisite. As most cheesecakes are, it was heavy and I would have wanted to take some home for a snack but it was too good to resist eating all at once.
author: Chris G.

description:
Wow, what a find! 

The food is amazing. The place is romantic. The owners are super sweet. What else can you ask for?

Ok, parking in the area is a pain. Uber there if you can.
author: Cindy C.

description:
5 stars for the food. Like omg it's so gooood.
2.5 stars for the service.
So 3.5 stars overall.

Online Yelp reservations make it really easy and quick to plan an evening out.

Food was really good. We ordered their veal gnocchi special, sea bass with asparagus and farro, with the octopus salad and two desserts (those were the real winners- apple cobbler and bread pudding). 

Everything was cooked perfectly, had great flavors and complementing textures! 

Only negative was the service. It wasn't where they disappear and never come back situation- I'd actually prefer that to our situation, it was the exact opposite! We had four people hovering over us all evening. Every few minutes they'd take turns asking how we're doing and if we need anything, like they were trying to turn the table in an empty restaurant. It got really frustrating because I couldn't catch up with my friend when someone was coming over asking the exact same question we just answered.

Hopefully they were just overstaffed on a slow night... But it definitely put a damper on the evening.
author: Mandi W.

description: This place is superb. We have never had a bad meal here. Food and service are both exceptional.
author: Farrah L.

description: Ambience was great as well as the food . Our waiter really helped us out pick the right stuff to order .
author: Namrah S.

description: This is an amazing restaurant. The ambiance was pretty romantic and warm, so that was awesome. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday celebration on a Saturday evening. We were not disappointed and loved our experience. We had the burrata appetizer - MINDBLOWING. How they prepared that cheese was just incredible. I had the pork chop while my bf got the duck; both dishes were full of flavor. The duck breast had such a delicious sauce! At the end, I ordered the panna cotta with slices of banana on the side. It came with a bday candle so that was really cute. Extraordinary experience. 10/10 would recommend!!
author: Bonnie W.

description:
A compact, romantic place for hearty Italian fare paired with quality wines. I liked being able to choose among several wines by doing half glasses of each, and the server was very patient and obliging in offering suggestions for pairing. In my case, a cream of mushroom soup, as well as a meaty pappardelle dish went down satisfyingly alongside the wine. 

A perfect venue for date night - but do make sure to get reservations.
author: Vincent L.

description: I am always impressed when I can get a vegetarian risotto or gnocchi with many toppings in them. I was pleased to see options that included fall favorites like pumpkin seeds and butternut squash. I would highly recommend the risotto! Also, the black and white bread pudding was very chocolatey with just a bit of a white "chocolate," which was good. It had an interesting ribbon of something in it that I didn't recognize though. You'd have to ask the chef about that. Also, I realize that I love hazelnut ice cream. Next time I'd like to try the burrata (partially because of my love of figs). Ps. Read the menu at the bottom. It's pretty funny!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Consistantly excellent!
Great food, brilliant wine list.  Warm and attentive service and you cant beat the location for San Francisco's Russian Hill charm.  

For starters; Gnocchi with a light white truffle infusion...a must have along with the octopus salad.  Followed by the "grilled buttery roasted chicken"... or the duck breast. Holy hell !!... I can decide..they are all very good.

Save room for the owner's made-on-site desserts....."black and white bread pudding", my favorite!

I have been dining at Frascati for 15 years...they nail it every time.
Bravo
Jeff C.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Chocolate bread pudding?? oh yes.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a restaurant for dinner with a nice ambience and a hint of romance (and where we wouldn't feel like sardines packed inside a tin can like most restaurants in San Fran). We stumbled upon Frascati on Yelp and decided to give it a shot, and boy what a good shot it was. The lighting was perfect, the tables just far apart enough so you wouldn't feel like you were eavesdropping on your fellow diner's conversation. It's a smaller restaurant but that makes it feel so much more private and personal. For appetizers we had gnocchi and the meat tartare, both delicious! I ordered the Alaskan Halibut and it was probably some of the best I've ever had. Cooked to perfection, it just melted in my mouth and fall apart on the plate, a truly beautiful mess. For dessert we had the chocolate bread pudding with ice-cream on top, which was to die for! Overall, the service was great, super friendly staff, and lovely atmosphere for dinner.
author: Alexa M.

description:
What a cozy, neighborhood gem. I came here for a birthday dinner with my sister and had a lovely meal. I was able to grab a reservation just a day in advance and was glad I did since the restaurant was bustling at 7pm on a Sunday. By the time we left close to 9 however, the place had mostly emptied out. 

We started with the strawberry salad, which was crisp and refreshing, with some delicious duck mixed in to add a savory kick. Generous portions as well. We were both feeling like pasta, so I ordered the pappardelle with pork sugo (basically shredded, saucy pork shoulder) and my sister opted for the fettucine with beef bolognese. Both were delicious! Highly recommend both. 

We ended with the black and white bread pudding which is basically a large brownie topped with hazelnut ice cream. I was a little disappointed in this one, since parts of the bread pudding were a little dry and hard and it wasn't as moist as I was hoping it'd be. 

Friendly and attentive service throughout the meal. I would definitely come back for a fancier meal that doesn't break the bank!
author: Vivian L.

description:
I went to school in SF, and I came here with a friend after completing our very last finals before graduating.
The restaurant has a really nice romantic ambiance.
Everyone at the restaurant was welcoming, and our server was quick and attentive. 
We were seated on the upstairs and ordered octopus salad to share, and I had the duck breast. 
The octopus salad was refreshing and duck was cook perfectly.
Only thing that makes me hesitant about going back is the parking situation. 
We almost gave up eating here because of the parking issue.
Other than that, I had a great experience dining at Frascati.
I would love to come back with my husband when we figure out about the parking issue.
author: Hyemin J.

description:
Winner, winner chicken dinner. Or should I say chicken, fettuccini, halibut and steak dinners. 

That's what our party ordered at this great neighborhood establishment in San Francisco. We were visiting in the city and found this place on a Saturday night. It's an upscale casual environment. 

We started our meals with the gnocchi, corn bisque, and strawberry salad with smoked duck. The gnocchi was the best I've ever had. The soup was very good. The smoked duck on the salad was delicious. After the appetizers came the main courses. Steak was cooked to perfection; halibut was meaty and very fresh; the chicken was tender and juicy; the fettuccini came with an octopus Bolognese that was a hit. 

Since we were celebrating a birthday in our group, we ordered dessert. We ordered bread pudding, the peach-blueberry cobbler, and a couple of sorbets. I only tried the bread pudding because everything else had been good and the bread pudding was no exception (it's the second best bread pudding I've ever had). It actually resembles a brownie and comes with a scoop of homemade hazelnut ice cream. The cobbler was also excellent and was served with homemade vanilla ice cream. 

The only negatives to the evening were the parking troubles (give yourself at least 10 minutes to find a spot) and the single stall restroom; however,  the food, service, and ambience more than made up for it. Next time I'm in the city, Frascati will get a visit.
author: Kelvin J.

description:
This place is just ehh. I feel like I am being generous giving it 3 stars. Maybe I just had too high of expectations given the high reviews on Yelp and Google. However, out of a group of 7, each of us left underwhelmed and disappointed. 

The overall experience can be rated as such: 

Service: 3 stars (being generous here)
-Had to ask for refills for everything after they sat empty for some time
-two of the three servers seemed annoyed and stood around and talked crap about the other staff members...Classy.
-We accidently broke a wine glass getting into the cramped tables with a wheel chair (totally our bad) and the waitress made a rude comment and almost seemed pissed at us for the duration of the evening? 
-"rules" say no baseball caps (this is entirely understandable) HOWEVER, kitchen staff are totally visible from all parts of the restaurant given the open kitchen concept and two of them had sports team baseball caps on? 

Food: 3 stars 
- octopus salad: overly dressed but enjoyable (4 stars) 
-Duck Breast: total disappointment. cold/barely warm when served, over cooked, unbrowned, and dry. (1.5 stars) 
-Chicken: very good flavor and very juicy (4.5 stars) 
-pork chop: nice flavor, very juicy, but did not come out hot (3.5 stars) 
-Papardelle: nice flavor, well executed (4 stars) 

-Chocolate Bread Pudding: just OK. Also was not very warm, didn't even start to melt ice cream (3 stars) 
-Kiwi Sorbet: Amazing!! (5 stars) 
-Affagato: just ok. (3 stars) 

Ambience: 4.5 stars 
-great place to watch cable car go by 
-Very romantic little restaurant 
-the only thing that took away from the environment was the lackluster customer service

Overall, there are much better choices in the city. In fact, there are better choices on the same block. So, unless you are looking for a romantic setting to watch the cable car go by, save yourself the trip and go elsewhere.
author: Alyssa F.

description: Sorry if this is a harsh review, but when you pay close to $150 to eat out you would hope it's better than what you can make at home. It was a disappointing experience. Had high hopes that it's going to be a great meal. I had a steak, I'm not sure how as a chef you can go so wrong with making a steak. Very very chewy bland flavor... the vegetables were good...Thank god. My date had the duck.. my god the reviews about how good the duck suppose to be... I have no idea why it's highly reviewed, it was ok nothing special about it.  The octopus salad maybe the only thing was ok. Won't eat here again.
author: Moe N.

description:
Tuesday night date night kinda place and that's what we came here for. Everything was good, but nothing too exciting that I would go back for. 

We got the gnocchi to start with, then a butternut squash risotto and some pappardelle paired with a decent bottle of red wine. The chocolate bread pudding we ended the night with might be my fav thing of the evening, followed by the gnocchi.
author: Romeeta S.

description:
This place was great! The service and food was delicious.  We had the duck and half chicken , two deserts and lots of wine. The chicken was tender and the duck was great. The portions are a little small, but it was very flavorful. The waitress was very attentive and friendly  as well. The ambiance was good and it was nice to see the owner running the kitchen and greeting people. 
I highly recommend for a date ! Very romantic ambiance
author: Michelle K.

description:
Finally got a chance to try this place. My experience was ok. 
Service was great. People were very nice and friendly.
Location: parking is hard in this neighborhood 
Food: we ordered lots of food. Few appetizers and entree. 
Burrata, bruschetta, grilled bread salad and soup. All tasty but soup portion was a bit small. 
Pork chop: very flavorful but a little dry
Half chicken: very tasty and juicy (highly recommended) 
Butternut risotto: tasty ! 
Filet mignon: not very tasty and dry
Pan bass: not tasty and the ingredients didn't really match well with the fish 

This restaurant is open kitchen. We sat at the second floor and after the dinner we smelled like food. The fan circulation needs some upgrades.
author: Tammy V.

description:
On a recommendation from a couple who lives in the neighborhood, we took an uber from Union Square to Russian Hill.  Great little neighborhood.  The only negative was that the restaurant was pretty empty at 7pm and we don't love to eat in empty restaurants...who does?  But by the time we left at maybe 9 there were more people, although still many tables open.  The service was excellent.  Friendly, able to banter a bit (I have a husband who likes to banter!) and was good with our slow pace. I thought the ambiance was good (other than the emptiness) and it reminded me a bit of a trattoria I would have visited in Italy. 

We shared a bottle of Josh cab and were happy with that.  We started with the beef tartare and I thought it was fine-to-good.  I liked the toasts it came with and maybe it needed a touch of something, not sure what.  My husband liked it and it's more his style than mine.  For dinner I ordered the  fresh pappardelle with pork sugo.  Excellent!  I asked for a touch of the spiciness and didn't notice this at all so they may have omitted it altogether.  The sauce was chunky, noodles cooked perfectly and the flavor was great.  My husband had the alaskan halibut and was very happy with it. I thought at first it was not going to be filling enough and too delicate and simple for him...he's a steak and potatoes /braciole/risotto/lasagna/cream sauce kind of guy, but he loved it. I think he liked it's delicacy and loves peas so he enjoyed the spring vegetable ragout.

We were too stuffed for dessert so had to pass.  It's not a huge menu so I think we lucked out in that both of the dishes we had were really good.  I'd say for someone that isn't  sure, check the menu to make sure there's something that interests you.  I would go back and am grateful to the couple who suggested it because we enjoyed the "neighborhood-ness" of it for sure.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Cute place with a humble, yet bistro-like feel of the best and path .food and service was excellent . The mushroom bruschetta is outstanding as well as the filet and Grouper. Only knock is the close distance you have next to the others  (we had to listen to the couple argue beside us ) 

Definitely worth a visit
author: Mr. J.

description: Get the roasted chicken... I would give that meal 6 stars out of five. Lots of food, excellent flavor, vegetables, it was truly great. My fiancée had the chicken, but I ordered the duck breast. This was good but not amazing. We also ordered the cheese plate, which was kinda fun but overall the cheeses were not extraordinary. Get the chicken and you will love your meal.
author: Parker C.

description: At the suggestion of other Yelpers we made a reservation at Frascatis for dinner. Seated on time with excellent service. Prompt but never rushed. The menu changes but we tried the potato gnocchi appetizer. Light and wonderful flavor. The salmon with pea risotto for my husband and fresh made papardelle with roasted tomatoes for me. This is located in Russian Hill and away from the heavy tourist area. Worth the walk or cable ride!
author: Mary F.

description:
Food 3.5/5
It's pricey for what it is.  The pasta was good. The Bolognese sauce was boring.  certainly wasn't worth $27. The panna cotta tasted good but was a little soft. The burrata dish was ok. I found the place loud but ok atmosphere.  Service was a little pushy but it was fine. The one thing is their bathroom is tiny and gross. It smells like urine down there.  I hope the burly scruffy bearded guy smoking a cigarette outside wears a beard net and wears gloves.
author: Adriana B.

description:
Good food, but not in love with the atmosphere for the price. 

Atmosphere wise, The place was bustling and warm, but a little more on the crowded and loud side for the price point. The table beside us kept having to use the bathroom and really impacted our meal (we had to move our glasses to ensure nothing was knocked over -- not their fault, it was just tight). 

Food wise, it was pretty good -- i started with the burrata and had the FRESH FETTUCCINI, which were both decently tasty.

I think for me, the biggest sticker was the price -- for this cost, I would have expected a higher end atmosphere for sure and maybe a little more from the food.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Warm and inviting from greeting us at the front door to all of our servers (tip of the hat to Kathryn!). A gem of a small restaurant on the corner in a great neighborhood. The food was delectable, especially the homemade fettuccini and Bolognese and the gnocchi appetizer...absolutely top drawer. No pretense, just great food in a wonderful atmosphere.
author: Scott B.

description: My bf took me here for my birthday and I had a lovely time.  The restaurant is tucked away in a little corner and it's small, intimate and romantic.  We started out w/the octopus salad, the octopus was tender and cooked perfectly, greens were dressed well and my only complaint was that I was there was a little more citrus.  My bf had the halibut entree and I had the duck breast.  The halibut was perfectly cooked and presented beautifully. I loved the sauce for my duck (wish I had more).   My only complaint about my dish was that half the duck was cooked perfectly rare and half was overdone.  It was more of an execution thing bc the rest of the dish was lovely.  We had the famous bread pudding for dessert.  It was very tasty but I don't like super sweet desserts so it's not really for me.  Overall I had a good experience, staff was superb.
author: Honey S.

description:
Such a gem in Russian Hill. I came back again recently after having tried it several years ago. We got seated right on schedule for our 8:30pm reservation at a prime table right next to the window with a view of the quaint neighborhood. Service was great, it was past closing time when we finished our entrees and we were the only ones left at the restaurant but the server very genuinely asked if we were interested in dessert! Food was also great, my favorites being the burrata from the appetizers and the pork dish for the entree. 
I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a more upscale neighborhood restaurant!
author: Gloria N.

description: Not trying to be too harsh but this might have been the worst Italian food I ever had. We ordered the most popular dishes: boar ragu and Bolognese. Boar smelled musty and gamey. Pastas were all over cooked. Gnocchi appetizer had strange texture like that of wonder bread when rolled up into a ball and soaked into water. In general the presentation and taste of all the food was like hospital cafeteria food. Not sure why this place has 4.5 rating.
author: Amy K.

description: Absolutely wonderful. Friendly service, very romantic and intimate. Although it was small tables are thoughtfully set with the right amount of spacing so it was not loud or intrusive at all. Great service and incredible food presentation as well as taste. Highly suggest this special spot.
author: Day S.

description: My family and I were lucky to have our dinner on our last night in San Fransisco here.  The manager and staff are amazing.  The food was excellent!  Appetizers, main and wine; we all enjoyed.
author: Lenox D.

description:
Went here for my parents anniversary. They were able to accommodate my toddler nephew and that was great. We got seated in the upper level. The staff was cordial. 

I love their food. I prefer the options during summer-fall. They have more exotic stuff and their use of veggies and fruits is exquisite. During winters it gets a little bit of the usual and a bit meat-heavy. Have a few vegetarians in the family and some with dietary restrictions. Just gets a little more harder.

We got the tomato bisque, bread salad, burrata (pancetta on the side), cheese plate, and gnocchi to start. All were good. Not a fan of the aged cheeses on the plate. We didn't ask but maybe we could have received a double of the other two. 

We were pretty full by this time and ended up sharing entrees. we got the Fresh Tagliatelle, a veggie version of the Fresh Tagliatelle, Roasted Half Chicken and the risotto. All good again. The veggie tagliatelle was my least favorite - very one toned. 

The desserts have always been lacking, compared to the quality of the food. We got the apple cobbler and the Affogato. Not my favorites. Also, the coffee is on the bitter side.
author: Dee V.

description: Everything about this restaurant is perfect. Fantastic service. Food was amazing. Nice wine list. I think my fettuccine was hand made? Truly delicious.
author: David R.

description: Came for dinner, it had been a few years. Although this spot is still cute, the service great, the food wasn't as good as the last time I was here. Great apps for sure.
author: Jonah K.

description: Frascati is always a delight and I love going here when I want to have a good evening. I love their maple leaf duck breast a lot. Some of their other great finds has got to be the pork chops, lamb pappardelle and the bread pudding. The bread pudding is mind-blowing and it tastes different from the traditional bread pudding other restaurants sell. If you're ever in the area then I recommend checking out this restaurant, and make sure you do order some of the menu items I recommended. The ambiance is great and the service is even better. Try this place and you'll be amazed by the overall experience.
author: Diego R.

description: Efficient and professional service, plus delicious food and excellent wine. We had gnocchi and steak tartare to start, followed by the pork chop and duck breast and finished with the cheese board. All fantastic. The recommended pinot noir needed a few minutes to warm up but was top notch. A lovely local date night spot.
author: Sophie E.

description:
My boyfriend and I had a wonderful time last night at Frascati. We made reservations through yelp at 8:30pm and we got there 30 minutes early but was seated right away which was nice. The host gave us the menu right away and we looked through the menu. 

We started off the night with some yummy sparkling wine. The prosecco was deliciously sweet and had some citrus taste which went well with all of our dishes. For starters we had steak tartare (definitely a recommendation!!) and two salads: octopus salad and strawberry salad. Steak tartare was super duper delicious and they give you four pieces of toasted bread and you eat it like a brushetta with some salad. *If you're not a fan of eating raw beef then you might want to skip on that.* After that our salads came. My favorite was the strawberry salad. The octopus salad was good with the oranges,olives and vinaigrette but I still preferred the sweetness of the strawberry salad with smoked duck breast meat instead. The strawberry salad definitely got my attention lol. For our main course, my boyfriend ordered the pan seared filet mignon and for myself I had the king salmon. Both were super delicious and tasty. For my boyfriend's filet mignon he had it medium rare which was perfectly cooked. My salmon also had perfect seasoning and some veggies on the side.

For dessert, we shared a vanilla-bean panna cotta. It was super good and not too sweet. They had some toffee pieces on top and it was just out of this world. I also secretly asked the waitress to put a candle for my boyfriend lol and she was totally cool with it. 

Service and food is definitely 5/5! Will be back again! :)
author: Monica W.

description: Quaint and quiet neighborhood restaurant. A solid wine and food menu. Everything was delicious. The atmosphere is very warm and friendly
author: Kimora B.

description: Our service was amazing and so was our dinner, the bread pudding was a tad dry, but it's an amazing restaurant that will accommodate any dietary needs
author: Hayley S.

description:
Pros:
-Awesome lighting and atmosphere
-Great music in the background
-Not too loud
-Not too close together and not too crowded
-Was greeted immediately with a smile
-Awesome looking menu
-Nice service but...(see below)
-Some of the food: Started with the mushroom bruschetta, butternut squash soup and the duck salad.....All VERY good! 

Cons:
-Service was a bit pushy...wasn't given too much of a chance to really look over the wine list or menu when the server, Brian, came up and asked us if we had questions (on the wine list)....literally twice, in about 2 minutes. He gave us his recommendation: a Bordeaux; when I asked for the tasting notes for the wine (not uncommon at ALL...fruit forward, peppery, jammy, tannin level, etc.), he just said it was good...and fruity. Okaaayyy. Got the bottle out of interest and almost feeling a bit pressured. Not the best ever, really. Just ok. (We aren't super picky, but we do know wines well. For the almost $90 price tag...just nope) 
-The rest of the food: Main courses were a bit of a disappointment. Hubby got the "pepper crusted" venison...not so pepper crusted....or peppery...or crusted in any sense..at all. Totalllly bland. I had the bass...kind of over cooked and bland too. Bit of a let down after such awesome starters. Not saying totally inedible at all, though!...but When you're dropping over $200, forgive me if i'm wrong, but I kind of expect to be totally wow'ed from beginning to end.
author: Julia D.

description:
Food was very tasty (we're vegetarians), primary waiter was very attentive, funny and generally gave us a good experience. All that deserves 5 stars. And Thank you to our waiter and the kitchen :)

What brings it down to a 3-star rating was a very weird and inappropriate behavior from what we understood is the owner, which i'd give 1 star; my husband and me was having a discussion, and this guy come over and turns to my husband and ask him if he 'needs more water'. This was in my eyes very random and odd that he 1) interrupted us and 2) only turned to my husband. Per my husbands experience, the guy looked intimidating into my husbands eyes as if my husband was doing something wrong. 

If he has an issue with us as customers having a discussion, I'd recommend that he ask both of us if there was a problem instead of being biased and assuming my husband was the 'bad guy'.
author: Marie V.

description: Loved Frascati! ALL of the food was so good and service was great too. The owner was there and made sure to acknowledge our anniversary - thanks! We will definitely be back.
author: Piper W.

description:
Every time I tell myself I wouldn't want to live in San Francisco,* a stellar little neighborhood joint like this reminds me how great it could be. 

In another life, I could be a Russian Hill retiree that comes to Frascati every week to indulge in fresh, creamy burrata laid atop toast, layered with prosciutto and drizzled with balsamic. When my appetite wanes, I could make a meal out of just the octopus salad, or the gnocchi. Maybe the staff will get to know me so well that they'll simply put in the order for my herb-crusted ahi tuna, always rare, right when I sit down. Perhaps I'll even get just a glass of one of the stellar Napa whites on the list, as opposed to sharing the bottle. 

In this life though, I'm resigned to visiting SF a few times a year, drinking all the wine, and eating all the food. The struggle is real.
_____________

*Mostly because NYC is so, so much better in every possible way. Come at me, bro.
author: Peter D.

description:
Octopus Tagliatelle. Cabernet. Bruschetta. 

Boom! 

No doubt I'm coming here again.

Not much of a beer selection, but you really aren't here for the beer anyway. Wine selection trumps the former, and I'm totally good with that.

They're only open for dinner and they do fill up quite quickly. Reservations would serve you well or coming in early to cop a window seat or a seat at the bar would also accommodate.

It's low key fancy - which means it's fancy food but you don't have to wear a prom dress to dine here. You can totally walk in in jeans and a tee, or in a business suit coming straight from work, or in shorts and a tank like I did. Go figure, I'm a South Bay chick who rocks South Bay chic and would wear shorts to the city ignoring the 10 degree difference between SJ and SF any day. 

Love it here, and I'm sure you would take a lovin' to it too.
author: Cat V.

description:
We made a reservation at 8 and were quickly seated right after coming in. The place itself is so adorable like a house. There's an open kitchen concept on the first floor. My boyfriend and I sat upstairs overlooking the first floor which I think are the best seats! 
We decided for a bottle of their red. They have a lot of options to choose from and the people working there know a lot about their wines. For appetizers we ordered the tartar and the gnocchi. I loved both dishes! The steak tartar came with a lemon caper aioli, crispy shallots, on a crostini. It came with two so it was easy to split. The russet potato gnocchi came with wild mushroom, butternut squash, sage, parmesan, and white truffle oil. The gnocchi was delicious! 
For entrees we ordered the pork chop and lamb. My lamb was so good! Definitely the star of the show. My boyfriend loved his pork chops. We ordered their apple cobbler for dessert that came with vanilla bean ice cream. I love apples so I enjoyed my dessert. 
This is a really romantic restaurant and they're also very good for large groups as well. The only downside was that their bathroom was on the first floor so if you were eating on the second floor you would have to walk all the way downstairs.
author: Ashley N.

description: Everything you're reading about the reviews are true. We went for dessert on Saturday night, the atmosphere was perfect for date night, the desserts were beyond amazing. I ordered the chocolate bread pudding and it was so good, but too much for one person. Next time we're sharing. My husband got their homemade strawberry ice cream and it was delicious. Thank you yelp reviewers!
author: khayfer K.

description: Me and hubby were looking for a romantic place to dine at in SF. This was a last minute plan and we were having a really hard time finding a reservation. We were lucky to get one here. Parking is a pain because the streets are busy and the Walgreens parking lot they recommend on Polk and Broadway was full. We got seated in a quiet romantic table for two tucked in a corner. The food was super, I had the butternut squash risotto and hubs had a beef dish, we both cleaned our plates. The wine selection for glass is much smaller than the one for bottles, so we got a bottle. For dessert, we had the Affogato, it was excellent with a very creamy house made ice-cream. All in all, a great place to dine at but the restroom was gross, so taking a star off.
author: Simpreet K.

description: Our food was good. However, the server Brian had an attitude that we did not jive with.
author: Debi C.

description:
Finally back to writing some reviews and glad that this can be my first one back!

Came here this past Friday to celebrate my girlfriends birthday. The outside of the restaurant is pretty plain and simple, but I prefer it that way. It's right on the corner which makes it pretty easy to find. The customer service throughout the night was fantastic from the moment they sat us to our goodbyes. The ambience inside is romantic and dark, perfect for my occasion, however the place is pretty small so not ideal for large parties IMO. Now for the food.

The appetizers were fantastic. We started with the Potato Gnocchi and Beef Tartar. The gnocchi was amazing, perfectly made and the white truffle oil made it that much better. This was one of my first times eating beef tartar and I will highly recommend this one and keep eating it from now on if they all taste like this! The accompanying sauce suited it well and the meat was very fresh and savory.

The highlight of the night was the Octopus Salad, YOU HAVE TO GET THE OCTOPUS SALAD. I cannot stress it enough it was that darn good. The octopus was cooked to perfection and the size of the pieces were just perfect (the amount of octopus was very generous)The salad also came with chorizo (what?!?) that was my reaction to it but wow did it suit it well. These meaty flavors were balanced with the apricots and fresh greens in the salad and mild dressing. I wish I could eat this every night, a must have if you are eating dinner at Frascati!

My entree was good, but a bit under whelming following my appetizers. I ordered the pappardelle which came with pork Sugo, tomatoes, chilies, spinach and pecorino Romano. The flavor was good but I regret getting this as an entree as it did not pack the wow factor the appetizers did for me. The pappardelle itself was difficult to pull apart and got stuck together quickly which made it a bit more difficult to eat, nonetheless I finished it all, but next time I will definitely go with the duck breast or a different option.

Overall I would recommend Frascati and I will be back again very soon to try some different entrees and get more of that octopus salad!
author: Josue V.

description:
What a find!  Started with the steak tartare and it was so fresh and flavorful. Next, the squid salad-absolutely incredible.  The squid, chorizo and oranges paired well and we couldn't stop forking every last bite.

For our entree we shared the pork chop and gnocchi appetizer.  The chop was cooked perfectly and so was the gnocchi.  My only criticism was the vegetables that they both sat on.  Just didn't work for me.

Next up the dessert:  black and white bread pudding and a scoop of chocolate ice cream.  The bread pudding tasted like a big brownie and it was so good.
author: Tiffany M.

description: The place knows how to cook a steak; the roasted vegetables accompanying it are flavourful and not over-cooked. We also had brochette; it was crusty and warm with cool, fresh toppings. All ingredients were fresh. Staff was attentive but not intrusive: good serving skills and impeccable social skills.
author: Cathy R.

description: Old school ambiance definitely attracts a more mature crowd than I'm used to. However, don't let that fool you. The food is delicious and the service is wonderful. Great place to bring your parents, grand parents, etc. as it will surely impress.
author: Nathan E.

description:
I just had the most incredible evening at Frascati! My (now) husband and I were looking for a place to dine following our civil wedding ceremony at SF city hall. We wanted something upscale, romantic and delicious - and Frascati delivered. 
I was able to get a reservation just a few days in advance and was very happy when we were seated right away upon arrival. Noting this was a very special day for us, our host gave us table that was perfectly intimate and treated us with champagne. 
The service, food, and ambiance were all incredible. We would come back here - special occasion or not - on a heartbeat. A lovely find!
author: Nicky Z.

description:
All things considered, this place came up short.  Our waiter was grouchy, he was curt, and I felt like our table was an inconvenience to him.  Maybe it was because I came with kids (11&13) who are, for the record, well behaved, who knows?  

The food was good - not great - but good, solid B.  We had gnocchi, filet mignon, and risotto.  The presentation was nice as you can see by the pictures, but the portions were small~ish.  The ambiance is quaint but not memorable.  They have an accomplished wine list, which we indulged, but even after a few glasses of vino, I felt shortchanged.   

I found it odd that in the VERY SMALL uni-sex bathroom, the large mirror hanging directly above the toilet is tilted down.  It forces anyone standing to watch themselves urinate, I found myself chuckling. 

Considering San Francisco is a food paradise, after my $195 investment, my lofty expectations were not achieved.
author: Chris G.

description:
i came here for dinner with my boyfriend for our anniversary. the restaurant is kind of small and cozy. the atmosphere is classy and romantic, with dim lighting and candles on each table. most of the customers were dressed up nicely. we made reservations and were seated upstairs.

the menu states "cell phones in use will be confiscated and made in soup. sports caps were made for the sports field" haha. my boyfriend and i decided to order a n appetizer, two main courses, and two desserts. they also serve you free bread with olive oil while you wait for your food.

steak tartare (5/5) - this was delicious! i'm not really sure how to describe this, but it's like flavored ground beef with bruschetta bread.

grilled pork chop (4/5) - i don't eat pork as much because it's usually really dry. i enjoyed the pork chop with the parsnip puree and the other stuff that was part of this dish.

roasted half chicken (5/5) - i love eating chicken as my main meat and this chicken was pretty good. the skin was probably the best part, though it was a bit salty. the brussel sprouts, potatoes, spinach, and onions helped with the saltiness though haha. i would recommend this dish!

affogato (5/5) - chocolate chip biscotti + espresso + vanilla ice cream = yummm. the concept is similar to a root beer float. might be a bad idea to eat this at night time because of the espresso haha.

blackberry sorbet (5/5) - i'm a huge berry fan. anything berry flavor, i will eat! this was really delicious! after eating half of my scoop, i had to slow down and drink more water because the sorbet was getting really sweet.

the service is really good here. they check up on your table pretty often. it does get kind of warm inside here because the kitchen is open on the right side of the restaurant rather than being in the back. it does get pack here, so it doesn't hurt to make reservations! and the food does take a while to come out. i think it took about 30 minutes for us to get our main courses, so make sure you snack on a little bit of the bread they offer while you wait for your food!
author: Sylvia H.

description:
My wife and I arrived for our 745pm reservation and were promptly seated in a front nook near a window. We never really got the sense that we were really welcome. However the ambience was very pleasant. By the time we were ready to order at 8pm the place was starting to get packed.
For appetizer we ordered the tartare. Took about 20 minutes for the tartare to arrive. Admittedly this was a bit too adventurous for us and we didn't like it much. Tasted like a undercooked burger patty. I realize it is raw beef. But nothing memorable about it at all.

For entrees we had ordered the king salmon and the pappardelle.  There was a period of waiting for our food of nearly 30 minutes and our server never once checked on us. There was a large group opposite of us that seemed to get all the attention. We truly felt like back burner customers. When the food arrived it looked gorgeous. The pappardelle however was so bland. It tasted like canned tomatoes and not much else. The salmon was also pretty bland. The only thing I could taste was the overly charred sides where they "seared" it.
 
In hind sight we should have sent our entrees back and cut our losses of the evening. We were never asked how the meal was the entire time.
We wanted to get outta there so we asked for our check which was provided promptly. 10 minutes had gone by and several attempts to get the attention of our server failed. Again, all eyes were on the large group. We finally got the waiter after someone from said large group pointed the server our way since they noticed our waving.
We are relatively experienced diners and generally not too picky. We were here in SF on vacation and everywhere was amazing. This was literally the only thing we experienced in SF that was poor. Based on the average reviews of Frascata it sounds like we ordered the wrong things and got unlucky with our service. 100+ dollars dinner for 2 we expected so much more. Next time we are in town we will not even consider Frascata.
author: Ron C.

description:
Damn, I was hoping to be the 1000th review (seems like we have been to this place that often) but will have to settle for what looks like the 1003rd review. So close!

Why do we keep coming back so often? Consistency. I say this over and over again, innovation is over rated and consistency is under rated. 

Consistent excellence means I know, on the drive to the restaurant, I will be happy. I can already imagine the meal since I have had it before and I can remember how great it was - a bit like the flight to Hawaii. You know where you are going is going to be awesome so the trip there is fun, too, not just the arrival. 

Frascati for me is consistently excellent. Burrata + Octopus Salad + (pick 2 of 3) Duck Breast / Half Chicken / Pork Chop -- perfect dinner for 2 every single time. Every. Single. Time. 

At the end, we are stuffed, no room for dessert, but would love to have a few sweet bites before leaving. Well, they have SUPERB in house made ice cream and sorbets and one scoop is $4. They have the full sized desserts, but I very much appreciate the small "just give me a few sweet bites" dessert option. 

All in all one of our absolute favorites in the city, bar none, and has been for as long as we can remember.
author: Sai S.

description: Roasted chicken was very good. But pork chops weren't great.  Waiter was very unattentive and service in general was a little odd. For example a guy gave us the butter after we finished our meal.  When it was supposed to come with the bread. Id come back for the chicken dish.  Wines weren't spectacular.
author: Kristine N.

description:
Basic pricey Italian restaurant.  It's a place where some people clean up before dining so don't expect to stroll in with your pup.  I had a great meal here but it was completely unmemorable.  

However, I love the location on the cute block of Hyde, close to Swensons (ice cream) and 2 blocks away from Polk St so you can walk to the party without getting interrupted during an adult dinner.
author: Amy J.

description: Met old high school friends that haven't seen each other in 40 years. Friend lives in SF and adores this restaurant, for good reason. Sat upstairs where it was a bit quieter, but it's right above the open air kitchen and got a bit toasty. Started with a nice red and shared the  bread salad between 3 of us to leave room for the entre and dessert, of course. Two of us had the Tagliaterre pasta with lamb ragout sauce, which was fabulous.  Friend thought there should've been more pasta in the dish, but I savored the meat sauce finished with the blackberry sorbet and we all shared the chocolate cake with ice cream, which was an incredible combination of flavors and textures with the hazelnuts. Overall the dinner was fantastic. The only negative was an overly talkative server who regaled us with tales of the logistics of working in the restaurant when we preferred to spend the time chatting among ourselves. He also refused to take our appetizer order until we were ready to place our entire order, which seemed to be more for his convenience than ours. One star off for intrusive server chatter but otherwise a 5-star experience.
author: Garry W.

description:
Definitely a fan at Frascati. Great service and love the environment in Russian Hill area. Pretty much everything on the menu, you cannot go wrong! The wine selection isn't too bad either.

As for starters:
- Steak Tartare with Lemon-Caper Aioli, Crispy Shallots and Crostini
- Russet Potato Gnocchi with English Peas, Tomato, Fava Beans, Thyme, Asparagus, Parmesan and White Truffle Oil
- Octopus Salad with Potato Confit, Wild Arugula, Orange Segments, Olives and Chorizo Vinaigrette

As for entrees: 
- Pan Seared Alaskan Halibut with Quinoa, Spring Vegetables, Pea Shoot Salad and Chive Beurre Blanc
- Grilled Pork Chop with Butter Bean Ragout, Smoked Ham Hock, Ramp Greens, Roasted Garlic, Natural Jus and Tomato-Olive Compote
author: Jenn L.

description: Cozy ambiance!! This is a very cute restaurant off the beaten path. We ubered here and had a lovely meal. We scored the table with the view of the cable cars and walking traffic. Delicious wine and pasta. My Bread salad was unique and tasty. All the employees were excellent!!!
author: Cecilia D.

description:
TL;DR - Wow, based on what we ordered, it seems like you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

To be quite honest, this area has a plethora of good eateries. Unfortunately, bad planning led to last minute dinner plans which led to a crazy long wait time.... everywhere. 

We wandered into this area because there was a 2hr wait at all the other places where we usually dine. (I'm lookin' at you Lord Stanley, 1760 and Stone's Throw)

Within minutes, we were seated and ready to order.

Wine
- Decent cab, but I was too hungry to care about the booze haha.

Food
- Smoked Salmon Bruschetta: YUM. Only two pieces but the flavor was there! When we ordered, I imagined more of a lox and schmear kinda deal, but nope, what we were served was infinitely better!
- Octopus Salad: Heavy heavy heavy salad. Nice chunks of octopus balanced out with the bite from the arugula and salinity from the olives. There was a bit too much potato for me and I ended up not having room to order an entree for myself. 
- Roasted Half Chicken: He is obsessed with chicken and I'm glad (for once) that he is! This chicken was so juicy and delicious with an amazing crispy skin. Wow.

The only hitch was the service. Our server was so brusque and a little curt. It wasn't even close to closing (7pm) in a half empty restaurant and he already seemed like he wanted us to leave as fast as possible.
author: Crystal Z.

description: Came here for dinner with some family who had been here before and highly recommended it. Cute place ran by the owners. The owners wife bakes much of the dessert menu on her own. Food was amazing, however, portions were on the smaller side. For 3 people we got 3 appetizers and each got an entree. The appetizers we got were the burrata, grilled bread salad,  and the potato gnocchi. All 3 were amazing. I got the eggplant risotto which seemed interesting to me since I never had something like it. The eggplant was shredded into the mixture and every blended perfectly and I was very satisfied with my selection.  Menu is a little limited as well as drinks since they only serve wine but is a cute place to go for dinner.
author: Shannon F.

description: Simply wonderful. We did some research to find this place, which ended up seemed like a spot for locals rather than tourists like us. It was excellent from the greeters, waitress, the food and drink, as well as fellow patrons. I highly recommend this spot!
author: K P.

description:
Dear Frascati,

Let me guess, you're from SF. 

I knew it! Everything about you really says "vintage SF". From walking down the quaint neighborhood to entering your small, charming little place.. when I think of the SF dining experience, you will always come to mind.

We got there hoping against hope that the wait won't be too long. Took a while to find parking as this little neighborhood was very busy. Went up and down those notorious vertical hills, got to see alcatraz in the distance while circling around. Nice bonus.

Once we got to you, one of your men basically told us, he would hook us up and find a seat for us despite it being pretty packed despite a lack of reservation. And so you did. So you did. Got seated pretty quickly. Bonus points. The atmosphere here is great, and the service was bar none.

And the food. I already knew which dishes I wanted to try (thanks yelp!). Debating between the Maple Duck, the Pork Chop or the Chicken. Went with Maple Duck (because it looks so pretty) and the Chicken (bc only a top notch restaurant does chicken really well). We waited. We got. We ate. We cried. oh so good.

(somewhere in between I took picture of the food like a good yelp addict)

Dang Frascati. You nailed the chicken. it was as juicy as people said it was. I rarely order chicken unless I am at a really good restaurant and have high expectations and you nailed it. Very good. The Duck was good as well. Love the mix of flavors.

Overall it was a sweet time. Ambiance + Good Food + Good Service + Good Neighborhood + Good Time = 5 stars.

Enjoy it. You deserve it.

I will be back to try other dishes.... so be ready.
author: Paul L.

description: Excellent restaurant with great service. The food was absolutely delicious! Would highly recommend for date night or for those visiting the town.
author: Hemin N.

description:
Based on what seems to be recommended the most, we ordered the following:
- Burrata with Prosciutto di Parma, Micro Basil, Balsamico, Fig Jam and Toasted Baguette 15
- Octopus Salad with Potato Confit, Wild Arugula, Orange Segments, Olives and Chorizo Vinaigrette 15
- Maple Leaf Farms Duck Breast with Caraway Spaetzle, Citrus Mâche Salad, Hearts of Palm, Orange-Herb Agrodolce and Huckleberry Jus 30

The octopus salad was the best. The octopus was plump and tender. The burrata didn't taste quite fresh. The duck was decent, but for $30, I expected something more refined. The dishes used showed their age as Frascati has been around for a long time. They should really throw out the ones that have turned blackish.

We got seated upstairs, with a view to the dining room. The service was swift and friendly. The place was dimly lit creating a romantic ambiance. Patrons seemed to be enjoying themselves. Frascati surely is a charming neighborhood restaurant, but it is not a gem.
author: Aldo H.

description: Great restaurant with a pleasant ambiance!  Service was professional and attentive. I started with a well-portioned Octopus Salad.  It was okay as the Octopus was a bit spongy lacking some seasoning & flavor for my palate.  I had the Braised Beef Short Ribs for my main dish which was perfectly cooked and full of flavor.  The Apple Cobbler was delicious, however, the Warm Black and White Chocolate Bread Pudding was mediocre as the vanilla ice cream wasn't absorbed.  Overall, I would definitely return if you were looking for a romantic place for a nice meal paired with quality wines.
author: Jazz T.

description: My husband and I only had one night in the city, and this was the absolute best thing we could have done with our time. The food was delicious, the staff were wonderful, and the cheesecake was the smoothest I've had in my life. There is a cozy space upstairs that looks like the perfect area for an intimate evening out, but we opted for downstairs so we could enjoy the liveliness of the kitchen. The only downside is that we live a few hundred miles away and our next visit won't be for another 4-6 months.
author: J W.

description:
Came here for dinner with a party of 6.  We had made reservations and was seated upstairs overseeing the kitchen.  The lights were a little dim upstairs, but it made it more intimate.  As the night went on, the restaurant was fully packed even on a Sunday.

For starters, we had the Potato Gnocchi, Steak Tartare, and the Burrata which came on top of a baguette slice.  All were really tasty even the gnocchi which I'm usually not a fan of.  For dinner, I had the Tagliatelle with white fish.  My husband had the pork chop.  The plates came out hot from the kitchen and the dishes were cooked well.  Absolutely nothing to complain about.  

For dessert, we shared the Affogato and the Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta.  I have to say it was difficult to share amongst the 6 of us!

Overall, food was excellent.  Service was attentive.  Would have to come back again. 

Great place to come with a group, but also great for a romantic intimate dinner for two.
author: Erica S.

description: I went here for dinner and tried the burrata appetizer, duck breast main, and Meyer lemon cake. All three where exquisite. The atmosphere is relaxed, the crowd was on the older side. Service was quick and quiet, just the way I like it -- I barely noticed the staff were even there.
author: Dejana B.

description: My wife found this place on Yelp and it was very good.  Love the atmosphere and the food was excellent. In addition, the service was excellent. The Pappardelle was excellent and my wife had the filet mignon which was also very good.
author: Matt O.

description:
The ambiance, service and bev/food were so good! The timing of food was spot on and the all of the staff made you feel very special. 

Tip - Parking is not super easy, as we had to park three blocks down steep hills, so just expect to do that! It was a quick and painless exercise before and after the meal. :)
author: Tatum R.

description: Still great. I first ate here over ten years ago so when I made my reservation it was with reservations. I was hoping for the best and they delivered great food at reasonable prices considering the location. Don't miss this place.
author: chris m.

description:
Frascati is so good.  Everything on the menu is perfect.   The staff is great. Just a smart place to have a dinner out with you friends or loved one. 

Enjoy-
author: Troy V.

description:
epitome of mediocrity
steak tartare was tasteless. and very watery. i couldn't taste any of the filet mignon. it seems like they found a way to save on meat. 
the duck salad was great. good balance of ingredients. the meat itself has a good flavored well balanced with the other ingredients.
the pork chop was ridiculously salty. the pork itself was well cooked but seriously lacked flavor. overall the dish was pretty much bland. The seabass was tiny and tasted boring. bathing in a very very diluted watery seafood soup. what shame. Service was also very amateurish. i was expecting more. they brought 2 glasses of wine when i clearly asked for one. and sat us cramped between tables. when there was plenty of space available in the restaurant. also no crumbing between courses? that's a minimum. 
i won't go back. i feel like i traded my money for bland and salty food. i really don't understand the 4&1/2 star ratings... very disappointed
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Really good service.

Very tight intimate space

Horrific parking situation

Maple leaf duck was really tasty. Tender duck. Dried fruits. Fresh cherries $32?

Steak tartare was good but nothing spectacular. I did like the pickled beets that accompanied it $17

Peach blackberry cobbler was so good $9

Black and White pudding was disappointing. Way too much chocolate. Way sweet. $9
author: wolfie g.

description:
I love a good steak dinner, and Frascati makes an OUTSTANDING filet mignon. It was so good that it turned my cooter into the Fountains of Bellagio, with music playing and all. Not only was it presented in an amazing sauce, but it also had a generous dollop of this tasty white stuff on top (which might have been herbed butter, not cum). The meat was so tender and flavorful. I scarfed down my portion and wanted more.

The pappardelle with beef sugo, caprese salad and lamb appetizer were also excellent. Actually, I have a feeling that everything on the menu is delicious. I did try the much raved about black and white bread pudding for dessert though, and thought it was just okay. I'm not sure if I would order dessert here again, but I do know the savory dishes are to-die-for.

There's only one bathroom, and it's TINY. I recommend taking your piss or crap before coming here.
author: Suany W.

description: My wife and I dined here after I read some reviews on best romantic restaurants in sf. This place mixes Italian with a very Mediterranean feel. I have traveled all over the world and this restaurant definitely has the feel like we were in Sardinia. The kale salad was a delight to start with, I have the short ribs, which melted in my mouth. My wife has the fish. Amazing. The service was excellent, even with the owner, I believe, coming and checking in. Great job!
author: Sean M.

description:
Parking is a PAIN. 

Food however, worth the trek to find parking. I loved the food, the ambiance, and the service. We were greeted immediately and sat upstairs, overlooking the balcony. The zin that was paired with my duck made me super happy. I just knew I had to order the duck after reading prior yelp reviews. 

The boyfriend ordered the grilled pork chop. Boy was that a great choice. This is probably the best pork chop I've had. I'm glad we got the octopus salad and burrata to start. They were amazingly flavorful and cooked so perfectly. 

I wish we had some space for dessert but really, we ordered a lot for two people. I'd definitely come back again and would recommend this place to any guy trying to impress a date with his choice in restaurants! Just try to get a reservation for a window seating. It's probably the better seat.
author: Marlene T.

description:
This is a classy romantic place that's cozy and serves food with robust flavors! Great for dates!...  Expect to spend $100 for two.

Ordered:
1. Russet Potato Gnocchi w/ Butternut Squash
2.  Octopus Salad
3.  Fresh Pappardelle
4. Maple Leaf Duck Breast.

---

1.  Gnocchi was cooked to perfection.  It was served with Mushrooms and Sage, though they are cut so fine that you won't get a spoonful of just mushrooms.  I myself am not a big fan of mushrooms, but the way the chef prepared this dish made it tasteful, without getting a huge portion of mushroom per bite.  

2.  My favorite was the Octopus Salad.  The Champagne vinaigrette that is served with this salad is very sharp, yet is a great compliment to the Feta, white beans, and cucumbers.  If you are looking to go w/ just one starter, I'd recommend this.  The portion is good sized for two, and a very tasteful starter.  I would have liked to have a little more octopus in the salad (As I am a big octopus fan), but the salad overall was great.

3.  My least favorite of our choices.  While still tasteful, the pappardelle stuck together over time, but came apart without pulling up other pieces.  The pork ragout that is served with is has a very strong flavor but really paired well.  Overall, the flavor I was impressed.

4.  They serve the duck medium rare so you'll have to tell the waiter/waitress how you want it cook, if you want it cooked differently.  I normally each meat medium rare so this was perfect.  Not a single big of duck remained, as it was a great dish.  The duck breast is lean, with little to no fat, and cooked a perfect medium rare.  Mustard greens are served with this dish, which I was a little hesitant about, but the chef prepared a nice proportion.  Not too much, and not too little.  There are enough on the side to taste, but it's not overdone so it drowns out the natural taste of the duck.  From the entree perspective, I'd highly recommend and would eat again!
author: Jared N.

description: Small, intimate, romantic restaurant off of the Hyde Street trolley line with superb, authentic Italian food. Don't skip dessert. Small wine list, so we always bring our own. Highly recommended, locals place
author: Chris C.

description:
Always surprised when I'm asked about a restaurant I haven't come across on yelp and already bookmarked. Not sure how I missed it but so glad my date thought of it. Who isn't huge fan of cute, intimate restaurants that have great food & wine?! A date night winner! 

Im not a frequent visitor of Russian Hill area so I found this charming place a nice treat and a perfect change of scenery from the mission. We had a 9pm reservation so it was not too crazy when we got in but still quite busy. 

We started off with the gnocchi and a bottle of Merlot, whats there not to love?! The gnocchi was perfect! I went with a heirloom tomato risotto and my date went with a Halibut dish. Although it was carb overload for me with the gnocchi and risotto, I was happy with my choice. The risotto was one of the best I've had! We ended dinner with very little room for dessert but decided to try the bread pudding which was heavenly!

The ambiance + service were absolutely wonderful! I would def recommend this as a date spot.
author: Hetal P.

description:
Really great time here.   Top notch, unrushed service,  beautiful delicious food.  Prices reasonable

Came in without reservation and we were seated on a Sunday evening.  Service was fast and professional.  The server was well versed on the wines and the menu which is always nice.  I ordered with a little modification to the meal and he handled it easily.  Food came out beautifully presented and the chef did a great job modifying my food and it was ridiculously delicious.  The octopus was moist(sorry), crisp, tender, flavorful, hot and to die for.  I went to kokkari for octopus and frascati blew it out of the water!  I am on a hunt for the best grilled octopus and this is in my top 5.  My friend had the duck which he enjoyed.  We both nearly licked our plates.

I wasn't hungry for dessert but we had a panna cotta anyways

Bathroom so small I opened the door to wash my hands.  

Would not change a thing.  Hope to be back.  Highly recommended
author: Mimi B.

description:
Service: excellent. The manager came to check in on us almost every dish.

Food:
Steak tartare: very flavorful. That shallots added a nice touch. Very fresh ingredients.

Octopus salad: octopus was cooked perfectly, juicy and tender. Just the right amount of crunchy greens and some citric fruit

Pork chop: very juicy and tender. The sauce is really good, along with the tomato compote.

Bread pudding: the hazelnut ice cream is divine. Very rich chocolate bread pudding.

White peach sorbet: this is actually quite sweet but very refreshing.

Totally will come back!
author: Ruxin H.

description: I'm too big a fan of burrata and steak tartare, so please just take this review with a grain of salt. Honestly, those two dishes are the only reasons I chose this place to begin with. Needless to say, I've eaten in every restaurant in SF with these dishes. The steak tartare here at Frascati was special. Perfect quality of steak paired with the beets and the bruschetta. Magnifico! The burrata was good but didn't stand out to me like the tartare. Service was very good as I expected in a restaurant like this. Shared the burrata, (2) steak tartare dishes, strawberry salad, heirloom tomato risotto, a beer, a peligrino sparkling water plus 2 desert entrees came to $170 tip included. Got exactly what I wanted and we were stuffed at the end of the night.
author: Chris Y.

description: Such an incredible date night experience. We just so happened to run into the head chef outside the restaurant right before walking in who was wearing a Detroit Tigers hat. Well, we connected instantly because we were from Michigan! We ordered the burrata to start...so delicious! And then he sent out some amazing little bites they called the Mediterranean Avocado Toast...WOW! Hubby got the pork chop which was so juicy and flavorful and I got the chicken which is so far away from my norm (I'm usually a fish person) but it came highly recommended. Boy am I glad I got it. The skin was crispy and sweet and the chicken was so moist and flavorful. Mmmmmm. The service was great too! I would highly recommend.
author: Abby W.

description: Meats could be better quality/fresher: Grainy texture in duck breast. However the King salmon was fresh and cooked perfectly.  Desserts were good. Overall, pricier side for the quality of food and tight space.
author: Frank Y.

description: Amazing and very attentive. I took my husband here for his birthday and he had an absolute great time. Thank you for helping me make his day special.
author: Brittany B.

description:
We had our last dinner in San Francisco here on a recommendation from a new friend, and we were delighted that we were able to grab two seats at the bar since we did not have reservations. To say that we were satisfied is an understatement. The staff was wonderful, especially the bartender, with whom we interacted the most. Very helpful, knowledgeable, and accommodating. We decided to each have a salad and share an entree so that we could leave room for dessert. The salads are very generous and filling. Unlike a lot of other restaurants, it's not all greens with a few tidbits thrown in. I highly recommend the Grilled Bread Salad, which I plan to replicate some time soon. My wife enjoyed the Roasted Persimmon Salad a great deal. And we shared an ample portion of the Braised Short Ribs, which literally melts in your mouth. The accompaniments were also perfectly prepared; we loved the horseradish potato puree so much, we will be replicating that this week!

So yes, we saved room for dessert, and so glad we did. We usually don't get dessert because we end up eating too much beforehand, but we were so happy to enjoy the Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta, so light and delicious, and the caramelized banana was a most perfect addition. 

In short, this was the best meal we had in San Francisco and we are so glad we saved the best for last. I highly recommend Frascati, just make sure to make a reservation, which you can do right at their Web site. This is truly a five-star restaurant.

Incidentally, to clarify on my survey answers, I indicated that I'm not sure this place is good for groups because it really is small and intimate, though I suppose if you make a reservation for a large group well enough in advance, they could probably accommodate. Also, I personally don't think Frascati is suitable for children unless they are well-behaved and have mature palates. And yes, the attire is casual, but be aware that this is an upscale restaurant, so leave the ball caps and cutoff shorts behind.
author: Ralph M.

description:
After a fantastic dinner at stones throw I noticed frascoti across the street and put it on my must try list. Super cool looking restaurant with a great menu. After leaving my overall impression was eh...

There was no host stand so walking in for our reservation a busy waiter told us to go hang out by the bar. Hmmm, ok but there was no bartender so we just sat there for a sec. I guess my week long reservation got me a table in the middle of the room right in front of the main door. Blah. Thankfully a couple was leaving and they accommodated us with a better seat. 

After perusing all the great Yelp pics I knew I wanted the burrata and halibut. The burrata was fantastic. Nice texture with a touch of balsamic and some greens (Kinda hard to mess up). The halibut wasn't very good. Way over seasoned with pepper. It was well done on the outside with some raw, "sashimi" looking stuff going on inside. Date got the duck which was cooked nicely. 

Our waiter was nice but kept rushing over like he couldn't be bothered. After all the great reviews I was looking forward to an experience. In reality it was just a decent dinner. Nothing I would go outta the way for.
author: Mark N.

description:
Whoah, way to hit a New American meal out of the park Frascati! Excellent service plus beyond delicious food led to leaving my heart in SF (you knew the stomach was the way there, no?).
