I came in for a birthday dinner (turned 30) on a Saturday with reservations for 9. We were seated upstairs, and it was blazing hot due to the small kitchen just below. We were seated a few minutes early and out waiter was very attentive throughout the meal. My sister and I can be a bit of a pain sometimes when dining out, but he rolled with the punches with an experienced hand by mixing humor and keeping it real. Our food came out very well timed, with good pauses so I could mingle with my guests.

The food was beyond everyone's expectations, which were already high. The bread, focaccia and regular, was fresh and light. I started with a grilled bread salad, which had a perfectly light champaign dressing, goat cheese, white beans, cucumbers and olives a all over it. I don't even like salad, but me and my mom loved this one. My sister shared some faux gras, which I wasn't too pleased with but did have a try (not my thing). My best friend had some burrata (cheese on toasts) that she really enjoyed. My brother in law enjoyed his fresh corn bisque soup.

For main courses, several of us had the best chicken ever. It wasn't overly sophisticated, but was perfectly cooked and packed with flavor. I enjoyed the crispy chicken skin (normally not my thing), along with the lovely artichoke, potatoes and onion accompanying it. One of my friends had the risotto and the other gnocchi, but we'd have enjoyed another vegetarian option. Another friend had the duck and it was sumptuous. Sister loved the filet and bro enjoyed his fish. We finished with a dairy-free cake I had brought in with us, seriously awesome chef.

Whenever that craving for excellently executed food, head on over to Frascati for a fresh take on delicious new american cuisine.
author: Jim A.

description: The service was great...the food was OUT-OF-THIS-WORLD. I'm very happy that I took our out out town guests to this restaurant.
author: Robbie M.

description: Great location, amazing food and really cool staff. Great for date night. The New York Strip is the best I've had in the city of San Francisco.
author: Nerissa L.

description: Always a favorite. Ambiance is A+, really like seeing/hearing the cable cars rolling by. Food is consistently good and is a great neighborhood joint we go back to time and again.
author: A Z.

description: An excellent restaurant for a romantic outing! The steak was great, the service was awesome, and the ambience was pleasant. What more can you ask for?
author: Max P.

description: I had a good time here,love the atmosphere ,food and wine here.will come back for sure.
author: Mohammad M.

description: Great service, incredible food and very reasonably priced wine list. What's not to love about this place!
author: ryan a.

description: My girlfriend and I were spent the night in the city for our first anniversary last weekend. Per my sister's recommendation to ended up at Frascati. It was a very nice experience, very romantic. There was nothing our server could not help us with - he made amazing wine recommendations and then suggested us what events we could enjoy in the city. We got our dinner started with a caprese salad and prosciutto figs and balsamic reduction - just delicious, never have I had such melt in your mouth buffalo mozzarella. Next we had the pork chop and tagliatelle with pork fennel sausage. both amazing. Before leaving we took the server's advice and we ordered a dessert - per his recommendation we asked for the Warm Black and White Chocolate Bread Pudding - he couldn't have made a better recommendation. the ambience and as i said, the service, marvelous. Wonferful experience.
author: Donald S.

description: I was persuaded by the good reviews to come here while on vacation, but unfortunately I was a little disappointed. The restaurant is very cozy, I enjoyed the quiet romantic ambiance, and the service was nice. The food for me was just ok, nothing extremely compelling. My main issue was a cramped gross bathroom--I was surprised to see a dirty gas station bathroom in an otherwise lovely restaurant.
author: Lacey H.

description: We were very pleased with our experience! We shared the cheese plate, a salad, and a main course, which ended up being the perfect amount of food for two. The wine selection was great, and our server was attentive. The atmosphere was upscale yet cozy, not snobby which was great for a birthday dinner for two. Since we live nearby, we will definitely be back!
author: Danielle H.

description: Been coming for years, through all the various owners. Quality is first rate. Highly recommend.
author: John R.

description: This is our go to place anytime we visit San Francisco- always excellent food and the service is above and beyond!!! Do not miss Frascati!
author: Toni D.

description: Amazing, best Italian food I have had in years. All these reviews are spot on. Octopus and chorizo is amazing! Fresh made pasta was like nothing I have ever tasted.
author: Bridget B.

description: My boyfriend took me to Frascati for dinner last Tuesday night. We found it to be a quiet, spacious, two storey restaurant with unique food and a pleasant staff. It is a great date spot. It feels very European; elegant and stylish. The food was really interesting; from appetizers to the main course to the dessert we had. The grilled bread salad was huge and the duck breast and lemon chicken were well prepared and seasoned just right. Our service was excellent, we really felt that our waitress was personal and polite, not rushing us or pushing us to order anything we did not want. Very nice experience.
author: Jennifer E.

description: Beautiful window seat. Small restaurant feel. Helpful attentive staff. Just what you want for an anniversary dinner. The menu offered a little bit of everything. We both got the filet which was absolutely amazing. So satisfying. You will not be disappointed.
author: Mindy T.

description:
We came here for NYE dinner. They have a 3-4 course pre-fixe menu for the night ($90 for 3 courses and $100 for 4). The hubby and I shared 2 appetizers, 1 salad, 2 entrees and 1 dessert.

For appetizers, we had the veal tartar and scallops. The veal tartar was so so -- the meat was tender, but I thought the fixings were lacking. There was no small dices of cornichons/red onions, which I think is very necessary to add texture and zing. Also no quail egg on top, either. The scallops were very good. The morsels were well seared and caramelized on the outside and tender on the inside, in a word, perfectly prepared.It sat on a little bed of sauce that was yummy, too. I wish there were more than three scallops, and the scallops were on the small side, too.

The pear salad had one piece of roasted butternut squash and 2 dabs of blue cheese. The arugula was fresh and the dressing was super good. It had a depth of flavor that makes me think they reduced the vinegar a bit. I'm not a big salad person and this was pretty good, although unremarkable.

The surf and turf entree was the star of the evening. The lobster claw is delicate and sweet and so fresh. The steak was just the way we wanted, medium rare. The meat was very tender and had a nice char crust. The lobster sat on a small pile of noodles in a seafood-y cream sauce. The lamb shanks were a bit dry on the outside. It was properly cooked and fall off the bone, but it needed more sauce. I think when they reheated the shank for service, that's when it dried out a bit.

The dessert was an apple crumble. We were beyond full at the point now. The apple crisp was simple and no crazy seasonings. I thought it was OK.

Altogether, I thought the food was probably 3.5 stars and the service 4.5. We had a table of 10 and the servers were attentive and didn't get any orders wrong, which is pretty remarkable for NYE. And the space was tight and no one knocked anything over. I thought it was a bit overpriced at $150 per head (also shared 3 bottles of wine that was on the pricy side). I don't feel like the food was good enough for me to go back to, though.
author: Alice W.

description: Really great service both in speed and attentiveness. Very good recommendations from our waiter on starters - octopus salad is a must.  Main courses were tasty with an excellent presentation.  You will not be disappointed.  The only thing I would improve is the bathroom door - doesn't quite latch shut all the way.
author: Eric S.

description: This is a wonderful locals restaurant on Hyde. The wonderful smells of the kitchen abound all around the small and very quaint setting. The menu is not huge but gives you enough choice to satisfy most everyone's taste buds. We always ask for a table in the upstairs dining room. Its quieter and  very cozy plus  you can really get the great aromas  coming off the open kitchen below. My wife and I love this place. What could be better with cable cars ringing past the front door along with a very nice atmosphere and excellent food. Put it on your list.
author: Robert J.

description:
Fantastic little restaurant. 
Due to the heat, we chose to sit outside so there was air movement, inside was stiflingly hot. 
Wine menu is varied without overwhelming you with choices which is appreciated, and the Chateau Gree Laroque was a perfect compliment to our dishes. 
I started with the duck confit salad - and I will daydream about that salad. Warm spinach with perfectly prepared duck, small crumbles of blue cheese, cranberries with a warm balsamic. Heaven, and the softer Bordeaux wine went perfectly. I am craving the salad as I recount it. 

The pork chop followed - juicy and cooked throughout without being dry, an achievement for a thick pork-chop. The cabbage was unremarkable, but the apple compote with the olive oil potatoes were well done. Hard to follow the perfect salad, but overall I was extremely pleased with my choices. 

We decided to forgo desert. 

I would definitely recommend. The staff were kind and funny, the atmosphere is relaxed and the food is fantastic.
author: Julia H.

description:
Hmmmm not what we were expecting for sure... But reading the reviews we were looking for epic as far as food and were disappointed. Two appetizers and an entree and for all three we felt the food was good... But not great. Flavors not really matching up... Like when you cook a meal at home and have a 'missed moment' in the bringing together of the dish. 

I should add the drink issue. I had one of the the cocktails they offer (not rating on this... But thought I would mention). It was quite awful... And poor quality. I didn't drink it and it sat untouched on the table the entire meal, dessert, and pay process. And... No mention about this from the waiter. It was obvious I was unhappy yet nothing. Now yes... Me disliking a drink is not the restaurant's fault and it should not be. BUT... In a place as 'nice' as this, it should at least be brought up. Kind of weird to be honest. 

Oh the good you ask? Well... Ambiance awesome. Service attentive.

But again... Dont we go to places like this for the food?

Ok off to the next San Fran place!
author: John W.

description: Best kept Yelp secret in SF. Make your reservation well in advance or plan on eating early. Everything is what you'd hope for and more. Thanks Frascatti's!
author: Michael H.

description:
OCTOPUS SALAD: yes, it is as good as they all claim 5+

DUCK BREAST: yes, it is as good as they all claim (and even better!!) 5++

PORK CHOPS: yes, it is as good as they all claim 5+

WARM BROWN WHITE BREAD PUDDING: urrrrrr....mixed reviews on this one, so I ordered it to write my own review. All the above dishes have been described so well by my fellow yelpers, but few have described this dessert with the same depth. Some claim it's the best dessert in the city and that they come here just for this dessert. Not so sure I would agree with that. It was good, but does not live up to the reviews. Here's why:
I like my bread pudding on the softer side, almost "custardy." This bread pudding has been reported as dense, which is true because it is denser than what you would expect for bread pudding, but it is not dense like a fudge brownie or flowerless cake). In fact, if you look closely at the bread pudding, you can appreciate that the texture looks just like the white part of bread.

Taste: The center was pretty dry because it didn't absorb the melted ice cream. The dessert was still tasty, but not worth spending calories for. I have such a terrible sweet tooth that my husband could not believe I left the dessert unfinished. It was definitely reheated too, because the center was cooler than the outsides. 

Presentation: I don't really know why the word "white" is in this dessert. Aside from the obvious white ice cream, the bread pudding only has a few specks of white chocolate--this bread pudding is 99% brown. 

Overall: I regret ordering the dessert because it didn't live up to my expectations, but if I hadn't ordered it then I would still be wondering if I missed out. Despite my disappointment with this dessert, this restaurant still deserves a 5 star for how well everything else tasted. 

I would still come back here and recommend this place to friends and family, but I'd think twice before ordering dessert.
author: Logan N.

description: A delicious menu. A fair number of items on the menu but not overwhelming. Excellent presentation and a wine list that pairs well with the food. Will Surely be back.
author: Matt H.

description:
Great little Italian restaurant. We sat upstairs and we're able to watch the kitchen work its magic. They have some typical Italian dishes, but they also serve some that seem a little more authentic. 

Service was smooth and professional, the wine selection was really good considering the size of the space, and the food had great presentation and tasted great.
author: Thomas R.

description: Special hole in the wall place super intimate dim lighting. Very friendly service, I split the toasted bread salad which was tossed in a champagne dressing with delicious, fresh, & creamy feta. I got the half chicken with Brussels and was swooned with the crunch outer skin and the juicy tender inside. My boyfriend got the fresh spaghetti, which was probably the best tasting I've ever had . The service was great and the sparkling rose went down like water; all in all I'll be back!
author: Sara K.

description: The ambiance is small and intimate, but does get a bit loud for dinner. The maple duck was excellent, and the cooked strawberries were a nice touch. What was really a standout, though, was the dessert. The bread pudding was so decadent - and was perfect with ice cream.
author: Leeyen R.

description:
FOOD 
1.) octopus salad, yum!!!! Surprised! I'm Usually not an octopus person. 
2.) gnocchi! Yommmmm my kinda dish
3.) chicken, ehh?? Tastes like normal chicken nothing special Altho server said it was their must have dish 
4.) pork chop, mehhh maybe this is what pork chop is supposed to be like but it kind of had a crunch to it like cartiledgy eck I gave my friend the rest of my piece didn't even finish it
5.) black white dessert 'twas alright 

***shoulda followed my gut and gotten the flat iron steak!!! 

SERVICE 
Good 


ATMOSPHERE 
Love he atmosphere I've always walked by and loved the ambiance it's a small cute cozy restaurant with two levels and secret back room kinda would be good for private party on the top. Small bar w small bar seating in Russian Hill on Hyde street so def get the tree lined cable car rolling down and Swenson's for dessert down a few and Lombard curvy street
author: Angela L.

description:
With the great restaurants in the neighborhood and the highly rated stars on yelp, I expected a lot better.  Came here for Mother's Day, and had an enjoyable dinner, but nothing was "great."  It was "good" food, but because everything else is good in this city, I expected something better for a 4.5 star place.  Nothing impressed me.

To sum it up, I probably wouldn't choose to go back.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Arrived at 6pm on a Sunday to find the place slammed. We did get our reserved table for two and were seated promptly. Our waiter was nice but hurried. To begin we shared the steak tartare appetizer. It was tasty but chopped so small as if it came out of a blender. Not the most appetizing texture. My wife enjoyed her Pappardelle and I had the Risotto which tasted OK but was a bit mushy. I'm ready to take some responsibility for what I ordered and the resulting texture issues.
I'm happy for any restaurant that appears to be doing well, but to describe the atmosphere as intimate or romantic is a stretch. From the outside it does have that appearance, but once inside the pace is a bit frenetic. I had the wine list opened and was about to ask our waiter a question about the Italian wine selection. He saw that I was pointing at one in particular and before I could ask about it he said "I'll be right back with that sir" and he was gone...
author: W. Harry K.

description: What a gem - we sat by a small window on the third level. I love the buzz of this restaurant as you walk through the door. The owners really take pride in their business and greet you with a wonderful smile. We started with the potato gnocchi - yum. The broth with vegetables was delicious and the gnocchi was moist and succulent. The lamb ragu pappardelle was very good but I craved parmesan not the feta it came with. I felt the parmesan would have given the dish more depth but that's a totally personal taste. Now the lemon pudding was fantastic - I don't often do dessert but I can't forgo a lemon cake. This was a denser lemon cake and I loved it with the berry sauce and a wonderful dollop of sweet cream on top. I really wanted seconds but my pants were telling me no! I would definitely go back here as the whole package makes for a wonderful night out. I enjoy a vibrant restaurant with character.
author: J N.

description:
We went on Saturday evening and it was extremely hot in San Fran but they did their best to make us comfortable.  They have some tables outside.

Food was delicious as always......
author: Pat H.

description:
Frascati have been on my radar for years and finally got a chance to dine here without a dinner reservation. 

I started off with a glass of pinot noir while my friend had a beer. We ordered:

- Russet Potato Gnocchi = with Leeks, English Peas, Fava Beans, Roma Tomatoes, Parmesan and White Truffle Oil. Somehow the gnoochi was not to my liking, maybe because it had a dried after taste. Something imbalance about it.

- Grilled Swordfish = with Wild Mushroom Ragout, Radicchio, Baby Spinach and Kalamata Olive Butter. The fish was part broken when it was served to us but that didn't bother us.

- Maple Leaf Duck Breast = flavorful flavors but two small cut pieces of duck did not do it for me. Although the picture looks like the portion was huge, it was half the size of my fist. 

I wanted to give this place more stars, but that is the most I could do. The service was attentive however the food was lacking. At most 3 stars is decent in my book.
author: Owie N.

description: Appetizers were good but not amazing, the burrata was especially disappointing lacking the creaminess I expect. The entrees were amazing! We had the short ribs which were melt in your mouth delicious and the lamb papardelle whose noodles were delightful.
author: Monica R.

description: Big fan of the potato gnocchi; the butternut squash soup was okay, and my boyfriend said the chicken was very fresh. The staff was great, helpful, and gave us privacy. The ambiance was great. My boyfriend and I went for a romantic evening.
author: Veronica B.

description: Arrived just before our reservation and I easily ordered their glass of Sangiovese, which I found disappointing, although my date enjoyed his Orvieto.  We sat at a charming two top, with adequate space, this bustling night.  Service was smooth and charming.  Our shared little gem salad perfect, my Date loved his Pork Sugo Parpadelle and my Black Bass with cous cous was wonderful.  We were stoked that they offered Panna Cotta, so each had our own, and weren't disappointed.  Overall a success and would recommend.
author: Alex J.

description:
Came with my husband for his birthday dinner. The host/maitre d was very welcoming, setting a very nice tone for our evening. The food: delicious. The cheese plate was interesting, the octopus salad was earthy with chorizo (?) and olive accenting perfectly grilled octopus.The entrees: Filet Mignon, tender and juicy, and Bass with a silky lobster jus -so good. Dessert and coffee (the panna cotta was delicate and the chocolate chip cheesecake was not too heavy or too sweet), were worthy compliments to the starters and the entrees. 

The service. Our waiter was... odd. He wasn't outright rude, he was cold and unfriendly.

He did the weirdest thing: My cell phone was on the table, and when he came to ready the table for the food, he picked it up and put it on my bread plate. Like that was the best place he could think of to put it, OR, he was was trying to scold me for having my phone on the table. Weird.

He was not engaging. When we sat down and he came over I said we were here for my husband's birthday, he sort of blew that off. I was hoping for a candle or something on his dessert, nothing. I wasn't expecting a routine a la Friday's, but something to acknowledge the occasion would have been appropriate.

Our dessert was brought by the host/maitre d, and his smile and warm tone was such a nice change from the pinched, uncomfortable episodes with our waiter. Why our dessert/coffee were served by the host is a mystery to me. Again, he wasn't terrible, it was "serviceable" service. He was fine. I tipped over 20% (because the reality of the experience didn't hit me until I got home, and the food was great.). The host held the door open for us as we left, big smile on his face, gracious from start to finish. As we passed our waiter he had the same mask on his face that he had the entire evening. Would we return to this restaurant again? Based on the service we had, no.
author: David J.

description: Trifecta!!! Perfect location, delicious food, the most friendly and welcoming owners! Going back this weekend.... can not wait.
author: Sarah S.

description: A gem.  Was directed there by Fairmont concierge and she was right. Great atmosphere matched by the food.  We're from RI where're there are plentiful Italian places and this would have been a headliner in our state. Must try!!!
author: David F.

description: A fantastic restaurant. The atmosphere is cozy and the food is fresh and well prepared. Highly recommend the Octopus Salad as others have mentioned for an appetizer. For my main course I had the duck breast and it was exquisite! Crispy skin perfectly cooked. Good for both special occasions and a casual dinner.
author: Bijan M.

description: This was the single best dining experience my girlfriend and I have ever had and we regularly dine at much more expensive/highly regarded restaurants.  The service was outstanding, the food was believably delicious.  We never waited long for anything.  The wine was exceptional.  The prices were reasonable. I can't say enough about how great it was.  We also happen to live only 6 blocks away and appreciate being able to walk here easily.  Love, love, love this place!
author: Dan J.

description:
Based on the reviews, I was expecting a far better experience.  The server was exceptionally cold and distant. I wouldn't say she was rude, but she certainly detracted from the experience. 

Unfortunately the food was mediocre to poor. We ordered the burrata appetizer. It had a minuscule amount of cheese and was served on a small artichoke which was hard to the point I had to spit it out as it was not something that could be swallowed. 

The smoked salmon appetizer was decent but uninspired. 

The steak tartare was overly spiced and not particularly appetizing. 

Of the main courses, the spaghetti bolognese was ok, but nothing special. 

The worst was the blue nose bass.  Small piece of over cooked fish.  Miserable.  They should be ashamed to serve this. 

In summary, the experience did not come close to matching the rating on Yelp.  Beware!
author: Avi L.

description: I gave 2 stars because the food wasn't terrible, and it was only my first time there. But nonetheless it still left a bad enough taste that I probably won't return. Long story short, it was my bfs bday, I had called several times to confirm---especially an hr before our reservation reminding them it's for a bday. I believe I had spoken with Brian, any who we show up, we order dessert, and nothing. Not even a candle, they had completely forgotten. Such a disappointment. Lost a customer.
author: D S.

description: Such a nice neighborhood restaurant. Rebecca and Jon make you feel like you're part of their family. The risotto is always so yummy along with everything else! Check it out. You're gonna be happy you did!
author: Kathy C.

description: Saw this place from the cable car and remembered the location.  Found it on yelp and wow are we glad we did!   John, the host, made us feel like locals.  The wine was priced right.  Service was impeccable.  We started with a gnocchi appetizer, My husband considers himself a gnocchi expert   and thought they were superb.  I had a filet mignon you could cut with a fork that was cooked perfectly with accompaniments that made me want to lick the plate.  Thank goodness the bread was terrific.  My husband has the halibut which he said was great.  Well cooked and seasoned.  Dessert?  We weren't hungry but we had to have the black and white bread pudding. I hate to admit it but we finished the entire plate.
author: Mary S.

description:
What a treat!  Tucked In a cozy neighborhood on Russian hill, this gem was busy but not packed. Call ahead for a reservation or you can walk in to grab a seat at the wine bar.

We started with the wild mushroom bruschetta with a Sauv blanc and a prosecco -- delicious. We then had a duck confit salad and a cauliflower bisque - another win.

My husband decided to stay with the duck for his main course and I had the pork chop. Both very well prepared, and exactly what we were hoping for.

Service was very attentive. Not a quiet place on a Thursday evening, but a beautiful dinner spot.
author: Charity R.

description: Fast service, friendly staff and excellent food! Ambiance was warm and inviting and the walk back to Union Square was perfect after a delicious meal!
author: Judy D.

description:
I'm sure some ladies can relate. You meet a guy that you're really into. He's tall, handsome, charming, and knows all the right things to say to make you swoon. Every time you see him, your heart skips a beat.

As my wise friend always says, "You gotta check out the gym before signing up for membership." So you do but you have to locate it with  tweezers. Whomp Whomp Whomp. I guess that's why strap-ons were created right? *SIGH*

Finding a microscopic gym is a disappointment which is exactly how I felt about Frascati. I've had this bookmarked for years and with an overall 4.5 star rating, I thought it would be the perfect place to bring my foodie friend for her belated birthday dinner. Unfortunately, Frascati turned out to be one of the most overrated restaurants I've been to this year. While it may be a good neighborhood restaurant when you have very few choices available to you, it wasn't worth traveling across the city for (unlike their sister restaurant Campanula Kitchen & Bar: http://www.yelp.com/biz/campanula-kitchen-and-bar-san-francisco#hrid:vM9Bzx9OpgZIz8SWtSXsiQ). Everything we ordered was mediocre across the board; some dishes were bland, others too salty and/or not very well executed.

F O O D
*Russet Potato Gnocchi w/ Leeks, Butternut Squash, Mushrooms, Sage, Parmesan & White Truffle Oil ($10): 2 STARS
http://bit.ly/YcCJM5
Doughy and dense, the gnocchi was not how I envisioned it to be (I like it fluffy) neither did the blandness of the dish even the truffle oil couldn't save.

*Octopus Salad w/ Wild Arugula, Potato Confit, Orange Segments, Olives & Chorizo Vinaigrette ($12): 4 STARS
http://bit.ly/YcCMaM
The best dish of the night, the octopus was poached then grilled making it deliciously tender. The mélange of peppery arugula, sweet orange and chorizo vinaigrette made it one tantalizing salad.

*Grilled Pork Chop w/ White Bean Puree, Braised Escarole, Mostarda, Pickled Beech Mushrooms & Stone Ground Mustard Jus ($27): 3 STARS
http://bit.ly/WiUpp1
While the pork chop was perfectly cooked to a medium rare and nicely tender, it was underseasoned. The accompanying veggies were as mushy as Gerber baby food.

*Maple Leaf Duck Breast w/ Herb Spaetzle, Maitake Mushrooms, Hearts of Palm & Huckleberry Sauce ($26): 2 STARS
http://bit.ly/12knkJU
A highly touted dish on Yelp, the duck was an utter disappoint. Overcooked, overrendered, and overseasoned, the uber salty duck was tough, dry, and the not so crisp skin had lost all of its rich fattiness. The accompanying herb spaetzle and mushrooms were just plain bland.

*Warm Black & White Chocolate Bread Pudding w/ Hazelnut Ice Cream, Caramel & Chocolate Sauce ($8): 2.5 STARS
http://bit.ly/T49jwj
A deceptive name, this over-hyped dessert is basically a brownie a la mode. I didn't care for it as it was dry, heavy, and too sweet for my taste.

S E R V I C E
Friendly, warm, and attentive, the service is just as would expect from a charming neighborhood restaurant. Food service was timely.

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R 
Cozy and tightly packed with yellow hued walls, wooden flooring, and Christmas lights adorning the balcony, Frascati is good for intimate dinner dates but not for large groups. Sit near the window to watch the cable car pass by and people watch or sit on the mezzanine to oversee the action on the kitchen while the aroma travels up into the mezzanine. 

P A R K I N G 
Street parking in Russian Hill is probably the worst in the city because there are no nearby lots and no valet parking is available. Allot an extra 30+ minutes for finding parking.

If you're looking for a real neighborhood gem, head over to nearby Allegro Romano (http://www.yelp.com/biz/allegro-romano-san-francisco#hrid:JZWIUVS3v93tIAJsj9YI0A) and be prepared to be swooned by sexy Italian stallions.  ( ^ _ ~ )
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
What a delightful spot! 4.5 stars. Perfect for a date night. It's on the smaller side and quiet, very intimate vibe and totally unassuming. Service was impeccable. We shared the cheese plate and the octopus salad to start. The octopus salad is a must. For our mains we shared the halibut and fresh tagliatelle with sausage, ramp pesto and tomatoes. Halibut was decent but the tagliatelle is another must. For dessert we shared the affogato, which was one of the best I've had.

Bottom line: Frascati is a total gem. Definitely worth a visit!
author: Casey N.

description:
What we ordered:

- Bruschetta and Gnocchi: both were so delicious. If I had to pick one, I'd go with the bruschetta
- Roasted half chicken: Perfectly cooked! The skin was crispy and the chicken was really juicy
- Tagliatelle: Pasta was cooked to perfection. My least favorite out of all the dishes we had but the bar was set high.

Overall really good service, food, and wine. Looking forward to coming back and trying their other dishes.
author: Laura D.

description: Nice ambiance, romantic setting on a hill right by the cable cars. Neighborhood feel with lovely interior decor. Smaller restaurant but not tight and not too loud. Service was attentive and polite. Owner came to say hello towards the end of our meal. Food was really good. From the 2 appetizers to main entrees to dessert. Just scrumptious!  We had the gnocchi, which was silky and smooth. Octopus salad had hints of so many hidden flavors but was light and just right. We had maple duck breast and halibut as main courses. Both were excellent. There were ingredients in the dishes that I couldn't recognize but whatever they were, they were a delightful mix. Dessert was peach and blackberry cobbler and was just heavenly. We didn't utter a word until we savored every crumb!  Speechless!
author: Sue W.

description:
All I can say what an excellent place to eat.. Perfect view on Russian Hill.. Iron Flat Steak was excellent.. Hostess and staff was excellent . Perfect place for a good date.
Go D-Town Tigers..
author: Mr. S.

description: Cozy restaurant with professional, attentive service. Food was expertly prepared and served promptly. I had the burrata and the pork chop. Beautifully presented and delicious. Nice wine list as well. Only reason for 4 stars is that it is warm in the restaurant. Windows were opened, but not enough circulation. (Gentlemen, dress in short sleeves.) Fortunately, we were seated next to a portable box fan that saved our experience. Would definitely visit again when the weather is cooler.
author: Rhett H.

description: If you're looking for a special night out and want to have amazing Italian food come to this place!!!
author: Luz R.

description: Made reservations here for my birthday two weeks ago and I had such a great experience! It was delicious. I got the burrata, duck breast, and the chocolate bread pudding. I can't believe it was bread pudding since it tasted like chocolate cake! Couldn't even tell the difference. We were the last ones dining in there and the staff didn't even rush us at all. Such a pleasant dinner and I would totally come back!
author: Diane L.

description:
Went here for Saturday night before a concert at the Masonic, with a couple of guests age 70+. What a great find, I don't get over to Russian Hill much, and this is a perfect intimate, neighborhood restaurant just as I'd hoped. Service friendly with no attitude. What fine restaurants always used to look and feel like.

Octopus salad was divine, tender and tasty. Wine options varied and fair. Pork chop juicy on the bone, with delicious beans and sauce. Pappardelle yummy. I'm sure you cannot go wrong with this menu.
author: Craig S.

description:
Really nice place with good service and delicious food. The fillet mignon and salmon bruschetta were amazing.

Parking in the area is a bit of an issue( look for parking close to Hyde and Broadway) but the food is well worth the hassle.
author: Hashim C.

description: John and Rebecca Rader truly create a cozy, warm and welcoming atmosphere at Frascati.  The staff knows their wine and pairs perfectly with your menu selections, the steak tartare is out of this world whatever they do with the beets in there adds such a freshness.  It's delicious.  The stress of the week dissolves quickly sitting in the picture window, watching the cable cars roll by and neighborhood folks walking their dogs. My favorite is the mushroom bisque it's perfectly balanced.  So good!  Each time we visit the dishes are full of flavor, cooked to the finest standards with such care and detail.  I love this place.  When you leave your soul is full.  (and tummy..)
author: Carie P.

description: We just had an enjoyable dinner at Frascati, not the least of which was the attentive (but not overwhelming) service.  We started with the burrata toasts and the gnocchi, both of which had excellent flavor combinations.  We then shared the little gem salad, again with delightful flavors.  My main course was the duck breast -- thick pieces seared crispy on one side and properly pink in the middle.  My wife enjoyed her risotto with eggplant, and we finished off with one of my favorite desserts after a large meal: affogato.   Highest recommendations!
author: Paul K.

description: Totally underwhelmed.  The food was fine but not particularly good.  Waiter never introduced himself, was nowhere to be found and was unhelpful about the menu.  None of the food was bad but nothing was exciting or delicious either.  Cute inside and nice experience with the Hyde cable cars going by though.
author: Erin M.

description:
This was a disappointment.   With such great reviews we expected more.  The service was good, the ambience tasteful tho nothing special and the cheese plate was a decent start.   But it was downhill from there.  My GFs dish (gnocchi) was dry and uninspired.  My pappardelle was too watery to really show it's flavour.  

I give it a pass for the money.
author: Aaron R.

description: I think this is what folks mean when they speak about great food in SF. Romantic ambiance set the tone for an elegant and memorable dinner. Great wine, great service. Wish I lived in SF so I could go there regularly.
author: Renée F.

description: Amazing food and dining experience. Food was top notch and enjoyed the ambiance. Great music too. The only reason I won't give it five stars is because the seating is tight and the bathroom is tiny. But I love neighborhood places and I really recommend this one.
author: Kristen R.

description: Here for a celebratory dinner and it was well worth it. We got the anchovies, gnocchi, chicken and papperedelli. Everything we got tasted sublime. Loved the ambiance as well. We got to sit on the top level that had a wonderful view of the whole restaurant. Finished it off with the black and white pudding that was definitely the cherry on top of our dinner. It was definitely a memorable dinner. Glad we made it out there.
author: Pushyak K.

description:
This was an unbelievably great experience and I almost don't want to post just in case more people discover this true gem but I do want to express my gratitude to Frascati and staff for a great evening. 

We went on a busy Sunday night with no reservation and my boyfriend and I were able to get prime seating and were treated wonderfully. 

We sat at the bar with an amazing bartender/server with over 25 years experience (sorry I've forgotten his name!) and had amazing potato gnocchi, half chicken (delicious) and even when the tagliatelle pasta dish I wanted sold out, the chef created something very similar for me without batting an eyelid.

Romantic, cosy but fun environment, fantastic authentic Italian food, great service and highly recommend the chocolate bread pudding and the Syrah by the glass ;) We will definitely be back
author: Jess S.

description:
Beautiful space - I love the location on Hyde and cozy atmosphere inside.  The host was incredibly friendly/sweet when he welcomed us in.  Unfortunately, our waitress was not warm or friendly at all.  She came over to our table, did not even say hello or smile and started in with, "can I get you anything to drink?"  This was a little disappointing right off the bat.  Thankfully (and I'm not sure the reason) about halfway through our night, we had a different waiter who was wonderful and took care of us for the rest of our visit.  

The food - left me feeling "meh"
Gnocchi appetizer - amazing!  If I go back, I will double this and order as my meal.  The bread salad - was OK, didn't blow me away.  I did like the dressing on it, though.  
Tagliatelle - delicious, lots of flavor, pasta is homemade, good portion
Roasted half chicken - Dad complained it wasn't a big enough portion.  He said everything served with the chicken tasted good, though.    
Halibut - So disappointing, especially since our waitress said it was the best thing on the menu.  The halibut was cooked perfectly, but the dish had no flavor.  I had a couple bites with pancetta that were OK, but for the most part it was bland.  I wouldn't order this dish again.  
Bread pudding - surprised people say to order this.  I thought the bread pudding was kind of dry and seemed to fall apart.  The hazelnut ice cream was the best part of the dessert.  I wouldn't order again. 

Overall - Not worth the money.  The gnocchi was really the only thing that stood out or that I'd come back for.
author: Elise C.

description:
I really wanted to give this place 4 stars, but unfortunately it's just not quite there yet. Service was great, atmosphere a bit noisy but cozy, the food is what is keeping me from giving that 4 star rating. To be fair, this place definitely is a 3.5 leaning towards the 4 star mark. 

We came here to celebrate my mom's birthday. Starting with the salmon bruschetta, octopus salad, and the gnocchi. The appetizers were delicious, I really enjoyed all three, and after consuming them I was prepared for a stellar main dish. Unfortunately, the duck was dry =(. I like to eat my duck medium rare, with a nice pink middle, unfortunately, mine was served well done. The same was seen with my girlfriend's duck. Big bummer! However, my parents who had the chicken and the risotto absolutely loved their dishes. Maybe we just came on an off night and the duck master was on vacation? At any rate, I am totally prepared to give this place another try, I just wish the consistency of their food was seen across the board.
author: Alex L.

description: Cute, little, tucked away restaurant. Cozy, small, intimate. The food is delicious, it's not overfilling, just right!! I loved it!! Definitely come back when I'm in San Francisco again!
author: Cherish M.

description:
What a cool place! Very intimate with great ambiance. Perfect for a date night or a special meal. 

Burrata toast: 5/5. Super creamy and delicious 

Octopus salad: 5/5. This was amazing! Octopus was cooked perfectly and the pairing of chorizo, olives, orange and peppery arugula was so yummy!

Maple leaf duck breast: 5/5. This was the best duck I've ever had! Not usually a fan, but this was cooked perfectly and so tender. The huckleberry jus gave it a nice bit of tang/acid which went nicely with the richness of the duck.

Pappardelle: 4/5. Also very good, but the 3 above were the stars of the show.

Would definitely return!
author: Kori P.

description: I found the food here awful. Everything had a sour taste, like it was inexpertly prepared. My wife had bread salad and gnocchi, I had burrata and steak. The prices are no bargain either.
author: Rich K.

description: Amazing burrata, wine and pasta and service was great! Very efficient and staff worked well together as a team!
author: Tina L.

description: Right on the cable car main drag, we secured a prime spot near the window, as the place opened at 5:30pm.  Watching the cable cars pass by was a treat.  This is a classy joint, but does a nice job of balancing sophistication and pretension.  The Tomato bisque to kick the meal off was heavenly..piping hot.  The bread and olive oil was appreciated, as was the coke, although having to pay $4 per refill was not.  The filet mignot, grilled chicken and duck were all glorious.  Well done.
author: Iftikhar K.

description:
+ burrata appetizer is YUM!!
+ maple duck breast was perfectly cooked
+ seafood for the linguini was really fresh
+ the desserts look amazing
+ cute 3-seat bar for those eating alone
author: Sherry L.

description:
Its been a while and I should have already reviewed them because the food is great.

When I'm in SF again I will be back and I will be getting one dish for sure...
Fresh Pappardelle with the Lamb sauce. Lissa G and I are trying to stay away from carbs but this made me realize that as an Italian that is blasphemy!

We were lucky enough to get a spot at their very small 4 person bar.  MAKE RESEVATIONS in advance if you are coming from out of town. It has 4.5 for a reason and you shouldn't miss out.
author: Jim G.

description:
For the price, three stars might even be generous.

I came here to celebrate a birthday and was pretty disappointed. We had the cheese plate and the strawberry salad for appetizers, which were both good. Our main courses were the miss. I had the duck breast, which was too salty and overall meh. The sauce just sort of lacked viscosity and flavor. My husband had the pappardelle, which he didn't even finish. 

For dessert we had the apple cobbler, which was good but not great, and the strawberry "shortcake" (admittedly, shortcake is in quotes on the menu and I maybe should've known better), which was one strawberry on a hard cookie with lots of cream. Sadness. 

I feel like if we just came for salads and appetizers and wine, this place might've been a winner.
author: Megan B.

description:
5 stars for ambiance and service. 
3 stars for food.
based on that, this should be a 4 star rating but I really didn't think the food was worth 4 stars.

We got:
- roasted eggplant risotto - the best thing we got, creamy and delicious
- roasted half chicken - I usually never order chicken at restaurants because it comes out dry, but multiple people raved about the chicken being the best dish on the menu. Unfortunately, ours was incredibly dry and therefore not good.
- short ribs - flavorful but not very tender. 

Perhaps we went on an off night, since the interior was lovely and our server was outstanding, but the food was very average.
author: Amy Y.

description: Wonderful atmosphere & service, but mediocre, uninspired and, unfortunately, tasteless food, from entree to dessert.  Disappointing.
author: Ruth B.

description: Excellent local restaurant in the neighborhood. Service was top notch. We had the octopus salad, halibut, pork chop, Meyer lemon cake, and black and white bread pudding. The standouts for me were the octopus salad, pork chop, and bread pudding. Now that I've moved into the neighborhood, I'll definitely be back often!
author: Robert L.

description:
Sorry, I just don't get what all the hype is about.  Food wasn't great, and the service was really disappointing.  For a little neighborhood place like this, with such great rating, I expected so much more, but the overall experience was mediocre at best.

The salads were weird: I had the grilled bread salad, which I thought would be a nice panzanella, but it was mainly a bunch of greens with some cruttons, which weren't anything special, and some sparse other ingredients.  I almost thought there was no onion, but then I founds some.  The octopus salad wasn't much better, with very little octopus, and it was kind of flavorless.

The swordfish special we had was reallly weird.  It was supposed to be served with grilled radicchio, but had maitake mushrooms instead.  The pork chop was a little over-cooked and not very tasty.

Dessert was pretty unimpressive too.  As was our server, who just seemed to have no time or patience to help us out with wine choices...maybe he lacked the knowledge to really engage, I don't know.  We ordered a glass of sparkling each before the menus even came, and were ready to drink to celebrate, but we ended up with just some glass pours because he didn't give me the confidence to committ to a bottle.

Maybe this place is coasting on an old reputation?  The guy at the door was very nice I remember, but that was about it.
author: Craig Z.

description: The place is small but warm and intimate.  The food was delicious and the service attentive.  It's always a pleasant experience to find an establishment that doesn't overcook their dishes.  The service was attentive without being intrusive.  Parking is always a challenge on Russian Hill but we just came before the high rush hour.
author: Susan L.

description:
Such a delightful date night spot! Intimate seating, perfect lighting, easy to have a great conversation with the person you're with, not too noisy... I could go on! I'll start at the beginning:

Located on tree-lined Hyde street right along the cable car line. 
Upon arrival, host didn't even allow me to get to the door before he opened the door for me. We were immediately taken to a table with a perfect view of the cable car line. I loved how the menu sets the stage for a nice dining experience: it states that no hats are permitted, and to leave your phone in your pocket or purse! Not at the table! 

To start, we had a mushroom bruschetta, which I didn't think you could make so freaking flavorful! And while our entree's were great, I think this appetizer stole the show. I had the cod, hubby had the pork, both were pretty darn good (but hubby thought his pork dish was a bit too tomato heavy). Service throughout the service was knowledgable and helpful. 

Great wine list, and desert wine list. Paired perfectly with the desert we ordered.  And of course, we still walked by Swenson's ice cream on the way home, because two deserts are better then one. I recommend you do the same:)
author: Meredith A.

description: Incredibly overrated restaurant. The food was bland and drained in excess vinegar. It is difficult to spoil burrata but this place managed to do so. The atmosphere is great for folks in their 50/60s but is otherwise unimpressive. Not quite sure how this place got as many positive reviews as it did. We were certainly misguided by all the positive feedback.
author: Leo M.

description:
Sometimes an experience at a solid 4-star restaurant on Yelp is...really just a three star one. Maybe it was an off night. Maybe it was that our expectations were too high. Maybe it just really isn't four stars. Maybe it really just is...A-OK.

Boyfriend wanted to make it a special date night, but knows almost nothing about the Bay Area. His usual is go to Yelp, find highest rated, oh look there it is! Okay let's go here. I tried to explain that sometimes that just isn't how it works, but he insisted and so I let him. That and we couldn't get reservations to The Palace so this was next on our list. We were able to get a 9:30p reservation on a Saturday night.

Parking is a nightmare. No heels lest you want a reason to use that deductible on your newly-mandated health insurance or you're an experienced drag queen.

The wine was good. Came out quick enough. We ordered two starters; burrata and the wild mushroom bruschetta. We watched hopefully as a table of four was seated 10 minutes after us...receive their starters about 15 minutes before we did. Maybe it was 20. The point is that we waited for about 25 minutes for our starter. To their defense the staff were apologetic, but I cannot believe that a restaurant would take 25 minutes to plate a simple starter or two during a time when most of the patrons were drinking their last sips of wine and signing the check.

The dinner itself was good - the quail risotto was fantastic, actually. The pomegranate seeds would burst as you chewed into it, making this complex flavor pairings amongst the butternut squash and creamy risotto. The filet mignon was equally delicious, but I can't comment much because that wasn't my dish.

The crowning disappointment of the meal, of course, was dessert. Their piece de resistance, the black and white chocolate cake with hazelnut ice cream is touted as "amazing" "omg" and "nomnomnom." To me it was dense, dry, and completely underwhelming. The hazelnut ice cream was good but absolutely not measured to the critical acclaim as it is shown in fellow reviews. Did we get an off piece of cake? Was the pastry chef out of town and they let their intern make it? I'm saddened because my love for chocolate knows no bounds, and yet there I was...not touching the cake.

The service was good, albeit slow. On a Saturday night. At 10p. Which is fine, I guess...until you look at the bill. Then it's not so great.

Maybe we'll come back, but not before we explore the rest of the city first.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Simple food made well! Excellent service. Party of 3 to celebrate an early birthday. The staff heard me talking about my friends bday and they put a candle on her dessert. Also we asked them to help us take a few pictures and they helped us take a lot! Water was always refilled. Got checked up on when needed, but wasn't overbearing. 

They give you bread to start off with, but it's not warm

Steak Tartare with Lemon-Caper Aioli, Crispy Shallots and Crostini-very well seasoned. Love this. 

Smoked Salmon Bruschetta with Citrus Mascarpone, Pickled Ramps, Chive Creme Fraîche and Micro Arugula-this comes with 2 big pieces, but we asked to make it 3. A lot of mascarpone so if you not a cheese fan, this dish isn't for you. I really liked it!

Foie Gras Torchon with Almond Puree, Shaved Kale, Strawberry-Basil Compote and Toast Points-this is a skip. I love Foie, but wasn't anything special and this will fill you up super quick. 

Corn Bisque with Corn Salsa-corn is in season. Sweet and savory. Perfect!

Octopus Salad with Potato Confit, Wild Arugula, Orange Segments, Olives and Chorizo Vinaigrette-I don't like octopus because it's usually way too chewy, but it was super good. Cooked perfectly and great flavors. One of my favorite dishes of the night. I can't believe I just said that! 

Fresh Pappardelle with Braised Beef Sugo, Chili Flakes, Baby Spinach, Roasted Tomato and Pecorino Romano-they do not skimp on the meat. More meat than pasta. Super tender and great sauce!

Maple Leaf Duck Breast with Crispy Duck Confit Hash, Citrus, Mâche-Fennel Salad and Huckleberry Jus-this is a must! Delicious.  

Not sure how we finished all that food and got dessert. 

Affogato Chocolate Chip Biscotti, Chantilly, Espresso and Vanilla Ice Cream-birthday girl wanted this. It's nothing special to me, but she really liked it. 

Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta Caramelized Bananas and Almond Roca-this was good. Refreshing after all that food we had.
author: Karen H.

description:
Nice neighborhood restaurant! 

Took a friend here for her birthday. Has the feel of a special occasion place. We were looked after well! Our server was super knowledgeable and helpful. All his suggestions were right on! 

The food was good! Everything we ordered was very tasty and served with gusto. The russet potato gnocchi was a stand out! 

If there was a downside it was the space. The space was a little tight, with the people at the next table feeling like a part of our dining experience. We found ourselves having to speak louder to be heard and we had to tune out our neighbors when we weren't talking.
author: Andrew M.

description: We saw this place as we were traveling on the SF Trolly, made a reservation and got held up in the Financial District. Brian was nice enough to hold our table. We had an amazing meal and the service was above par. We would totally go back the next time we visit. A must try!!
author: Tiffinny L.

description: We had a great time here.  Gabby was our server and she was top notch.  Friendly, attentive, knowledgeable, and unobtrusive.  We loved every thing we had.  I'm looking forward to our next visit.
author: Jan F.

description: I wanted a special place to celebrate my husband's birthday. Frascati turned out to be a great choice. It's in a lovely neighborhood setting complete with cable cars to watch while dining. The host was gracious and welcoming. We were asked if we would like a glass of wine and seated promptly. The menu and wine list had many tempting choices and we enjoyed our meal immensely.
author: Colleen M.

description: My favorite place is to sit at the bar.  The waiters are all so wonderful and helpful with their food & wine recommendations.  They never rush to finish your food or fine.  The food is beyond magnificent and the wine is always so excellent.  The desserts are to die for and they make a darn good coffee!  The pastas, the meat, the fish - so tasty!  It's a must!
author: Anjali K.

description: My favorite restaurant in the city. Perfect for date night. Amazing wine and food. Go there expecting to spend a bit more money, but you'll love the food.
author: Anthony S.

description: Amazing--fantastic food, reasonable price, incredibly welcoming hosts.  Beautiful decor and lighting, wonderful atmosphere and overall an amazing. Always have a seat at the table and an amazing Friday / Saturday night, would absolutely return here for a date or any other special occasion with friends / family. Love it!!! Great wine list too
author: Erica F.

description: Expected greatness but was just average. The food was good but nothing outstanding. I had the chicken which was good but we were a large party and my guests were not very pleased. Well below the reviews I had seen
author: Jay G.

description: I love this place.  Great spot for a date night.  Good eats - loved the fresh tagliatelle, the meatballs were bomb and moist, the dessert was really good, and the gnocchi was amazing.  Really good spot!
author: christopher h.

description:
Came here for our anniversary and the meal was amazing from start to finish. The waitress was very helpful and opinionated about menu items and their entire wine list, which was very refreshing (I hate when people haven't even tried the food at their restaurants!!).  The wine recommendations were excellent and the food was sooo good.  I literally think I ate an entire zoo in terms of variety of dishes. 

We got the: 

Steak tartare- YUM, the olive spread (i think) on the side was amazing mixed with the steak. 

Octopus salad-my favorite thing of the entire night; I would come back here just for a glass of wine and that salad any day.  The brined and then grilled octopus was out of this worlllddd texture-wise and the combination with arugula and potatoes was yuuumm--mmy! 

Duck Confit salad-also really good but the BF finished it faster than I could steal more than a small bite..

Roasted Chicken- up there with NOPA for best chicken I've had in the city. The skin was perfectly crispy and the meat was sooo tender! I loved the artichokes on the bottom :) 

Pork Chop-cooked perfectly but seemed to be underseasoned for me and over seasoned for the BF. I think he inhaled a peppercorn or something.  

Chocolate bread pudding- I dont think I'm a bread pudding person. The texture was bizarre, but that's more to me wanting it to be like a brownie..the ice cream though, WOOOOOOWWWWWWWW. 

Cant give it 5 stars since the waitress did forget our bottle of wine for like 20 minutes and I didn't love everything I tried BUT it was an incredible meal and solid 4 stars!
author: Raina D.

description:
Came here for a special occasion w/ the misses. Once in a while we try these nice restaurants and often times we are impressed. This was no different. 

The vibe of the place is very calm and mellow. It's two floor seating in a great neighborhood. We walked in and were immediately greeted by the staff. Actually showed up a bit early but they were able to seat us. 

The waiter really sold the chicken. I don't often order chicken but he said this is a bit different than what we'd expect. The misses ordered the chicken and it was actually really good but nothing out of this world. I mean, it's chicken. 

I got the pork chop. AMAZING. Probably the best I've had in a long time if not ever. I'm a bit new to eating pork so maybe I'm not an expert. But I really enjoyed it. 

For appetizers we got their octopus salad and gnocchi. The salad was the best thing we ordered and I highly recommend. The gnocchi I've had better. It was bland.

We even ordered their bread pudding dessert. And it did not disappoint. I was just already stuffed. But it was REALLY GOOD.
author: Yevgeniy K.

description:
The good:  Very attentive, generous pours of wine, great atmosphere, the bread pudding.

That not as good:  Portions not very large, even compared to other high-end expensive restaurants, so I felt it was not the best value.
author: Kelly M.

description: Wonderful dinner!! Gnocci appetizer was amazing. Lamb pasta dish was also fantastic.
author: Shawn P.

description: Service was great. Location was easy. Price was reasonable. Food was good but not amazing. Would try something else before I come back here.
author: Michal D.

description:
Had a really nice dinner here the other week. The ambiance is really warm and romantic, and you can sit downstairs where it's more boisterous or upstairs where you have a view of the place and a little more quiet. 

The food was solid, but I think the ambiance and the service wins over (hence my rounding up to 4 stars). I'd come back and try some different dishes.

* Russet Potato Gnocchi - 3.5 stars
(with Melted Leeks, Mushrooms, English Peas, Baby Carrots, Parmesan and White Truffle Oil $10)
Really nice truffle oil flavor. The gnocchi was soft & chewy but got hard kind of quickly. The veggies in the dish seemed misplaced. 

* Foie Gras Torchon - 2.5 stars
(with apple-currant compote, sauterne gastrique and toasted brioche $14)
The foie gras tasted like canned pate. It was extremely salty as well. Not a dish worth ordering.

* Grilled Pork Chop -
(with Smashed Potato, Pancetta-Grilled Scallion Vinaigrette, Cipollini Jus and Tomato-Olive Compote $27)
My friend got this and enjoyed it.. I didn't get to try a bite =(.

* Maple Leaf Duck Breast - 3.5 stars
(with Herb Spaetzle, Hearts of Palm, Mushrooms, Scallions, Grilled Radicchio and Huckleberry Sauce $26)
Really nice & tender duck breast. There were a lot of flavors and textures that went together pretty well, bu the huckleberry sauce was a little too tart and overpowering.

* Warm black and white chocolate bread pudding - 4.5 stars
(hazelnut ice cream, caramel and chocolate sauce $8)
REALLY nice. This is more of an intense and moist dark chocolate brownie. Just wish the ice cream wasn't as sweet.. something like vanilla bean would have paired perfectly with this.

* Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta - 4 stars
(Caramelized Bananas and Almond Roc)
Also very nice. The panna cotta was a little on the soft side; I like a little more rigidness to my panna cotta (so there is a little more resistence when you slice your spoon through it. Not to the point that it's like Jello. I just like having a balance to the texture).
author: Ziyan C.

description:
This cute/quaint little place was amazing! Went around 6 on Saturday night, and it wasn't too busy yet, so they seated us right away upstairs. It was cool b/c we could see the open kitchen down below!
The interior was very cute + ambiance is great. I was super excited just by seeing the deco, and the waitress was very friendly/welcoming/attentive.

FOOD ORDERED:
For an appetizer, we got the octopus salad. The octopus bites were soft and very flavorful, and the size was perfect for 2 people to share.

For entrees we got the duck after seeing all the wonderful yelp reviews and the pan seared bass. I don't usually like duck AT ALL because the times i've had duck, it was too oily and greasy... and i just don't like it. but this duck was SO GOOD! i felt like i was eating a unique steak, and it def. did not disappoint. the bass was also AMAZING! it was super soft and juicy, and i highly highly recommend it!

overall, i had a very good experience. although it was pricey, the food + service def. made up for it! :) thank you frascati.
author: Alee C.

description: This place is great and one of the better restaurants in the neighborhood.  Their menu items are consistently good and have a true European flavor - from their charcuteries and cheeses to their pastas and more.   They are truly a neighborhood favorite hangout for a good reason.  I recommend sparkling wine/champagne with the roasted pear salad and their house "tempernillo" with the charcuterie.   The Friuli Cab Franc pairs well with both the filet and the Tuna Tagliatelle.  One BIG suggestion: They need to add the Mac n cheese side dish from Campanula (the sister restaurant that closed in our neighborhood...wahh!) @ Frascati!!! :D (hint, hint)
author: Mitzi A.

description:
This neighborhood gem is my go to for accessible, elegant dining where you don't have to dress up. I've been here multiple times and the service is always top notch (with a wee bit of playful attitude). The best places to sit are at the counter and upstairs where you can people watch and see the action in the kitchen. 

As for food get the half roasted chicken. It's so darn good. The skin is seared so it's like butter. The risotto is excellent too. For appetizer I got the little gem salad. Perfect amount of dressing. The menu is limited which is good, sometimes too much choice is a bad thing. You can't go wrong with anything you order. 

Good wine list and save room for dessert.

This is also a great place for a romantic date.
author: Timoteo K.

description: Husband took me here for our anniversary. Exceptional food and incredible service. Well worth your time. Be sure to book a reservation for your next special event. Truly made our anniversary dinner memorable!!
author: Miranda G.

description: The food, wine selection, ambiance and service is very good. But unfortunately, this place is overpriced for what it is. The portions are small and the prices are high. Furthermore, the menu selection is limited. We settled for the chicken, which was very good and the gnocchi appetizer was excellent but $15 for 10 gnocchi seemed a bit ridiculous.
author: Michael M.

description:
I noticed this place after dining at Stones Throw & wanted to give it a try.  I made reservations for four.

The place is cute.  We ordered the Cheese plate & a salad to share.  For main courses we had the Steak, Duck, Grilled Pork Chop & the Pasta dish.  No dessert - we went to Swensens for ice cream!

The Waiter NEVER asked us how we wanted our meats cooked.  My son prefers a rare steak & it was well done for him.  My pork chop was dry & way over cooked.  I like my meats well done but moist.  Overall, I expected the food to have been more delish & full of wonderful favors.  The meats should be tender & full of juices!  This was disappointing.

Our Waiter wasn't exactly warm & friendly.  He wasn't rude - but didn't make us feel he was happy to serve us either.  The other wait staff seemed better & made up for it.

We won't be returning.  Will stay with Stones Throw when we dine in the area again.
author: Marie E.

description: Very good choice. I had the chicken which was cooked perfectly. The only downside is the price point. I will definitely be back.
author: Peggy C.

description:
Believe the reviews -- neighborhood gem, traditional SF, old-school service, quality food -- it's all true. Service and food was excellent on a recent Saturday night. We arrived 45 minutes early, hoping by some chance we might get seated somewhat early, but definitely planning to wait. We were seated instantaneously (maybe a fluke, but still). Besides some slight confusion with two waiters taking our orders, service was solid. The ambiance and size of the restaurant is really wonderful, too. I'd love to sit in the second-floor mezzanine to get a view of the whole place.

The buratta crostini and clams were amazing to start off with. Prosecco was delicious. We went with the maple duck breast and sea bass as our entrees and never looked back. Both were cooked to perfection. The sea bass came with the best romesco sauce I've ever had.

Oh, and save room for the black-and-white bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream. Yeah. I would go just for that in a heartbeat.

This made me never want to eat at an overhyped SF restaurant again. Frascati is the real deal.
author: Elena K.

description:
My husband and I love this quaint little restaurant, which is embedded so peacfully on the corner just up the street from our place in Russian Hill. We've been twice, and have had excellent experiences both times. For entrees, the two dishes that stood out in my opinion were 1) the rabbitt and 2) the roasted chicken. I know what you're thinking - chicken? Why would you order chicken, are you nuts? But oh, this chicken will change your mind about ordering chicken out. It was the juiciest, best tasting chicken I've ever tasted. Also, typically my husband and I are not into dessert, but the warm chocolate cake was calling out to us from the menu, screaming "eat me!!" So glad we caved! What a delicious ending to such a great meal!"

The service here is also stellar. The perfect amount of attention where they're there when you need a refill on your wine, but not too much such that they feel like they are hovering over you all the time. Both times, we had excellent servers, and everyone else in the restaurant that we spoke with were also very accommodating and friendly.

I highly recommend you take someone special...or even a group of girlfriends...out for a nice meal at this cozy little restaurant. Word of caution, if you need to drive, parking is not ideal in this neighborhood (which is why we are so glad to have the luxury of walking over!). Also, reservations are booked out quite a bit in advance, so keep that in mind as well.
author: Rachael S.

description: Every time we've been here, the food has been outstanding!!  Not only is the food great but the service is just as good.  This is a neighborhood gem!!
author: George M.

description:
This is a legitimate 5 stars. Across the board from service, food quality, and experience...not a single complaint. 

The menu changes constantly so this is based on the night  of 5/3/13. We shared the burrata that came with Wild Arugula and a tomato-mint jam. Highly recommend. 

I had the swordfish which was grilled and flavored nicely. Served in a light broth with spinach and mushrooms. It was delicious. 

My girlfriend had the pasta special Tagliatelle with pancetta which was also very good. 

It is expensive so this is definitely a place to treat yourself or that special someone. Probably not a once a week place but absolutely a place to come back to for a nice evening out or special occasion.
author: Derek S.

description:
Great food, very accomodating staff and cute ambiance.

I love Frascati. The food is consistently good. The waitstaff and hostess, in my experience, have always been very helpful and have fit us in without reservations. The restaurant is small but very cute... and right on the cable car line. 

Would go again in a heartbeat!
author: Amy L.

description: 4.5 stars.  I would have given this place five stars except for a slight hiccup in their service model/handoff to new server. Other than that, a really terrific small quaint environment serving awesome food. Everything was cooked to perfection. Great date or couples restaurant.
author: Daryl S.

description: Great appetizers and entrees. Nothing particularly exciting but still a good experience. The dessert we ordered (chocolate bread pudding?) was pretty awful. Id recommend getting dessert somewhere else.
author: Jessica P.

description:
We went to Frascati for the 1st time last weekend and had a wonderful experience! From the moment we walked in & were welcomed so warmly by Brian to after our dessert plates were cleared. Service was super! Food delicious! Setting just right for this charm in Russian Hill.

I do not write reviews unless very pleased or very displeased & this was a great night out that I wanted to share about-
There was some strange issue w/our reservation & Brian called prior to ensure all was set. He sent us a glass of champagne too - classy! We started with their popular gnocchi & were glad we did! Our meals were great and the servers knowledgeable & friendly. I have to close with the fact that the chocolate bread pudding was one of the best desserts I have ever had! We are glad we live so close & can go again!
author: Angela T.

description:
Octopus salad- one of the best things we had

Water melon salad - I don't cook and I could have made this in 4 mins. 

Gnocchi - was dense and not melt in your mouth delicious like at stella alpina in burlingame. 

Pork chop - agree prob best main and cooked to perfection but sauce was top salty and really not all that great. It seemed like it was the same dark sauce they used for the duck, pork and filet. 

Bread pudding - best part was the single scoop of hazelnut ice cream which was great. Bread pudding was good but 4 of us sharing one was plenty. 

Friendly service.
author: Melody T.

description: 8 of us dined tonight at 6:30.  The number in our party changed a couple of times after we made our reservations and the restaurant was very accommodating.  We were seated right away and our service was prompt.  My only complaint...we had a waiter with an attitude.  One member of our group wasn't aware that their bar service did not include liquor...and he ordered a gin and tonic.  Simple, right?  Just say "we don't serve liquor," right?  Well he went into this sarcastic spiel about sending the guy down the street to the market to purchase the liquor and oh by the way, get some tonic too.  Our friend was humiliated and embarrassed. There were several more snooty comments by the waiter...not sure if he thought he was being funny or what...but what would have been a great night turned into a night with an asterisk.  We had a very nice meal--we ordered several different entrees and each was delicious...but oh yeah, that was the place where the waiter was so rude.
author: Dawn W.

description:
Came here for my brother's birthday with a party of seven.

5 Stars for excellent service from every single person who helped us.

The Duck entree and the bread pudding were both 5 star as well.

Octopus salad was 4 and a half stars and the duck salad was also great.

For appetizers, we split a number of dishes- the best was the gnochii though.

Love the setting- as others have described, its a romantic, charming restaurant.
author: Charles S.

description:
Ever think to yourself, "Golly, I just wanna take the lady to a dinner that will get her so turned on that she'll be dying to give me oral pleasure on the way home..."? Well then friend, Frascati is the place for you! It's small, romantic and hands down the best food you will ever have. 

Went with the boyfriend for our anniversary dinner and after parking 40 miles away, (uphill! both ways!) we made our trek to heaven. We were quickly seated and greeted by our awesome waiter. He was excellent! He helped us pick our entrees (braised short ribs for me, maple leaf duck breast for the man) and the perfect wine to compliment it. Now, I'm NOT a big duck eater. They are cute. I would rather pet them. That said, I would murder the shit out of all the ducks in order to have this entree again. In fact, I almost had to murder the shit out of the boyfriend to get him to give me more than one bite. Luckily, he is a smart man. I got two bites and he got to live another day. But I digress...

I took the advice of my fellow yelpers and tried the bread pudding. All I can say is HOLY. FUCKING. SHIT. Good thing I wore my fat girl pants cause we gorged out on that thing. Amazing! 

Seriously, yo. You want to go to Frascati. Take the girlfriend. Get some fancy food and road head. It worked for me and it can work for you too!
author: Angie H.

description: Great local bistro. Good food. Attentive but not intrusive service. And reasonably priced. Easy to get to by bus or cable car. Certainly worth a try.
author: Kathryn S.

description:
10 years living in SF, this is by far my favorite restaurant and the most consistent in quality, service, and blowing my epicurean mind! Owner, staff, everyone is amazing. Wine, Bruschetta, Octopus Salad, THE CHICKEN (SF's best) or whatever amazing little special they've dreamt up is money in my mouth. 

Love is an understatement.
author: Derek R.

description:
Food was good, but not a memorable life experience. So much so, that I forgot what the restaurant was called until I dug it up from my email thread. Servers were not attentive at all, and kind of haughty when you tried to call for their attention.

Cute date night spot, I guess, if you base it on neighborhood, decor and lighting.
author: Diana K.

description: Just arrived in San Francisco and uninterested in tourist fare in marina area. But walking famous Hyde St we came across the cosy Frascati neighborhood restaurant that was packed at 9:00 pm. After a short wait we were seated at a nice table and introduced to a professional and friendly waiter that answered all our question in a friendly and courteous manner. His recommendations were spot on and everything was perfect. The cheese platter was of a nice and tasty variety and was terrific.  The spouse and i were pleased to have perfect halibut. The desert like everything else was also good. Our teen som was very impressed and said it was his favorite family meal. The trolley also passes by and makes getting there easy. Great place.
author: Kelly T.

description:
Very busy, so it can be hard to get a reservation. The food is fantastic. Service efficient and friendly, but not bothersome. We usually go to the bar and save the formality of table seating. Same menu.

Bar tender will take care of you...
author: Jay E.

description: Michelin recommended. Awesome place. Everything was delicious, sophisticated and creative - flavours explodes in ur mouth.  And I mean close your eyes type of good. Starters wAs amazing - mushroom bruschetta and potato gnocchi. Gnocchi to me was slightly above the bruschetta. Mains we had duck and porterhouse pork. Pork was by far the winner. Duck was tender but had some veins. I've never had pork so soft and flavorsome. Waiter also said chicken was popular whilst Michelin guide said bass is good - something to try for next time. Dessert we shared black and white bread pudding - comes with hazelnut icecream. The ice cream was the stand out there. Excellent service. We will be back!
author: I L.

description: Small, but so big on flavor and service! Whilst visiting San Francisco, I had the pleasure of dining here. The Owners (maybe he was a manager) greeted us; they were attentive. I ordered the Pappardelle which was probably one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. The grilled bread salad was also a great starter. My fellow diners raved out their pork chop as well! We ordered a cheese plate and a mushroom bruschetta to eat while we waited on our friends; they were also fantastic. Recommend if you are ever in Russian Hill.
author: J.P. D.

description: The food is incredible here but I felt like it was a bit overpriced. It has one of the best locations though if you want an authentic San Francisco experience. Right on Hyde, you get to enjoy a great meal and watch the street car roll by every now and again. If you're in the neighborhood and want something fancy and nice, check out this place.
author: Samara C.

description:
Frascati is the ultimate date spot for a special occasion or just a nice grown-up weekend dinner.

Secluded on a romantic corner of Hyde, Frascati-diners are treated to a fine European meal in an intimate and charming environment.

Imagine yourself on a secluded block of the cobble-stoned Marais in Paris, sitting at a small table overlooking the sidewalks from your romantic perch with a bottle of red wine. This is Frascati.

Some notable dishes from the 5-7 times I've been here:
--Wild Mushroom Bruschetta: delectable combination of mushrooms and goat cheese, this is the perfect plate to start the meal with
--Roasted Half Chicken: my favorite chicken in San Francisco (far better than Zuni, in my opinion), topped with herbs and breadcrumbs, this is the perfect dish
--Black & White Chocolate Bread Pudding: I'm not really a bread-pudding person, and neither is my boyfriend, but this is one of our favorite desserts in the city. Warm, and oozing with chocolate, I could almost always eat another order.

Classy, romantic, and charming, Frascati is the perfect upscale neighborhood spot.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Absolutely perfect in every way. Our dinner here just might have been the finest dining experience that we have ever had. First, the service was spectacular, even before we arrived. When a member of the staff called me early in the day to confirm my reservation, I asked if it could be moved up. Not only did they accommodate me by changing my reservation, but when my wife and I showed up earlier than expected we were seated immediately. Service during the meal was spot on, with three different staff members taking care of every need in a timely and unobtrusive manner.
