Now, as good as the service was, the food was even more spectacular! We started with the Burrata, which, for me, was the highlight of the evening. The cheese was super fresh, the balsamic was rich, and the combination with the prosciutto and fig jam was AMAZING! Best bite of the night. My entree for the evening was a Dungeness crab risotto. It was perfect; creamy risotto studded with luscious crab, tomato and asparagus. I mopped up every last bit. My wife chose the roasted chicken and, let me tell you, she was in heaven. This is the BEST chicken that we have EVER had; anywhere, anytime, any preparation. This was the essence of chicken on a plate. My wife had a foodgasm with every bite, and, based on the few bites she shared with me, I can understand her joy. We finished our evening with a shared vanilla bean panna cotta, which was once again perfectly prepared and served with caramelized bananas and almond rocca. Every bite was blissful. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough.
author: Jason E.

description:
I've passed up Frascati several times and while we've been meaning to try for quite some time now, the decision to go always end up being an afterthought. Unfortunately the lack of planning always results with us not being able to go because of one of two different reasons: they're booked for the evening or it's past their cut off time for same day reservations which I believe it is 4:45 pm. This time we decided to plan ahead and we reserved a table a day ahead.

We were seated on the mezzanine level near the stairs which was warmly lit and romantic. The venue has quaint charm to it and it is ideal for dates and small parties. Due to the restaurant's cozy scale I would think it would be a challenge to accommodate larger parties. 

Looking around most diners were older out to have a pleasantly quiet Sunday evening dinner with a glass of wine (mostly red). Service was impeccable and they made sure we were pleased with our orders and our water glasses kept full for the duration of the meal. 

Frascati suits the neighborhood it's located in; nice although not pretentious, most would consider it overpriced and somewhat conservative. My only complaint is that the parking in the area is almost impossible however that won't stop us from coming back. Perhaps next time I'll save room for dessert and try that bread pudding. I hear it's wonderful!
author: Esther A.

description:
I took my client and potential angel investor to Frascati to talk shop. From start to finish the lovely folks in Frascati were super attentive and delightful even when we were an hour late. The ambiance reminded me of old San Francisco, speakeasy-ish with dimmed lights imbibed with European decor, yellow walls and crisp white table linens. I would recommend that they do update their web presence -- does not do justice to the experience once you step inside their doors. 

I ordered the Fresh Pappardelle with sugo. The pappardelle was super fresh, light and cooked to perfection. The sauce was super tasty and unforgettable. I can still remember the flavors and it reminds me of my Italian family who I lived with in Chicago. The foie gras torchon was creamy and beautifully presented. For an elegant, light and very Italian finish, I went for the Vanilla Bean Panacotta. 

I would certainly come back here with my boyfriend. :D
author: Jessica V.

description:
Went last weekend with a group of friends and our experience was strange to say the least. 

The food is delicious and everything we ordered was fresh and prepared with top notch ingredients. I'm usually not a fan of octopus but the octopus salad was delicate and interesting. 

Our server was visibly annoyed with my fiends and I from the moment she came to our table. It seemed as though as she was trying to rush us through our meal. We hadn't seen each other in awhile so the first time she came to the table we weren't ready to order. Maybe she was having a bad night but front that point on we got a side order of stink eye with every interaction. 

The tables and decor are intimate which worked perfectly since we were a small group. If I ever go back I'll make sure to study the menu beforehand so my order is ready.
author: Sara D.

description: We had an amazing meal.  We started with some meatballs and spicy tomato sauce, she had the tenderloin and I had the halibut.  All totally amazing.  We finished with the bread pudding, also awesome.  Great meal, nice atmosphere.
author: Nick A.

description:
I stopped by here for dinner a few Tuesdays ago for dinner by myself.  I was on a business trip and wanted to eat good and found Frascati on yelp.  After trekking up and over Hyde, I was ready to eat.  The restaurant looks small at first glance until I realized that there was a back room and a second story with seating.  The tables were all covered in white tablecloths and then white paper while the lighting seemed a bit dark, probably mood lighting.

I decided to start off my meal with the steak tartare.  It came served with some pieces of crostini and crispy shallots.  There was a large amount of tartare and even after heaping it onto the crostini I had some left.  The flavor of it was awesome as it had some acidity (mushroom vinaigrette) that cut through the meat and helped make the taste even better.  For my dinner entree I decided to go with the duck which was served with mushrooms, spaetzle, hearts of palm and a huckleberry sauce.  The duck was a bit under seasoned although tasted exquisite whenever I got some well seasoned bites.  Everything underneath the duck sort of reminded me of a good stuffing and while I enjoyed the Huckleberry sauce at the beginning, I was getting tired of it near the end of my meal.  Still it was a great meal overall.

The bottom line for me is that I would definitely head back here in the future.  Everything about the place was good from the service to the ambiance and especially the food!
author: Jason F.

description: Food is incredible! I have been here a few times and it is delicious. Unique dishes and great wine pairings. Servers are very professional and personable. Will definitely be going back.... Often :)
author: Grace H.

description: Love this place. Perfect place for a romantic dinner. Great lighting, warm atmosphere, attentive wait staff, and top notch food. Highly recommend, we will be back!
author: Sarah Y.

description:
GM Brian did not disappoint with a window seat for us (and there are only two windows!) The window seat showcases a precarious 4-way stop on Russian Hill that highlights how most people do not come to a complete stop in their cars. For goodness sake, STOP! before you hit that lady walking her two little dogs wearing clothes!

Starting with the warm Octopus Salad, we moved on to the Wild Mushroom Bruschetta. I could have been satisfied with just the salad, bruschetta, and wine.  For entrees, we ordered the Roasted Half Chicken and Maple Leaf Duck Breast--all complemented with a Baker Lane pinot noir. For dessert, we had to try the black and white chocolate bread pudding. Again, I was not affected by eating the chocolate as I am so many times at home. 

If I lived on Russian Hill, I would be at Frascati with my girlfriends every week. The ambiance is quintessential San Francisco, the food is delicious and special, and the service is doting.
author: KJ N.

description:
We were lucky enough as tourists to spot this gem from the cable car.  We ate at the corner window table and watched the neighborhood come alive in the evening.  We sampled the appetizer menu and the well priced wine list.

Friendly, skilled service and fun patrons made this an ideal San Francisco experience.
author: Scott W.

description:
I love the corner where Frascati is located. It's such a wonderful setting especially for a dinner around the holidays because you have the lights adorning the trees on the streets and the cable car running by. It just feels so San Francisco, so home. 

Now on to business. I had a reservation here at 5:45 with two friends and was seated promptly. To start, I ordered a Cabernet, but unfortunately I can't tell you what kind it was because I'm not much of a wine drinker. I just know that I like Cabernet! This was definitely the best wine I ever had in my life, which probably isn't saying much, but then again this is coming from someone who doesn't like wine!  At this point I'm having high hopes for the meal.

The nice waitress we had gave us plenty of time to decide on our food and answered any questions we had. We decided on the following:

(1) russet potato gnocchi -- 3 stars. the gnocchi seemed bland and doughy. nothing special.

(2) octopus salad -- 3 stars. for an octopus salad to receive 5 stars, it better have some super fresh octopus and greens, the ingredients in this salad were pretty mediocre.

(3) grilled pork chop -- 4 stars. very well-made, great taste, tender. a solid piece of pork shop. but i wouldn't come here again for the pork chop.

(4) roasted half chicken -- 5 stars. well-seasoned, moist throughout, and downright delicious!! this is honestly the best roasted chicken i ever had in my life. ironically, my friends and i were skeptical about this dish because we were like, "how good can chicken be? it's always dry at the breast." but this chicken completely shocked us because it was not dry whatsoever. i would definitely return to frascati for the chicken and the chicken alone, and it's 90% of the reason why i gave frascati an overall rating of 5 stars (the other 10% was for the wine and service). if a restaurant can do one dish so well that it'll redefine the way i think about, in this case, chicken, it deserves 5 stars. well-done, frascati!

(5) warm black & white chocolate bread pudding -- 3.5 stars. the bread pudding was not warm because the ice cream made it cold. it was also dense, chewy, and boring in flavor. i don't see what the hype is all about.

(6) pumpkin pie -- 2.5 stars. cold but edible. didn't have much pumpkin flavor either.

In sum, i would come here again but next time i would skip all the small talk and cut to the chase--two roasted half chickens and one glass of that awesome cabernet all to myself!
author: Katherine Y.

description: This place is the complete package. Exceptional service, authentic, incredibly delicious, great wine and one the coolest views of Russian Hill. If you can, try to sit in one of the front two tables. You'll be able to see the Cable Car pass by. I'd recommend the octopus salad and the pappardelle. Both extraordinary!
author: Tommy M.

description:
Pork Chop: Excellent. The best Pork Chops I have had in the last years.
Burrata: I do not know what happened with our Burrata. We have had this appetizer before and my friends and I agreed that this time it was not as good as usual.
Gnocchi: Excellent. Probably the finest dish we had.
Octopus salad: Fresh and flavorful. All of us loved it.

The 3 stars are because we found so much chewing gum under our table. It's not like we do not like chewing gum, we just do not like it under our table when we are trying to enjoy our dinner.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Date night!  Cute little neighborhood restaurant.  My boyfriend and I have passed by this place many times and thought to try it one night.

Very intimate setting.  Very friendly and knowledgeable waitstaff. Dim lighting, cute and cozy dinning experience. 

Dinner:
-Duck Confit Salad with Baby Spinach, Red Onions, Dried Cherries, Gorgonzola Cheese and Balsamic Reduction (one of the most memorable dishes on the menu.  Duck cooked to perfection and super tender!)

-Pan Seared Bluenose Bass 
with Saffron-Tomato Broth, Mussels, Clams, Marble Potatoes and Romesco Aioli (nice light seafood dish. Pretty healthy choice on the menu)

-Grilled Pork Chop 
with Smashed Potato, Pancetta-Grilled Scallion Vinaigrette, Cipollini Jus and Tomato-Olive Compote ( tender pork chop!  I heard amazing reviews on the pork chop and of course we had to get it. Nicely cooked and full of flavor.  A great choice)

Dessert:
Decided to skip and be good on our "diet"
author: Ying F.

description:
My GF little ham surprised me last night by taking me to Frescati. We got an awesome table on the upper level right by a window overlooking the street. Similar to many Russian hill spots this place has a charming, cozy.....dare I say, Romantic feel. We started with the gnocchi and burratta and split the shrimp/scallop main. The food was excellent, though so may say small portions, we thought they were perfect. Usually I want to roll over and die after eating gnocchi, this was just the right amount to share. We brought our own bottle of wine. Interesting corkage pricing: first bottle $20, second $25, third $30 (3 bottle max). Still $20 corkage is reasonable to say the least. Our server was very nice, attentive and polite (shocking for SF I know, her mom taught her well) 

Forgot to mention we had the cheese plate for dessert which was awesome. I'm not into presentation but even I noticed how good it looked.....and tasted

We loved it. Great spot

P.S wine and beer only
author: Ben K.

description:
Wow! What an amazing meal! Started with the wild mushroom bruschetta for the table. I had the gnocchi as a starter, which was delicious!

My mother had the roasted chicken and loved it. My father had the tagliatelle and also loved it. My pork chop was very tasty. The restaurant has a great vibe, some may call romantic. Being from Texas, I thought it was quintessential San Francisco.

Service was awesome! Definitely worth a try if you're in the city.
author: C B.

description:
Simply amazing. Upscale but casual joint that isn't pretentious, yet very classy. The food is just amazingly fresh and well presented.

I had the octopus salad to start and halibut for an entree. They were both cooked to perfection and extremely tasty. The wait staff was very attentive but not overbearing. 

I'd definitely come back here again.
author: Victor W.

description: Had dinner here with my four coworkers and we absolutely loved it! The waiters were fabulous and entertaining. The food was incredible! Their menu does change daily, but if the roasted beet risotto, pork chop, potato bisque, or gnocchi appetizer are on the menu, they are all winners! The desserts were delicious too...we ended up ordering three and sharing because no one could decide on one!
author: Nikki M.

description:
Excellent!

You walk into Frascati and immediately see the simple yet elegant ambience and are welcomed by very friendly staff.  We decided to dine downstairs because the upstairs was a little too warm.

The food is amazing.  We started with the caprese and the gnocchi which I highly recommend.  For the main course I had the pork chop and my date had the steak.  Both were delicious but I have to say that the pork chop really stole the show--it was by far and away the best pork chop I have ever had.  I thought the dinner could not get any better after the appetizers and main, but I was wrong!  The snickers cheesecake and the peach blueberry cobbler were so good.

I highly recommend this place!  

Tip: Opentable showed that no times were available, but we called and were able to secure an 8pm reservation on a Friday.
author: Damon W.

description:
Came here for dinner a friend on a Wednesday night.  We shared a few plates...the burrata was fresh and delicious...the gnocchi were perfectly cooked and the fish special was one of the best I have had in SF.  Definitely would come back.  

Only negative...I did not like the table we were seated at, which was upstairs and felt like we were in a converted attic.
author: Nic S.

description:
I occasionally get this nagging feeling that Yelp has deleted a few of my reviews, as I swear I've left one for Frascati before. Having been a while since my dinner experience here, forgive me for any misinformation, or lack there of. The main takeaway is that the food here was quite tasty, so, never mind the particulars and give it a shot!

Coming in for dinner with my dad several months back, we ordered (I believe) a blood orange tuna carpaccio, flat-iron steak, roasted half chicken, and chocolate bread pudding. While the carpaccio wasn't particularly interesting to me, one must consider I'm not a huge fan of raw fish - that said, it was still a bit too sweet, and the slices were still a bit too thick to captivate me. And while my dad's steak was enjoyable, the chicken was where the meal truly shined: moist, tender, flavorful, and just overall amazing. By the time we got around to dessert, I was already painfully full, so it was a _little_ unfortunate that the dessert was as hefty as it was. But, that said, it was pretty tasty, and surprisingly, not as horrifically sweet as I had feared it would be.

I can't remember what the bill came out to, but I believe it was roughly $90 or so after tax. A bit hefty at first glance, but, not so bad once you consider that we ate enough to feed three (or possibly four). Decor was a little bit more upscale than I was expecting, so I was taken aback a little, but Frascati would certainly make for a nice dinner date. Just be prepared, because trying to find street parking here is ridiculous - we eventually settled for a garage, after almost 20 minutes of circling the area.
author: Johnny W.

description:
I don't play the lottery. But if I did, I imagine winning feels a little like stumbling into a place like Frascati without ever having heard of it on Yelp. 

Intimate welcoming environ. Friendly and smart staff. Way cool small bar. Compact menu that means they focus on a few things done right. Its all very, very good.
author: J T.

description: Frascati has that warm, inviting neighborhood charm mixed with fine dining.  A cozy little place with a quiet upstairs dining area.  Get the table that's overlooking the kitchen and enjoy watching the cooks work their magic.  The duck breast and grilled octopus salad were absolutely delicious, both recommended by our fabulous server,Julia, who kicked our dining experience up a level!  Julia wins my Best Server award!  She has such positive energy and spirit that just gave us such joy to share that space with her.  Will definitely go back!
author: Helen H.

description: We went here with family and it was a pretty high end restaurant defiantly a good place to bring a date. We had reservations and they gave us the best seat upstairs where it is quiet. I got the applewood pork I would not recommend it was dry and got boring to keep eating, my mom had the duck which was delicious sister had the risotto which was a good pick too. The desserts are good here the apple pie was really good with a la mode.
author: Vincent G.

description: Wow. We had such a wonderful evening. A perfect place. Transcends genre. Casual but very sophisticated. Steak tartar, baby spinach with duck confit, and much more. Excellent personal service.
author: Elinor J.

description:
This place has a relaxed, homey and down to earth ambiance while giving comfort food an upscale, yet unpretentious, twist. Everything they did was done very well and there was no sense of them trying to stretch beyond that, which is refreshing in a city where a lot of restaurants try to be more than they are.

First off, we were running late for our reservation. We called and asked if we could move it back half an hour and they made it work, no problem. They have a beer and wine only menu, but their wine menu was quite good. They had quite a range of prices, from $40-$150. There were California, French, and Italian sections along with "interesting" red and white sections that didn't fit into those categories. The waitress was not only knowledgeable about the entire list, but also was able to communicate it in a simple and understandable manner.

The steak tartare was quite good. The beef was more finely cut than most places, and the crispy shallots gave it a very unique and savory flavor. Also, the ratio of steak to toast was absolutely optimal. When they brought the appetizers, one person got something other than what they ordered. However, they expedited the correct one and it was on the table with two minutes. The waitress also came over, said it was her mistake and apologized. Very nicely handled.

All the entree portions were large and very tasty, everyone enjoyed their meals. They were plated thoughtfully but not over the top. I especially appreciated the soup plating in that it made it around some corners and up the stairs without having any soup come onto the sides of the bowl.
author: Michael S.

description: We got to sit in the corner table overlooking the intersection. There was no air circulation at this corner table on this rare 80+ summer day on san francisco. But this is not the reason I gave this cute little restaurant 3 stars. We had made reservations for 4 and having parking is hard to find! We circled for about 30+ min and finally found a spot on vaness . Upon arriving, the other half of our party was seated and we the server approached us in a unfriendly (bitchface) demeanor. Asked us about drinks and then came back and asked us about the order (no explanation of dishes, specials, or recommendation). We ordered the fig/prosciutto appetizer, kale risotto, and duck breast. The food was great but the server was mediocre and looked like he hated his life and his job. Would love to grab food here for Togo in order to avoid a sour face that would ruin my appetite.
author: Janice A.

description:
I went to Frascati about 5 years ago and at the time it was a 5 star restaurant. In the hopes of reclaiming that great time I decided to pay another visit on a Friday night. 

One thing that surprised me was that the place was not full, whereas it was always packed many years ago. I was dissapointed that none of the flavors popped; it was your basic steak, pork chop, chicken fair. The final disappointment which is not subjective was that my duck breast came out cold. Bah!
author: Artur R.

description: Wow, just amazing from making the reservations, to Brian hosting, to Julia serving, and finally the unbelievable meal and ambiance. Must visit and finish with the chocolate bread pudding. It was a great romantic atmosphere.
author: Martin G.

description:
Frascati effortlessly eased into my Bay Area Top Five restaurants last night, with a delightful dining experience from start to finish. 

Above the bustling restaurant and kitchen, there is split level, quieter dining, and our small party was able to converse and really enjoy the spread of wonderful food offered by this gem of a restaurant.  The staff was helpful, attentive without being smothering, and fining was leisurely-paced.  Ambiance: warm.

We started with the wild mushroom bruschetta, which were out of this world.  The Monterey Sardines were also fresh and tasty, but I think I'd probably go for the burrata/prosciutto instead.

Both the duck breast and filet were cooked to perfection, and it's quite possibly the tenderest, best-prepared duck I've had in the city.  Don't expect traditional length noodles on the spatzele, but it's delicious nonetheless.

Both the panna cotta dessert and the blueberry cheesecake were good, though not great, but still didn't diminish the fact that this restaurant is a wonderful place to enjoy overall great food, in the company of great friends. 

Recommend most highly.
author: Theresa B.

description:
Love the atmosphere the most! Romantic, warm and feels like you are at a friend's house for dinner. Sat upstairs on the balcony over looking the main floor and kitchen.

The Halibut was wonderful with a medley of flavors and vegetables. My date had the pork chop, which very tasty as well. 

The service was very friendly and helpful. She helped me pick a wine to compliment the Halibut and the Pork as well.

A wonderful experience and definitely a place to go back to!
author: Leslie E.

description: We came for the first time for the wife's birthday, 4 people, locals.  I have to say this was one of the most enjoyable meals in a long time.  Great setting, we were lucky enough to get the window seat at the front facing the cable cars going by.  Service was excellent, food was really great, every dish was devoured down to the sauce on the plate.  Great wine list.  No need to go over each dish as they were all really good. Plus, it was not too loud! What a concept.  We were so happy to find a great neighborhood spot that has been around forever and still HAS IT.
author: Jim J.

description:
We celebrated my mom's birthday at Frascati on Friday night. I'll nutshell the experience and then full review below for those interested.

Nutshell: Pretty good food, excellent service, but just doesn't measure up to competitors.

Full review: we had the gnocchi, burrata & heirloom tomato salad, and fig salad to start. There were 6 of us so I was a little worried about portion sizes - but these were appropriately sized for sharing. The gnocchi was excellent! Really knocked it out of the park. The tomato salad was a bit blah. Don't get me wrong, it was good - but where was the wow? The fig salad was also very good although the balsamic was a tad overwhelming. We started with Sancerre (similar to a sauvignon blanc) which was deliciously light and refreshing. One of the things I loved about Frascati is that every single server we spoke with was more than willing and able to provide a wine recommendation. 

My mom and I shared the flank steak and the sausage risotto. The steak was cooked perfectly (medium) and was very tender. I thought the flavors were good. The parsnips that came with it seemed a little droopy though. The risotto was just ok - nothing to write home about. There wasn't much sausage in it. Others at the table ordered the duck and the halibut and everyone seemed to agree they were pretty good. With our main course we had a Pinot Noir (from Washington maybe?) that our waiter suggested which was excellent. 

We had a fruit tart waiting at home so unfortunately we didn't get to try anything off their dessert menu. All in all a very nice experience, but lacking wow factor.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Went to frascati for dinner. Make sure you have a reservation. Got lucky to get the window seat - and watch the cable cars go by. 

We got: 
Burrata - great start to the meal with a burst of flavors. The fig jam adds a nice touch to the cheese with prosciutto

Halibut which was crusted with Porcini. Pretty good and healthy. It comes along with some salad and isn't cheesy. So if you are looking for a healthy option get this.

Risotto - was pretty good too !
author: Priyanka P.

description:
So let's just get it out of the way here.....it's ALL about the Bread Pudding.  If you eat nothing else at this place, you'll *definitely* want to get the bread pudding

Halloween festivities brought us to the neighborhood & we had had Frascati bookmarked for quite some time - thank goodness now was the time to give them a go

Started out w/ the Burrata w/ Fig Jam & greens on Bruschetta - omg this burrata was so incredibly creamy & delish - paired w/ the sweet fig jam & the charred bread - awesome!

Although listed as an appie, I asked to get the Gnocchi as my main & it was extremely flavorful.  Unique grainy texture - almost like a cornmeal but the dumplings were still soft & fluffy w/out being chewy.  Lots of leeks, mushrooms & a creamy butter sage sauce - this thing was awesome!

1 buddy got the Duck Breast & claimed it was among the best she's tasted

The bf got the Seafood Risotto & claimed it was the creamiest risotto he's ever had - plate completely polished

Dessert.....well, let's just say we only ordered 1 Bread Pudding but could have easily stuffed ourselves silly w/ 1 for each of us.....it was THAT good.  Ginormous portion....super chocolaty, w/ toasted Hazelnuts & the ice cream was a perfect pairing for the warm pudding - totally took it to the next level & even a week later, we were all still talking about it & more importantly, still craving it!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Service was excellent. I had a long chat with "the wine guy", Justin, before settling on the Huët Vouvray Le Mont Sec 2012. The California wine selections are a little limited, but there is a lot of depth in the European ones here. 

We started with the cheese plate. Then, I had the gnocchi with asparagus and peas as a first course and the pepper encrusted ahi over a bed of greens and bacon mashed fingerling potatoes for the main course. 

We made dessert a two course affair... Starting with a shared scoop of basil ice cream that I followed with the white and dark chocolate bread pudding topped with hazelnut ice cream which I enjoyed with a couple cups of really good decaf coffee. 

It was a very satisfying meal. Would definitely go again.  I just found out that my sister got engaged here back in 2002 and this restaurant is on a very short list of favorite places to go not only from her, but also from some of my very well traveled friends.    Definitely worth visiting.
author: Dan D.

description: After a rough day at work, my friends and I decided to treat ourselves to dinner at Frascati. The gnocchi, octopus, pork and duck dishes were really delicious. They really have such a way with meats and sauces. Dessert and wine were fine. Best of all, steering us through the menu was our waitress Julia. Not only did she know the menu like the back of her hand, but she has that rare quality about a person (kindness, good cheer, sincerity and well being) that just had all of us simply honored to meet her. We had such fun whenever she stopped by that we joked she should sit down with us for dessert. What a great meal, and what great staff! We hope to be back soon.
author: Dennis W.

description: Overpriced and overrated. Cute space, great service but $26 for gnocchi (they can do an entree portion of the appetizer) and $26 for tagliatelle that was just ok. The octopus bolognese was a unique dish with a nice lemony finish. The rabbit bruschetta was bland and very chewy.
author: Angela L.

description:
Three stars is solely based on the service, since the food was great.

When we walked in, the host kindly offered us our choice of two tables - one by the kitchen and one upstairs in a separate dining area. We thought it would be nice to be a bit separate from the rest of the tables, and opted for the upstairs. 

The minute we walked upstairs, there was a noticeable change in the temperature, which dropped about 10 degrees. My husband and I noticed that the window was wide open (it was a February evening and around 50-55 degrees outside) AND the overhead fan was on. We nicely asked our waitress if she could close the window. She rolled her eyes, looked totally annoyed and said "I just get really hot up here." Then she proceeded to "act" like she closed the window per our request, when in reality she just closed it by 1 inch and left it wide open.

My husband and I were shocked and didn't know what to do. I've never encountered a server who puts their own personal comfort over that of their guests, and who would act so clearly annoyed at a very reasonable request. I was uncomfortably cold and we eventually had to ask to be reseated downstairs.

If I was the manager of Frascati, I would be mortified that my employee treated a guest in this way. This was our first time at the restaurant and while the food was great, we won't be back for this reason.
author: Rose S.

description: 3 stars is being slightly generous. This restaurant is ok if you're in the neighborhood. Ok for a date night or with friends. Again, if you're in the neighborhood. I would not recommend it if you're traveling far and NOT good at all if you have kids. And they're not even that nice. That's the part that kills me. I have very well behaved kids and they were just SO unfriendly. Not so happy overall with our evening.
author: Rachel A.

description: Came here on Wednesday night with a couple of my girlfriends. The service was great. The food was good but not my favorite. Its definitely worth trying though!
author: Alexis G.

description:
My boyfriend and I tried this restaurant on our visit to San Fran from Denver two years ago after seeing the good reviews and menu. 
We have never been so satisfied by the atmosphere, service and most of all the delicious food. I ordered the risotto, and I have yet to eat its equal.
We have gone back once more on a second trip and received the same treatment. I highly recommend for a special occasion or just an amazing experience in an adorable neighborhood.
Very romantic!
Love you Frascati!
author: Erin L.

description:
I've been to Frascati a grand total of 2 times so far, and both experiences were wonderful! First time was to celebrate the bf and my 1 year anniversary and second time was to celebrate Father's Day... appropriate for both occasions! 

Food was YUMMMM!!! These are some of the items I've tried.

Appetizers:
Mushroom Bruschetta (3.5 stars): Personally I'm not a huge mushroom fan, but I did like the combination of mushrooms they were using, flavor wasn't too mushroomy, 'shrooms had good texture... Probably would be 4-5 stars if you are a mushroom lover!

Steak Tartare (3 stars): Also not bad, but to be honest, I'm more partial towards Vietnamese steak carpaccio because I think it has simpler, yet richer flavors.

Entrees:
Maple Leaf Duck (5 stars): OMGeeees... love. Maybe I'm being racist, but duck at "American" places usually disappoints me because I'm Chinese... so usually I compare all types of duck to Chinese Roast Duck because Chinese people really have their recipe for super flavorful (yet oily) and tender duck DOWN. But this one DID NOT disappoint! Duck was so tender, and I loved all the combinations of ingredients they added to this dish... the spaetzle (kinda pasta-y/cheesy consistency), heart of palm, and other things that I naturally had to google to find out what it was.

Grilled Pork Chop (5 stars): Also super delicious. Pork is a tricky one sometimes because people tend to overcook it for fear of having rare pork... but this one was cooked just right, and it was one of the most tenderest porks I've ever had.

Dessert:
Chocolate Bread Pudding (10 million stars plz): This dessert was AMAZING. Wow wow wow. Wow? It's kinda like a sweet, semi-thick chocolate cake with some bombass hazelnut ice cream that perfectly balances and complements the whole thing. I would go back to this restaurant JUST FOR THIS. Probably big enough for 2-4 ppl depending on how hungry you are, but I can probably eat one of these on my own and so can the bf just because it's so delicious. They sometimes run out near the end of the night, so ask your waiter to save you one!

I forgot what fish my mom had, but she said that was also really delicious. Other than the food, ambiance is great. Really cute and intimate seating conducive for great conversation... upstairs seating is super cute too, overlooking the whole restaurant. Only downside is that parking in this area is usually a pain, so go a bit early for your reservation!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Was here for a wedding reception.  The service was excellent and the waiters took their job seriously.  The filet mignon was one of the best I had....tender and flavorful.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Brian M.

description:
A welcoming restaurant, that feels like dinner at a friends.  Great food, even gluten free options.  The very creative chef can modify meals to your request, low sodium, no wheat or at least make suggestions.  Everything is fantastic.  It's a rather small menu with a choice of pasta or risotto, fish, pork, beef, or chicken and sometimes a special.  I'd go through and describe each one but best for you to go there and be happily surprised.  

A small place with an upstairs loft that gets really hot, even in the winter, so if you're always cold request an upstairs table.  The entire restaurant is very warm so dress lightly.  

The sommelier will help pick out a fantastic wine to go with your meal. They focus on smaller boutique wineries rather than the big box, high output vintners so you're likely to find a new favorite.
author: Dena M.

description:
Great service. If they don't have any tables then sit at the bar and have great conversations with the bartender /waiter. 

The lamb risotto was the best dish.
author: Sabrina J.

description:
I would give the food 4 stars!  Delicious! 

I am giving the service 2 stars. The service at face value was great. Our server was attentive and very nice.  The low rating is due to the wine recommendation from the server.  My boyfriend and I asked for a good Italian red wine because we did not know any of the wines on the list.  And yes, potentially using the word "good" was our downfall, but the three recommendations were for wines with prices ranging from $90 - $135.  With a wine list that has a bottle of wine for $36, recommending only the top shelf wines seems kind of bizarre.  Or at least if you are going to recommend the $135 bottle of wine, point it out on the wine list so the customer knows what they will be paying.  Our server gave us the description of the wine and did not reference the list at all, so we had no idea what we were getting ourselves into until the bill arrived and we had managed to order the $135 bottle.  

I definitely learned my lesson on requesting a recommendation on wine, but shame on the server for padding the bill with an expensive bottle of wine without full disclosure to the customer.
author: Katie T.

description:
Yes, I'll call it, scream it, do whatever I can to let anyone and everyone know who's willing to listen - BEST MEAL of our whole trip !! I can still taste that pork chop a week after having it. A huge thanks goes out to a fellow yelper - Mr Andrew O - cheers for the recommendation, seriously dude, your palate is exceptional!!

When you combine all the elements of a solid restaurant, the ambience, the service, the food - you get Frascati !! There was nothing our server could not help us with - he was all over it, from recommending wines to match our meals, to giving us a low-down of whats happening around SF, this guy was great value. 

We started off with a classic caprese salad and prosciutto wrapped black figs in a balsamic reduction dressing - holy mother, never have I had such melt in your mouth buffalo mozzarella - I just wish I had taken a photo of it. It took everything we had to stop from scoffing these starters down. Next we had the pork chop and tagliatelle with pork fennel sausage - my friend had the pasta and she was speechless. She's a picky Italian so when she mouthed the words 'OHMYGAWD', you know Frascati nailed it. After having read previews reviews, we couldn't leave without having tried their dessert - the Warm Black and White Chocolate Bread Pudding - REMARKABLE !! 

An absolute gem of a place.
author: Maria N.

description: We are here for our honeymoon from Boston and my husband found this gem. I always want every meal to be the best one of my life and this surely was! The burrata with perfect tomatoes, salad with watermelon, chicken with a crispy finish and the to die for vanilla bean panna cotta was outstanding. The owner chatted with us, the waitress lovely and the atmosphere cozy and classy. Highly recommend!
author: Megan C.

description:
What a great gem of a restaurant! Walking in I felt like I was in Italy, the vibe of the restaurant makes you want to stay there for hours.  Our server was amazing, she was friendly, witty, and knew what to recommend. The food, was incredible - I had the halibut and could easily have had 2 servings.  The wine selection was great, we were there on a hot night so chilled wine really hit the spot.  

Most yelp reviews recommended the bread pudding so that was the obvious dessert choice.  It was just as good (maybe even better) than described.  

Tip for those driving in, leave plenty of time to search for parking.  Finding parking was difficult.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Frascati is one of the best restaurants in the city we ever tried ! Everything was tasty and delicious. Perfect service.  
Definitely coming back and we highly recommend it!
author: Ornella G.

description:
That's 5 stars for overall ambiance, 5 for service, and 5 for food. A great experience!

A friend and I stopped in on a whim, drawn in by the warm glow of the restaurant and the smiles on everyone's faces. We dined outside and enjoyed wine and three courses of amazing food. We were never without wine in our glasses or food on our table. The service was incredibly attentive, and multiple people came out to check on us and ask if we needed anything.

The food was divine from start to finish. The duck confit salad was to die for. The truffle gnocchi was super truffley. I was left wanting more of everything.

Highly recommended for a romantic date, or for a solo dinner. Sit at the bar and dine alone, the folks at Frascati will take care of you!
author: Julie P.

description:
My friend and I found Frascati on the Yelp app and it did not disappoint!

The restaurant is so cute and romantic. It had a lot of Boston's South End-esque feel. Our table was tucked in right by the window which gave us the perfect fish bowl view.

We started with the potato gnocchi and duck confit salad. The gnocchi was good. It was served with a truffle oil sauce with asparagus, peas and tomatoes. The server told us it was one of his favorite appetizers in the restaurant. However, i think my favorite dish of the night was the duck confit salad. It was delicious - Baby Spinach, Red Onions, Dried Cherries, Gorgonzola Cheese and Balsamic dressing. It was the perfect taste/texture combination! For entrees, my friend ordered the steak and I ordered the maple leaf duck breast. Both were really good. The Spaetzle that was served with the duck was delicious. 

To add onto our food coma, we ordered the chocolate warm bread pudding. I'm not really a fan of bread pudding, but according to many yelpers, it is one of Frascati's best desserts. It was good. but it was a bit too sweet and rich for me.
author: Terry C.

description: Yum!  A "must see" while in SF.  $12 cab ride from Moscone Convention Center.  Killer menu, wine list, and a nice staff.  Reservations recommended!  Enjoy...
author: Vic M.

description:
3.5 stars. I came in with higher expectations than what was delivered, and the main disappointment fell with the service and lack of "wow" factor from the food. Our server was off beat on multiple many requests, simply forgetting or taking FOREVER to deliver on small requests like water and bread refills, bringing hot water, balsamic vinegar, etc. when asked. 

Food itself was solid but not super memorable (I think it's been almost a month since I came here and I couldn't even remember what I got!). Of all the dishes we tried among the table, I'd say the pork chop was the best. Also, the black and white bread pudding was good but definitely overhyped. Almost more like a fruit cake than a bread pudding. 

Anyway, I'm glad I tried this place, but not sure I'd actively recommend this place or come back.
author: Erica L.

description: Frascati is the epitome of fine dinning with a touch of elegance in a quaint atmosphere, in the Russian Hill neighborhood in San Francisco.  The ambiance is warm and inviting, the restaurant itself sits on a corner, and it looks a lot like it's right out of an old world magazine.  The staff is professional and knowledgable.  The lighting, perfect!   We started our meal with the Wild Mushroom Bruschetta with goat cheese fondue, crispy bacon, micro arugula and Saba.  Next we enjoyed their Lobster Bisque with Crostini, crème fraîche and basil pistou.  My dinner entree was the Butternut Squash Risotto with melted leeks, Tuscan black kale, pomegranate arils and Parmesan.  The fresh bread was wonderful, as was our wine selection from Portland.  There was a large espresso machine nearby to enjoy an after dinner espresso or enjoy an assortment of hot teas, along with their wonderful dessert selections.  On a lighter note, this place had one of the smallest restrooms, ever, along with an interesting way to get to it!  Wonderful little place, look forward to another dinning experience here soon.
author: Winny S.

description: Always a great experience, I couldn't recommend it enough.  Make sure to make a reservation as it they only have a small 2 person table for walk-ins.
author: Chris H.

description: Really disappointed- saved this treat as a late Valentine dinner. Our server was underwhelming,and seemed forced (the busser were extremely nice though ) I work in a restaurant 5 days a week and did not appreciate a flinch at giving a gift card as partial payment. Food was ok. Next time I'll stick with Stones Throw.
author: Sharon N.

description:
We got to the restaurant an hour early but the staff was nice enough to seat us even though their restaurant was extremely busy. The ambiance is intimate but slightly noisy because of all the dinner conversations going on. 

I highly recommend the Mushroom Bruschetta for starters.  The steak tartare was pretty yummy but I think Wayfare Tavern's steak tartare is way better. The gnocchi appetizer was ok.  There was nothing too memorable about it.

For the main course, I had the papardelle with pork. It was pretty delicious and the pork was so tender but I think the noodles were a bit bland. My BF had the Frutti di Mare. The seafood they used tasted pretty fresh and the risotto was prepared well. My BF's dad really liked the Filet Mignon.  I got a chance to try it and I must say they cooked it perfectly.  The meat just melted in your mouth and it was perfectly seasoned. 

My only complaint was that I had to ask a three times to get some balsamic vinegar for my bread...hence the minus point!
author: Shirleyanne A.

description:
This place is quaint, charming, and a thoughtful menu.

We made reservations and were seated on the second floor, while charming, we were right above the kitchen, so it was a tad bit on the warmer side of our dining experience.  

The menu is seasonal, but it is good:
- Burrata App: By far, one of the more unconventional takes on this classic dish.  It was really good, and very fresh.
- The gnocchi: This was well seasoned, and beautiful.
- Flank steak:  A tad bit on the salty side, but delicious and well executed.
- Duck Breast: Beautifully cooked, and overall delicious.

All in all.  A wonderful place for a special event.  It has an interesting menu that erally plays up the local ingredients.  But, I would stray away from a table on the second floor, because it's warm.  Also, the bathroom is the smaller than a port-o-potty, so its a snug fit for sure.
author: Natalie G.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend for an anniversary dinner on a foggy SF night  and this place was PERFECT. It was cozy and warm and the food/wine was FAN-TASTIC.

These are the dishes I had and recommend:

To start: 
burrata 

Main: 
Fresh Tagliatelle with house made pork sausage = YUMMMMM
Braised lamb shoulder = melt in your mouth AMAZING 

They had a nice wine list and the recommendation we got was spot on.

The menu is simple but the execution of the dishes is impeccable.
author: Shivani S.

description:
Frascati was a cute, cozy, romantic restaurant, in a cute neighborhood. First I have to say, our server, woman with brown hair, maybe 30's or 40's, was one of the best servers me, or anyone in my party has had in years. She was so friendly and on top of things, and was all around fantastic and knowledgable. 

So for the food. The cheese plate and apps were good but not great. The filet was great and the panna cotta was probably the best panna cotta I've ever had. It was cooked so perfectly! It melted in your mouth. 

Frascati was very good, but didn't blow me away. I'll try something new before I go back. But I would definitely go back!
author: Rachel A.

description:
Good service, good wine list, good ambience... Food was good too.

Nice find in that Nob Hill / Russian Hill.
author: Sasha B.

description:
Came in on Saturday August 24th, 2013 at 7:15 after being able to move up our 9:15 Reservation. We were immediately greeted by the hostess --- and taken to our table up on the 2nd floor on the left side of the stair case when going up the stairs. This single table against the rail --- which has a beam over the center of it in my opinion honestly should not be a table. As this was voted one of the most romantic restaurants in San Francisco --- this was a tad disappointing.

As for our service --- the server was extremely nice, however, he was quite overworked. It appears they did not have a bus staff --- so he was running around trying to do everything at once and therefore was not very chatty. However, when my girlfriend did mention it was our 1 year anniversary --- he did arrange for an unexpected complimentary dessert of pistachio ice cream to be sent over. 

We had the: Smoked Salmon Bruschetta with Citrus Mascarpone, Red Onions, Capers and Chive Crème Fraîche for $13; along with the Maple Leaf Duck Breast with Herb Spaetzle, Maitake Mushrooms, Scallions, Hearts of Palm and Pomegranate Sauce and the Seafood Risotto.

Each dish was cooked perfectly --- and well prepared. The Bruschetta was two long pieces which went down perfectly. Otherwise, the seafood risotto was excellent --- with two large shrimp, mussells, and a few other pieces of seafood. 

Overall, it was a good value but I prefer their sister restaurant in North Beach.
author: Brian D.

description: My wife and I had a wonderful dining experience here on Friday night. We were visiting from NY and staying down the hill at the Argonaut. This is a great little upscale neighborhood restaurant serving very high quality food. The service is professional and friendly. No need to go into detail here about the food because all of the other highly favorable Yelp reviews pretty much reflect our experience. Everything we ordered was spot on. Place is small and appears to be very popular so reservations are a must. If you are in this area and are looking for a really great place to have dinner Frascati is an excellent choice.
author: Mike I.

description:
Probably one of the best restaurants located in SF.  Perfect place to take your significant other on a special occasion.  

Tried their staple dish: maple leaf duck breast.  Absolutely delicious.
author: Joshua P.

description:
This cute little restaurant with a cozy ambiance serves up seasonal, farm-fresh New American dishes.  

Typically it gets pretty packed so be sure to make a reservation in advance.  However, on the night I went with my husband and friend, it was a quiet night and we got a lovely seat right at the window.  Our server was a super friendly lady that answered a bazillion questions we had about the menu and wine list... What a trooper!

For food, we ordered a feast consisting of the Artisanal Cheese Plate, Mushroom Bruschetta,  Russet Potato Gnocchi, Fresh Pappardelle, Frutti di Mare Risotto, and the Maple Leaf Duck Breast. All the dishes were phenomenal (I personally adored the bruschetta), but since Frascati has homemade pasta, the pasta entrees are the way to go.  

We opted out for dessert but their chocolate bread pudding concoction sounded divine...Maybe next time!

http://www.landingstanding.com/a-fat-kids-dining-guide-to-san-francisco/
author: Meg R.

description:
Non-existent street parking. Circled neighborhood for 25 minutes before scoring quasi-legal space. 

Excellent menu: we had the cheese plate, burrata, gnocchi, seafood risotto, half chicken and filet mignon. 

Wonderful wine list. We had two bottles, with the score being a Nebbiolo. 

Competent and friendly service.
author: Karen Z.

description: This is a lovely little neighborhood restaurant with excellent food. The octopus salad and duck dishes are particularly good. Sadly, because I've had rude service here twice (in the most recent incident, the waiter greeted us with a nasty, condescending "April Fool's" joke), I won't be back.
author: Quinn R.

description:
It had been ages since I've been to Frascati but we had good friends in town and wanted to re-visit it and was glad nothing had changed.  We had a very late reservation (9:30pm) so we shut down the restaurant but we never felt rushed and had a great time there.

We had two bottles of the Chianti and really enjoyed it.  For the meal I started off with the tartare which had a great flavor and a bit of a bite which I enjoyed.  My wife had the watermelon salad which was very good and the toasted pistachios were a great touch to that salad.

For the main meal I had the Cappelini Puttanesca.  It had a good amount of seafood in it and it was very good but wished it was spicier as I was told it was going to have a good bite.  Nevertheless I cleared the plate.  My wife had the sweet corn risotto which was amazing and I'm glad I got to taste it.

While we were full from dinner we wanted to get some dessert and ended up getting the cobbler which was good but a much larger than I thought.

Great dinner spot which is highly recommended!
author: Blake B.

description: I just went there and had octopus salad for appetizer and ahi tuna for entree. I thought both were good. But combined with the options I have in San Francisco and the difficulty to find parking around that area.... I may not revisit anytime soon..... Price is decent and very friendly staff.
author: Shannon J.

description:
I rarely give five stars out of the gate but Frascati deserves it. 
Bar none, the best neighborhood eatery in the City. To do better you have to go ultra high end and pay for the privilege. 
Stormy and I adored the Warm Fig in balsamic reduction appetizer.

Be sure to get a reservation.
author: Duane H.

description: Very cute and cozy place. Food was very flavorful. Chicken was the bomb! And Gnocchi absolutely delicious. Im not into fancy places but this menu was fabulous!
author: Clarissa B.

description:
I am always a bit skeptical about duck at restaurants. Overcook it and it can become tough, dry, and can lose its flavor. 

However, Frascati has by far the best duck breast I have every been served in a western style restaurant. Succulent, juicy and cooked just right and full of that full duck flavor. Because otherwise, why wouldn't you just get chicken?
author: Vince E.

description:
Came here on valentines day and had the lobster bisque the lobster salad the filet mignon and lamb and apple cobler.

Filet mignon and apple cobbler were amazing. Lobster dishes were so so.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
My bf's parents were coming to the city to take us out to dinner, and my bf left it up to me to choose where. Frascati turned out to be the perfect place for the occasion.

Our waiter recommended the gnocchi to start, and though it wasn't as light as he made it out to be, it was still delicious, especially with the butternut squash and black trumpet mushrooms. Loved every component of the grilled bread salad. My maple leaf duck breast was incredibly tender and flavorful, but the herb spaetzle was too salty. My bf's chicken was also cooked perfectly. Ended our lovely evening with the chocolate bread pudding. Tasted just like chocolate cake to me, but the hazelnut ice cream was delightful.

Thank you Frascati for the brownie points.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Overpriced for food that wasn't so good. I enjoyed our experience here but was let down by the taste of our main entrees. The restaurant's ambiance is a perfect setting for a nice date. We came here an anniversary dinner and the service was great.

We started off with the figs and prociutto and foie gras torchon. Both were delicious. For our entrees, we ordered the lamb chops and ribeye. Both dishes were just medicore and lacked a lot of flavors. For the price we paid, I expected more.

We finished off with the chocolate bread pudding cake. It honestly tasted like a normal chocolate cake to me. I was expecting it to be softer and more moist but it was dense. I hear the menu changes often so I'm hopeful that they make other, more satisfying dishes.
author: Victoria N.

description: Great ambience and food.  This is a cozy place made for intimate dates.  It is in Russian Hill so parking is always a challenge.  I would recommend taking an Uber or Lyft to get there.  There are also some good wine bars to visit near the restaurant in the case you have to wait on getting your table.
author: Dan C.

description:
This place is a classic Italian place. Which means excellent food, and tight seating. The menu is pretty limited, nonetheless, everything is awesome. Be warned, parking around that place is a huge pain- and it's the city's hilly part:-) it's a trolley line though.

Totally worth attempting.
author: James C.

description:
We visited Frascati last Saturday night for our 10th wedding anniversary, my 40th birthday and my husband's 41st birthday.  August 1st is a very special day in our lives and I wanted it to be perfect.   We were visiting from Portland and after a lot of research, Frascati was our choice for this important night.  After all the great reviews on Yelp and after the best dinner of my life at Cafe Claude the evening before, I was somewhat disappointed in Frascati.  

I reserved a table a month in advance through Open Table.  I specifically requested their best table and attached a note explaining that we were in town for a very special day.  

When we arrived, we were seated immediately, which was nice.  However, I would consider the table one of the worst in the restaurant as it was right next to the bread sideboard, where the wait staff was constantly cutting bread.  The best table was in front of the windows, far away from where we were sitting.  

Our waiter, Michael?, was very knowledgeable and happy to give details about the food and wine (nice wine list and generous pours).  We started with the Foie Gras Torchon ($14) with Apple-Currant Compote, Sauterne Gastrique and Toast Points.  This was our first time having Foie Gras and it was pretty good, although I don't have anything to base it on.  It came with two toast points, four would have been appreciated.  

My husband had a wonderful watermelon salad ($8) with toasted pistachios, ricotta salata, balsamic vinaigrette, black sea salt and mint.  It was so original and easily the best dish of the entire meal.  I had the heirloom tomato salad ($10) with ricotta salata, micro basil, olive oil and black sea salt.  It was good, but I wish I would have ordered the watermelon!

The entrees were nice portions and presented very well.  I had the Grilled Pork Chop ($27) with grilled white peach, frisee, mizuna, spiced plums and cipollioni jus.  It was quite good.  Hubby had a grilled strip steak ($27), which he says is the best steak he has ever had.  For dessert we had a berry and apple cobbler with ice cream--delish!  

Overall, the meal was quite good, the service excellent, and the atmosphere was nice, although a bit loud.  I was disappointed that they never acknowledged our special day, but overall I would recommend Frascati for a nice evening out.  Food photos to follow...
author: Deb P.

description:
Hm, I'm not sure what I'm missing, but I can tell you what Frascati is missing: flavor and moisture.

Good thing I filled up with my weight's worth of bread.
author: Jess C.

description:
My suggestion is to wait until there will be an available table upstairs, so you'll be able to observe everything that's going on in the kitchen :) 

Pork chop was really good! The grilled sardines were tasty! You are gonna get them coming with a salad, lemon aioli and grilled bread :)

Other thing that I really liked was the watermelon salad (unusual mix) where the sweetness of the watermelon wasn't so obvious with the help of the balsamic vinegar and pistachio with mint.
author: Olga B.

description: Very good tasting balanced food- flavorful and not overwhelming with sauces or salt.
author: Eric J.

description:
I first dined at Frascati in 2010. The meal was so average that it fell off my radar. If I craved New American cuisine, I would hope for Gary Danko and settle for Marlowe. I'm so happy my friend CN reintroduced Frascati earlier this month because it was simply marvelous this time around.

Steak tartare wasn't on the menu that night, so we decided to share the octopus salad. This was the most incredible octopus salad I've had in my life--it was so balanced, clean, and nuanced in flavors. I just loved the big chunks of fresh octopus. You know a dish is successful when it leaves you wanting... Just. One. More. Bite.

For our main courses, I had the scallops with lobster ragout and CN had the duck breast with mascarpone polenta. The four jumbo, perfectly cooked scallops were plump and tasty. I didn't care for the lobster ragout because I couldn't see or taste the lobster. I also enjoyed the savory duck alongside the creamy polenta, but the skin could've been crispier. Much crispier. Like the $13 roast duck in Chinatown.

For dessert we had the warm black and white chocolate bread pudding. It was neither too sweet nor too rich. Although not the best I've ever had, it was definitely a sweet ending. Frascati will never be Gary Danko, but it doesn't try to be. It's the unpretentious, ol' reliable in your neighborhood.
author: Liz T.

description:
I was really impressed by Frascati and highly recommend it to anyone who wants a great meal in a classic San Francisco neighborhood. 

We had a 5:30 reservation via Open Table but came about 15 minutes early. No problem, they seated us at the bar while my friend and I chatted over a glass of wine.  The Pinot Noir ($13) is great.

When we were ready, we had a seat in the front of the restaurant, by the window, which I thought was a great spot.  Our server was super knowledgable about the menu.  After taking our order, we were served bread with a really high quality olive oil for dipping.

The food was amazing! We had appetizer of gnocchi with mushrooms, carrots and truffle oil and the seasonal side of brussel sprouts as another app, as recommended by our server.  I could have eaten both those things as my entire meal, they were so delicious!

Onto the for mains -- my friend had filet mignon with polenta cake  ($30) and I had the highly touted duck with spatzel and huckleberry ($26). Both entrees were cooked perfectly. I wasn't a huge fan of the sweetness from the huckleberry but otherwise loved my duck. 

To finish, we had expressos (done very well!) and the famous chocolate bread pudding with ice cream - to die for!  Even though we were stuffed, I seriously considered loosening up the notches in my belt just to squeeze more goodness in, but alas I resisted. 

Even as we ended our meal and continued to chat, they never rushed us out, which I appreciated.  Throughout the dinner, service was attentive and friendly, but never over-bearing!

Frascati - thanks for a great meal, I will be back!
author: Karen S.

description: A gem in the neighborhood! I small restaurant with ambient atmosphere and excellent food. The herb crusted ahi tuna was mouth watering and cooked to perfection!! Great for upscale dinning expereince!
author: Tanya T.

description: I really don't like that Yelp only has a 5 star rating system... 3 stars feels too low for this place but 4 stars feels too high. Overall quality and presentation was adequate? If you have been to Nopa, Frascati is not quite as good if that makes any sense. For apps, we ordered the Bruscheta, Soup, Duck Confit salad and Octopus salad. Our mains were the Pork Chop, Duck Breast, Filet Mignon and fresh Papperdalle. The salads stood out. Of the mains, i would recommend the Filet and duck breast. As you can see from all the photos uploaded, the Duck breast entree is very popular but the plating/presentation could be much improved. Good food but maybe not somewhere id go again for a while with all the choises in SF.
author: Denny C.

description:
Food was very good.  We ordered the ahi tuna tartare appetizer which tasted very fresh, albeit a bit salty  Then I had the capellini puttanesca, which I enjoyed, with a nice blend of olive and anchovies, and my friend had the maple leaf duck breast.  He really liked the spaetzel with the duck, and thought the duck was good if not a bit salty as well.   We finished it off with the yummy peach blueberry cobbler (they do not skimp on dessert sizes).  I ordered a viognier but would choose differently next time.  Overall, the food was excellent albeit salty.  The service was well intentioned but spotty - our server forgot to bring bread, and then was slow to give us utensils, but the manager or owner was regularly circulating and very helpful. 

Definitely a cute/romantic restaurant.  i can see why it's so popular.  I think the ground level was nicer than the upstairs area, which was more intimate but had a weird layout.   (I also was surprised to hear that there was only one bathroom that was co-ed).  Worth another trip!
author: Vivian W.

description: Place is really small, noisy and not lovely. Not enough room on the table for appetisers and drinks, water glass and dishes. Food is unimaginative and unspectacular. Wine list is limited with no typical Italian table wines. Plating is really off putting. Just a mound of food on top of a starch.  Eh.
author: Frank R.

description: One of my favorite dining memories in the city set in romantic neighborhood of Russian hill is  one small, dimly lit, tucked away feeling, Frascati. Food done to perfection, every bite, and so memorable. not one bland food item ordered. cannot wait to return.
author: Christy D.

description:
On a visit to SF from Chicago and found this gem via Yelp.   Really solid from multiple perspectives:  management,  food, and service.    Justin, the manager was really great and really genuinely cared.  He even came out to chat with us after our meal as we were waiting for the trolley car to Union Square.   The food was so great with fresh pasta and great options everywhere.  I still remember chicken and I'm writing this 22 days later.   Service was impeccable, and really managed us well.  Dropped 25% as I do about twice a year.  

Thanks for everything and making a great impression on us!   You represent SF well...
author: Tom S.

description:
This place is great. from very friendly service, with a sense of humor that is not over bearing, and very attentive service (but not too attentive to annoy).

The food was outstanding. Started with the bruschetta and the burrata and prosciutto dishes. They were both amazing, at that point i didn't know if i could eat any more because i was already full (large portions)
but i went to the seafood bisque, very creamy and not too fishy - just right. Served VERY HOT.

Then the pork chop, cooked perfectly and balanced well with apple and bacon flavors. It was outstanding. My girlfriend got the ny strip and it was a 12oz cut, large piece of meat and the meat flavor was brought out well, not over done with sauces or extras. cooked perfectly as well.

Their wine list was nice (not a full bar) and we enjoyed a couple Italian and German white wines. 

Wonderful atmosphere. Feels like someone's house, intimate but also spacious.
Great spot. will return.
author: Dakin G.

description:
Everytime at Frascati were a great time! 
Food is delicious, not too much things on the menu, wine list is amazing...the staff knows how to take care of his hosts! 
Atmosphere is romantic, with dim light..
On hyde street in a nice neighborhood! 
You should definitely make a reservation...
author: Alice D.

description: It's quite expensive with a long line (make sure to make a reservation!), but it has the perfect atmosphere and delicious food. The other tip is to make sure they seat you INSIDE, the outside seating, while great, is nowhere near as romantic as the interior.
author: Robert H.

description:
just gonna be real, the place is kind of stifling if you're not used to old-money old-san-francisco dont-order-the-wrong-wine i-don't-care-if-i-have-nothing-left-over-for-rent kind of atmosphere. let's just say people don't walk in here wearing a t-shirt and jeans.

but with that out of the way, the food here was great. everything was delicious. the duck breast dish was really the star. the octopus salad is also delicious, as well as the spaghetti. was not too excited about the bass.
author: C. L.

description: Delicious from start to finish.  We started with burrata, gnocchi, bread salad w/amazing dressing, butter leaf salad.  For main course filet , halibut, risotto and paperdelle.   Everything delicious and plentiful.  Bread pudding unbelievable!!!.  Great waiter and service.  A real gem!
author: Janet K.

description:
Frascati is consistently good and we're frequent patrons.  But our meal last Saturday night exceeded even our expectations!  Everything was spot 'ON'...from the fabulous service, to the most incredible homemade burrata with truffle oil!! We could have made a dinner from this one appetizer, it was that good!  I ordered the octopus salad for my entree and it was excellent.  It was a perfect, light and delicious main course for me while my husband devoured the  delicious pork chop (he DID share one bite)!
For dessert we usually share the unbelievable bread pudding but on this night we let our server guide us and she recommended the homemade cherry cheesecake.  Oh my, it was DIVINE!  All in all, another fabulous meal at a gem of a neighborhood restaurant.  Highly, highly recommend!
author: Roberta I.

description: Cozy and lovely for date night! We shared the steak tartare appetizer and enjoyed the duck breast and fresh papardelle pasta with steak. The steak tartare was my favorite dish out of the three. The steak sugo in the pappardelle pasta was a little salty to my taste but I also tend to prefer less salt in general so in this case I think it's probably a preference thing. The duck breast dish was tasty, even the lentils in the dish was perfectly prepared. Nice wine by the glass list and a friendly waiter. My one complaint is tables are quite close and a little claustrophobic and there's a lot of commotion since the restaurant is small. In some ways I guess it's nice to have the bustling because it feels homier and cozier. Otherwise, I'd recommend the place to anyone looking for a nice family dinner or a solid date spot. Great find, thanks yelpers!
author: Vicky S.

description:
What more can I add that hasn't been said already? The food is fantastic, service is attentive but not overbearing, and the ambiance is just right. 

Pro tip: try to get a table upstairs against the balcony. You won't regret it!
author: NickJess S.

description:
I highly recommend Frascati! The food is nothing short of phenomenal. Everything I have ever tried here was simply delicious. This is coming from a picky eater. 
Very cute, intimate restaurant with great service. Perfect for date night.
author: Natalia M.

description: Came here for our anniversary last night. Kai our server and the host were both great. They treated us so well. This place is definitely the gem that everyone says it is. The food was cooked to perfection. Spiced and salted perfectly. Gnocchi, octopus salad, halibut and duck breast.  What an awesome experience. We will be back. Thank you for all of your hospitality and great food Frascati.  Memorable.
author: E E.

description:
it may be because Frascati was the first restaurant I ever ate at in San Francisco that it is often number one on my list of recommendations to tourists and strangers and anyone! the food is top notch and the setting and ambiance are so romantic, beautiful, and relaxing for a quintessential San Francisco evening. I love this place and so do my parents and so Frascati is very important to me. I hope to go back again now that I could eat more than a couple things off the menu (there was not many options for vegetarians).
I'll add that while Frascati is totally San Francisco/Californian, my parents and I are rooted in New England traditions and I think that Frascati pulls off some of this conservative, respectful, humble, and elegant pride. Simply put, Frascati is a classy place sure to impress whomever you take with you.
author: Libra J.

description:
We came here for a late dinner on a Friday night. The place is super super small so do not expect to have much room to move around or a lot of space on your table.

People here are super friendly, so pretty much everyone will ask you how your meal is. I found it a bit too much, but I much rather overly friendly than rude service.

We had their gnocchi, their burrata and their pork chop and thought the food was really yummy. It is also in a cute area in SF.
author: S L.

description:
Stopped by on a whim because we couldn't decide where to eat. I had heard wonderful things about Frascati so I was really happy when they had a table immediately available for us walk-ins. 

We started off with a bottle of wine, which they immediately brought over after we ordered it. The bread they give you unfortunately has a stale taste to it but the olive oil bottle they provide is pretty cute. For the starters, I got to try the gnocchi and the foie gras torchon. Both were very delicious. I loved the truffle oil and the mushrooms on the gnocchi dish. Everything blended well together. The foie gras was wonderful - rich and creamy, its flavors perfectly pairing with the apples and raisins accompanying the dish. The portions were also perfect - not too large but not too small. For the entrees, I sampled the halibut and the pork chop. Both were just ok - cooked perfectly but the favors were missing a "wow factor" for me. The way the menu described the halibut dish had me expecting a cream sauce for the fish but it was unfortunately a tomato-based sauce. The pork chop was tender but I couldn't really taste any flavors in the sauce. Both dishes came with potatoes that didn't really flow with the dish, in my opinion. For dessert we shared the chocolate bread pudding. It was good but nothing compared to Chaya's croissant bread pudding. 

Overall, I thought the food was just ok for the price you pay. Service was excellent though and they kept tending to our needs even after we paid and sat around the table just chatting. I wouldn't come back any time soon but would recommend you give it a try :]
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Oooooh yeahhhh.  (Somewhat glutenous, somewhat sexual tone.)  That's the kind of response I would have if someone suggested coming here again.

Had dinner here with a couple of friends. We ordered the steak tartare, octopus salad, risotto, duck breast, pork chops, and dessert (forgot what it was).  All delicious, all moist, and all full of flavor.  The portions are well sized, so I left full with a little bit of leftovers since we ordered appetizers, munched on bread, and had sweets.

Service is attentive, friendly, and helpful.  The ambiance is fairly relaxed, though at my next visit, I will probably wear something a bit nicer.  Great spot for a first date since it's intimate, not too loud, and lighting is more on the romantic side.  My friends and I also never felt rushed, but I believe we went on a Sunday night.  Not sure how busy it is on other evenings.

One critique: I spied a server transfer someone's leftovers into a container with bare hands (directly touching the food).  Not a germaphobe and she probably did the same thing with my plate, but um, ew.  Don't know where those hands have been...  I ate my leftovers the next day anyway and it was damn good.  Judge me all you want.
author: Dwigt K. S.

description:
I LOVE this place. Went here once several years ago with my family for father's day. Both the food and service were fantastic.

More recently I went here with my husband and a friend who is a total foodie. We were tasked with picking a location and we wanted a place that he would be impressed with. Frascati did not disappoint (and I'm pretty sure he trusts us to choose restaurants now!). I'm surprised that the place isn't more widely well known but I guess that's part of the appeal.
author: Sydney L.

description:
Great food, wine, staff and ambiance.

My wife and I found ourselves in the neighborhood unexpectedly one weeknight, so I called last minute at 6:45p and asked if they could get two in that night asap. Maitre d' said to come on by, 7p would work.

We show up and I'm in full tech start-up uniform: jeans, T-shirt, and one day's stubble. Everyone else is in collared shirts and dresses. (It *is* Russian Hill, after all.) Guy doesn't blink, offers us any table and suggests a great one in the window. I'm appreciative.

The wine list is great: maybe ten selections for each varietal, domestic and imported, but great range in price and hidden gems. We got a great recommendation for a white (The Fatto a Mano Tocai Friulano for approx. $34) and they have a reasonable corkage policy: $20/25/30 for up to three bottles.

The food was great, too. We started with Monterey Bay sardines, which came with a chili aioli that cut the fishiness with a little bit of heat on the back end. The watermelon salad was a little disappointing: just four small pieces of watermelon, drizzled with balsamic and some crushed pistachios.

All in all, very good food, great friendly service and nice ambiance.
author: Vince S.

description:
Cute little restaurant on Hyde st. The waitstaff is very friendly and knowledgeable. Noise level in the restaurant is perfect, we found it easy talking despite the restaurant being full.

We ordered the sweet breads + stuffed ravioli for appetizer, roasted half chicken, crusted lamb rack, and chocolate bread pudding. Our favorite is the roasted half chicken, it's very moist and juicy. The portion is very big (at first I thought, but then I finished it in the blink of an eye). The sweetbread is pretty good as well, the portion is kinda small, but probably bigger portion would lead to it being too heavy.

Great experience and great food. Will definitely come back!
author: Novalina N.

description:
The octopus salad was truly phenomenal. The best.

However, the gnocchi and tomato salad were good, but boring.

The duck was not well cooked, in thick slabs, and was missing sauce.

The halibut was bland and the seafood stew was lacking.

The fruit cobbler was weird and frankly gross and the bread pudding was dense but worse than a brownie or a traditional bread pudding. 

Disappointing.
author: Madeline S.

description: Outstanding neighborhood restaurant.  Great service and excellent food.  Our group shared apps of steak tartare, bruschetta and figs with blue cheese.  I had their pork porterhouse as a main.  It was wonderful, as was a friend's roast chicken.  Also great was their bread pudding for dessert.  I wish I lived in Russian Hill so I could drop by anytime.
author: Martin K.

description:
Excellent meal and service. Great ambiance as well. 
Gnocchi appetizer- very good, slightly heavy on onions but perfect portion size
Bread salad- great flavor, light dressing, bread was perfection
Pork chop. cooked to correct temperature, I asked for a different sauce and the chef was able to use the blueberry sauce from another dish with the pork, it was excellent. 
Wine list was long and the sever was present but not overbearing. 

I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Lisa N.

description: Amazing first dinner as newlyweds! Food and service was spectacular! Best fish I've had in a while. Will go back when we visit again.
author: Margaret B.

description: This is a very solid restaurant with a nice cozy candlelit, but airy ambiance, yummy food, an attentive owner, seasonal ingredients, and a localsy vibe.
