We loved the duck confit salad - reminiscent of France. The spaghetti squash with brown butter was lovely too. And the honey cornbread ice cream made from scratch was A-OK.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I already had high expectations going to Frascati based on the glowing reviews from yelpers and I was pleasantly surprised by how good my experience was.

The steak tartare was flavorful, soft, delicious on toasted pieces of bread.

The duck breast was very tasty and pretty tender although it was a tad more bland than I would have preferred. I would give this dish a 4 stars. They also gave me more breast than I had expected they would.

The filet mignon was cooked to PERFECTION. Melted in my mouth, soft, just a bit past the rare stage. I just wish they gave me a bigger piece so I could eat more of it.

The garnishings on the plates were meh. The duck came with some ok tasting veggies and pasta and the filet came with some veggies that tasted as though I was eating a salt lick. However I am going to let it slide since the veggies are just...sides and the main event were the meats which were done very well.

Bread is meh...kind of dry and bland. Which I was ok with because I don't want to fill up on bread anyways.

We ordered a Panna Cotta and WOWW it was the best Panna Cotta I have eaten thus far in America since coming back from Florence, Italy. People rave about the one at Qua Tutto and I thought that one was too stiff and chewy. 

Definitely try this place out. Prices aren't cheap but they are not expensive for the quality of food you get.

The service is also amazing.
author: Em F.

description:
Celebrated one of my birthday dinners here this past weekend.  And I had an enjoyable meal.  While it got off to a stiff and awkward, it slowly got better and ended on a nice note. 

Frascati is a cute little neighborhood restaurant in Nob Hill.  And on a nice evening, they offer the option of sitting curb side.  It was chilly this past Saturday evening, so we sat inside.  Being such a small restaurant, spacing can be a bit cramped throughout the restaurant.  

But there is also a very nice upstairs "loft" dining area overlooking the main dining room.  We had a table upstairs overlooking the sidewalk next to a double-window. 

Our dinner reservation was made for 9:15pm, and even being a bit later, the place was still quite packed.  Service definitely got off to a very slow start, with our server took a long time take our order.  Furthermore, he wasn't very friendly and definitely rushed us throughout ordering.  

However, when we did have questions about various items, he was quite knowledgeable.  Another small annoying side note about our server was the fact that he also had some bad-ass breath!  I was hoping he wouldn't bend down or lean in as it spoke to us.  Luckily, it only happened twice throughout the night. Haha.  

Appetizers: We started off with the Artisanial Cheese Plate which consisted of 4 Cheeses ($14.00)  However, after ordering our server informed us that they were out of one of the cheeses and only had 3, so they were going to charge us $10.00 instead.  I was quite disappointed about this because of the fact that the Cheese plate was definitely quite highlighted at the top of the menu.  But we made due with the 3 cheeses instead.  

The cheeses were a great way to start dinner. bit quite small portions.  I would've liked them to compensate with larger pieces of cheese to make up for the 4 type of cheese.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xdAgbLBQcffIxI8mYgjT1Q?select=o02hEw0e299JQ9AU4THxuw

We also ordered the Roasted Eggplant-Tomato Soup with Creme Fraiche, and the Duck Confit Salad with Baby Spinach, Red Onions, Dried Cherries, Gorgonzola Cheese with a Balsamic dressing.  

The Eggplant Tomato Soup was bland and boring, I couldn't make out much of the tomato flavor in combination with the eggplant, and it also had a bad "burnt" taste to it.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xdAgbLBQcffIxI8mYgjT1Q?select=2gFO8g2k427P71HRvv8YoA

A favorite of mine, and definitely something I'd order again is the Duck Confit Salad.  What an awesome salad to start off with, and quite unlike anything I've ever had before.  The salad wasn't chilled like normal salads, but instead, the spinach was lightly cooked and flavorful.  The duck was also perfectly cooked and crispy in certain parts.  I also love the combination of the sweet dried cherries and the gorgonzola cheese.  Everything in the salad paired together perfectly.  
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xdAgbLBQcffIxI8mYgjT1Q?select=ovMLhmGuyEoRygfJGoniRQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/xdAgbLBQcffIxI8mYgjT1Q?select=Tlgg-eDwy_KX4mx09CwQIw 

For entree's, mom ordered the Maple Leaf Duck Breast and I ordered the Pan Seared Filet Mignon.

My Filet Mignon was a bit undercooked for my preference as I ordered it Medium, but came out a bit more rare.  The overall feel of the dish didn't knock my socks off, as the demi glace sauce had a bit too much wine flavor. A side of Potato Cauliflower Gratin, and Baby Root Veggies were also provided. 

The Duck Breast was was cooked to perfection and the sauce was sweet and flavorful.  Presentation-wise, but the Filet and the Duck had the same plating.  

As for dessert, we ordered the Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta with Almond Roca and Caramelized Bananas.  The Panna Cotta had great Vanilla Bean flavor, but texture was way too pudding-ish in my opinion.  I loved the almond roca on top and the few caramelized banana's were cooked perfectly.  

While our server started off unfriendly and rushy, he never failed to be very attentive to our needs...i.e refilling waters and complimentary bread, and he even attempted to sing Happy Birthday to me when my dessert came out.  Very sweet of him.  Overall, I will give him the benefit of the doubt in that, after the crowds died down, he became much better and calmer.  

Frascati is cute neighborhood spot with a cozy dining room.  I would recommend sitting in the loft seating area as it was a bit quieter and intimate with smaller 2 person tables, as opposed to the main dining area.  

Overall of the 3 appetizers we started off with the Duck Confit Salad was my favorite.  And while entree's while flavorful, they seemed quite similar to one another.   But not bad! 

An enjoyable dinner.
author: Cass J.

description: Really special place with intimate upstairs dining area that had view of the kitchen. Great for a romantic evening. Parking in a nearby paid lot is your best bet if you're not on foot.
author: Dan S.

description: I called on a Monday night to see if I could dine solo.  They were very accommodating and gave me a great little table.  I ordered the halibut and I must say, that was THE BEST halibut I have ever had.  The staff was very attentive without being overbearing.  They even brought a small pairing of a great Italian wine that complemented the halibut.  My regrets:  there was a great looking sardine appetizer that I didn't order.  Also, I was told they are known for the duck dish and do want to try it next time around.  So dear reader, correct my mistake!  Order sardines and duck.
author: Kristin E.

description:
Went there to celebrate my friend's and my birthday and came out totally pissed by the staffs.  Their service was not even up to par to begin with but what really pissed us off was their attitude when we questioned about the bill.  When I made the reservation I specifically asked the person (owner) if they'd do anything special for the birthday person and his response was "Yes, we have a special dessert for birthday."  So when we finished our dinner, one of my friend asked the waiter about the birthday special and the waiter recommended the peach cobbler & chocolate bread pudding from the regular menu for the two birthday people.  My birthday friend was so happy and thanked the waiter for the desserts on the house but he didn't seem to hear him.  We finally found out why his lack of acknowledgement when we saw the check, because the desserts were on the bill!!! Since I was the one who confirmed about the special, I asked the person who brought us the bill about the charges.  I told him about what I was told when I made the reservation and he gave me a look of disgust and said "No! WE don't give anything for birthday!" then turned around before I could say anything!!!  That attitude there was not even it!  Another staff came by and started telling us that they never offered anything for birthday for as long as they were open and looked at me as I was lying to him, he might as well call me a liar then!!!  My friends and I love to try new places and have been to many Michelin Star restaurants and we can tell you this place is not Michelin Star level but they probably think they are and thought we were there to trick them in to giving us free desserts!  We had wanted to go to Swensen for dessert but stayed because we were told about the "special" dessert!  Their food was OK but with that service I certainly will never go back and highly recommended that everyone not to go.  For your well-being, DO NOT GO!!!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A day after the review I made (above) I got a voicemail from the owner.  He started off by saying that he's the one who took my reservation and remembering me mentioned about two birthday people; and he recalled that he told me that he'd make a note of that but never said that he'd buy us dessert.  He stressed again that "we don't do that!"  Then reluctantly he apologized for the miscommunication.  That was the first time anyone from that restaurant said an apology!!!  Yesterday they were all snooty and readily accusing us for lying!  It didn't cross their mind at all that it could be some kind of miscommunication and just apologize for that last night.  I don't know why they were so obessess about their dessert and kept thinking that we were upset because we couldn't get them free!!!  Like I said from the beginning what pissed us off was their ATTITUDE!!!  This phone call had the same ridiculous attitude; the owner did not hesitate to end the call by saying that I was being UNFAIR with my review and that's his opinion!  Unbeliveable!
author: Yani C.

description:
Frascati is the neighborhood restaurant from which I judge every other neighborhood restaurant.  It's exceptional in every conceivable way.  I've eaten here alone on business (at the small bar top) on several occasions and while this is definitely the type of meal that you want to share and love with others.... I assure you it's an experience you shouldn't miss even if you're in town on a whim.

My wife and I journeyed out to San Francisco in 2014 and without a hesitation I booked a table a few months in advance for our anniversary.  We were seated in the front window where the romance of San Francisco and the warm atmosphere of the restaurant itself come together perfectly.  The roasted chicken is worth walking 7 miles for and their specials are always delightful.  I'm so happy I found Frascati and I'm so happy to be able to share  it with others.    

To me, Frascati is San Francisco.  It's real amazing food served by real amazing people.
author: C. K.

description: Hip little place...amazing steak, great wine selection and the chocolate bread pudding and hazelnut ice cream was fabulous. Definitely going back!
author: Katie A.

description:
Frascati was a pleasant surprise! Located in the neighborhoods off Hyde Street, you would have never known that there are so many cute little restaurants/lounges/shops etc. in the area. After finding this place on yelp and looking over the menu, we were pretty excited to spend our last night of our wedding anniversary weekend here. And they did not disappoint. I had the lamb and wife had the risotto, and we shared a great bottle of wine, two of the four cheeses on the menu, and the gnocchi starter dish. I don't think I've ever had all the dishes we ordered in one sitting melt in my mouth like each one of those did. And our server was so friendly and upbeat! They got pretty busy after we were sat, but she attended to us like nothing (not that we needed her to since we were enjoying our food and the cute place and each other's company in conversation). I can't wait to go back, hopefully with more people so they can enjoy this great place as much as we did. I now have a goal to try everything they put on their menu. 

ONE MORE THING.. We were sat upstairs and got to watch the kitchen at work from up above. Magic I tell you!
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Wow, I didn't know that it's been three years since I last went back. My sis and the family are in the process of going to ALL the restaurants that I took Mr. Douche (aka ex bf) so this was stop number #2 off our list.

We got a res at 7:30 (BTW, the auto shop next door is now a parking garage for $8)

We arrived and the place was packed! Our table was upstairs (opposite where Douche and I first had our first romantic dinner--yes I'm not bitter!)

Moving on...our server (which my siblings nicknamed "the French Jack Black") was prompt and nice. We started off with a Kir Royale (my sis is into champagne mixed with something...) it was awesome. She also brought a bottle 2007 Cobb Pinot Noir -- the sommelier was fan of her best friend so our corkage was free.

I had the potato gnocchi (which tasted awesome and just the right portion) and I also just had a mushroom soup (I didn't like it too much but I was saving room for my chocolate bread pudding and my bikini!).

Overall, friendly staff and awesome service. My sis of course took care of us and my bro and I are ever so thankful for that!

PS: forgot what my siblings ordered b/c of the wine but they devoured it so I assumed they enjoyed it =)
author: Cath M.

description:
I've been here twice within the last 3 months, once for a girl's night out and once for a date. The ambiance is perfect for both occasions and pretty much any other occasion on the table... quintessential San Francisco meets Italian Cuisine. The seating by the windows are perfect for getting that traditional SF-flare, watching the trolleys go by while enjoying a meal. 

Here's what I've tried: 

Potato Gnocchi (3.5 stars):
This appetizer was very light and filled with an interesting mix of peas, tomatoes and mushrooms. I'm not sure how well the peas went the rest of the dish but it was good nonetheless. 

Artisanal Cheese Plate (5 stars): 
Now anyone who knows me knows that I love a good cheese plate. And this cheese plate satisfied me in every way. Perfect blend of sheep, cow and goat milk while encompassing nutty, robust, sweet, salty and other sharp flavors. Pair it with a glass of Pinot or Chardonnay and you've hit foodie galore. 

Nettle Risotto (3.5 stars - 4 stars): 
Perfect amount of creaminess but I wish it had more of a mushroom-flavor. I prefer Isa's Truffle risotto over this one because of the overpowering flavor of the mushrooms. This one is great for those who want the sole focus to be on the cheese. The melted leeks brings in some interesting texture as well. 

Warm Black and White Chocolate Bread Pudding (5 stars): 
I don't even like bread puddings but the waitress recommended this as their signature dessert. And if someone picks out one dish as their signature dish, you've simply got to try it! So glad I did because it was absolutely divine! A cross between a molten chocolate cake, white chocolate pudding and some bread chunks.

One little tidbit - make reservations at least a week in advance because they tend to book up really easily! I had to make them 2 weeks in advance to ensure seating for 3.

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: One of our best dining experiences. A must try when in the San Francisco area!!!
author: Kristen H.

description: Cute little italian place, good for an intimate date night dinner. Good was really good, proper italian fused with fancy san francisco menu items, but all in all simple dishes witj lots of flavor.
author: E B.

description:
I was only in San Francisco for a long weekend, so I relied on yelp to guide me to a delicious dinner (that wasnt touristy!) by our hotel. Once again yelpers guided me in the right direction! 

My first impression of Frascati was how cute the restaurant was. If I lived in the neighborhood it would be my go to date spot. Very intimate and romantic. 

To start we got the mushroom bruschetta which was delicious! It was relatively simple, but everything came together so well and it might have been the highlight of the meal for me. We then split the filet mignon and the bass. The filet was fantastic and the sides were delicious, but I wasn't a huge fan of the bass. The portions were small and the service was pretty lackluster. I felt that our whole meal was rushed. Not my favorite meal of the trip, but definitely an enjoyable dining experience.
author: Erica M.

description: Really cute neighborhood restaurant with a super friendly and quaint vibe. Came with a large group (nearly 30 people, with reservation far in advance). Staff was very attentive water and wine glasses were never empty and every request was immediately attended. Food was great, the avocado and cucumber soup was very refreshing and different from any soup I've had, the halibut was perfectly done and the apple crisp dessert was to die for (do not miss this dessert, it was much better than the bread pudding or panacotta). Great area of town as well with many places to enjoy after dinner if desired.
author: Amanda W.

description:
Very wonderful restaurant - delicious food, neighborhood feel but still a great date place, and sweet staff :) As a vegetarian I was very impressed by how good the food was, despite the single veggie entree option (mushroom risotto was superb!). 

Expect parking to be a slight pain, and you'll be fine.
author: Lana L.

description: The bread pudding is so delicious, I'm willing to let it violate my mouth in the middle of the night.
author: Leiren M.

description: Great Halibut entree. Restaurant was too warm in October and menu was a little limited. 4 out of 5 overall though.
author: Matt G.

description:
Simply amazing.

The service was great and reasonable prices.  The filet mignon and the duck breast was perfect.  Tender, perfect crisp on the outside and balance of flavor.
author: Allen T.

description:
Came here on a Sunday evening.  Very weird cramped set up on the second floor we were put in.  We were sitting on the side hall way.  Was this a previous house?  The place was very hot and smokey so the windows next to us were open which helped the air. 

The food:  We ordered:

crab salad:  Bland and salty.  What a disappointment.  The avocado cream thing they had on the side of it helped a little with the saltiness of the dish but would definitely not order this again.

Biratta and tomato jam, arugula salad:  Very good.  The tomato jam was sweet and tasted a little like sun dried tomato with sugar.  Definitely the better appetizer.

Main course:

Halibut:  Kind of bland, but well cooked/tender.  The sauce tasted like carrots with cream.  Came with zucchini and beans.  The zucchini was bitter, not good, and the beans was just kinda strange. It was okay/would not recommend ordering this.

Flat iron steak: Very well seasoned and flavorful.  Definitely the better of the entrees. 

The service was spot on however, and the wait staff very attentive.  We got our water refilled regularly.

All in all, it's a hit/miss 50/50 kind of dining experience.  With all the great restaurants in SF we would not be coming back.
author: Eating And Living Well U.

description:
Last month, I checked out Frascati in Russian Hill, a Mediterranean-inspired bistro.  Tucked in the corner of one of the neighborhood's many tree-lined streets, Frascati reveals itself as a gem, warm and inviting to both its local residents and diners from afar. 

Walking in, you feel like you're in the cozy confines of a quaint inn; candle light bathing the small dining room where patrons sit side by side.  The experience is elevated quickly by the immaculate service provided by the courteous staff.

Our food was delicious, from start to finish.  We first enjoyed the "Russet Potato Gnocchi with English Peas, Corn, Asparagus, Melted Leeks, Diced Tomato and White Truffle Oil", it just melted in your mouth.  For our entrees, we had the "Pan Seared Filet Mignon with Potato-Fennel Gratin, Roasted Root Vegetables, Wild Mushrooms and Demi Glace" and "Grilled Pork Chop with Braised Cabbage, Chorizo, Butter Bean Ragout, Arugula, Roasted Shallots and Tomato Olive Compote", both were just out of this world good.  It's been refreshing to visit a place that just excelled on all levels, and to be apparently doing it for that long (it's been open since 1987).

Highly recommended.
author: Saminda W.

description:
The food and service here is fantastic. I had passed by this place many times and always wanted to try it.  Luckily we got the last reservation on a Saturday night because we saw them turn people away. 

Gnocchi- delicious, light and perfectly accompanied with spring vegetables
Steak tartare- great mustard vinaigrette enhanced the flavor of the beef 
Burrata- I pretty much like all burrata
Pork chop- a little dry but otherwise good
Halibut- light, delicious vegetables
Chocolate bread pudding- AMAZING! I subbed it with chocolate peanut butter ice cream and it's not only the best chocolate peanut butter ice cream I've ever had but the bread pudding convinced the two other people I dined with that they like bread pudding now
Lemon cheesecake- good without overpowering lemon flavor
Wine selection- My only con here is the wine temp seemed too warm even for red. It was very warm in the restaurant that day and the might need to store them in a cooler place
author: Lisa K.

description:
You can't go wrong here. Frascati offers comfortable, friendly service in a neighborhood restaurant. Once, six of us walked in with no reservation and lucked into a table. It was located upstairs in the back next to a fan, which was critical because otherwise I would have roasted.

The food is satisfying and the wine list touches many bases. Feel free to mix things up among small or big plates and share as desired.
author: Mike H.

description:
It's unbelievable and difficult to admit that after 2 years in the neighborhood we only very recently supped at Frascati. We arrived early'ish and were immediately seated without reservation.

We went on to enjoy an excellent meal comprised of gem lettuce salad and grilled sardine starters followed by bay scallops and an amazing sugo served over papardelle.

My only suggestion to, request of chef would be to grill sardines until the skin is crisp and flakey. 

We've now corrected our 2-year oversight and will return to Frascati!
author: Jay D.

description:
Parking: parking is TERRIBLE. We had reservations at 8pm on a Tuesday night and it took us at least 30-40 minutes just to find parking. The staff at the restaurant recommended parking in the parking lot on Broadway and Polk, we drove around but couldn't locate the lot and eventually parked 10 minutes away. 

Service: service was subpar. Complimentary bread was not offered until we asked for some. At least offer us some bread to keep our minds off of the terrible parking situation! We literally sat there for an hour waiting for the last person in our party to find parking. I don't remember our server's name but she was ok, nothing extraordinary. Some of the things she said could have been reworded so it's not offensive to some but it was nothing major. Lastly, there's a cake cutting fee which is absolutely ridiculous. At almost $4 per person, it can add up! 

Food: we ordered 3 appetizers and 4 entrees among 4 people. We ordered the russet potato gnocchi, monterey bay sardines and the cauliflower bisque as our starters. They were all delicious but if I had to recommend one, I'd say go for the gnocchi. For entrees, my friends ordered the roasted half chicken (very moist and tender), grilled pork porterhouse (good flavor) and the prawn risotto (good but can be heavy for some), while I ordered the maple leaf duck breast. I decided on the duck breast based on the recommendations here on yelp but I was disappointed. I tried all the entrees and the duck was my least favorite. The hash was good but the duck lacked flavor.

To sum it all up: parking sucks, service is meh, food is good. Would I come here again? Probably not.
author: Dada F.

description: Perfect dining....'nuff said.
author: Darby W.

description: This place is a little neighborhood gem. So cozy. Felt like a setting out of Europe. Very classic inside. The staff a lovely. The ambience warm, homely and inviting with a touch of elegance. The food was very good quality. I had the duck and my man had the chicken which we both really enjoyed. The red wine was yummy. Very nice experience overall.
author: Sarah H.

description: good food, good wine, and great service - but not so stellar that warrants a 5 star review. i think i had the bass or whatever fish dish they were serving at the time, and it was great.  my friend got the pork chops, but he thought it was a bit on the dry side - so the food quality may be a bit hit or miss depending on what you order.  ambiance was cute/cozy (not exactly a huge space), although the crowd seems to be a bit older. good for a low key date night or catching up with a friend!
author: Lisa H.

description: Really delicious neighborhood gem.  Went with friends and ordered the gnocchi and mushroom bruschetta appetizers.  They were great, but really the roast chicken made the biggest impression on me.  I normally don't order chicken because it's usually dry, but the waitress insisted it was the best she's ever had so I tried it.  So glad I did - so juicy and tasty.
author: B. Y.

description: I have been here several times and the food is very consistent. Frascati is a small, quiet restaurant on a corner in Russian Hill. My last time was not as good, my guest had the pork chop, which she did not care for, and I had the Risotto, which did not have enough sausage (or maybe I just like sausage too much). The atmosphere is really nice and somewhat casual which is great for a neighborhood spot. Besides, I really hate those high end restaurants made for snobs. Wine selection and knowledge of the wine by the servers is great. They are also great about bringing you a few different tastes if you can't decide.
author: Danny M.

description: Everything was delicious and not overwhelming. I loved the octopus salad. As for dessert both the cheesecake and the panda cotta, the panna cotta was to die for :)
author: Aspasia I.

description:
My wife and I celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary at Frascati, and they did not disappoint. To be honest, I thought I made the reservation at a restaurant that had a full bar, but it was okay that they just served beer and wine. The food and service were excellent.

I had a special appetizer that had clams, mussels, and some other seafood in a tomato sauce. It was amazing... the best mussels and clams I've had in a long time. My wife ordered the filet and I opted for the duck breast. Both were excellent - prepared perfectly and very flavorful. 

Overall I was very impressed. The restaurant is small, but we had plenty of room and it was very quaint. And what a value for the price... I've been to much more expensive restaurants that weren't nearly as good (service or food). 

The only downside is they did not have a full bar - only beer and wine. That wasn't a problem for me but my wife doesn't drink beer or wine, so we left as soon as we finished eating and went to a nearby bar for a nightcap.
author: Brandon E.

description:
Cozy, great service and just amazing quality fine dining!

Ambiance is quaint.  Street parking challenging but worth the visit.
author: S A.

description:
I really wanted to like this place given the high ratings but sadly I was very much let down. 

The food was certainly not worth the price. I ordered the Pork chop which was dry and she ordered the duck breast and that was dry and bland. If it was 15-20$ I would be less disappointed but you better step up your game when your charging $25-35 an entre.

Also, the servers just take your dish before you are even done or without even asking... Ridiculous 

It's a wanna-be fine dining spot. I feel like all these restaurants on hyde are that way. Its only a matter of time before they go belly up if they are providing that caliber of service and dishes for the price.
author: John S.

description:
We had an amazing server, and everything we ordered was just beautiful - both on the plate and on the palate.  

Living in the neighborhood, it's impossible to not want to eat here on a regular basis, although it can easily be a destination in and of itself. Impeccable.
author: Laura W.

description:
Frascati is a very pleasant restaurant, it is a perfect date night location as the decor is very quaint and stylish.  I had a tough time deciding if this was a 3 or 4 star restaurant (both represent very quality establishments.  Look at rating distribution, I'm pretty tough on places).  After writing the review and looking back over it, this place is a 4 star restaurant.

Lets start out with the good:  

Awesome looking interior, including a raised dining area overlooking the small downstairs seating area.

The food was delicious, I especially enjoyed the Octopus Salad, and the bass.  Both were cooked to perfection and the Octopus was more tender than any I have had before.  The bread pudding was also amazing.

The OK:

The porkchop was very good and tender.  The potatoes and bacon pieces on the side were delicious but the sauce it was served with was a little too sweet.  Luckily It was covering the plate and not poured over the pork chop so I just avoided.  Still it would have been nice not to have something as strong.

The service was a little rude at first but once they calmed down and realized I was a foodie they were amiable.  I just hate the discriminating service I get because I am young, it makes me want to stiff them on tips but then I am just feeding into the cycle.

The Salmon Bruschetta was OK, it was tasty but did nothing to really wow me.

I will definitely be back here sometime.  A very nice local find for me.
author: Ryan J.

description:
Frascati is a strong 4 in my book. 

I have been twice and definitely look forward to my next visit. I lived in the neighborhood which was nice given Russian Hill's notorious lack of parking. As others noted, you can take the Hyde St trolley here which can be fun from time to time. Frascati is on the pricier side, but you definitely get what you pay for. 

When I want a delicious, intimate dining experience in an ultra-local neighborhood, Frascati is high on my list!
author: Peter C.

description: You can tell the difference between a pseudo Italian restaurant and an authentic one by the quality of the olive oil it puts on the table. Although the menu signaled tired tried and true dishes, the real negative began w. the olive oil: brought to the table in an unattractive bottle with a cork for pete's sake! greasy to the touch, you have to pull out the cork (why not a pouring spout?? a bottle with handles??) and pour. I smelled before the pour and knew it was not a good oil by that alone. The taste confirmed it and it was downhill from there. Bread nothing to write home about in a city with GREAT sourdough all over the place. I ordered the cheese plate to start. When it got put down in front of me it was totally unappealing in color. The server made a point of saying that on the side here, "are some candied apricots"!! what a total JOKE! they were ordinary dried apricots, dry being the operative word. I could see this, I did not have to taste it but I confirmed this by taste. There were some green apple slices, (sour) the top one had some core left on it. Under that was this red stuff that was a slightly bitter jam, perhaps a tomato chutney but I could not figure it out. Some walnuts some almonds, the cheeses were ordinary and small. I left most of this dish. I ate the cheese but longed to combine it with some sweet as should have been on the plate. Then I had the duck breast salad.  Truly I could have eaten something better off the salad bar at Whole Foods. The duck was dry, chewy and old tasting, the dressing was a standard affair. There is another duck entree on the menu and I am sure they are recycling what they don't use on any one day into this insipid salad. The desert was good, the only thing of all our courses that was. My husband had the chicken and I was surprised how bland the taste was, tough, stringy and dry. He left a lot of it. The prices for the level of food here were ridiculous only adding insult to injury. Even the servers in my opinion, 'get' this. This place is just racking in the money and do not care a jot about their customers. I felt embarrassed for them and could not even look our server in the eye by the end of the meal. Plus they check went down on our table WHILE we were eating desert! What UP? there was not a big crowd waiting to get in or anything. The lighting in our upper backroom, was dreary, like a worn out bar. Nothing sparkles here, don't go.  Want nice meal in a similar place but really really tasty and at the same price? Try L'Ardoise, Noe.  Shame on this place.
author: Mary J.

description:
The meal started at a 4 and didn't dip at all at any point in the night. Was here for a group business dinner so we got to splurge a bit, the cheese plate, buratta, and the ahi tuna started us off and every dish was fantastic. The cheese plate was very thoughtfully put together and we actually finished all of the cheese on it - a rare feat. 

For the mains everyone at the table got the duck and I got the papardelle. (I will never opt out of a papardelle if it's on a menu). The ducks came in a thick maple sauce that I think I could've only done a few bites of, but my papardelle was a delight. The pasta was light as air and the ragout was well concocted and tasty. Finished it all off with the bread pudding which you absolutely HAVE to order - it was THE best dessert I've had in the city so far. Boom.

I can't say that there's anything that really makes Frascati stand out among a sea of good Italian places in the city, but if you're in the neighborhood and looking for a little spendy evening don't hesitate to come here.
author: Lisa P.

description:
Really good smoked salmon flatbread

pork chop was cooked very well

duck breast was amazing

wine was good and very reasonably priced

dessert was really, really sweet, maybe a little too sweet.

overall great restaurant - was hard to find parking though
author: Gore S.

description: We came here around 6:00 on a weeknight after a day of sightseeing. The restaurant was highly recommended by friends who used to live in the city. We were with our two children - 8 and 11. We were seated immediately. Our server was very kind to our children and made them feel welcome. He even offered to make them something kid friendly off the menu. We enjoyed everything we ordered. My favorite was the gnocchi appetizer with the grilled bread salad being a close second. My husband really enjoyed the smoked salmon bruschetta. The homemade ice creams were also delicious. We loved our food and our experience. Hope to return before leaving CA!
author: Jenny G.

description:
Over-hyped juuuuuust a bit. 

But first: the appetizers are delicious. And the desserts were also very good. (burrata and bruschetta) 

But the entrees I tried were just "okay". Granted, my friend loved hers and has been here several times. 

(kind of tempted just to sit at the bar and drink wine and go straight to dessert if I go back). 

Great service though, the owner chose an incredible wine and our server was exceptional. Too bad the kitchen can't punch it up with the entrees. 

They definitely lose a star for having only wine (they claim to have "beer" but honestly, the selection was just, well, depressing. I was half expecting to see Naty-Ice on the menu). There are many exceptional beers that go with several of the menu items. (To clarify, please don't turn into one of those pretentious "beer pairing" places. Just add some Old Speckled Hen, Franziskaner, or the Duvel which seems to be everywhere these days).
author: Mike V.

description:
We celebrated a birthday here recently and everything was delish. Started with the figs and the octopus salad, which were both divine. I ordered the duck, which I always do with trepidation since duck is either perfectly prepared or awful. Thankfully, this quacker was perfectly prepared, beautifully rare, crisped skin, and very yummy. My partner's ribeye was also tasty. 

Sadly, I was not blown away at all with the chocolate bread pudding. As a self-proclaimed bread pudding aficionado, I couldn't wait to try it. But I didn't think it was very good--more of a pudding without any bread. It was the first time in history that I did not finish a bread pudding put in front of me. The hazelnut ice cream, on the other hand, was creamy and tasty. 

Whatever you do, DO NOT DRIVE to this restaurant. Parking is atrocious (the other 2 couples in our party spend 45 minutes driving around for parking; we lucked out and found a spot after only about 10 minutes). They really should have valet for this area. Because of this reason alone, I likely will not be back.
author: Amy B.

description:
If you don't live there, Russian Hill is really one of those neighborhoods you never have a reason to go unless you are explicitly going there for the sake of exploring Russian Hill.  A low key and relatively posh neighborhood, there are some impressive fancy-ish joints.  A "Mediterranean style bistro," Frascati seems to use that loose definition to serve what Yelpers would call "American (New)".  Perfect for those modestly sized portions of meat paired with a healthy doses of fresh vegetables and a side of class.  Worth the cab/trolly trip up the big hill if want something more sophisticated than North Beach, but not a destination place if coming from further away.

Russet Potato Gnocchi: White truffle oil paired with any sort of tuber is a win in my book.  The gnocchis were soft with a slight pan sear on the outside and starchy goodness on the inside.  Liked the fresh pairing of the peas and asparagus which helps cut the heaviness.

Wild Mushroom Bruschetta: Fondue is a bit of an overstatement for the goat cheese on top.  It's more of a partially melted, mostly solid topping.  The crostini, goat cheese and mushrooms all tasted good individually, but were pretty mild as an aggregate.  Needs some pizazz.

Roasted Half Chicken: Apparently a neighborhood favorite here.  Perfect for those who love a mish mash of flavors!  The skin is crusted with potent spices and salt.  The meat is moist and oozing aromas of herbs.  The side veggies would have been lackluster, but absorbed all the chicken drippings to have some personality.

Grilled Pork Chop: Had I not just had the Food Network famous pork chop from Tee Off Bar & Grill, I might have been kinder.  Frascati said this was brined for 24 hours, but I really didn't taste much flavor seeping deep into the meat.  The sear on the outside was ok, but could have been crispier.  The veggies were hidden beneath and satisfactory, but once merely leveraging the flavor from the meat.
author: Adam B.

description:
Date night in San Francisco does not get better than dinner at Frascati.  The service was so impressive that I decided to put them to a little test.  I left my napkin on my chair, went to the bathroom to wash my hands and told myself I'd write a 5 star review if that napkin was refolded for my return.  Of course it was and here we are now.

Highly recommend the caprese, gnocchi, and filet mignon.  

There is not a single thing I have to complain about during my visit there.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Jarica S.

description:
I live * MAYBE * a half a block away from Frascati. 

Countless times I've walked by and thought that it was out of my price range and that I would save going there for special occasion. Well, it finally happened. The special occasion was my mother being in town from Los Angeles. 

The restaurant is surprisingly big given the neighborhood how small it looks from the outside. Who knew it would have a 2nd floor for seating?

The place itself is very cozy and from walking by I could always tell I was not leaving this place without spending a serious amount of cash on dinner. 

I was lucky that my mother doesn't eat a lot so we shared some dishes. 

The biggest hits were the halibut and the panna cotta. 

As our entree the panna cotta was excellent. Whatever veggies came with it were very tasty and at the mid $20 price was not as outrageous as I thought it would be. 

I also tried the pear salad which I enjoyed and the gnocchi which I thought was excellent though you only get about 6 pieces of gnocchi which was disappointing. 

I will generalize and say that portions were consistently on the small side. Were it not for this I would probably give Frascati 5 stars. The relationship between value, quality and portion sizes is important to me. 

I can't say I was too thrilled about our waiter. He was definitely nice enough. Perhaps because we were speaking Spanish the whole time he felt we wouldn't understand what he was saying to us. A plus was the gorgeous Brazilian / Nicaraguan staff person who stopped by to say hello as she set the table. She was genuinely warm and friendly and my mother appreciated someone chatting with us in what I am sure she (my mom) thought was a place where nobody outside the kitchen spoke Spanish. Big props to the busboy for also chatting with us in Spanish for second and being very helpful in bringing us water and bread. I think he picked up on my mom's monolingual-ness and talked to us more than he normally would to other patrons. 

All in all - I enjoyed Frascati. We shared most of our food and left with a $60 tab (drank water, no wine). 

I recommend it for a lively date place. It's right on Hyde street so you can cable car there or take the 45 Union. It's a cute neighborhood with plenty of trees and spots to visit afterward for a post-dinner drink. 

PS: DO NOT DRIVE HERE. PARKING IS IMPOSSIBLE IN THIS NEIGHBORHOOD. 

Okay, that was my parking PSA.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Food is soooo good!!!  Everything excellent - atmosphere, service, experience!
Except...
.....dessert.  Dessert was just ok.  Felt like I ordered dessert at TGI Friday's or Bennigan's - big portion, really sweet and very ordinary.  I have a sweet tooth so when they hire a star pastry chef - I'll be back!
author: Daniel K.

description: Definitely a hidden gem amongst the hustle and bustle of San Francisco. Each meal starts with bread and olive oil, as a good Italian meal should. For apps we had a gnocchi dish and a cheese dish - cheese dish was much better. Not saying the gnocchi was anything to scoff at, but it was nothing special. Entrees (strip steak for one and pasta for another) were served fresh and swiftly; however again nothing too impressive. They do have a great wine selection, but not a full bar.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Actually 3.5 stars!

Food: 4/5
Service: 3/5: we were seated upstairs (there were only a few tables upstairs), and the ppl around us were leaving, so the waiter asked us 3 times if we wanted to move downstairs when we were already situated, and politely declined
Ambiance: 4/5
Parking: NEGATIVE 5- the BF paid $20 for two hours of parking since we got frustrated driving around for 15 minutes looking for parking, and our dinner reservation was at 9:45pm!

What we ordered:
Wine: Savignon Blanc: 4/5: pretty good for the price: $9.5/glass
Appetizer: Foie Gras: 1.5/5: This dish was not that great for the $ you paid. They gave you this huge piece of Foie Gras, but w/ two tiny pieces of crostini. The Foie Gras was really bland. Yuck, I would not recommend this.
Duck breast: 3/5: It was duck cooked in two ways; one pan fried crispy and a little TOO salty; I believe the other was medium rare and perfect. 
Mushroom Risotto: 5/5 DELICIOUS!! portion size was great and it was cooked to perfection--a creamy, well seasoned sauce. Yum =)
Dessert: Chocolate bread pudding: 5/5: DELICIOUS!! the hazelnut ice cream with small chunk of Walnuts made it extra good! The choclate pudding was rich and the bottom of it has a slight crisp to it ;)!

Tip and tax out the door=$110+$20 (parking) for two ppl

Their menu changes often, but the waiter told me their duck, chicken and ribeye items are always on the menu; OH and their chocolate pudding! I highly recommend the risotto and chocolate pudding!
author: Jen H.

description: Delicious! Frascati is the kind of neighborhood restaurant everyone wishes to have within a short walk from home. Well thought out creative menu, excellent curated wine list, and a dessert menu you can't pass up. All this combined with an experienced staff which provided great service made for a perfect night out.
author: RJames H.

description: Great food, great service, great dining experience. We didn't have reservations, but they fit us in without any wait which was so nice as the place was packed on a Friday night. I had the halibut main course, my husband had the risotto and his sister had the chicken. All delicious! The panne cotta dessert was also amazing. If you are in the Russian Hill area--or want to hike up there--this is a great spot.
author: Leanne W.

description: Food, service and the ambiance here is great. What is worth writing a review? - their French toast for dessert and cheese plate. I can't wait to go back and have the French toast again. The cheese selections and combinations for cheese plate are quite yummy as well.
author: Kanwal A.

description:
(See pics)

Definitely a solid 4 stars, more like 4.2 stars!

Appetizers gnnochi was not heavy and with lots of tiny bites veggies, and I love the texture of the gnnochi.

Duck egg with aspagas, was a bit bland and watery that it was probably not cooked well.

Main course wise, the pork chop was nothing like what you would think! It's medium done but was very very juicy, nicely done and a big dish!

Duck breast was fantastic as it was made it 2 ways. 1 piece was seared and fully cooked-- crisp and rich. The other piece was done medium rare that was soft, delicate and smooth to taste.

Dessert wise, the pudding with ice-cream was very big but very delicious. The affogato was really good with strong espresso, a good calming kick before the evening ends.

I really love restaurants that are smaller and with a half upstairs lofty style, and Frascati is one of those. It gives the intimacy, friendly feel.

Did not try their wine as we brought our own. They were very nice to help let the air out using the special carafe. Totally professional and knew what they were doing!

Service was very very good. Even we arrived for the last seating they let us stay and gave us plenty of time to enjoy the food and company.
author: T L.

description:
Outstanding restaurant!  Great food and a warm, cozy atmosphere. I rarely eat pork at a restaurant and I chose the chop which was perfectly cooked and impressively presented.  My wife had a filet which you literally could cut with a fork.

The service was appropriately attentive and wonderfully personal.  We will definitely be back the next time we visit San Francisco
author: John M.

description:
Just ate here last night for the first time and lemme tell you it's damn good! I'm going big on this one with saying Frascati easily has a place right now in my top three places to eat in SF when considering food, price, service and ambiance.

My date and I ended up having a 5-course meal sardines, octopus salad, mushroom gnocchi (which the waiter served to us on the house!), pork chop and their famous chocolate bread pudding (which was on just about each table at one point when looking around) and a couple glasses of the Neal Zin.  Everything from start to finish was amazing including the food, the wine, the service and the ambiance!  

If you haven't been, go! PS ...the waiter mentioned the half roasted chicken is extremely popular and if he took it off the menu his regulars would probably have his throat.  I'll be back and the chicken better be on the menu John ;-)
author: Miss A.

description:
This is a awesome Russian Hill neighborhood restaurant.  I came here on Wednesday night with 3 friends and was not expecting such a great meal.
The place has a very laid-back contemporary ambiance and honestly felt like it could be someone's home.

Food:
1) Russet Potato Gnochi - excellent, they didnt go overboard on cheese/cream
2) Burata Caprese - I had forgotten how good tomatoes can taste, simple ingredients with alot of flavor
3) Capelini Puttanesca - excellent, seafood was fresh and cooked well.
4) Roasted Half-Chicken - better than Zuni Cafe - more tender, better flavor, skin was delectable.
5) Salmon - very good, but a bit more subdued compared to the other dishes.  

6) Bread Pudding - finger-licked the plate clean, it was that good.  
7) Home-made Ice Cream - all flavors great, would recommend the coffee flavored one.

I wish we had got to sit in the main room to get a feel for the cable car/pedestrian ambiance as opposed to upstairs.  

All in all - would come back any day.
author: Aasim K.

description:
My husband brought me to dinner here for our first Anniversary. That's not the only reason this place is special.

The dim chandelier lights and intimate candlelight ambiance - Loved it! 

I ordered the Truffle risotto. I loved the overpowering flavor of the mushrooms. This dish was rich, looked small but truly filling. The melted leeks inside the risotto brought out an interesting texture as well. It was amazing.

I'm not done, dessert was absolutely to die for. The chocolate bread pudding is a must!

don't miss out.
author: Muneera M.

description:
I've eaten here a few times for special occasions and each time, it's been absolutely charming and wonderful. 

The service is consistently pleasing, the food artfully presented and filled with delicious flavors and enchanting combinations and the wine list is quite thorough and accommodating. It's a small intimate restaurant and it's easy to feel as if you're in Italy.  The wait staff is also fully knowledgable and helpful in making astute wine recommendations.  

We ordered and shared the following: 
*Monterey Bay Sardines with Meyer Lemon Aïoli, Chili Oil, Herb Salad and Grilled Ciabatta - These were just so fabulous and you must make sure to get the sauce in each bite. It really made it and the sardines were cooked perfectly. Not everyone can serve delicious sardines and these were yummy!

*Calimari salad (a new addition I believe) - Delightful. We were sad when it was gone!

*Cappelini Puttanesca with Tiger Prawns, Dungeness Crab, Roasted Tomato, Anchovy, White Wine, Olives and Herb Bread Crumbs - I'm not much of a pasta person but the pasta itself was truly delicious and fresh. The fish was outstanding and cooked perfectly as well.

*Fennel Dusted Halibut with Fennel Salad, Salsify Purée, Tomato Salsa, Mâche, Red Onion and Charred Scallion-Pancetta Vinaigrette - This was so beautifully done. The fish hardly required a fork it was so tender. There was such great flavor throughout. Another dish we were sad to finish!

*Blueberry peach cobbler with vanilla ice cream. - I was getting full but it truly was delicious. My date loved it and there was certainly nothing left!

The atmosphere is quite romantic both during the day while watching cable cars go by and during the evening while enjoying the warm glow of the terracota walls accented with chandeliers throughout. Just fabulous! Looking forward to my next visit!

Tip on parking: it is a drag but if you're having a tough time, there is parking just down the street on Hyde (in the same block on the same side) towards the water. It was $10 for 2 hours.
author: Mo O.

description:
OMG, savored every. single. bite. Butternut squash and mushroom risotto with truffle oil: to die for! Burrata appetizer is as good and creamy as it gets...Pork chop entree= delectable. Cannot go wrong if you order these dishes! The chicken was also yummy but I liked my pork chop better. They do always change the menu around but keep the main proteins and change the sauce/sides. 

A little pricey unless celebrating or out for a special occasion-- or when the parents are in town. ;) Worth every penny tho! Run, dont walk.
author: Sabrina S.

description:
I went here for my birthday - July 18th.  I enjoyed a 3 course meal with my wife and mother-in-law.  We arrived at 6:30pm on a Monday with only 3 tables seated.  Within 30 minutes the entire restaurant was full.

We began with wine by the glass and a cheese board.  The cheese board featured 4 cheeses, each paired with honey, nuts, apple, etc.  Each pairing was genius and created a combination better than the sum of the parts.

Between the 3 of us, we had a Sangiovese, Cabernet, and Zinfindel by the glass.  I found all 3 to be really average.  I would personally reccommend bringing a bottle from home and eating the corkage fee.  Additionally their wine menu seems to center around $40-$50 bottles, with the next step up being $100.  I'd like to see more options at more pricepoints.

For our second course, I had the bread salad and mushroom soup.  The bread salad was surprisingly tasty, but could have been a smaller portion.  The mushroom soup had a great mushroom flavor, but could have used a second dimension (truffles, etc.).

For the third course I had the gnocchi which was homemade in a beautifully naughty butter sauce.  My wife had the sweet corn risotto.  Both were total homeruns!  The cheese plates and the entrees are what made this so special.

Now for service, I am disappointed.  We put in the reservation that it was my birthday.  My mother-in-law also mentioned it to the waitress while I was in the bathroom - and they didn't even say happy birthday.  Kind of lame.  I am a grown man, but it would have been nice for at least some recognition - after all we dropped well over $200 on the tab.  

Food - 5/5
Ambiance - 4/5
Service - 4/5 (I will give them the benefit of the doubt)
Value - 3.5/5
author: Brian K.

description:
Maybe more of a 3 3/4?  I dunno...it was pretty good, but nothing wowing.  We came here for May Double Date Night.  We shared the foie gras, the octopus salad, the duck confit salad, and the carrot bisque.  The foie gras was good, but can you really mess that up?  The octopus salad was just ok in my opinion, but take that with a grain of salt too since I don't care for seafood.  The duck confit was a little too overwhelming with the blue cheese and the cherries and the spinach, and the duck.  Good, but a little too much.

I ordered the duck breast and it was cooked perfectly.  It came with spaetzle, which was a little too much and just kind of overtook the plate.  Maybe cut down on the spaetzle a little bit guys?  Just a teeny tiny bit?  My friend also felt the same, as he ordered the same dish. The boyfriend ordered the risotto...it was good, but nothing amazing, and our other friend ordered the pork and she seemed to enjoy it as well.  I also disagreed with the wine pairing that was given to me.  I had said I like spicy, and wanted a pinot to go with my duck...I've had fabulous luck in the past with such pairings.  The waiter insisted that I go with the zin instead.  It was lacking and I was not impressed and wished that I hadn't let him pick my wine for me.  Blah.

Dessert consisted of the sorbet and bread pudding.  We were given extra dessert because the waiter forgot to bring out a side we had ordered.  I really enjoyed the prickly pear sorbet, the guava was pretty good too.  The bread pudding was good, but kind of a throwaway too.  Overall, it was a good and decent meal.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: Fresh fettuccini with shrimp, clams, mussels, and calamari in an amazing basil pesto and citrus gremolata. Amazing! I am a sucker for fresh pasta but this place did everything right. I loved the atmosphere of this place. Very cozy and welcoming. If parking did not suck so much here, I would be back more often.
author: Schelly Y.

description:
I'll break this into two reviews that I can sum up as follows:  Food: very good, Service: Not so much

First, the service:  We had an early reservation at 5:45.  I understand that restaurants have a limited number of seats and need to turn their tables, but our waitress was just rude.  She was smarmy and bordered on annoying.  (long dark hair, older and dark thick black glasses).  We no sooner glanced at the menu, when she came over to take our orders.  I gave her the benefit of the doubt and hoped she was just being friendly.  3 minutes later the same thing.  When we finally are ready, she is obnoxious.  I ask her to tell me more about a dish and instead of describing it she looks at me and says "what do you want to know?"  I want to know what it tastes like!  That's why I asked.  You work here, and part of your job is to help me enjoy my visit by answering any questions I may have.  That's how you earn tips.  

The first course was served while my wife was in the bathroom; no-good.  The main came about 3 minutes after they cleared the plates from the first course.  We no sooner finished our mains than she was hocking us about our desert order.  The spoon hit the table and our check was in front of us.  I've never had a server do such a great job at ruining a meal with her terrible attitude and desire to kick us out the door.  1 star for service

Second, the food:  The wife started with a fig appetizer that was outstanding - baked figs stuffed with maytag bleu cheese, served w/ prosciutto balsamic glaze over bread.  This was a well thought out dish that was perfectly executed.  I had the foie gras torchon--another solid A+.  Main courses were also quite good.  I had duck served over spaetzle; the duck was cooked to perfection, and the setup was great.  The wife doesn't usually like duck that much and loved it.  She had a branzino that was good, but not my favorite.  It wasn't bad, but something in their tasted a little odd.  She didn't love it either.  For dessert we had chocolate bread pudding w vanilla ice  cream.  I'm not sure if it was bread pudding or just warm chocolate cake, but it was divine.  All in all, I'd give the food a solid 4 stars, maybe even 4.5.  

Dear Frescati:  Keep the chef, replace the waitress.
author: Chad K.

description: I wish I could remember our servers name ,she was fantastic. We had the gnocchi, octopus salad, pork chop and duck breast. All fantastic. Octopus salad could've used a little more orange to balance the flavors, two segments wasn't enough for the large portion.
author: Michael H.

description:
Second visit in two weeks.  Inviting bistro with lovely, friendly service. Lucky to find parking both time altough that might be an issue as this is a neighborhood destination.  Imagine that if we lived in the neighborhood, Frascati would be our weekly dinner spot.

The courses are seasonly influenced...... I ordered the same starter and entree both times.  Only issue was  at the second visit the starter lacked enough citrus for my taste although not enough for me to not clean my plate.

Roasted Artichoke Salad with Arugula, Toasted Pistachios, Spring Onions, Fava Beans, Ricotta and Citrus Vinaigrette.

Fresh Cappelini Puttanesca 
with Tiger Prawns, Anchovy, Capers, Roasted Tomato and Herb Bread Crumbs

Was taken back that they serve Foie Gras given the current chef debate about animal cruelty.  Not a debate I am waying in on given the many other local and national challenges we have. This lovely restaurant has plenty to offer for everyone.
author: Barbara W.

description:
Frascati will not disappoint - provided you can get a reservation!

Friendly service, welcoming atmosphere & great food.  

Also a good date place!
author: Kelly C.

description:
Great service. 

Outstanding food. 

The gnocchi is.... heavenly. 

The filet was melty yummy deliciousness....

Yummm.....
author: Jodie B.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE

Its just another over priced and over hyped "gourmet" restaurant.  We eat a lot of gourmet meals from top of the line chefs and the one thing where many fail is by not appealing to a wider palate. 

Their cheese selection was horrendous. I have a rule: dont eat stinky cheese.  The steak tartare was beyond bland. Thank goodness for the $12 salad with croutons and the bread with olive oil and basalmic dressing. We skipped the entrees and have no regrets.

Won't return.
author: Randy S.

description:
Came here on a walk-in, and didn't expect much, but I was pretty impressed with the overall dinner experience.

For apps, I had a steak tartare and mushroom bruschetta.  The steak tartare was decent, not great, and a bit smaller than I expected.  The bruschetta was awesome, though I will admit to having a mushroom fetish (more than) occasionally.

For the main courses, I had the maple leaf duck breast and the lamb sausage tagliatelle.  The duck was ok - the meat came in 4 large pieces which were tender and a good amount of chewy, but weren't that flavorful.  The tagliatelle was easily the best dish of the night - both the meat and pasta were excellent.

For dessert, I had the warm bread pudding - a solid dessert, but again, nothing to write home about.
author: Josh Q.

description:
This place was amazing. Great service (attentive but not sycophantic), incredible food (get the steak, get the steak!!) and nice atmosphere without being horribly loud. Seating on the balcony with a view of the kitchen is really nice if you get the option when booking.

Only thing (just FYI and nothing to do with the restaurant) is that parking is a pain in the behind. Drove round and round with no luck and ended up parking illegally...apparently (don't shoot the messenger if this isn't true!) the traffic wardens stop operating at 8pm ...so a later dinner reservation might be safer!!
author: Faith S.

description:
I live 1 block away and took my fiancée here for her birthday. We have always walked past this place and wondered what it was like. We used to live in Napa and thus know good Italian food but at hefty prices.
I ordered the fish. I had to send it back because it was massively undercooked. To be fair they did comp the dessert but for the price the whole meal was very satisfactory. Walk an extra 50 yards to Amarena around the corner for proper Italian food which is cooked all the way through. Amarena has a better atmosphere, service staff that smile, and glorious food. Frascati staff can find my name circa May 12th, 2012 if they wish to contact me.
author: Nicholas H.

description:
It is shameful that it took us nearly 2 years before returning - shameful!

Frascati is excellent in every way and never disappoint.  Service was friendly and attentive.  Great ambiance, it's always charming to hear the cable car goes by.  They are not snobby so dress up or down - hubby was in shorts and polo, some were in tees and jeans, some in suits and dresses.  

What we had this time:
A bottle of Spanish red - medium body, nice flavor and a hint of spice

sauteed calamari and scallops over a frisee salad - the calamari and scallop were cooked perfectly and just slightly seasoned for the perfect starter

watermelon salad w/ crumbles of cheese, pistachio nuts, finely cut mint leaves and dots of thick balsalmic vinegar?  the watermelon wedges are so sweet and the mint really made it a refreshing salad that prep your appetite for the delicious food to come.

rack of lamb with watercress salad and a tower of eggplants - the lamb was SO tender and flavorful, it's the best lamb we've had for a long long time - every piece was savored

homemade fettucini in pesto sauce w/ mussels, clams, chunks of tiger prawns, capers and topped with tasty toasted breadcrumbs adding a nice texture.  al dente, piping hot and delicious!

last but definitely not least, what I consider a MUST HAVE (I actually asked the waiter if this was still on their dessert menu before I ordered) - the black and white chocolate bread pudding.  This is to die for, which explains why I finished the very last bite even though my stomach was about to explode.  Imagine a large slice of dark, gooey, chewy brownie/cake with a large scoop of hazelnut ice-cream  topped with a piece of dark chocolate.  

hubby also had a decaf cappucino and it was really delicious - so delicious that hubby asked the lady who prepared it what she used and learned that it was Peet's Espresso Forte.  

LOVE it!
author: Gloria H.

description: One of the best parts of Frascati is the service, but the menu is a close 2nd!  We tried the Halibut and both of us really enjoyed it.
author: sterling p.

description: Once again...Frascati nails it. There's something to be said about a place where you can walk in, alone, get treated like a king/queen on a weeknight, like it was your last meal. Bravo.
author: Jill S.

description:
My review is going to be repetitive of what every other yelper said but just to reiterate... 

This mediterranean style bistro has a beautiful ambiance with chandeliers, a small open kitchen, a short bar, and a mezzanine overlooking the first floor.. Diners enjoy delectable meals while pedestrians and cable cars pass by outside.. Can you spell seductive? ;)

The gnocchi (has lots of small corn, peas, diced tomatoes; beware) but is delicious. The gnocchi itself was cooked perfectly and the sauce it sits in (comprised of white truffle oil, yum) was so good you have to continue dipping your bread in it after finishing the dish.  

The Maple Leaf Duck Breast is a must try. 

The Cappelini Puttanesca is good due to the high caliber of the restaurant, however, I was surprised that the dish was both slightly spicy and very seafood-y. I would probably go with a different dish next time.

Lastly, the CHOCOLATE BREAD PUDDING is to die for. Even my boyfriend who very rarely likes dessert (I don't know how we get along :p) couldn't stop saying "This is so good. This is so good."

Sooo.. Because the restaurant had excellent service, atmosphere, and food, I am giving it 5 stars, although if I could I would probably rate a 4.5 or so.
author: Allie E.

description: Great little place in a good location. Small and intimate setting makes for a great date night. All of the dishes were incredibly tasty, especially the black and white bread pudding! Fair prices for the quality that you get. We will definitely be back soon!
author: Charlie T.

description:
We had a fabulous dinner at Frascati the other night.  

Recommendations - 
*Cheese plate to start
*Pork chop - the best ever! 
*Scoop of Smores ice cream 

We hope to go again when back in the neighborhood.
author: Sarina H.

description:
Rating based on strange and rude service.

I have lived in SF for a year and dined at 115 restaurants.  I rely on Yelp comments and pictures to help me choose where to go, since there are so many places out there. There are only so many weekends, and going out to a nice dinner is my favorite way to spend a Saturday night.

That being said, I rarely leave my own reviews, but am offering nothing but honesty with this one because it had to be said.  So, if you are like me, reading this review and deciding where to dine:  Choose somewhere other than Frascati.

Is it an intimate and cozy setting?  Yes.  Is the food good?  Yes.  HOWEVER ... bad service can ruin your meal.

My husband and I had TERRIBLE service at Frascati last night during our dinner.  We were rushed, treated as though we were not welcome and then essentially ignored by our waitress.  We are polite, clean, nice people, who had spent $100 on wine and appetizers within the first five minutes of sitting down.  But because it was a Saturday night our waitress wanted us to order everything else at once, or not at all, and we weren't sure what we wanted for our entrees yet, so just wanted to eat another appetizer while deciding.  Apparently, not allowed.  There were open tables and it didn't look that busy.  While this doesn't seem like a big deal, it was shocking to be told what you MUST do by a waitress while dining out.  She sent someone else over to our table who tried to rush us along as well.  When we asked for the manager, he was just the same -- dismissive and rushed, saying the kitchen prefers complete orders only.  Because of this, we decided to ask for our check and leave before getting entrees.  Who wants to sit at a restaurant where you are made to feel unwelcome, which is apparently a policy confirmed by management.  

With thousands of places to eat in San Francisco, and many good options within the Russian Hill neighborhood, don't waste a night on a place where people have reported bad service because it could happen to you.
author: Ashley P.

description: We live really close to this place and have been wanting to try it out. Finally we got a reservation and got to try there yummy food. We both got the pork chop and I liked it but I didn't finish the entire plate because the chops had a nice portion of fat on it. Which I do not care for. You just have to cut around it. I wish they would have given up a better seat. I really wished I could of sat upstairs. Oh well, next time.
author: Jess O.

description: When you find yourself trying not to get chicken at a restaurant. Do not resist at this place. The chicken here is cooked to perfection. Gnocchi as a starter was simple and yummy. Wine was paired perfectly. Dessert was good but I should have tried the Panna cotta. It looked yummy.
author: Maey P.

description:
I found Frascati via yelp when looking for a nice place to dine while in San Fran without having to wash dishes at the end of the night. 

Frascati was perfect, it was a quiet and intimate atmosphere with attentive service. I would definitely recommend Frascati to couples celebrating a birthday or anniversary. 

For our appetizer we had the Russet Potato Gnocchi, which was so good we used all of our bread to mop up the leftover sauce from the dish. For my entree I had the Half Roasted Chicken, which was absolutely perfect. The chicken was juicy and the sauce was flavorful, but not heavy. My mom had the Pork chop, which had to be sent back because it was quite raw in the center. Regardless, when the dish was brought back it was delicious and we ate every bite. 

I would go back to Frascati for a romantic evening with a special person.
author: Leah P.

description: We just walked in on a Saturday and got seated. The cable car stops right there which makes a great start on the SanFrancisco experience and ambience. We had the best service during the whole night. The cheese platter had Epoisses on it, my favorite cheese in the world, so I had to order it. The Sardines were not great so my husband was at first disappointed. But then the main course came and the Maple Leaf Duck Breast was incredible and so was the Pan Seared Bass they had that day. We found a very good bottle of wine as well. We wished we had room for dessert especially their bread pudding which looked so yummy but we just couldn't. I would highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Carol M.

description:
Let me begin by saying the atmosphere is fantastic.

Unfortunately the food is not.

My date and I shared the Sardines and the bread salad to start. I don't know what to say about the sardines but they just weren't very good. The bread salad was not really what I was expecting, a lot of lettuce and not much else, though the dressing was good.

For the mains, I got the pork chop and my date had the sea food putanesca. While the pork chop was decent (though under cooked) the putanesca was horrendous. The sauce tasted like it had come out of a can and the pasta was overdone. The dish actually gave my date a stomach ache.

I wouldn't go again, and if I were you I'd try another restaurant.
author: David H.

description:
Great place and great menu from top to bottom it was a good choice to go there
We had the duck and the Rib Eye go with the Duck it was my mistake to order steak in a place like that but I'm not holding it against them

Service was spot on time and very attentive and dessert was out of this world

Go see
author: Zil M.

description:
Tiniest place EVAR!!!! NEVER come on a Friday (especially after 8pm). It's horrendous trying to look for parking around the area. My friend booked this place, so we came. We got seated upstairs in the corner right where you come up the stairs. Sitting up there sort of reminded me of ron weasley's house. I was ready to bolt if I heard something squeak. Of course it didn't.

I started off with the figs wrapped with prosciutto. It wasn't as ripe as I thought it would be biting into it. It didn't give off that sweetness. I also got to taste the gnocchi with mushrooms, which was pretty tasty. Pretty salty. Next round included pork chops, duck breast, and roasted chicken. As everyone has said, the pork chops is pretty good. I could tell it's been in a brine ... a bit salty. The duck and chicken were cooked really well, but also pretty salty. The meat was tender and juicy though.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Problemo numero uno: my expectations were WAY too high

Problem number two: I was responsible for choosing this restaurant for Valentine's dinner because of those overly-high expectations

Problem number three: my bf's fish had almost no taste (though the sides it came with were good - pureed cauliflower, etc)

Problem number four: the pasta I ordered was very good but I felt bad that I had such a better dish than he did (I shared, of course!)

However, there were definitely some plus's too...

Plus number one: the atmosphere is very clean, simple, and relaxing

Plus number two: the table bread with olive oil was delicious

Plus number three: the special cioppini was pretty good though not totally amazing as an appetizer for us to split

Plus number four: I do trust my friends that have told me they love Frascati so maybe I will go back sometime but find out what they order first!
author: Meghan P.

description:
I had been dying to get to this place for awhile since it is just a few blocks from where I live, but I avoided it due to the price.  I usually only go to a few of these types of places a year.  I finally got the opportunity when my parents came into town for my birthday (hey I did let them stay at my place for several weeks!).  

I had huge expectations after reading the reviews and this place delivered.  I'm happy to say it was the best meal I've had in the two years since I moved to SF.  I'm a big fan of tuna tartare and it was delicious here.  The serrano chilis were a perfect touch.   For a main, I ordered some type of skillet steak dish served over an heirloom salad.  It was amazing and I was blown away.  I had to force myself to slow down and enjoy it.  I tried the duck and pork chop too and both were excellent.

We had to try to bread pudding too.  It was very good, but I was expecting a little better after reading the reviews here.  This place is awesome and I will definitely come back if I have a big date sometime, although it will probably be awhile they way things are going now.  

And thanks to parents for making this review possible :)
author: Paul W.

description:
Pros:
Excellent mediterranean food.  Anything with cheese, truffles, or pasta in it here is outstanding, and the wine pairings are great too.

Cons:
Hard to park in this neighborhood, so take a taxi!

Fun:
Any street with a cable car running down it and a European feel makes for amazing ambiance.  This stretch of Hyde Street is one of the most charming in San Francisco, and at Frascati they have some of the best food to match.
author: Mike G.

description: I love, love, love this restaurant! The staff is amazing and so very sweet. The food is perfect and the wine list is great. It is just the perfect SF neighborhood restaurant.
author: Candace C.

description:
Actually left this place thinking that I might die of fullness, but I couldn't contain myself around Frascati's unbelievably delicious food. Called Saturday around 3pm and easily booked a reservation for that night.  Were immediately seated by a very friendly gentleman upon our arrival, and were invited to choose upstairs or downstairs for our table for three.  We chose upstairs, which was very cozy and quiet. Frascati's overall ambiance is romantic and relaxed, with dim lighting and close tables. Nothing to go crazy for, but definitely pleasant and comfortable. 

BUT THE FOOD! I honestly cannot remember the last time I had this good of a meal. Our waitress was very helpful and attentive, and provided some helpful advice that led us to order the mushroom bruschetta, two orders of the pork chop, a swordfish, a side of brussels sprouts, and to top it off a vanilla bean panna cotta with carmel and bananas. INCREDIBLE! Everything just kept getting better and better (hence my eventual food coma). The mushroom bruschetta was great, overloaded with toppings including goat cheese and pancetta, but not too messy. It did only come with two pieces though, so I would recommend to share between two people, cutting them for three was a little awkward. The side of brussels sprouts was a great twist on the vegetable--an addition of capers gave it a little something special. I don't like fish so I didn't get to personally try the swordfish (though my Dad loved it) but hands down the best pork chop I've had in my life, or at least since I can remember.  The sauce made it absolutely mouthwatering, and the side yukon gold potatoes with bacon vinaigrette provided the perfect complement. I couldn't take a bite without talking about how great it was! The other items on the menu also sounded great, but I really don't think I could ever order any other entree after experiencing this pork chop! The night was complete with the most delicious dessert- a perfectly sized panna cotta with a side drizzle of carmel and sliced bananas. Again, just amazing! They even brought it out with a candle since it was my birthday!

I could not have left this place happier, or more stuffed full of deliciousness, and would hands down recommend this restaurant for any occasion.
author: Julia P.

description: Highly recommend the Duck Confit Salad!! As an entree I had the seafood risotto and loved it! Everybody at the table was impressed. For the chocolate loves- the white and black bread pudding is a must!
author: Ani C.

description:
It was good, service was great.

Duck breast was very interesting, it was almost like a duck steak.

I had a terrible time trying to find parking though, and ended up parking like 5 blocks away.
author: Wynn C.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurant in SF. 

Outstanding food and service. Love their Pork chops, best I've had so far. 

Will definitely stop by again when I'm in town.
author: Scotty I.

description: Came here with family to celebrate a birthday. It was amazing.  Don't remember the specifics but I highly, highly recommend this place. Service was attentive and efficient.  Food was excellent. I would definitely come back. That's endorsement enough!!
author: Steven D.

description:
Great service

Loved the risotto and watermelon salad

Would def come back again
author: Cece L.

description:
