ENTREES:  My boyfriend ordered the pork chop and O.M.G....heaven on a plate!  The chop was grilled to perfection and the flavors were exceptional.  He had the winning dish for sure!  I ordered the filet mignon, which was great quality, but lacking a bit of flavor as compared to the pork chop.  Great veggies and potatoes served on the side.  But don't mess around, seriously...just GET THE FREAKIN PORK CHOP!!!

DESSERT:  The chocolate bread pudding is amazing, we have had it before, but this time we were pretty full after inhaling our food.  Of course I have a sweet tooth, so I still wanted to order dessert regardless of being so full.  But the bf isn't much of a dessert guy, and I couldn't do it alone, so we (sadly) told Angela we would pass.  Of course, minutes later, Angela brings us a scoop of their homemade (and delicious obviously) chocolate ice cream with a candle for my boyfriend's birthday.  She said she couldn't let us leave without something sweet...again, she was the best.

Bummed they are already booked for Valentine's day this year...because we wanna go back as soon as we have another excuse for a nice dinner!
author: Sandra M.

description:
Frascati is a small restaurant located at the corner of Hyde & Green.   Tables are placed very close together and the room gets noisy when full. Try to get one of the 2 window tables (one for 4 and one for 2) which provide a quieter and more intimate setting. 

Food was good but not great; inconsistent flavors and seasoning. The potato gnochi was recommended for an appetizer. It was ok but had an overly strong garlic flavor. On the other hand, the red pepper soup lacked flavor and seasoning; could hardly taste any red pepper at all. The deboned roast chicken, which was also recommended, was juicy and tender but the dish was too salty. So, not that impressed w/the food.   Service was good; plates delivered and picked up promptly and water glasses refilled w/o asking.

Street parking in the area (if you know it) is virtually impossible to find. Valet parking is not offered, but there is a private garage available about 1/2 up the block.   

I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again but, if you're in the area or can take the cable car or Muni there, it's a nice place to eat.  Don't think it deserves the 4-5 star reviews that other people have posted but you should have an acceptable meal here nonetheless.

If it's open, make sure to stop at Swenson's for an ice cream cone at the corner of Union and Hyde.  It's the "original" Swensons and has been at this location for over 60 years.  I use to climb up the hill from Helen Wills Playground (at Broadway & Larkin) in the summer to eat ice cream there as a kid and it was great stopping there for some ice cream again last night.
author: Martin C.

description:
I loved this restaurant experience.

Frascati is a small, warm, neighborhood restaurant with excellent food and service. The only knock is the difficult street parking (not unusual in SF!, but more challenging than a lot of areas, I would say).

The style is California cuisine-ish. However, I must mention that what is not California cuisine-ish are the portion sizes. Often I feel that the serving sizes at some chi-chi places are a little chintzy. NOT so at Frascati. You get a good serving size of whatever you are ordering, from starters to dessert, and particularly, the entrees. 

I enjoyed the mushroom bruschetta (give me more!), and the fresh pasta (I forgot the Italian name of the pasta form) in cream sauce. Very tasty. Someone else had another pasta (different sauce) and that was very good as well. Others enjoyed their duck breast and pork chop. 

The dessert of chocolate bread pudding was okay, a little dry for my taste. But the apple cobbler was very good. 

The service was great and attentive, very helpful answering menu questions. 

Prices are typical for this type of restaurant and well worth it: mostly mid- to upper-20s for entrees and low teens for starters. The wine list is varied and not too long. I ordered a nice Spanish garnacha blend which went well with everything.
author: Shan H.

description:
These folks are victims of Yelp*

I, like so many others read the Yelp reviews and learned how good the pork chops and bread pudding were and went there for that.  The pork chop was delicious but my date expected a more traditional, high quality, bread pudding with some chocolate but got bowled over by the intense chocolate and couldn't eat it.  They did remove it from the bill and were very nice and concerned about it.

Since they seemed so concerned so I brought up the pork chop issue.  The lady I spoke with was genuinely pleased that so many people came for their great pork chops but didn't seem to realize that a lot of the popularity was from the rave reviews on Yelp!   It's an interesting trap to be in.  They certainly don't want to become a "one dish" restaurant but more newbies than not are likely to order the pork chop and bread pudding after reading these Yelp*reviews.  I'll admit, I'll be hard pressed to not order the chop next time but I'm sure it's not the only thing that's good there.  Read all the reviews.

Location was interesting.  Atmosphere was very nice.  Prices matched the venue.

For desert I had a Swenson's licorice ice cream at the other end of the block up the hill.  Fabulously good.  (Warning!  I'm guessing they only have it with the pumpkin at this time of year - Halloween.)
author: David U.

description: WOW! let's just say i'm thoroughly impressed by frascati.  dare i say they are the epitome of how dining out should be in sf...yep i said it and i meant every word.  we were about one hour early for our reservation(yes, one full hour) and thought, what the heck, let's see if they'll seat us.  the guy in charge, john, was so accommodating and actually sat us!  it was our lucky day!  we ordered the cheese plate, gnocchi, octopus salad, him the pork chop, and me the halibut.  i could not find fault in any one of our dishes.  seriously.  gnocchi was so soft and fluffy.  the accompanying sauce was delicious.  octopus was amazing.  cheese plate, well you can't go wrong with cheese.  one word to describe my halibut would be perfection.  the meat was flaky and fresh and juicy and just everything you look for in a piece of cooked fish.  my boyfriend's pork chop was really something.  not at all tough or dry, it was in his words way better than the chop they serve at nopa.  we finished off the night with their black and white bread pudding and basil cheesecake.  needless to say i was a full and happy camper by the end of dinner.
author: Melissa Y.

description: I had two meals here in the past 4 years; one was several years ago and my boyfriend at the time and I walked in, and it was a weeknight in winter so it wasn't terribly busy and Frascati KILLED IT. The second time was New Year's Eve 2014/2015 with my new boyfriend and the menu was fixed, and it was delicious and wonderful. The only issue was that I ordered the steak and he ordered the salmon, but we ordered the exact same appetizers and I got larger portions of lobster, etc on my plate. I think it was just dumb luck, but my boyfriend was put-off and assumed it was a conspiracy by the chef because he thought the chef assumed a man would order the steak, and thus sent ME the larger portions. I think that the waiter obviously would hand us the plates at random, and it was luck that my lobster salad had 1.5x as much lobster in it. So yeah the consistency was off but it didn't bother me! (Don't worry I gave some pieces of lobster to my boyfriend). The dessert was too huge, though. We were overly stuffed for the dance party later but that's not Frascati's fault.
author: Valerie W.

description:
Imagine: girl and guy on a romantic date together. They peer into each others' eyes, holding hands. The cable cars' bells ring outside as it passes by this cute, cozy restaurant in the heart of Russian Hill in San Francisco.

No, it's not just in movies. This could be you.

Frascati oozes romance. It is not only located in a prime neighborhood, it serves up delicious food without breaking the bank. 

You must get:
1) Duck Confit Salad - so amazing!!! It was a party in my mouth at first bite.
2) Russet Potato Gnocchi - Melts in your mouth. I loved it and I don't even like gnocchi.
3) Roasted Chicken - juicy.

People rave about these:
1) Maple Leaf Duck Breast: cooked medium rare so it was a bit chewy. My friend loved it. I thought it was okay. I didn't think it was flavorful enough.
2) Warm Black & White Chocolate Bread Pudding: must share because it's too big for one person to eat. It was okay.

Still thinking about that Duck Confit Salad. YUM!
author: Tina T.

description: Epic!  Went with a large party for a friends birthday and had a wonderful time.  The food was delicious, the staff fun and friendly while remaining attentive and the manager, Justin, was very knowledgeable about their wine offerings.  I couldn't have been more pleased!
author: Jeff S.

description: Loved this cute little restaurant. Not the easiest to get a reservation but it is well worth it. I had a great chicken dish and a delicious bread salad which is big enough for a few people.
author: Jaclyn B.

description:
Came here last week on our first of many "date" nights. haha. Loved absolutely everything!

We had the following:

- Russet Potato Gnocchi with Melted Leeks, Thyme, Diced Tomatoes, English Peas, Asparagus and White Truffle Oil
- Maple Leaf Duck Breast with Herb Spaetzle, Hearts of Palm Salad, Arugula, Scallions and Huckleberry Sauce
- Cioppino with Saffron-Tomato Broth, Tiger Prawns, Bass, Dungeness Crab and Fregola

I typically don't like gnocchis because they're usually too heavy tasting. But these were pretty good. Great flavor. The duck was cooked perfectly and the meat was juicy and tender. The cioppino had an awesome sauce that I used all of the bread to soak and munch on even after I finished the dish. Didn't want a single drop to go to waste. haha.

For dessert we had:

- Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta Caramelized Bananas and Almond Roca
- Warm Black and White Chocolate Bread Pudding Hazelnut Ice Cream, Caramel and Chocolate Sauce

I've gotta say the panna cotta was an overkill. The chocolate bread pudding was soooooooo good that it just out shined anything other desserts. It's to die for seriously. I would come back just to eat that!
author: Cynthia C.

description: Our second night in San Francisco we at here. The food was excellent. I would particularly recommend the Burrata as a starter and the Hangar steak as an entree. My wife and I both enjoyed our meals, but we were also very impressed with the personal attention given to us by our waitress as well as the owner of the restaurant. As out of towners we felt as though we were treated as long time regulars of the restaurant. Our glasses were never empty for long and the attention to detail to food preparation and flavors was truly exceptional. I highly recommend this restaurant
author: Brian F.

description: The truffle gnocchi was dressed in the best sauce I've ever had with gnocchi; not too overpowering that it drowns out the gnocchi, but definitely very flavorful. The beet salad was definitely colorful though I expected it to have more greens and be more of a salad rather than mostly beets. The scallops were huuuuge and succulent, lighly browned and paired with a vanilla sauce, which wasn't too sweet. Frascati is definitely a great find and has a relaxed, classy atmosphere.
author: Kelly N.

description:
Amazing, simply the best!

Took my husband here last night for his birthday after walking by here and seeing it was so popular for the last six months. We were not disappointed! Everything from the service, the wine, to of course the delicious food were great! 

My dietary restrictions can be hard at restaurants but they were incredibly accommodating. It was amazing. The highlights of the meal were the Tartar with the spicy drizzle, and the scallops entree. They also cooked my filet perfectly rare like I like it and the server made sure to recommend some of his favorite dishes. 

No more looking for excuses to come to Frascati, the food and service is worth the price. They serve best neighborhood Italian food! The ambiance makes it a great date restaurant as well.
author: Natalie N.

description:
On our first night living in SF (6.5 years ago), my wife and I walked out of our drab corporate housing and randomly walked into Frascati. We sat at the bar with two 75+ plus year old regulars (both lifetime sf residents) and the former owner behind the bar. The food was fantastic and the conversation was just as good. It was a great introduction to the city. 
I was skeptical and disappointed when the Wood's sold, but to my surprise new ownership maintained the high standards. The best part was that our favorite dishes were still on the menu (the bread salad and the seasonal gnocchi).  
Frascati is still a special occasion place for us and will always be a sentimental favorite.
author: pablo e.

description:
Oh my yum!! Talk about a perfect dinner. Visited this place with co-workers after a long hard day and everthing co-operated.
 
It was a hot day in SF (yes you read that right :)) so we sat outside. Talk about the perfect dinner( yes I said it again :))

Everything we ordered was excellent and I could almost smell the Italian sun ripening the tomatoes :)
author: Teju A.

description: Excellent ambiance, classy but not pretentious ... very good to excellent food at reasonable (for SF) prices.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
I have heard this place is great from many of my friends and finally ate here recently. The gnocchi w truffle oil was fantastic, Salmon cooked to perfection, and black and white bread pudding dessert was amazing!

Wine list was also great. Also, not a late restaurant in case you want to hang around past 10:30.

Great neighborhood spot, and I would definitely go back.
author: Jordana C.

description:
This place is so cute! Frascati is definitely a gem of Russian Hill.  The restaurant is on the corner and it's not very noticeable unless you're in the neighborhood. It's quite small inside but luckily there is a couple tables upstairs.  BFF and I were seated upstairs (by request) so that we can chat.  If you're seated downstairs be prepared to be elbow-to-elbow with the fellow patron.

Ok on to the food.  We had:

Appetizer:
Foie Gras w/ apple currant compote- delicious!!! Good portion with two pieces of toasted bread (brioche).  The texture is mousse like and I love how the sweetness of the compote compliments the flavor of the foie gras.  The waiter also suggested sweet wine with our foie gras and that definitely added to the party in the mouth.  After we polished off the Brioche I just started spreading it on my table bread.  Yum!

Pan Seared Quail Risotto - Portion is huge! The quail was delicious. Very juciy and had quite a bit of meat on it.  The risotto was interesting. Definitely way too much food for me.  I finished about half of it before I was completely stuffed. The risotto rice is larger than i'm use to.  I also thought it was a bit on the saltier side. Other than that great flavors all around.

Maple Leaf Duck Breast - Two large pieces of duck! Super yummy and I love how tender the meat is.  My friend enjoyed it very much.

For dessert I ordered the chocolate mint ice cream. OMG it was really good. Tasted exactly like eating a mint leaf.  I love mint so the extra potent mint flavor was an extra plus for me.  Also there were large chocolate chips in there too.  My friend had the sorbet and it was also very excellent. Very light and very refreshing.

The wine selection wasn't too bad also.  Wish they had half bottles though. 

Service is excellent too!

Highly recommend for an intimate date (ask to be seated upstairs) or dinner with friends (max 6 people)!
author: Terry D.

description: The food was mediocre, presentation was bad. Nothing special with the service/ambiance. Took us 45min to find parking. Definitely not coming back.
author: Nikki M.

description:
Love love love love LOVE!!!!!!!!

I am not one for hyperbole but Frascati is a MUST. I first heard about it in 2004 when, as a starry-eyed tourist on the cable car, we passed by the place and the cable car operator told me he highly recommends it. 

Fast forward to 2007 - I finally booked a table for dinner with my then bf - we shared the bread salad and a few longing glances. My love for Frascati stayed - the boyfriend didn't.

My life drew me back to San Francisco in 2010 and we happened upon Frascati when my friend's birthday dinner got turned away elsewhere. I didn't think they would be able to accommodate me but **Miracles of miracles!** They were able to seat all six of us on a table upstairs and they treated us like kings. I returned for another meal with the new bf and another friend and service has always been amazing.

The menu changes seasonally but I have tried:

the potato gnocchi - melt in your mouth and delicious with a delectable hint of truffle oil
The mushroom bruschetta - the roasted shallots and the arugula brought out the hearty flavors of the roasted mushrooms
The foie gras torchon - it was typical foie gras flavors but I would say I've tasted better torchon

The roasted half chicken - full of chicken flavor and tender both for the white meat and the dark meat - seriously my favorite chicken dish by far (and yes I am a picky chicken eater)
Short ribs - they had a special and the short ribs were succulent and fell of the bone. 
Duck breast - I love duck and frascati does an amazing duck here. I still don't know what huckleberry sauce is but I know that the tartness perfectly complements the duck.
Papardelle with wild boar - it has a slight kick to it but I am willing to overlook the spiciness because it was THAT good.

If you were to have one meal in San Francisco, come to Frascati. The service is great, the wine list is superb and the food is to die for.
author: Karen K.

description: The watermelon salad was a sublimely refreshing late-summer appetizer, and the tagliatelle with pork sausage was so delicate and was perfectly just-spicy-enough. The wine list is superb, and Justin recommended some excellent wine pairings. I wish I'd had room for dessert. I might have left my heart here...
author: michele v.

description:
Amazing food and place!!! Loved every penny of it!! 
Staff is excellent there. Unfortunately they spilled the glass of wine of my girlfriend's, but in the end they offered us free desert, coffee and a bottle of Moschato D' Asti!!! 

Definitely going back!!
author: Nikos D.

description:
We left a tad disappointed as we had high expectations given the rave reviews on this site. Maybe it had something to do with not ordering any of the dishes that the waiter had recommended (we weren't feeling pork chop, duck breast, filet mignon, or the halibut, for various reasons). 

The wines we ordered by the glass were great - the pinot and the syrah. 

The olive oil that accompanied the bread was excellent.

Burrata - 3 stars
Sea bass - 3.5 stars my partner thought it was overcooked. I thought it tasted fine.
Risotto - 3.5 stars. Maybe a bit too mushy. There wasnt too much italian sausage, which i preferred, but others may be bothered by this.
Bread pudding - by far the standout dish of the evening. it was outstanding. 

There are similarly-priced restaurants more to like our liking so we probably won't return.
author: j d.

description:
They say third time is the charm...I had intended to eat here two other times and things got in the way so this time I was determined and they knew my name so I didn't want to be blacklisted from this place.  

It was a date so our intent was to have a great meal and great atmosphere.  We called to push back our reservation by half an hour and they said that was no problem.  We got to the restaurant and were seated right away, no waiting like some places make you do because they didn't plan accordingly and it turns out that someone is still eating at the table that's supposed to be yours.  None of this here.

We had water brought right away and our waiter stopped by and told us what he thought were some great dishes.  We then proceded to make our choices on food and wine.  The couple next to us had both of the fish dishes and while they looked great, somehow they didn't quite do it for either one of us, I think we were in a  meat sort of mood.   So we ordered the foi gras and risotto and then the lamb and pork chop for the entres.  The food was absolutely great, everything was fresh, well prepared, very flavorful and came out at the perfect pace.  I usually never order pork but it was great, very lean and flavored with apples and figgs.  We then ended the meal with the espresso ice cream dessert.  Even though we were both full, we couldn't resist.   The desserts looked too good and we both have a sweet tooth, plus we figured we could go for a nice walk after in Russian Hill.

So that's for the food, the date went great as well, the little neighborhood restaurant just kept us totaly relaxed, happy and talking the whole night long.  When we got there it was completely full, upon leaving only a few tables remained.    It's a great spot for dates, friends or dinner with the family.

I would definately come back to try the other dishes and I love Hyde St, away from the noise and hussle of Polk.  But be were, you should cab it, there is no valet and no parking to speak of.  Incidentally the 2nd time I didn't eat at this place was due to parking issues, well lack there of.
author: Inga W.

description:
Seating = excellent; Service = Very good; Food = Hit and Miss
Nice, elegant neighborhood style restaurant. We made last minute reservations in November 2010 and were accommodated, which was more than we could have asked for. Although we arrived later than we had indicated, we were promptly seated. My husband ordered the tomato bisque and I ordered a seafood and pasta dish. The fresh baked bread was very good. I also had the bread salad, which was very good (would recommend). My husband's tomato bisque tasted like Campbell's tomato soup out of the can. It was absolutely horrible, especially for $10. My seafood entree was very good (would recommend). We did not have dessert. On my next visit to SF, I will try some other places.
author: C J.

description:
It's a cute place with good service and pretty good food.

The food is a bit hit and miss, some dishes were excellent while some was pretty Meh. The best thing was the hazelnut ice-cream, by far!

But, people, romantic? Really? Why? Because it's dimly lit? It is crowded and fairly noisy, not very romantic at all.
author: Maggie X.

description:
We came last night expecting typical Italian fare. I guess because on Yelp it is saved as an Italian restaurant. So we were only disappointed with that and that isn't the restaurants fault. Once we got over it....our meal was very nice. The grilled bad salad and the chicken were the standouts at our table. The cheese plate was also delish. Service was pleasant and neither too much or too little. 
P.S. there is a small parking garage two doors down!
author: Cassie P.

description: 2.5 Pretty place with very good service.  The food was not that good.  Ordered the foie gras and expected pieces of foie gras....received pate that honestly tasted like Oscar Meyer liver sausage.  They were very nice to swap it out for sardines The sardines were just ok...nothing I would order again.  The maple leaf duck breast was "interesting" The pieces of duck were perfectly cooked. The herbed spaetzle tasted....bad....(I'm sure there are others who think it's just wonderful.)  The pappardelle was blah.  The pan seared fillet was very good.  The standout of the meal was a berry sorbet...incredibly delicious ....made in house.
author: Bleep S.

description:
I was slightly disappointed given that it was a special day and I paid for a meal that I thought was only worth a mere 3 stars.  You can't blame me for having such high expectations considering it was my SO's birthday who is none other than the bangin' hot Randy T.

We booked reservations through Open Table and specified that it was a birthday dinner. They kindly seated us in a cozy and intimate corner situated away from the dining crowd. How thoughtful.

We both enjoyed our appetizers but I honestly would have preferred his octopus salad over my salty foie gras. I had to ask for more bread to balance out the saltiness of the foie gras. My duck entree came with 2 pieces. One piece was cooked just perfectly, tender and medium rare. The other piece however, was more of a medium thus I spent most of the time trying to chew it into a digestible form. Docked a star for inconsistency. The SO wasn't blown away by this halibut either.

My panna cotta dessert was meh. I was excited for the caramelized bananas but they could have taken the dessert to new heights had they given me a whole banana flambe. The other dessert, warm black and white chocolate bread pudding, was amazing! Yes, you heard right, a CHOCOLATE bread pudding with HAZELNUT ice cream to boot! The pudding had bits of nuts and other ingredients I couldn't quite pin point that added well to its texture. 

They were nice enough to stick a candle in Randy's dessert which was a good excuse for me to sing him the "Happy Birthday" song AGAIN (yes, I spoil him).  I couldn't help but wonder if we didn't order dessert, would they have still offered us a birthday treat? Nonetheless, Randy was irked that his dessert wasn't complimentary. Can't really blame them for that, after all, we are fine dining in an economic slump. 

No major complaints from me except that I value consistency. Maybe next time they'll get the duck right.
author: Nancy L.

description: A great neighborhood spot that is warm and friendly, and with seriously good food. Pretty comfortable and warm, and yes, just a little loud, but it's one of my favorites.  The food is very solid - not too fancy, but a little creative here and there, always fresh, and always delicious. BTW - don't even think of parking in this neighborhood... Uber.
author: Mark W.

description: Here on a business trip from Chicago and just dumb-lucked getting a parking space right across the street so we stopped in. Food was superb. I had the duck and my coworker had the filet. Both were cooked to perfection and the portion sizes were perfect for a late dinner (not too big). Highly recommend if you are in the area.
author: Mark D.

description:
Anytime you crave a place when you're full, you know it is good. That's how I am right now. I ate a very filling lunch at work, but thinking of that chicken still makes my mouth water.

I love the location of Frascati, right on tree-lined Hyde Street, with other small restaurants nearby. Inside, the old candy shop is very quaint and welcoming. 

I've been twice with no reservations so we just sat at the bar and ate. The service there was great and very attentive. The asparagus and waldorf salads are both incredible, great flavors and perfectly prepared. 

For entrees we got the ribeye and chicken. The ribeye was good, but the chicken is the restaurants signature dish. The meat was very juicy and flavorful. The wine selection was of good quality, but not extensive. The pours were generous too. 

The first time we went, we skipped dessert and went to nearby Swenson's for ice cream. Although that place is delicious, the second time we stayed for the bread pudding and were glad we did. Definitely enough for two people and quite delicious.

The bar is a great place to eat, but I'd recommend reservations, this place is packed every weekend night.
author: Jeff O.

description:
came here with the boyfriend last week.
everything was so good.
Please try the octopus salad.

mmmmmm
author: mel l.

description: This is the closest I have come to a perfect meal in many months. The food is amazing. The service is attentive but not obsessive. And what a lovely atmosphere! A small, intimate dining room. Cable cars zooming by. Everyone seems friendly but minds their own business. And did I mention that the food is spectacular? Well it is. But get a reservation. And take the cable car there if  you are downtown!
author: Carolyn H.

description:
Continues to be one of my favorite restaurants in the City.  Go for the bread salad.  Stay for the pork chop and the pinot.  Refuse to leave until they serve you the apple cobbler (Top 10 desserts in SF--see my list) and the decaf.  You may have to be rolled out of there.

Ridunculous.

And I mean that in the best possible way.
author: Scott W.

description:
One of my favorite places in my neighbor.  I live about 3 blocks away.  Two of my friends and I were here on Tuesday.  The waiter was very kind and knew what he was talking about especially the wine.  He made great recommendations.  We had chicken, duck and pork chop.  Everything was juicy and delicious.  My chicken had a nice crispy skin over the very flavorful white and dark meat.  The mussels wasn't so special.  The gnocchi lacked gnocchi and had lots of other chopped vegetables instead.  The bread salad was tasty with the large sized coutons.  When me and one friend went out to smoke between appetizers and main course, the waiter brought our wines out to us.  I thought that was pretty cool.

Nice place overall.  I would definitely revisit.
author: Kevin L.

description: This place is amazing!  In the heart of the city, this quaint restaurant represents why I feel San Francisco is romantic!  Every few minutes you hear the ding of the cable car trolley and if you sit upstairs by the window, you feel the cool evening breeze.  It is a classy, cozy spot with excellent service and delicious food.  I like that their menu is seasonal and all the food is only the best & freshest quality.  My taste buds have never experienced the flavors of all that we ate.  From the cheese platter, gnocchi, risotto, duck salad, the pistachio crusted halibut to the wines, everything was prepared and presented with utmost class.  Frascati was definitely a treat! I give it FIVE STARS :D
author: Earlene C.

description:
I'm pretty much giving Frascati a 4 star rating solely based on the atmosphere. It is dimly lit, perfect for an intimate dinner with your significant other. I'm a busy guy, I'm sure you are too. I'm also pretty introverted and I was surprised because I hadn't had a two hour dinner in a long time. 

We started with the cheese plate and a bottle of Zin. Although initially the service was a bit slow and we had to remind our server of our bottle, once the server realized we'd been waiting, the rest of the experience was great. The servers are incredibly personable and friendly. The cheese was OK. The wine was great.

Later we ordered the duck and a risotto. Both spectacular. 

I would recommend this restaurant to a friend.
author: Jonathan A.

description: Two words: pork chop. It's so delicious. I just recently had the pork chop at NOPA as well (which I know people love) and I'm going to say that I think it's better than NOPAs. I love the atmosphere of this restaurant as well. I've been a couple of times and the first time I sat upstairs above the kitchen. Smelling everything cooking before you get your food is definitely a form of torture because everything smells so good and you want to order one of everything. I also loved sitting upstairs because if you sit at the table on the end near the railing you can see all of the chefs work their magic which I think is really interesting. This place is a good date place but also appropriate for family. It's a win win all around.
author: Kerry K.

description:
Unbelievable service.  I haven't had a server this knowledged of his food, menu and wine in a long time.  Anything he explained to us made my mouth water.. literally, i was really hungry already.   I went to dinner with 3 foodies for sure, so I let them take reigns of the dinner.  Them, coupled with our waiter made for great recommendations and a great time.  

The gnocchi, while not the best I've had, twas very good, but the accouterments to the dish is what made it.  Parmesan and truffle oil can make a shoe taste good.  I didn't get a main dish, the appetizers (balsamic, blue cheese crostini things and the Steak tartare to share) were both fantastic.. and filling, and I HAD to save room for dessert!  and I'm glad I did, the Vanilla Panna Cotta and the Peach-Blueberry Cobbler were killer.  BF loved the Panna Cotta and I could have eaten the Cobbler as my dinner and been satisfied.  

I thought the place was VERY reasonable for the menu and atmosphere, and I would be happy to go back.
author: Kristi D.

description:
Frascati is a wonderful Nob Hill neighborhood restaurant. I was lucky enough to be taken here for my birthday by my wonderful husband. Had been experiencing a lot of stress in May and our dinner that night was exactly what the doctor ordered.

The atmosphere is small and intimate. The wait staff is top notch. We had so much attention and they didn't even know it was my birthday. Upon recommendation of the sommelier, we started with a bottle of Campion Pinot Noir 2005. It was an excellent choice.

I had the foie gras appetizer served with small toasts. It melted in my mouth and was very delicious. My husband had the calamari that was equally good. For our entrees, he ordered the flank steak and I got the Artic Char (fish). We were pleased with both choices. We had to have dessert even though by that time, we were pretty full. My husband had the cobbler and I had the bread puddling with hazelnut ice cream. I can't say that I've been a huge fan of bread pudding in the past, but this was truly exceptional. They make their own ice cream and it was really good. 

Overall our experience was absolutely fabulous. We were very pleased with the service, atmosphere and food and highly recommend it for others to try. Restaurants like this are one of the many reasons we live in such a great city as San Francisco.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Well this place surely has a charm about it. My friend and I came in and immediately liked it. 
We ordered:
-gnocchi with mushrooms and truffle sauce
-beet salad
-scallops in a vanilla sauce
-brussell sprouts with capers

The gnocchi was definitely the highlight although we only got about 8 gnocchi pieces. Really good sauce and really good mushrooms. The beet salad wasn't quite what I expected... I wouldn't get it again. The scallops were wonderful and brussels weren't quite what he hoped for. All in all the food was quite good and the place has a lovely charm about it.
author: Natasha P.

description:
Amazing restaurant. I've been here twice and have absolutely loved it both times. 

The staff is beyond friendly from the moment you step foot into the restaurant and the waiters are incredibly attentive. 

The atmosphere is quiet, quaint and romantic. The food is equally sophisticated and simple - incredibly delicious. 

Great restaurant for a date or a nice night out with family. Definitely one of the best restaurants in Russian Hil, if not the whole city.
author: Cristina P.

description: Nice little restaurant. Foods were interesting and the server was nice. The restaurant was not fully packed in a Friday night dinner time. This is probably because finding a parking in the area is almost impossible.
author: Herman K.

description: I love this place! I think it's one of the cutest, most charming and romantic restaurants in San Francisco. I've sat downstairs in the window and upstairs in the balcony, and both experiences were equally amazing. The gnocchi appetizer stands out in my memory as the best dish, but both the scallop and duck entrees were also very good. The food is solid and the price fair. But best of all is definitely the ambience - you can't help but have a great night sitting in such a sweet restaurant along the cable car line at the top of Russian Hill!
author: CJ J.

description:
My mom came from out of town & my husband & I wanted to take her somewhere nice. After reading all the wonderful reviews we decided to go to Frascati. 

Atmosphere was very pleasant.. 
We sat on the top level overlooking the 1st floor & the kitchen. It was very nice. Decor was cozy .....lighting was soft &soothing. 
Service was good. Can't think of anything negative to say... Attentive yet not too over baring. 

Food: 
Duck Confit Salad - superb. 5 out of 5 
Octopus salad - very good. 
Potato Gnocchi - 4 out of 5 
Entrees: 
Risotto -very tasty. Good, rich flavor. 
Red Snapper - loved it. 
Duck Breast - Unfortunately it wasnt as good as everything else & my mom is the one who ordered it. Out of 2 pieces of duck that were served - one was perfectly prepared but the 2nd one was overcooked & chewy. She didnt return it though, which is a good thing because she usually does lol. 
Presentation of food was very good. 
Unfortunately, we were in a hurry to go see a show so we didnt have time for dessert. I am sure it would have been superb. 
Overall we liked the place. I wouldnt say it was as good as it gets but definitely worth trying & I would go back. 
(They do have a very tiny bathroom. Its just 1 stall shared by men & women... but I guess its ok. After all you dont go to a restaurant for its bathroom :)
author: Irina K.

description: Great location, service, and ambiance. I just wasn't horribly impressed by the food. It wasn't bad, but it also didn't wow me at all.
author: Daniel D.

description:
this friendly and cozy neighborhood restaurant came highly recommended by a friend and we made the trip together when we finally got a reservation for the four of us on a friday night at 9.  a little late but the best we could do.  parking in this area is of course horrendous.

we sat upstairs in the back and it was nice and cozy.  i was afraid i was going to have to listen to the couple next to me all night but the surroundings really melt away after a little while. the servers seem icy at first and i thought he was arrogant and rude but more time told me that he was just blunt and knows his stuff.  when asking for recommendations you really get just that, a recommendation.  

we started off with gnocchi.  and for the first time in my life i did not spit gnocchi out.  i dont know why i never liked gnocchi but this was good.  we also started with duck confit salad also very good.  the dishes felt season with the gnocchi paired with squash, mushrooms and the salad containing dried cherries.  i got to try a little of everyones dishes and i must say it is true what they say about the pork chop here!  it is delicious!  they brine it first which keeps it moist.  the chicken is also very flavorful and juicy.  i had the seafood stew and enjoyed how they put in cod fish etc.  the risotto also had a nice kick.

we were all so stuff at the end we didnt have room for dessert.  next time!
author: claudia y.

description: One of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco for many years. The staff are well-trained, attentive, knowledgeable and make you feel very much at home. Setting is delightful - cozy, elegant, and intimate. Cheese plate is superb, as are the gnocchi. Can't go wrong here.
author: J D.

description: Excellent atmosphere with cool local neighborhood vibe.  Great food and service too!
author: K H.

description: Great ambiance, excellent service, pretty good food (on average). The items we tried: APPETIZERS: mushroom bruschetta, lobster bisque soup, pear gorgonzola salad. ENTREES: filet mignon, crusted bass. DESSERT: chocolate cake, panna cotta. The filet mignon and panna cotta were by far the highlights of our meal. The gorgonzola salad and chocolate cake were good, too. I wish the mushroom bruschetta had more flavor, and the crusted bass and lobster bisque were very bland. All in all, pretty good food, but I've had better, especially for the money. Living around to corner, I'd definitely give Frascati another shot to try some of the other menu items.
author: Eric C.

description:
I have a confession to make. It's only Wednesday but I've already been to Frascati this week...twice. 

It's not entirely my fault. I've had friends in town, which means it's my duty to show off the local cuisine. And Frascati is a mere three block walk from my apartment so...can you really blame me?? 

At least I didn't order the same meal twice. Trust me, it wasn't easy. I am completely and utterly obsessed with Frascati's duck with spaetzle and huckleberry sauce. Normally I'm more of a seafood entrée person, but I don't even glance at the other menu items. The second time around, however, I opted for the lighter two appetizer route: a savory mushroom and goat cheese bruschetta followed by a deliciously crisp pear and gorgonzola salad. And wine, obviously. 

But the REAL reason I drag my poor (lucky) friends to Frascati time and time again is the dessert. If you know me at all, I'm sure I've already evangelized the Frascati warm black & white chocolate bread pudding, but bear with me. If a molten chocolate lava cake and bread pudding mated, this would be their offspring. (Not sure that dessert sex is an appetizing concept but, oh well.)

All in all, I've been to Frascati about four times in the last month. But it has to stop, mainly because...I was caught. On trip #2 this week the host gave me a weird look and started to say "Waaaaait weren't you here..." until he was stopped short by my searing glance. My friends should think they're special, and not just excuses to indulge in orgasmic desserts. Can't it be both?
author: A M.

description:
Came here expecting a very nice dinner at a nice-trendy spot and it didn't disappoint.  It's very small.  We had reservations right when it opened and we sat at a front window table... very tight, but it was nice to people watch and see the trolley go by as we ate.  We got three appetizers: a wild mushroom bruschetta, octopus salad, and burrata.  I really loved the wild mushroom brushetta and octopus salad... the burrata was also very good, but it's always very good and it was the smallest portion I guess.  We got 4 entrees... pork chop, sablefish, shellfish linguini, and I got the duck.  Everyone liked their entrees... I cleaned my plate.. 2 duck breasts over herb spaetzle... it was a lot of duck and one of the breasts had the good crisp skin w/ a layer of fat underneath.  I didn't share with anyone.  We got the chocolate bread pudding which wsa very good.  not too sweet... kind of like a warm bread-brownie, but moist and soft w/ a huge scoop of ice cream on top.  I got the White Vermouth dessert wine which was interesting.  Throw in a bottle of wine and it was a pretty expensive meal, but not bad... almost $70 a person w/ a generous tip.  

Atmosphere is nice... tight quarters, very small space, but they have a cute/tiny upstairs area and it's the type of place that can be both fancy/romantic and casual at the same time.  Busy and cramped, but not super loud.  The bathroom is TINY.  it's the smallest bathroom I've ever been in, but it's clean.  Service was good.  It's just a professional place where they're executing everything correctly.
author: Easter E.

description: In the top 5 restaurants in San Francisco. Period. Try everything. Go again. Really an amazing adventure of flavors in every course.
author: Inna L.

description: One of those places that you'll never forget.  It was fabulous.  We just happened on Frascati when another local restaurant couldn't accommodate our walk-in request for 6 (2 parents & 4 older kids). The Frascati owner-reception was phenomenal, the wait-staff top notch, food was some of the best we've ever had.  From gnocchi to half chickens to blue nose bass to pork chops...there was not one disappointed diner in our party.  We finished our meal with dessert because we were confident that we wouldn't want to miss out.  The servers made spot-on recommendations of the famous bread pudding.  We also opted for 2 other plates of apple cobbler & French toast...seriously, the best!  An experience we won't ever forget.  Thank you so much for a memorable meal for our first night in San Francisco.
author: Betsy S.

description: What can I say? Top-notch service, delicious satisfying meals, wonderful location... what more could you ask for from a restaurant? The atmosphere is lovely and intimate. the ingredients they use are so fresh, everything just melts in your mouth. I could not recommend this cute little restaurant more.
author: Alyona P.

description:
A friend brought me here for my birthday.  We had reservations, and were seated right away.  It was packed.  I'm assuming it is probably always packed, so I would make a reservation.  It is a small space and very busy.  I like that about it.  It was very charming.  All of the wait staff was very friendly.  They were all also on point, like you would not believe for such a busy small restaurant.  

We got the Smoke Salmon Brushetta to start.  There was a TON of smoked salmon on these.  It was delicious.  Could have been a mean in itself.  Next we got the Roasted Artichoke Salad.  This was also amazing.  Both of these were plenty to share for two.  For my main course I had the Duck.  I would throw it out there that this was by far the best duck I have ever had.  It was cooked perfectly, and according to how the chef wanted to cook it.  I was so full and made myself finish it because it was AMAZING.  My friend had the Flat Iron Steak.  This was also delicious.  My duck was better haha, but it was also so good!

Over all this place is awesome, and very reasonably priced for how delicious it was.  I will be going back, and recommend it to everyone I know.
author: Meg B.

description: Top notch food and dining experience!  It's a small, but very cozy atmosphere.  I love it!
author: D. C.

description: This place is incredible!! I had the burrata and gnocci for appetizers with a friend after a long hike, then the pan roasted chicken for entree. My friend had the risotto, every thing was absolutely incredible. I'll definitely go here again if I get the opportunity!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
The Best!!!! My husband and I are both chef's From Manhattan Beach, CA. it's very difficult to dine out with our expectation level.  We were up visiting Family and just  wanted one night with good food. My niece recommended Hyde St. We saw a guy sitting outside with his dog and The gentleman was very inviting but not pushy. The restaurant wasn't crowded and we thought let's give it a shot. We where blown away.  we had a Hawaiian Server. She very friendly and the food was amazing. The octopus salad was so tender and flavorful and had the perfect profile. My husband had the bread salad which was just as great. My entree was the lamb and my Husband had the tagliatelle pasta.  our compliments to the chef.  As we finished the restaurant was packed. The one thing that I noticed was the attention to detail and the great hospitality.  When there wasn't any seats the host offered champagne to a party of 5 or 6 while they waited.  This is what its about.  You don't see to much of that in the south bay. You have a great spot and we will be back every time we visit. Thank you for such a memorable evening. Oh yes the buratta was so sexy. A must have.

Good Luck,

Sherie and Johnny from the South Bay
author: Sherie D.

description:
Frascati is a cute, cozy Italian restaurant in Russian Hill... or "Mediterranean style bistro," as they describe it on their website.  The service is good and attentive, yet unpretentious.  

We had gnocchi for our appetizer and a bottle of Blanc de Blanc, Domaine J. Laurens champagne.  For dinner, I had the mushroom ravioli because I THOUGHT it was the only vegetarian option.  This was interpretation fail because apparently "sweetbreads" are the thymus and pancreas of a cow, so I couldn't eat that part.  

What kind of restaurant in San Fransisco doesn't have at least one vegetarian main course?  I know they change their menu a lot, but at the time when I went, there was no option.  Fail, fail, fail.  The gnocchi was really good - had pretty perfect texture and pretty delicious sauce (yum, white truffle oil).  The mushroom ravioli also had strong mushroom flavor, which I loved, plus amazing sauce.  

I'd give it 4/5 for lack of vegetarian options.
author: June L.

description:
My boyfriend planned a romantic double date with a lesbian couple we're friends with at this neighborhood gem.  Overall, Frascati is a solid 4 stars.

Food = 3.5.  The appetizers are fantastic little dishes to get your appetite whet.  The four of us shared the cheese plate with fruit, nuts and compotes; gnocchi appetizer; and the fois gras.  Each of the dishes were well-presented and splendid.  For a main course, my boyfriend had the scallops, which were perfectly seasoned and seared.  Unfortunately, my pork chop was a tad dry and too salty.  

Service = 4.5.  Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable about every dish.  She asked questions about our tastes, our appetites and our dislikes and make thoughtful recommendations.   Our courses were served at a very even pace.  

Atmosphere = 4.  Set on a quiet corner on Green and Hyde , Frascati is a neighborhood gem that shines on Russian Hill.   The main dining room next to the open kitchen is cozy and inviting.  The tables are set apart so you're not sitting on top of strangers dining next to you.
author: Eddie L.

description:
If you know only one thing about your trip here, it's that you better save some room for that chocolate bread pudding everyone raves about. It's moist, it's delicious, it's like a cross between a fudgy brownie and a real bread pudding... all I can think of is that it must have taken some serious soaking in some serious chocolate for it to achieve that kind of textured cake consistency....because hello it did start as BREAD! The hazelnut ice cream is the crowning glory, oh and the slice is huge, so even if you are a greedy bitch like me, you will still not mind sharing.

Esp if you sampled the rest of this menu like you should have. Get an appetizer, get a salad or their soup, and a big fat entree. Their portions are pretty darn big. The smoked salmon bruschetta was very good. The black figs with bleu cheese, genius. I wouldn't have ordered it but I am glad my husband did since I ate half of his. The mushroom soup was not my favorite, it needed more flavor in my opinion, but everyone else loved it. Rib-eye with bleu cheese and heirloom tomato salad, big winner, loved the garlic seasoning it came with...not too overpowering so you don't feel like you are leaving smelling like a Dracula-repellent, but just enough to add real flavor. Sampled the rest of the table's pork chop and salads, yum.

Service was excellent, very friendly, brought out my sister's dessert with a lit candle for her birthday, and the waitress even went and asked the chef when we wanted her to explain the difference between capers and caper berries (you know the giant ones that look like olives!). During the busy Sat night hour, the fact that he took time to give her the answer for us, fabulouso!!
author: Mara T.

description:
My wife and I had dinner at Frascati last Saturday evening and enjoyed it tremendously. We were only in SF for one night, and researched frantically just days prior, trying to find a place that would not disappoint. 

It is a quaint little place that is charming and welcoming. It can be romantic, but is not stuffy or pretentious. You can dress casual or a little more formal, and you will fit right in.

I ate in three courses, starting with an italian sausage risotto which was amazing (maybe slightly over salted, but tons of flavor). Then I had a mushroom bisque which was smooth and flavorful. My main course was a rigatoni dish with a rabbit meat rague sauce. Also amazing.

We finished off with the black and white (a chocolate bread pudding we read about in other reviews). We were not let down.

Prices were moderate. We each had three courses, dessert, and an $80 bottle of wine, and after tip still got out of there under $200.

Service was great, and with a seat right by the front window, we got to watch the trolley's cruise by all evening long.
author: T S.

description:
My darling friends took me here for my most recent birthday thanks to the recommendations of several coworkers. The place was packed when we arrived on a Friday night. Thankfully we had a reservation and got seated right away. I was told to ask for their homemade butter with the bread. I had the halibut, which was good, but my friends who got the duck were the real winners of the night. Another must is their chocolate bread pudding, the dessert is simply out of this world. And no, I am not exaggerating. We rounded out the fabulous dinner with glasses of rose, we're gay men after all.

Our waitress was very sweet and took very good care of us. She knew we had to make it to my birthday party in the Castro so she was extra efficient.

~A
author: Alex C.

description: Cute restaurant. Propped on Hyde Street, this place is super cozy with the feeling that you are actually in someone's home. Went here for an anniversary. We got a table upstairs in the corner.  A little bit on the darker but was fine. The food was excellent. We shared a pear salad, the mission figs and the duck breast. All excellent. Would definitely go here again, but would share the plates as they were pretty large.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
This is a quintessential San Francisco Neighborhood restaurants.  Small/borderline cramped, great services, delicious California cuisine and fantastic atmosphere.

Our server was very friendly and always there with a suggestion and funny insight into the menu. The wine menu covered a lot of different wine regions but I thought it was lacking in the Cab department. 

The pork chop was tender, moist and with a perfect crust. Easily the best pork chop I have had at a restaurants. My dads double cut brined and stuffed pork chops are still number 1.  The potatoes that came along with it were OK and had some type of vinegar on them. I am not a vinegar fan so they didn't really appeal to me. 

The desserts were absolutely amazing.  By far some of the best I have had in the City. The bread pudding was more a chocolate brownie sundae than actual bread pudding. And the apple crisp was on point. Another surprise was how large the size of the deserts were. We laughed at the sized and told the waiter that we should have order 3. He told us that he wouldn't have let us order three. Sad thing is that we ate every last bite and could have had more since it was so delicious.

My only complaint of the restaurant was the  pear salad. It was rather pedestrian and tasted like any other one I have had before. I guess it's is my fault though for not ordering some more adventurous.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Yelp describes the cuisine as "American," my Zagat guide says, "Californian/Mediterranean," and Opentable, "French/Mediterranean." 
I'm not entirely sure how define the menu myself.

I enjoyed the quaint/romantic atmosphere while dinning, but it was a little chilly/drafty in the restaurant. Our server was helpful in helping us choose from the menu, and the food was good. I enjoyed our starters (steak tar tar and something else) and salads (something to do with pears) more than my main course. I would dine again at Frascati if I were in the neighborhood.
author: Miss B.

description:
Much more 3.5-stars than 4. I had been wanting to eat here for years and finally made a reservation. It's a cute cozy place, although immediately after walking in, it seemed a bit chaotic as far as the staff went, and that feeling unfortunately continued. We were seated immediately, our waitress stopped to take our water order, then a few minutes later the host came by to take our water order. We gave it again. Then our waitress didn't come back for a while longer. I had a few questions on the menu, so when she finally came back, I needed a minute to think, which I'm sure my husband was thrilled about since it would probably be another 10 minutes until she was back.

Regardless, it wasn't that bad, she was helpful with the menu. After reading the good reviews for the octopus salad, I was debating between that and the duck confit salad, she steered me to the octopus, and it was good. The octopus was cooked perfectly and had a good mix of flavors with the other salad toppings. I can't remember what my husband got to start, perhaps a special, as he was eying the gnocchi, but after the poor reviews for that, I think he considered something else.

For our mains, he went with the pork chop and I went with the paparadelle. Both were good enough, but nothing memorable and we were both just like, 'eh'. Nothing to complain about, but nothing we'd come back for. We decided to skip dessert there as nothing sounded good, and we headed next door to Swensen's for a scoop - their ice cream is sooo good!
author: Lauren M.

description: The food at Frascati is simply wonderful. I had the gnocchi with truffle oil and fresh peas and wow! They are nice, calm, and serve some of the most delicious food there is.
author: Alb M.

description: I came here for my birthday. The burrata caprese and the filet mignon were delicious!
author: Tyler C.

description:
I love this place-- it has its character!
I've been here twice, and both times were great!  Good food but not overpriced!  Highly recommended!
author: Elena L.

description:
sometimes the bread pudding is crispy and sometimes it's too soft

but service is always excellent and the coffee is superb.
author: Josie M.

description:
My fiance and I have been to this place twice, and I can honestly say that I have found nothing wrong it. Both times we went, I was looking for a somewhat romantic place for a special evening. After searching around the web and reading review after review, I couldn't get away from Frascati.

The service is top-notch. We arrived early both times we went and were seated right away on what seemed to be very busy weekend nights. I also asked for a "romantic-type" table and they put us on the balcony overlooking the first floor. Actually, if I had one minor issue, it's that the tables are a little small. We had a few different plates and a bottle of wine on there at the same time and there really was not enough room for it all. I'm just being picky, though.

The apps, the entrees, and the desert ... all outstanding. And this place is not too pricey at all either. It's is a quaint little restaurant in a quaint little neighborhood. And if you're into wine bars, head across the street after dinner to the smallest bar I've ever seen, a place called "Bacchus". That makes for a great date-night all-around.
author: Jonathan C.

description: If I could give this place 6 stars I would! I had a reservation for 8:45p but got there around 7p. We were not too dressed up but the waiter made us feel very welcome. Offered to seat us at the bar. Every course we had was amazing! My friend ordered the figs for an appetizer which was sweet and decadent. I ordered the fresh pappardelle with beef and basically licked the plate clean. The deserts were so rich! I ordered the chocolate bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream and my friend ordered the peach blueberry cobbler...so delicious. Definitely recommend!
author: Aisha J.

description:
My date and I decided to come here Friday night after doing a bit of Yelping.  We ordered appetizers, mains, and dessert.  For appetizer we ordered foie gras torchon and gnocci.  For mains we ordered pork chop and duck.  For dessert we shared the warm black and white chocolate bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream.  

Dinner was extraordinaire!!  This is the BEST dessert I've had....EVER.  The warm CHOCOLATE BREAD PUDDING was crunchy and chocolaty and perfectly balanced with the hazelnut ice cream.  The MAPLE LEAF DUCK  BREAST was cooked to perfection.  It was tender and juicy and crispy with the right amount of wild mushrooms.  We also LOVED the GNOCCI.  Definitely coming back here very soon.
author: A T.

description:
The food at Frascati is definitely still delicious, but my one complaint is that the Ciopinno is not always on the menu... boo.

My family and I came here the other night for dinner and after raving about how amazing their Cioppino was, we arrived to find it was not on the menu...GASP! So I asked our nice waitress about it, and she informed me that it just comes and goes, has nothing to do with the seasons, it's just not a staple item (which it most DEFINITELY should be). Call me a baby, but this is the reasoning for the subtraction of one star... the other food was still delicious, but when you have a taste for something to find it's not available, it kind of ruins the experience, no!?

Enough whining, as for the food we had, it was still really good. My mom and sister both had the potato soup with the Duck Confit salad (which was delicious), dad had the soup as well as the Dungeness Crab Salad. I had the Asparagus salad with the Sea bass Crudo. The dessert was definitely the highlight, we shared a scoop of two of the ice creams as well as a lemon/blueberry dessert. Both were very good.
author: Emily S.

description: My wife and I were told about this restaurant from a barrista at La Boulange. Reservations for 630pm on a saturday were easily made. Our server was Julia who could not have been any better. The ambience was very comfortable and relaxed. We started with a selection of cheese and savories. Followed by the duck confit salad and also the fig with prosciutto, which was a different take but both were delicious. Dinner was sea scallops and also the grouper with beluga lentils. The whole event at this beautiful restaurant was flawless. Call, make reservations, and enjoy this experience.
author: Sean H.

description:
I reserved a table for 2 on a 3rd party reservation internet site. We took the Powell-Hyde cable car from Union Sq and got off literally in front of the bistro, which was a pleasant and unique experience. We were seated upstairs, which I preferred, as there is a more cozy ambiance without all the traffic moving through the restaurant. Our waiter was patient and answered any questions we had about the menu. His wine suggestions were spot on; two glasses of cabernet later, and I was three sheets to the wind!

The bread was warm and fresh, the wine was absolutely flawless, and it is here that I had the BEST gnocchi of my life. I'd been to Italy and other fine Italian restaurants in the States and nothing has ever compared to what I had here. I was in heaven. I had the duck and my date had the fillet mignon. Personally, I preferred the fillet but the duck was pretty good. We each had two glasses of wine, a first and second course, all for just under $150!!! I would come back in a heartbeat!
author: Becca C.

description: Started with the really tasty Grilled Bread Salad (white beans, cucumbers, red onion, kalamata olives, feta and champagne vinaigrette), then Maple Leaf Duck Breast (with herb spaetzle, hearts of palm, scallions, wild arugula and huckleberry sauce)--outstanding sauce and cooked to perfection, and finally the Warm Black and White Chocolate Bread Pudding with Hazelnut Ice Cream, Caramel and Chocolate Sauce!  Great flavors across the board.  Cozy place tucked in a great neighborhood.  Off to an awkward start with some strange interactions with our waitress who was probably well-intentioned but maybe unpolished, but nothing big enough to detract from a splendid evening at a restaurant I would definitely seek out again.
author: Paul B.

description:
Made a last minute reservation for dinner and I'm glad I did.  The food was solid.

For apps, my boyfriend and I tried the gnocchi.  It was good, but nothing out of this world.

For my entree, I tried the bronzino, which was flavorful and delicious.  My boyfriend ordered their special of the night - pappardelle in a pork stew.  To be honest, I skipped out on ordering the special because it didn't sound too appetizing to me.  Thank goodness he thought it sounded yummy because it was!  The pasta was so fresh and the pork stew was so tasty.  The dish had a nice little kick to it, which I enjoyed immensely.  If you are ever offered a pappardelle in a pork stew special, order it!  You won't regret it!

And for my favorite part of the meal, we ordered the oh so famous Chocolate Bread Pudding.  I was kind of full from the meal, but there was no way I wasn't ordering this dessert since every since review raved about it.  So I ordered it.  And I liked it, but I didn't love it.  

The best way I can describe the dessert is that it looked like a brownie with ice cream on top and it had the texture of a chewy brownie made with large pieces of oatmeal.  Definitely not your conventional bread pudding.  It was good, but I've had better dessert in my lifetime.

Overall, my meal at Frascati was satisfying.  Though I can't say I'll be back any time soon (mostly because there are just too many other places to try in SF), it was good food.
author: Kristine B.

description: What a delightful restaurant on Russian Hill.  The food is wonderful, the service excellent and the ambiance gets an A+. The maple leaf duck breast was probably the best duck I have had anywhere.  We frequent this great little restaurant whenever we are in the city.  Gayle M
author: Gayle M.

description:
One of my most favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Although parking can be a challenge in the area, there's a parking garage on Hyde close by (although I'm not too sure of the rates) and the cable car runs right by the restaurant. Frascati is perfect for dates or dinner with friends/entertaining out-of-towners - it's small, charming, and the food and service is absolutely excellent. Although it's difficult to get a reservation without planning a few days in advance, there's usually room at the bar and you don't compromise any of the attentive service. 

The food is fantastic. We've had the Waldorf salad, asparagus salad, roasted chicken (which is absolutely divine and I don't usually like chicken), and the rib eye. All of it was excellent and each plate was a good size. The chocolate bread pudding was also very tasty although very rich - we split it between two people which was just perfect. Highly, highly recommend!!!
author: Jess B.

description: Great experience, neighborhood atmosphere and very chef style fusion food. Wife had duck breast, I opted for halibut. For an appetizer we shared sardines. All was prepared and presented finely. We brought with us our wine and were charged corkage fee. Would go back there as I like fusion food and appreciate quality. Reservation was easy to make with Opentable (wisely integrated with Yelp).
author: Zeev S.

description:
4.5 stars, really.

Went here for dinner on a Monday night and had a fabulous dining experience.  We sat upstairs...really cozy place.  Food was delicious...we had the duck and a pasta dish.... both wonderful and the bread pudding was a great way to end our meal.  Our waiter couldn't have been any more tentative!

Highly recommended...and you know a restaurants is good if it's a Monday night during a year of recession, yet the place is STILL PACKED!
author: Jennie L.

description: If you are in the mood for an apple crisp or a chocolate bread pudding...this is the place. Some of the best desserts I have had in San Francisco. The food is very good as well but the real draw for us is the dessert. Upstairs can get a little warm, we actually have sat in front, outside, a couple of times when the weather was nice and that was great. Hyde street is a great spot.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
One of my absolute favorite restaurants in San Francisco. A true neighborhood gem. My first time visiting was when I was only a week-old SF resident, living just two blocks away. My dad happened to be in town for a business trip and came over to help me put together some ridiculously complicated IKEA furniture. By the time we finished at 9 pm, we were starving and wondering where to go. His friends had recommended this place in my new hood, so we walked around the corner to check it out. Despite being late on a Tuesday night, the place was quite lively. We sat at the bar and had hands down one of the best meals ever. And the service is wonderful, truly makes you feel like you are family. In the nearly 5 years since, I've been back many times and it's a constant favorite when the family comes to town.

I always go for the gnocchi, grilled bread salad and whatever fresh fish they're serving. Save room for dessert - the warm black and white chocolate bread pudding is to die for and has converted even bread-pudding haters!
author: Elizabeth P.

description:
Octopus salad, and gnocchi were tasty.
Duck was ok but not memorable.

Chocolate bread pudding was Very Memorable and awesome :) panna cotta was good too.
author: L B.

description:
My son and I hopped off the cable car during a recent trip to San Francisco, and stopped in here.  We originally planned to only have an appetizer and then dessert, but the Monterey Bay sardine appetizer was so delicious that we ended up having dinner.

I've never eaten in a place that served squash and brussel sprouts that were so good that I wanted to lick the plate when I finished the portions, but Frascati did.  We shared an order of Frutti di Mare risotto, which was perfectly cooked/seasoned, and simply delicious.  The vegetable sides (not listed on the menu, but ask for them) were absolutely fantastic...I just wish I could duplicate them at home since we live a long ways from San Francisco.  The pot du creme for dessert was creamy and perfect.  
I wish we'd been able to return another evening and sample more of the menu since everything we ate was so well-prepared, and the flavors were so complementary.

The wine list was also really nice.  I think this is a great, unpretentious neighborhood with a nice wait staff.  Wish it were in my neighborhood!
author: michelle a.

description: This place has been consistent. The maitre d is great. The servers are great except for the one woman who addresses the tables primarily for the order. Unfortunately she doesn't know how any of the dishes are prepared. So be prepared that you're on your own. But the good news is that the menu fluctuates little except by season. The duck: over cooked. Skin undercooked. Consistently underwhelming. Pork chop great but commonly over brined and raw near bone. No one seems to know how the octopus salad is made but they could always do better with fresh octopus rather than needing to poach it, marinade it and then fire it. Pass. The pappardelle is great. More sausage to noodles would be great. I find their pairings to be very sharp in contrast. Take the duck salad. Where you may want to see a nice lemon balance with a duck salad, they put maytag blue on it. It's like throwing a hand grenade into the whole dish muting the subtle warm rich tones of confit duck. Good neighborhood gem and more like the typical versus the rare brasserie. The lava bread cake was microwaved and in 15 minutes it was rock hard. What a shame.
author: Tertiary D.

description:
Wonderful, consistent, inspired, seasonal ingredients. 

I especially recommend the bread salad, the gnocchi starter, the duck breast (perfectly cooked), the branzino and the pappardelle with wild boar sugo... yum, yum, yum. And that's all I can recommend because that's everything that I've eaten on the menu! Good wine list, too.

The service is attentive and the staff knowledgeable, thankfully not pretentious.

I'm so grateful to have this gem in the neighborhood. Highly recommend.
author: Miranda B.

description:
This is San Francisco's charm at its best.

Tucked in the rolling hills of Russian hill, this corner gem sits along a splendid tree lined street that exudes an old romance that you thought was long gone.

I had walked by Frascati's for months, but this past Saturday night I finally had the pleasure of stepping in. I had requested the window seat, and because the couple was finishing up dessert when we arrived, we made our way to the bar and enjoyed a glass of wine.

The bartender who also ended up being our server was spectacular. Warm, endearing and an overall pleasure to speak with.

When we finally sat down, the ambiance of the place started to really kick in. The cable car slowly made its way past our white topped table, and the vibe of the restaurant allowed us to nestle into our own little space for dinner.

We split the artichoke salad which was light and flavorful and moved onto 2 great main courses.

We had the chicken and bass and both were spectacular. I had heard rumors that the chicken was phenomenal, and I will attest, it rests up there with some of the best roasted chicken I have ever had. 

The outer layer had a divine crisp to it, while the meat was tender and packed with flavor. Accompanied with decadent fingerling potatoes, this dish was a hit.

The bass was equally mouthwatering. Sitting in a tomato sauce, it was exciting and bold. A strong taste but served in perfect portions. 

Frascati is a classic spot. Full off charm, an intimate feel, and the hospitality of wonderful down home neighbors. 

This was a knockout, and I can't wait to come back. Shortly...
author: Mike K.

description: Sitting outside drinking a bottle of wine waiting for the table...lovely place solid 4.5/5
author: Troy S.

description:
One of the best meals I've had in San Francisco. 

Frascati is an unassuming little restaurant nestled in Russian Hill. I've probably driven by it a million times without noticing it. It's not the type of restaurant that I would like, the tables are close together, the decor is common and simple, but the FOOD is AMAZING! I think they have a grill in the kitchen where they perfectly sear everything that I ordered. 

MUST TRY: 
Grilled Asparagus with pouched duck egg 
Grilled Gnocchi with garlic and tomatoes.... 

I loved the charming little bottles on the table for olive oil, they're beautiful. You'll know what I mean when you get there. Am I the only one that loves these little touches and attention for detail? 

Our server was ever so kind to wrap one up for me. I think my friend uh, "took care of it" for me. Thank you!!!! Great wine list!
author: Sandy C.

description: Unfortunately Frascati did not live up to our expectations. The old-fashioned bread pudding for dessert was the delicious highlight. In Russian Hill I have had better meals for less money. The entrees were mediocre.
author: Tracey K.

description:
Elegant, simple, tasty....... this place hits the nail on the head.  A nice dimly lit quiet but not stuffy room.  A well thought out and concise menu with a good variety.  The Gnocchi with Truffle Oil and the Maple Duck Breast were amazing!  Black and White Chocolote Bread Pudding to finish it off for dessert.  Are you kidding me?  And I was able to get in the same day I found out about it.  Went with a few colleagues in town for a convention, in just a short cab ride we went from being stressed and talking about work to drinking great wine, eating delicious food and just hanging like friends instead of co-workers.

Thanks Frascati, for helping us have a great night and feeling like locals more than convention attending suits!
author: Matt B.

description:
Admittedly it's been two years since I've been back but the memory is still strong to highly recommend Frascati. Honestly, I think this restaurant is a nice compliment to Gary Danko, which is also in close proximity.

Great neighborhood restaurant. Atmosphere is best described as cozy. Tables are tight but the ambiance lends itself well to the set-up. Wine selection is very diverse and complimentary to the menu.

The menu has a wide selection of cleanly prepared dishes. I had the chicken breast that was prepared perfectly.

The service was attentive and prompt.

I would recommend this place for a special occasion. Call and make reservations...definitely. Children...I don't think I'd waste money on taking them to this place and if your child has a tendancy to become unruly take into consideration the tight and quaint seating arrangements.
author: Peter M.

description:
Met Michael, the executive chef, while I was selling my soups on the street one night so I had to come by and try his place...

I brought two friends with me and we all really enjoyed our experience...I had reservations at some real hotspots in town but settled on here and am glad we did!  Intimate atmosphere, knowledgeable staff, wonderful winelist encompassing both regional and imported varieties!  

I had the Duck and it was cooked perfectly...could have been sliced a little thinner but the flavor and combination of ingredients was comfort food for me.  I started with a mixed greens salad with pomegranites and a citrus vinagrette...not too overpowering, just right.

The dessert was amazing...I was very happy to have my pumpkin pie since the previous night (Thanksgiving) I missed out...and the double expresso was more like a triple...happy me:)  The pannacotta was delicate and wonderfully paired with a little caramel and some carmelized bananas...great way to end the night!

All this for a very affordable price...$200 including tax and tip for 3 of us...and attention to the details was great!
author: Brooke C.

description: Was my best dinning experience! Ever  I highly recommend if you want nice service and excellent food go here !!!! . I will go back soon !
author: Linda S.

description:
They have some great food here.  Many of the other reviewers pointed out the pork chop as stellar - I would wholeheartedly agree as it was very tender, juicy and delicious.  I also sampled the roasted half chicken which was moist and tasty as well.  I was disappointed in my maple leaf duck breast that many other reviewers had raved about.  The dish comprised of two pieces of duck breast that were allegedly cooked medium rare.  One of the pieces was overcooked and a bit dry.  The other piece was cooked on spot, but I found the meat to be overseasoned.  We had the apple cobbler and warm chocolate bread pudding with homemade hazelnut ice cream which were both delicious.

Service was good; I found the restaurant a bit too crowded with its small interior with too many tables crammed together.  As a result, it was a little difficult to hear at times when the room was full.
author: Bowdoin S.

description: super fresh, creative, delicious food with excellent service- a hidden gem of Russian Hill
author: Beth P.

description:
Here is the deal.

I really wanted to like this restaurant.  I have walked passed this little place a thousand times, peeking in to see the place full of patrons enjoying delicious food. Unfortunately, it did not meet my expectations.

Downfalls- which could also be viewed as tough luck.

1. Despite calling for reservations, still ended up sitting in the worst seat in the house. All the way in the back- too dark to read the menus, completely isolated from the restaurant alluring atmosphere that is seen from the window.

2. A very icy waiter.  He was really short with us about our food questions, not nice but not mean, he  just really had no character. Something I would not expect to see in this type of establishment. 

3. The food was plated better than it tasted. 
Appetizers: Heirloom salad- which was a very bland three hunks of tomatoes for $10. Gnocchi- creamy but no taste whatsoever- disappointing.  Figs- ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL. A very nice balance of savory and sweet with a bit of crunch.

Main Course:
