Sweet treats:

Bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream is a must, as is the dish with the basil ice cream served with a nectarine tart.

Last but not least, the staff:

Wonderful, wonderful people.  Jon Radar, the owner/manager, truly understands that you, the customer, is why Frascati exists so will accommodate you in any way he can (of course this is within reason!).  He always comes by the table to be sure we are comfortable, waves, or even comes out from inside the restaurant, when we're walking by on Hyde street, or listens to critical feedback with an open mind (I assure you there isn't much to say here).  

The rest of the staff -- Tony, Suzanne, Baselio, Scott -- are charming, engaging, knowledgeable and very entertaining!  I've brought my sisters here and my brother-in-law (who travels internationally and is admittedly a food and wine snob) and all were impressed by the food but mainly the staff.  They remembered details that were said earlier in the evening, offered to prepare something off the menu for my picky niece, and asked questions about their personal lives, creating a "I care to get to know ya" feeling.

In summation, every time I have something to celebrate, have friends in town, want to make an impression, or simply want good food, Frascati is the only reliable restaurant in the city I go to.
author: E Y.

description: Here in San Francisco for and this is a must for me to visit. It's quaint, small place where you're treated nice no matter what you look like. I got the sea bass and it was cooked perfectly. Melted in my mouth and went together perfectly with everything on the plate. For dessert I had there bread pudding. Perfect way to end a perfect meal.
author: Evan C.

description:
I came here like over a year ago, but some things still come to mind.

(1) Home of the world's smallest bathroom.

(2) I think the menu might have changed recently, but we had the gnocchi appetizer, it came tossed in some seaweed, but I don't think they did a good job of washing and draining it b/c there were like little pieces of sand in it. Crunchiest gnocchi I've had in my LIFE. I was so embarrassed I couldn't even tell them to take it back... so I just ate the gnocchi....

(3) one of the specials that night was the monkfish wrapped in pancetta or bacon. Everything was cooked to perfection, but it was a bit on the salty side....

(4) GREAT ambiance, cute restaurant, service was impeccable, intimate. 

(5) parking around here is atrocious.

(6) close to swensen's ice cream parlor. :p

Sigh.... It sounds like everyone else had a fabulous meal here. But I found the appetizer to kind of ruin my appetite. I wish I could say more positive things about this place.
author: Irene C.

description:
What a great place!! I came here last night with a good friend, ate a bunch, drank a bunch, and had a great time :)  It is a little small, so if you need to have one of those private conversations, this is not the place.

We didn't have a reservation, got there at like 8:15 or so, and were seated right away, the staff was amazing, and so friendly. 

I got the mixed green salad, and the pork chop (amazing)...my friend got the rabbit pasta dish...really good, just ate the left-overs for breakfast (couldn't wait til lunch!)...and yes, it's true, I took my friend's left-overs...

Definitely want to come back to this place.  It is so romantic and cozy, and they really work well with the space they have.  It's small, but they seat a lot of people in there.   Just another great restaurant in Russian Hill...
author: Kristin E.

description:
I have walked by this place for years always wanting to try it, but never did for whatever reason.  I finally made it on Sunday night.  I can't believe I haven't been sooner.

This is a great date place!  Very charming interior - both upstairs and downstairs.  The food was great - my halibut was good, but a bit mild/bland, but my friend's pork was really great - tender with some sweet grains (though he thought the waiter said "brains" which led to some amusing confusion).  The wine list was also very extensive with lots of good, reasonably priced bottles.

The absolute highlight of the meal was my dessert - chocolate bread pudding with vanilla ice cream.  I don't know where my recent obsession with bread pudding has come from, but I do know I have always loved chocolate.  The two combined = little slice of Sunday heaven.  And who doesn't want to experience heaven on the Lord's Day?
author: Amy K.

description:
When San Franciscans say to their Orange County and other out-of-town friends that "we HATE chain restaurants", it's Frascati they have in mind as the crown jewel of a terrific place to eat.  Small, boutique restaurant where the owner walks around and brings you delicious appetizers that do things to figs they never imagined when they were hanging around on the tree.

This place is warm and relaxed yet energetic even on a Sunday evening.  The wine list is incredible.  The pork is ingenious.  But in a test of wildlife acumen, it's entirely possible that lamb is even more brilliant.

Come here, and come here often.  You'll get that wonderful tickled feeling that comes from eating well.  And unlike a chain restaurant, if it's your birthday, you'll get a delicious bread pudding instead of a sombrero on your head.
author: Daniel D.

description:
I really liked this restaurant for its' open - airiness feel and lighting that seems the perfect setting for a date place.  

I had dinner here on a chilly night which originally had planned for sushi but switched b/c we couldn't be seated.  

The food was terrific... fresh, warm, and good without being over powering.  The service was attentive and everything was served just right.  


Liquor 3 Stars  Weighting Factor  10%
Atmosphere - 4 Stars                     25%
Food - 4 Star                                    50%
Service - 5 Star                                15%
OVERALL - 4 STARS                    100%
author: Tom L.

description:
God I love this place, I wish I'd been here more than once, but when I was here, it was probably a top-5 meal in SF, which is saying something, although it definitely had a lot to do with the circumstances and the incredible company I was with. 

I took my amazing fiancee here after popping the question, this was basically the most awesome place I possibly could go after asking her and was perfect on a perfect night! I love her!  

Highly recommend the cheese plate and the duck, both were delicious and everything complimented eachother very well. 

Also, if you've just gotten engaged, they'll give you free champagne, so everytime you get engaged, definitely head this direction!
author: Craig E.

description:
My wife and I used to frequent Frascati in the mid to late 90's when we still live in SF.  This restaurant holds a special place in our hearts and we try to make it back at least once a year for a meal.

We are so please that the current owners have upheld the standards of great food and magic.  You couldn't ask for a better, more romantic setting in a great neighborhood, with the cable car going by, and classic San Francisco all around.

I had the Halibut with a treasure of shellfish underneath in a saffron/tomato broth.  Fish was perfectly cooked and flavorful.

My wife had a steak that was equally as awesome.

Service was very friendly without being a nuisance.  Overall, we had a great dinner and night.
author: Patrick G.

description: Hands down, one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  Been here a few times and it's consistently always good and hasn't disappointed me yet.  The service, food, atmosphere is excellent, but I do recommend coming here with a smaller party since the restaurant is not big.  I love the friendliness of the staff and the interior of this place.
author: C W.

description: We happen to come across this restaurant on a walking tour of San Fran and was really glad we did!!  They accommodated us immediately.  The setting was nice, the service great and the restaurant itself completely unpretentious!!  The food was seasoned and served perfectly.  I had the risotto and my boyfriend had the monkfish.  Each dish was a 5 in its own right.  Also had the white and black bread pudding and found it a perfect end to the meal.  Would definitely recommend it and would come here again!!
author: Romie B.

description: This place is seriously delicious! I had the BEST pork chop I have ever tasted here. Their chocolate bread pudding is also amazing!
author: Kristen C.

description:
DOUBLE CHOCOLATE BREAD PUDDING!

The food and atmosphere are great, but I have made special trips to Frascati just to get this terrific bread pudding.
author: Brad C.

description:
Update:  I went for dinner on Friday 10/5 and was in white and dark chocolate bread pudding BLISS.  It is so good it's bad.  Bad, bad, bad.  Even my bf, who can coldly look away with indifference from the most delectable of desserts, ate almost half.  I had to keep jabbing him with my spoon to make him stop eating it.  Take my advice - order your own!  Don't share!  This is for reals!!!  As he said, "This is the best dessert I've ever had."  Amen.

Oh, and for main courses, if you are into that kind of thing,  I had the scallops to start and the frutti di mare risotto for main dish, although they are both on the starter list.  Everything was DELICIOUS.  I would have high-fived the chef on the way out but I didn't want to make a spectacle.  Sir, if you are reading this, I salute you.

______________________________________________________
I ate here a year ago and still have great memories of the meal, so I thought it was time to add a positive review.  The service was friendly, efficient, and warm.  The food was delicious.  Most of all, the black and white bread pudding was so unbelievably AMAZING that I still think about it.  Still!  A year later!!  

mmmmmmmmmmm.
author: Dani B.

description: This place is the best, duck and pork loin were awesome and the service is excellent.! You have to go to San Francisco just for this restaurant!
author: Joanne M.

description:
Hands down, best meal I've had in YEARS!

We were in SF vacationing and happened to head here with some friends and friends of friends. The restaurant is in a cute little area, the decor is soft, romantic, light, cozy - it was the most perfect meal experience I've ever had. The wines recommended were stellar as was every single menu item. As we were with a group of 6, we had the opportunity to try quite a few items and I loved every single one of them. You could taste every single ingredient listed for the food, nothing overpowered anything else. The food was light and filling. I had the Waldorf salad - so refreshing. Best dressing I've ever had. And the bread pudding was ridiculously awesome. 

The service was spectacular - homey feeling yet they really knew their stuff. 

This is the reason to move to San Francisco!
author: Kristie M.

description:
OK I give it a 3.5. The food I ordered was good but not great (not sure I'd give it the high zagat rating it has) but everyone else at the table loved theirs, so I'm thinking maybe if I ordered another entree I'd feel differently.

To start with, Russian Hill's a bit hard to get to from the peninsula/south bay but I loved the neighborhood feel of the restaurant. It was just so quaint and comfortable, yet nice. I like the downstairs, small wine bar, and little upstairs area as well. We got a great table at the window. It was fun to watch a cable car come by every once in a while. ;-)

The service was good and unpretentious--I really liked our waitress and all of the staff we interacted with.

Now, the food. Here's what we got as a table:
- Sausage risotto: sausage flavor without huge bits of sausage. I actually couldn't see the sausage but I could taste it. Very yummy
- Gnocchi: seared which interested me, as I've never had it prepared that way. Tender pieces and nice addition of little butternut squash squares and that bit of white truffle oil. 
- Scallops: my dish. Was just ok--it could be cooked just a wee bit less for my taste to give it more of a delicate taste. Also the sauce was just a tad too vinegary if I got a piece that was soaking in it.
- Short ribs: very generous portion and great flavor
- Duck: my dad liked it a lot, I thought it was fine and had a good sauce
- Chicken: pretty much a whole half of a chicken: breast, thigh, wing, etc. I thought it tasted kind of of boring but my mom raved about it. She said it was perfectly cooked and one of the best roast chicken she's ever had. 
- Bread pudding: bit dry on it's own but fantastic hazelnut caramel ice cream!

As a side note, I didn't like the scary steep stairs going down to the super small bathroom. It doesn't affect me patronizing the place, but was a bit odd.

Only other note that I'd take as a con is it was noted it was my bday on the reservation and they didn't even say happy birthday--I like it when they do that. :-( Guess I was spoiled by other restaurants going all out when they know it's a special day but I do like that attention to detail--makes you feel like they care about you as a customer. Since the people were so great there, I wasn't upset but would have been nice.

All in all, nice place and I would consider going back. My faves were the pasta appetizers and I hear you can get full portions of those for an entree so if returned, I'd do that.
author: Eve K.

description:
Came here to ring in 2008 a day before the official NYE madness. We reserved a table a few weeks ahead, requesting one in the small upstairs balcony area since it seemed a little more quiet and cozy. Apart from the occasional loud comments coming from the 4-top table of tipsy cougars-in-training, it was very intimate atmosphere. 

To do our best sampling, we agreed to split a few starter courses, an entre and dessert. We chose the steak tartare and gnocchi to start, which was presented beautifully and tasted great. The gnocchi was simple, cooked with olive oil, rosemary, sage, butternut squash, and maybe some spinach...or other leafy green vegetable that blended nicely into the mix. The tartare was uncooked to perfection, and came with garlic crostini on the side. 

For our second course, the boy had the mixed green salad and I tried the mushroom bisque with truffle oil. While the salad was a bit overly dressed with vinaigrette for my taste, the soup was excellent. I asked for more bread to sop up every last drop. 

We shared the "Earth and Ocean" which was Frascati's version of surf and turf (but with a better and more exotic name.) The "Earth" was a fillet mignon medallion atop creamy polenta, cooked rare (they didn't actually ask us how we liked our steak cooked, but guessed correctly; our order of steak tartare could have given away our preference.) The "Ocean" portion was mouth-watering butter-drenched lobster atop basil angel hair pasta. I'd have to say the Ocean ruled all, and was my favorite part of the entire meal. 

Our dessert was practically selected for us--once we saw our neighbors chocolate bread pudding come out, we knew we wanted the same. The bread pudding was like a mix between velvety chocolate cake and a soft rich brownie. There may have been some ice cream involved but I was too distracted by the chocolate portion. The serving was practically big enough for 4 people to split, but the two of us made sure we didn't have to take a doggy bag. To confirm our choice, the buzzed cougars nearby vocally expressed (several times) how they regretted getting the apple cobbler to the bread pudding based on how decadent it looked. Unfortunately for them, they could only dream of the taste.

Service was impeccable; instead of having one server assigned to our table, the entire staff worked together to go around and make sure every table had what they needed. It was a nice team effort and we never felt rushed or in need of anything. Price wise, it was definitely a splurge, but for 5 courses (1 main), dessert, a couple glasses of wine and a beer, for $120 it was worth it. 

In addition to the excellent food, service and intimate atmosphere, I enjoyed the classiness and humor displayed within the details of the menu. Not every drink menu you find will have a table of contents at the beginning to help guide you through the contents, nor will it list the place of origin for every beverage, including "Bud Light, St. Louis". Gently reminding patrons it's rude to be on your cell phone in a restaurant, they note at the bottom of the food menu, "Cell phones will be confiscated and made into soup." Nothing beats a Cingular soup de jour.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Great customer service; they were getting pretty late on the orders and served us some free potato-mushroom sautee, excellent flavor. Had the lamb, and loved the lamb but wasn't crazy about its accompaniment of slightly raw root vegetables covered in what I think were uncooked pea sprouts, but it had its function in the meal.
I'd recommend the cheese plate even if you're not a fan, or slightly lactose intolerant; I think its a pretty good conversation starter, and if it's a new venturing into the fine ways of the yuppie, even better--it'll be an amusing experience to say the least, though it will make you feel a star more uppity and I don't know if that's in a good way.
Wine... fantastic wine. I don't think any of this food could be paired better than with wine. Definitely more of a "special night out" type of eatery but, the bill matched the experience so thumbs up for that.
author: Jessica L.

description: Came here since the Fancy Dinner group had heard good things and wanted to try.  Apparently we dined here back in November; unfortunately, I don't remember much about the meal except that we were seated upstairs and it was FREEZING.  We were seated beneath a fan and asked to have it turned off, but our server said that the place would get too stuffy if it was turned off :(  I'm disappointed that the meal didn't leave a bigger impression on me; I'm sure everything was cooked well, but I cannot for the life of me recall anything that we ate.  I'm willing to come back here in the future and give it another shot, especially since our experience seems to be abnormal...
author: Mousputin S.

description: I made reservations via the Internet and asked for a window table if possible because I was bringing my cousin.   She left San Francisco 25-30  years ago to live in Arizona and misses San Francisco tremendously.  There were three of us looking forward to evening at Frascati and we were not disappointed.  I am always a little nervous recommending a restaurant but that is never the case with this wonderful spot. They very kindly accommodated my request for a window table. Our dinners were everything I said they would be.  It was a huge success and I shall continue to bring friends and relatives to this very special place.
author: Carolyn D.

description:
Charming restaurant in a lovely neighborhood. The service was extremely friendly and the food was good. 

For appetizers, we ordered the duck confit salad and gnocchi with butternut squash and kale. The salad was superb: a warm salad of spinach, red onion, and delicious pieces of duck. The gnocchi was a little disappointing. It was good but not very memorable. Plus the dish was not warm enough; kind of tasted like it was sitting out for a bit before it was brought out.

For entrees, we ordered the pork chop and the lamb shank. Again, both dishes were not hot enough and tasted as they had been sitting out. The pork was a little dry. The bacon infused broccolini it came with was very smoky and flavorful. My lamb shank was very tender and tasty.

The desserts were excellent. We ordered the black and white chocolate bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream. It was to die for. We also got the afforgato - hot espresso poured over rich vanilla ice cream. Both were excellent but the bread pudding was particularly delicious.

On the whole, I would rate the food a 3.5. However, the lively and cozy atmosphere, great service, and superb dessert places Frascati in the 4 star range.
author: Jenny K.

description:
One word: Burata. I'm in love with the Burata (fresh mozzerella) with apricot-basil chutney. Heaven.

But wait, there's more: The gnocchi really is exceptional (though this last time was maybe a little too tough--on other visits, it has been divinely soft and perfectly flavored). 

The wine selection is exactly what you would expect from a restaurant like this (Who serves a white Grenache? amazing!) The service is unpretentious. Bread pudding = drool.

Please Frascati, don't ever change.
author: Katie K.

description:
Came here with the 'rents on one of their visits to SF.  My dad almost died when he saw the check.  So expensive, and none of us thought the food was worth it.  We had tried to go to 1550 but missed our reservation because of the parking situation and they were less than accomodating ("yes, dad, i know it's only 5 minutes away but unless you want to take a cab then we need to leave 10 minutes ago!").  

so we went to frascati, and the fact that they were able to squeeze us in at 7:00 on a saturday without too long of a wait is why I'm giving them 4 stars instead of 3.  Thank you so much!  I did think the food was overrated, but maybe I need to give it another try?
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Frascati is perfection...definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the city.
I've been there a few times, and it has never fallen short of 5 stars. The service is fabulous. Each server I've had there has been attentive, personable, and extremely knowledgeable of their dishes and wine. 
The food...oh God, where do I begin? Everything I've had there has been melt in your mouth delicious. Be sure not to skip dessert...
All in all, Frascati is the perfect romantic neighborhood spot.
author: Brianne K.

description:
* friendly tip: come early (@ 5:30) because if you wait until 6 or later, you may not get a seat. Yes, even on a week day.

What a wonderful meal! Had dinner here 2 weeks ago- sorry for the delay! Will definitely return!

We ate:

-White Peach Salad- with ricotta salata over arugula (perfectly in season and more delicious than you'd think it could be!)
-Russet Potato Gnocchi -with Butternut Squash, Black Trumpet Mushrooms, Brown Butter and White Truffle Oil (best gnocchi in U.S.)
-Asparagus- with bacon, poached egg (just o.k.)

-Pan seared Chicken (best pan seared chix I've had, but not life changing)
-Halibut (flippin delicious!)

-Bread Pudding (pretty good, very rich)
 
We sat at the window and I liked waiving to the tourists on the cable car, bc they TOTALLY smile and wave back. Fabulous!
author: cali c.

description:
Not much more to say that hasn't been said in other reviews.  

It was my first time here so I went with the Gnocchi for appetizers and the Duck for the main course.   The pinot noir from northvalley by the glass complimented my dishes.  Next time I'm getting the chicken!!
author: Karena L.

description:
I took my mom here over Easter weekend, so my memory is kinda fuzzy about this place.  What I do remember is that we had an appetizer that was excellent.  I had the duck and that was good, however it was a tad too sweet for me.  I definitely prefer my main course to be savory.  The dessert however was absolutely to die for.  We had the chocolate bread pudding thing and I seriously cannot say enough about this dessert.  You must have this if you go here.  

BTW I will definitely be  going back shortly (its only 3 doors down from my place) and trying some of the other entrees.
author: Nick H.

description:
I will start this by saying this might be my favorite restaurant in SF! I know I know that's a bold statement especially since I have dined at some of the best spots this culinary driven town has to offer. However I had dinner there while I was in town a few weeks ago and once again I was blown away with everything from the food to the service and especially the ambiance of the room and the way the staff executes the entire experience. My date who is also in the restaurant business was just delighted over the service and especially the food.
The charcuterie was divine, the grilled bread salad was so good that as always I considered ordering it again to accompany my entree.
Thank you Frascati for continuing to be one of the best that SF has to offer. I can't wait till when I move back to the city and can become a regular of this fine establishment.
author: Bill H.

description: i enjoyed my first visit to Frascati b/c the food was tasty, the waiters were attentive and the atmosphere was relaxing. The reason why I'm not giving the restaurant 5 stars is b/c my date and I reeked of oil due to the open kitchen. So if you do plan to visit, be sure not to wear your favorite shirt =P
author: Alfonzo J.

description:
The food was great - we had the duck confit salad, the gnocchi starter, and the rack of lamb and tagliatelle with boar entrees.  Chocolate bread pudding for dessert, and an excellent bottle of wine.  Since we were eating so early (post matinee dinner at 5:45...hello, early bird special!), we got a great table for 2 in the front window, and so were able to watch the neighborhood and cable cars pass by.

What really pushed what would have been a 4 star review over the top was the service - I still have no clue what the front of house hierarchy here was, because everyone was lovely, helpful, friendly, and genuinely seemed pleased to have us there.  They all wanted to know what wine we chose, what dessert we had, etc., and told us a little about their favorites.  As well, the host/sommelier/head waiter (there seemed to be 2 of these gentleman there), had exceptional wine knowledge, and helped us choose a great bottle.

Romantic, cozy, and felt like a special occasion.  Plus, half the people who walked in seemed to know the staff, whether from repeat visits or from real life, so that's always a good sign.  Definitely a must try!
author: Shannon H.

description: The food and service here is truly spectacular! Your basic cozy cute neighborhood place but ramped up numerous notches. Two very classy Ladies who took care of us reminded me of Donna Rosa-and that's a huge azz compliment! I loved everything from the chewy Burrata and Tomato, Stone Fruit Bruschetta, Broiled Sardines, Watermelon Salad, Pork Chop, super delicious Wine options and Dessert-Panna Cotta OMFG. Great Service and super cute restaurant.
author: Karen W.

description:
One of the top 45 restaurants in SF, hands down!

Great date place, superb service, and the food is fantastic!

I am not usually a dessert guy, but leave room for the bread pudding - it's unreal.
author: J B.

description:
This place is good, but not great. 

I can tell Frascati puts a lot of effort into unique culinary inventions, but I didn't find a signature dish I was in love with.

Solid food, a little higher of a price point what I would have typically liked, but still a good place to go to.
author: Dan Q.

description:
Delicious!

I brought my my here when she came to visit me and we had an unbelievable experience.  Our table was ready when we walked in and we sat upstairs.  It is really elegant without being overdone in a cozy sort of way.  Just my type of place.

We ordered a delicious bottle of wine with the recommendation of our really helpful server.  We split the fig appetizer!  That was probably one of my favorites of the meal because it was full of flavor!  The balsamic was also great but the figs and the way they were cooked just blew me away!  The next course we had was the heirloom tomato salad.  Also, so fresh.  They really tasted like a tomato!  Next was our main course.  Although my mushroom risotto was good, it was not nearly as amazing as the chicken!  My mom couldn't stop talking about it for the rest of the weekend.  That really was quite a treat.  Frascati knows how to make a pretty tasty chicken!  Finally, dessert.  We ordered a fruit dessert which was also lovely.

Honestly, this place is a treat.  I can't wait to go back and enjoy some figs and a great place to dine out!
author: Cara D.

description:
I had heard the hype on this place and decided to try it out for myself.  After trying, my honest assessment is - it was a''ight.  I mean, don't get me wrong, nothing was offensive (except for the strawberry shortcake but more on that later...) but nothing was as grand as I thought it would be, which was just plain disappointing.

Started w/ the gnocchi and the risotto - which are the reason this place gets three starts.  It was GREAT.  Both had great flavors and left me wanting more.  I was excited for the main courses at that point.

I had the salmon, my boyfriend the steak.  Very disappointed in both - the bites were inconsistent and didn't make sense.  I wouldn't order either ever again.

Then came dessert, and yes, I may be biased (the boyfriend is a pastry chef) BUT seriously...the strawberry shortcake was disgusting.  It had, literally, a huge chunk of BUTTER just sitting on top.  The chocolate bread pudding was a bit better - but I think we had the end piece because it was a little tough and dry.
author: Jen L.

description:
One of my top 3 toughest parking experiences, ever.
This one ranks up there with the Mission district attempt of '02... or the Marina fiasco of '04.

This is a brutal neighborhood to find parking.  There are a dearth of parking lots or garages, and the locals viciously protect their territory like rabid dogs.  This is one location I'd seriously consider taking public transit for.

We had a sweet gnocchi starter and I enjoyed the lamb immensely.  Ended dinner with a great artisanal cheese plate which you can choose as a starter if you so desire.

The space is pretty small and kinda narrow, but they make do with what they got.
author: Gracie-C Y.

description:
Simply perfection and I LOOOOOOOOOVE this place.

I find that I have discriminating taste, and this quaint restaurant met and fulfilled, all expectations. I wanted to order everything on the simple, yet appetizing, menu. 

What we did order was exceptional (although I do have to admit that I've had slightly better duck breast elsewhere). Full and bold flavors without a pretentious overtone. Their gnocci appetizer was the best I've ever had...my mouth starts watering just thinking about it. This restaurant easily makes my Top 10 in the City.
author: Reina M.

description: This place is wonderful. Please take this from a San Franciscan...this was nicely priced, food is great and get this, The Service Is Excellent! We had the window seat was great to take in the cable car and the people walking by. If you want a dinner that is perfectly priced and so good at every level, please try this place.
author: LanceDanCraig G.

description:
For those who claim this is a neighborhood restaurant, cha-ching! You guys must be living the high-life. The food is solid, admittedly, but you pay the price. For an average of $24-$29 an entree, you could splurge at some of the city's top restaurants.

Reservations were not hard to get (called 3 hours ahead for a 7 pm time slot on a Friday night). Food was fine, but nothing I would rave about to any of my friends. For better Italian food for similar prices, i would recommend Perbacco or Quince. Among our party, we had the bread salad (do not order if you've tried the bread & chicken combo at Zuni Cafe!), sea scallops, soft shell crab, halibut, lamb, & pasta. Nothing stood out, although nothing was horrible. However, for the price and the culinary options available in SF, save your $$.
author: Carolyn F.

description:
Frascati's has a nice atmosphere and the food is good - as is the service!
will be back for sure!
author: M M.

description:
Frascati is a great date restaurant.  I wouldn't call it a destination restaurant.  But if you live in Russian Hill, this could easily become a twice a week place for you.  The restaurant feels small and intimate with soft lighting.  The service was fast and attentive.  The bartender recommended a French wine that I enjoyed very much.  While our server's recommendations were good, he comically repeated an identical description of his favorites to the table next to us, word for word.  

The food here is excellent especially for the price.  Frascati is not cheap.  But, the quality is very high and I generally find myself paying a lot more for comparable quality.  We started our meal with two types of crostini and brussel sprouts.  I am not normally a fan of brussel sprouts, but they were perfectly tender and sweet.  One of the crostini was topped with a reduction of figs and melted cheese.  The other was topped with stone fruit.  Both were excellent although I could have used a touch more salt.

My main course was a skate wing over some wilted greens.  It was perfectly seasoned.  Soft, tender.  Perfectly cooked.  Delicious.  I traded halfway through the meal with my girlfriend, who ordered the pork chop.  Her dish was also good.  But, if they have the skate on the menu, you should definitely order it.  The pork chop was well-cooked and a little rare near the bone.  But, the sauce did not compliment the pork very well.  It was like a hoisin glaze.  The flavor was a little sweet and it seemed overly reduced.  I could have done with a milder sauce and more of it.  But, the accompanying sides were very good and almost made up for the tasty but forgettable pork chop.  Our friends had the halibut over a tomato soup with shellfish and a half chicken.  The chicken was great.  The halibut was a little under-seasoned and could have used a little aioli or other fat to tie the dish together.  

We finished the meal with two desserts.  First, we had a bread pudding that was topped with a very flavorful hazelnut ice cream.  It was a little dense, but the flavor was nice.  The second dessert was a berry crumble topped with vanilla ice cream.  i was skeptical when it was ordered, but next to the skate, it was the highlight of the meal.  the flavor was very bright and deep.  The crumble topping was perfectly sweet and salty accenting the flavor of the berries.  the ice creams were great.  They are all house-made and had very delicate textures.  

In all, for the three courses, we paid $50 each.  It was totally worth it.  The food was delicious, the setting was lovely and the service was excellent.
author: Andrew W.

description: Had a great dinner, once again at Frascati.  Great place to take customers/clients and impress them.  Great food, warm ambiance, cute neighborhood and with the  cable car out front, it's really pretty impressive.   It's my "go-to" favorite restaurtant in all SF.
author: Dan B.

description: WOW WOW WOW.  Everything about this place was spectacular.  Exquisitely delicious food, attentive but not overbearing service, comfortable atmosphere.  Frutti d mare risotto made some serious waves through my taste buds. I also tried the roast chicken which was tender, juicy, and plenty flavorful.  Definitely not a kid-friendly place (to the post(s) about an experience with children at this restaurant, while there is never any excuse for poor service especially at this type of establishment, really, what were you thinking bringing your kids?!), and certainly on the fancier side.  As the thousand posts before me note, it's a great place for a date, and I think the menu was prepared for such--we ordered the bruschetta and received 2 pieces of bread for a party of 3.  The waitress was also sure to keep us updated on the AWESOME Giants game! Sweet.
author: Laura C.

description:
We just had dinner here for my birthday.  It was great.  For starters, our waitress looked like Isis from the 1970s Saturday morning TV show so I was feeling happy from the start.  This put me in a throw-back mood, and lets face it---this place is a throwback to the San Francisco I remember from 30 years ago, back when the city was full of unpretentious small neighborhood restaurants.  

We split the gnocchi appetizer, which was delicious.  We followed this with salads.  I had the octopus salad--another hit, with lots of meaty octopus and tasty chorizo that gave it a little kick.  As an entree, the papardelle with sugo was just perfect, and to finish it off, the bread pudding was as good as all the reviews say it is.

This was an excellent choice for a night out in the big city.
author: Patty P.

description:
things that I need to accomplish in my life: consume more frascati bread pudding and the spring gnocchi with truffle oil...

Just had dinner here again last night and its just as wonderful as it's always been.  Honestly, much better food than Jardiniere at half the price.  What more need be said?
author: Kosuke I.

description:
YUM. it's funny, I have heard about Frascati for the longest time and I went for the first time a couple of Sundays ago.

We walked in, me in shorts and cowboy boots and my dining companion prob had a green down jacket on, casual as ever, without a reservation. I was expecting a cold reception but were promptly seated.

We started with the gnocci. I have had better gnocci (at Zuni oddly enough) but the delectable flavored sauce made up for the somewhat dense potato dumplings.  I had the scallops and my companion had the duck...The scallops were quite good and the duck was yummy (and a generous serving size).

We had a bottle of the Rafanelli (VERY hard to find in a restaurant) and a wonderful Sunday comfort supper. 

NOTE: I liked the mixture of clientele and ambiance. There was a family of four, some double dates, older couples, younger couples, etc...it was not too stuffy but service was precise and food was served hot. It was not overly casual and loud or quiet and subdued. NIcely done.
author: Hilary H.

description:
I love House. One of my friends who raves about House also raved about this place, so I knew I had to try it.

The restaurant itself is small and cosy in a good way. Went there on a Sunday evening around 7:30pm and street parking was impossible to find. We ended up parking at a garage half a block down ($4/hr...so I guess you can view it as valet for $8 for dinner).

Food: 
- Wild Mushroom Bruschetta: YUMMY! Bread is perfectly crunchy with a lot of mushrooms on top. Salty and a little sweet / tangy at the same time. Flavors are intense, but good to have on bread.
- Maple Leaf Duck Breast: 2 pieces of duck breast on a plate of mushrooms, some dark / red salty / sweet sauce. I promise you there was a lot of butter, but this was amazing. It was a tad salty for my palate so I had to eat some bread to neutralize my tongue, but this was a solid dish despite this!
- Pan Seared Branzino: At first, i thought this was lighter than the duck breast, but by the end, I wasn't so sure. The fish was perfectly cooked (soft) with small mushrooms on top and a cream sauce. There was some form of delicious mashed potatoes or polenta on the bottom. This dish was also solid, but I think a little heavy on the cream (for my palate). Maybe I eat too much bland food
- Hot chocolate: Delicious. Tasted "fresh"

I'm definitely coming here again and trying more off their menu! They have a funny disclaimer at the bottom of the menu along the lines of "cell phone usage will result in your cell phone being used to make a soup".

We were too full to try desert. We left a few morsels on our dinner plates because were were so full, and the waitress remarked that she wasn't sure if we were done eating because the plates are usually scraped clean. I thought that was interesting / funny.
author: Julia L.

description:
After *almost* going to Allegro Romano, we were SO HAPPY that we found Frascati instead -- incredible food, warm ambiance, fantastic service, extensive wine list.  This place had everything we were looking for, and we will definitely be back.

We had the butternut squash and gnocchi appetizer, duck confit / spinach / dried cherry salad, wild boar ragu with pappardelle, and the pan roasted chicken.  Every single dish was to die for.  Even though we were full, we couldn't resist ordering the chocolate bread pudding to share.  We were seated upstairs, and as we were sipping our tea we suddenly smelled delicious, intense chocolate aroma rising from the kitchen.  Sure enough, when the dessert arrived it was the most wonderful dessert we'd eaten all year.  Plus they were nice enough to substitute the chocolate pistachio ice cream for me, since I'm allergic to hazelnuts.

If you are a "foodie" looking for a warm, neighborhood, romantic, comfortable place for a fabulous dinner, this is the spot.  If you are looking for a fancy, name brand, large, loud, "hip spot," this isn't it.

Plenty of tables for 2, as well as 4 or 6 or more.  ALL of the waiters and staff were very charming, polite, energetic.  Several of them were also very cute, and we enjoyed watching one table of 5 or 6 young women having fun flirting with their waiters.  Our two waiters must have come upstairs 5 times just to check and see how we liked our food.  Our waiter also suggested a wonderful champagne that we loved, when the prosecco that we originally ordered was unavailable.

All this, plus, the cable car stops right out front at the corner, and you can jump on and catch a ride home, if you had wine or champagne with your meal!

Buon Appetito!
author: Kyrie R.

description:
Excellent food, great service. The upstairs room is definitely the place to be. I originally planned to go over New Years, but they surprised me by raising the cost of their fixed price menu, so I delayed until things were more reasonable. 

It's a very romantic location, and two couples got engaged at other tables while we were there. One couple was so excited that they were making out at the table, and he even licked her ring. It was a little much, but the food made up for it.
author: Jesse E.

description:
What is there to say except. Fantastic. My girlfriend took me here for my birthday and it was too good.  The atmosphere, service , originality, and quality of food was all good.  Listen I am not a dessert person or a chocolate junkie but the chocolate bread pudding was incredible.  Almost like a soft brownie with hazelnut ice cream on the side.  It is huge and if I did not have to share would have wolfed down the whole thing.  Everything from the coffee to the wine was great. Only set back was the tiny bathroom which I will not blame them for cause they are of the area.  The toliet was still neat clean and comfortable, just tight.  ha ha

Great date place but a bit pricey but worth it.  So if you got some extra bucks check it out.  i won't even get specific about the food cause it was all so good so i am sure everything there is. They paid alot of attention to quality and orginal dishes.
author: Bucky W.

description:
The boyfriend took me here for my birthday dinner, after having a particularly crappy birth-day. Frascati almost instantly cheered me up! The waiter was sweet, the grilled bread salad fantastic (even my non-vegetable eating dinner companion ate it!). I had the filet mignon, and it was so good I wanted to cry. I tried a bite of chicken as well, and it literally melted in my mouth. Chicken can do that??? We shared that oh-so-famous bread pudding for dessert. The hazelnut ice cream was excellent, but there were a few bites of bread pudding that were stale, but once you got to the warm and rich chocolatey spot... yum.

An added bonus, I loved watching the chefs cooking from my table. Can I eat here every day, please?
author: Nicole z.

description:
The people here know what it takes to run a top notch restaurant. Every person who walks through their doors gets treated like royalty. That's right. No attitude!! Amazing...and the food..let's just say I would eat anything they brought out and I don't even eat red meat.
Go early, cause parking is a bitch and get ready to settle in. They don't turn tables quickly. It's all about the patron at Frascati.
author: M S.

description:
What a gem! Beautiful and lovely decor, and such a romantic atmosphere during candlelit dinner. Gnocchi with mushrooms are unique and to die for, roasted chicken with potatoes and artichoke was juicy and fulfilling, and chocolate bread pudding with ice cream - a beautiful ending to a superb meal. Amazing place!

The only thing is the bread in a basket was cold.. a warm bread would have been a final touch to a masterpiece.
author: Anya B.

description:
The setting is cozy, the food is fabulous, and the visitors tend to be on the older side (35-40+). My chicken breast was probably amongst the best I've ever had - and believe me, I've eaten all kinds of chicken.

The chocolate cake, however, was questionable. One, it was a little too sweet for my taste, but I've never been into sweets. Two, there were two strands of what appeared to be white hair; could've been overcooked fiber though. Didn't complain - I trust a restaurant like Frascati wouldn't dare pull something like that.

Time: dinner
Food: chicken breast, chocolate cake
Price: $40 after tax and tips, no wine
author: Jack W.

description: The restaurant was really good and service was great. The waiter really recommended the chicken as "the best". Pretty close. Very juicy and tasty. Would eat there again.
author: Andy T.

description:
I've been here a few times. The last time I went back we had easily one of the most memorably bad experiences ever. The waiter tried VERY hard to push chicken on us, as if our party of 3 were at the Legionaires conference in Boca Raton and they were all out of the lasagna. I would never eat chicken at a restaurant, or pasta, the easiest things to make at home.

Then we proceeded to wait for our food, and waited, and waited, and waited and waited. Meanwhile we sat in front of the drafty and cold entrance, and despite the fact that the restaurant was empty they wouldn't let us to move.I wore my my wool coat and scarf over my very inadequate dress and panty hosed legs, and my boyfriend's gallant pleading failed to persuade them to let us switch to one of the open tables. My mother was equally uncomfortable.

There is one tiny restroon here and it is perched in the middle of a flight of stairs that descend to the kitchen. A cook zipped in ahead of me, so I waited. And waited. And waited. Finally the cook left the bathroom and I went in. No toilet paper and no paper towels. Trying to banish from my head the memory of that Seinfeld episode where Seinfeld refused to eat because the cook arranges his crotch but doesn't wash his hands after he goes to the bathroom,  I went on a little hunt. No spare roll in the bathroom, not even in the little box on top of the toilet. None in the disgusting little closet down the stairs that holds the mop bucket. 

And we waited, and waited and waited, in the freezing cold, mostly empty restaurant. Finally our food came. Two of the plates were burning hot, as though they sat under the heat lamps too long. The lamb chop plate was stone cold.  So two overdone dinners and one pair of raw lamb chops, all slabs of unaccompanied, unadorned meat on plates.   


All in all, a very high price to pay for a thoroughly unpleasant experience.  The place was still empty when we left, so maybe this is the effect of a change of ownership. I would give zero stars if it were an option, and we will never, ever, go back.
author: jen n.

description:
It had been a while since my boyfriend and I had had a meal this delicious . Frascati is everything a beautiful restaurant should be; great food, ambiance and crowd. 

We started with the "fois gras with apple compote",very delicious, the apple and raisons complemented the fois gras very well.  For our entrees, I had the "paperdelle with pork sagu" and my boyfriend had the "filet mignon". Both dishes were melt in your mouth amazing. We finished it off with the black and white bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream on top which was moist, sooo tasty and made you wanting another piece.

Everything about this restaurant is soo well done, I would definitely come back and want to bring my friends and family.
author: Jaclyn B.

description: This is hands down my favorite nice dinner place. period. Ok, at least as of today. Everything on their menu is amazing! My friends and I started with the foie gras torchon, potato gnocchi, and smoked trout salad. For main courses we had the roasted chicken, pork chop, fettuccine , and duck breast. Everything was cooked perfectly, good sized portions, tasty, and flavorful...I'm actually drooling just trying to recount the experience; it really doesn't matter what you get, just pick your protein. We had the bread pudding for dessert. I was delightfully surprised to find that it comes with a heaping scoop of hazelnut ice cream on top (maybe next time Swenson's)! Perfect meal with friends, great service, delicious food. Couldn't have asked for a better dining experience. I can't wait to go back!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Excellent service.  You know, that's in those occasions, when food is good, like home, and you just feel right, with a waitress not too serious yet very professional, that you truly have a great dining experience, right?  Frascati's got the whole package.
The gnocchis and the plate of rillettes and ham for starters set the tone right away.  The rack of lamb was perfectly lean and meaty, the pork chop was moist and crispy on the edge, the seabass was great. Yes, we ate a lot.  The side vegetables are well taken care of, too, which shows that the chef made his homework and considered the dish in its entirety.  Perfect.
Expect a very rich chocolate cake for dessert and very sweet pineapple profiteroles. Over the top to my taste.
Corkage fees are waived for your bottles for each one purchased.
author: Damien J.

description: Frascati has reliably excellent food, good service, and a nice atmosphere. I hold back the fifth star only because it is priced according. It's not overpriced, but it's no bargain. It would be hard to stay under $100 for a dinner for two including tip.
author: Geoff R.

description:
Everything we had, we all tasted and enjoyed.  
Gnocchi, Duck Confit Salad, Watermelon Salad, Salmon, Sweet Corn Risotto, Pork Chop and Chicken.  Some wine and beer.  Unfortunately, no room for desert. 

Strongly Recommend.
author: Jar E.

description: If you can get a table upstairs by the balcony, do it...you get to see everthing being made in the kitchen. Fun stuff.  If not, go anyway. I don't usually give five stars. Great food and service. A little pricey but worth it. Pork chop is hard to beat.
author: Scott P.

description:
I had just signed for a place in the neighbourhood and as we walked down the street we popped in to Frascati and got a table right away (now this was like 7pm on a Friday so either the Gods love me and I truly AM the chosen one (which is something I strongly believe is the case) - OR they had gotten a recent cancellation).

The table is small (too small for 'the chosen one') and we have a hard time fitting bread, glasses and two appetizers on it at the same time. But I'm being picky.... The food was good. I remember having the bass. Nice atmosphere and very friendly staff.

The fact that they recognized the true, divine values cleverly disguised by my earthly shape rendered them an additional star.
author: Rich S.

description: 5 Stars!  Had dinner here at the beginning of May with my friend Gary.  We had spent the day hiking around the City and wanted to grab a bite to eat.  We were warmly greeted when we walked in and sat immediately, even though it was Saturday early evening and we didn't have a reservation.  Started with an excellent salad and gnocchi.  And the meal kept getting better.  Service was excellent and beautiful (worth it just to go back for that).  Definitely going to keep Frascati in mind as a "go to" joint for excellent Italian food in an intimate setting.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Frascati's charm couldn't be more quintessentially San Francisco. An intimate setting in storied Russian Hill, the neighborhood bistro overlooks Hyde street with its classic cable cars rolling by. With so much character, Frascati makes a perfect spot for entertaining out of town guests. Here were some of the highlights from my most recent visit.

Cheese plate: 
A rotating curation of local and international delights.  We tried the Humbolt Fog from Cypress Grove in Northern California and the Bayley Hazen Blue from Vermont. A thoughtful pairings of fig, apricot, quince paste, nuts and local honey elevated the flavors.

First course:
Next came the russet potato gnocchi with melted leeks, roasted squash, mushrooms and sage, all finished with a drizzle of white truffle oil. The gnocchi are hand wrapped fresh every day to picture perfect little pillows that melt in your mouth.

Entrée: 
I ordered the Maple Leaf duck breast with herbed spätzle, baby spinach and huckleberry gastrique. The duck was perfectly cooked and the accompaniments brought textural balance and harmony to the dish. I did yearn for a bit more acid from the gastrique, but a nice of Napa Valley Cab rounded it out. The maple glaze on the duck added the perfect bit of crunch.

Dessert:
The house specialty is Frascati's famous Warm Black and White Chocolate Bread Pudding, served with hazelnut ice cream, caramel and chocolate sauce. Our waiter rightly cautioned us to save room and we were so glad we did. Truly a show stopper of a dish.
author: Leah Y.

description:
One of my fave places to eat in San Francisco.  The menu is seasonal Italian with a California flair.  They change the menu daily so you are not bored.  They also offer a wine suggestion to pair with your food.  I have had an incredible watermelon salad here, some nice cold soups, good fish and pasta dishes as well as nicely prepared meats.  There is a secret about one of the tables here which makes the place very San Francisco to me.  You will have to eat here a lot and get to know the place to learn.

One drawback, it is always crowded and difficult to get a table here.  Most places are pretty accommodating but Frascati maintains the too cool for Apple vibe, even though I have eaten here like a million and one times.  It is always a toss between 1550 Hyde and Frascati.  1550 Hyde loves Apple therefore Apple loves 1550 Hyde.  Back in high school, I always picked the boy who brought me the flowers over the one who didn't call.  I like to employ the same philosophy on places to eat.

Another thing, sometimes they close the entire restaurant for private parties.  Best to call ahead.
author: apple r.

description:
*****3.5stars******
The good - Brussels Sprouts, Pan-fried Chicken, Latte, and deserts
The okay - Rabbit Fuselli, gnocchi (extremely small portion)
The not so great - Swordfish, ughh completely uninspired, the crazy talkative manic waiter.

I think this place is hit or miss.
author: Tamar N.

description:
UPDATE: My BF and I came here last night for a belated Vday celebration. Dinner was wonderful. I started with the mixed green salad. My BF had the mushroom bisque and it was really creamy and delicious. For my entree, I had the pork chop with mixed vegetables with bacon. The chop was heavenly! Thick, moist and so yummy. The bf had the swordfish, which was also really good. The bread pudding is STILL the winner. It was even better than I remembered it!!


Note: This review is just based off the warm black and white bread pudding.

FANTASTIC!!! Yum.... the bread pudding here is exactly what everyone raves about. It's slightly different from your typical BP. It's a lot more denser in texture. Not crispy or mushy... It went perfect with the hazel nut ice cream and chocolate sauce. 

I'm definitely coming back to try dinner and to get the BP again.
author: Denise L.

description:
A beautiful experience with impeccable tastes - the homemade gnocchi was delish and plump, the confit salad was rich and melts in your mouth, the roast chicken was a meal fit for a last supper, the homemade fetticini with anchovy pesto and seafood was amazing. The seabass was cooked perfectly, but could have used some more flavor - it was outshown by all other dishes. The bread pudding needs some kind of sauce, it was too dry and brownie-like for a good bread pudding. I would suggest white chocolate sauce with a hint of alcohol... The wine is incredible and the choices are impressive. Service was something to be admired. It's always nice feeling like your table is the VIP when the manager comes over to check in and say hello. 

Bravo.
author: Erin M.

description:
4.5 Delicious Stars!

Thursday night (2006/10/12) was not a night for an over-the-top indulgent foodie heaven dinner (read: I avoided sending myself into a self-induced food coma by not having the much praised bread pudding for dessert, but I will... just wait, I will!) but instead the second-stage rocket launch of a lovely, romantic evening.  Frascati glows from within with a combination of professional, solicitous service and the confidence of VERY well executed food in a comfortable environment.  Although the noise level's pretty high, it's manageable.  The tables along the side are pretty close together, but that's de riguer everywhere now. We were seated at a table in one of the front window bays so that helped with conversation for me.  The crowd looked like a combination of couples, neighborhood denizens and small groups of good friends out to celebrate the weekend - a happy unselfconscious crowd.

TLFC had the grilled bread salad with white beans, cucumbers, kalamata olives, red onion, feta cheese and champagne vinaigrette, followed by the charcuterie platter.  I had the mission figs with goat cheese prosciutto, balsamic reduction over something of a bready-toasty nature (this is a wonderful dish!) followed by the double cut pork chop, vinegar-y (but not too much so) peppers, tomatoes, polenta and broccoli rabe.  The slight bitterness of the broccoli rabe contrasted nicely with the polenta, but unfortunately it was a little too tough.  The pork was perfect - meaty tasting but tender. Our meal was accompanied by a fruity Spanish Rioja.

I'm glad I found Frascati - I'll definitely go back.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Okay, they've got enough reviews so my opinion will be marginalized in all the stars they receive.  Let me just start by saying my date was cutting her filet with her fork.  No, she doesn't lack etiquette; she's nothing but class.  She was merely making a point.  After I told her about the best tasting and softest filet mignon I ate at Citronelle in DC (where you could cut it with a butter knife), she proceeded to demonstrate the perfection at Frascati.

The service was top rate.  They're attentive but discrete.  We arrived 2 hours early since our previous plans fell through, so we killed time at Bacchus up the street based on the recommendation of our host.  Once he called to inform me of the table I requested was available (how many top tier restaurants offer such personalized service), we were promptly seated.

The food was good, even though my stomach was a little upset later in the night.  Wasn't sure if it was the duck; but if the volume of food we ate after we filled up on the cheese plate at Bacchus is a reflection of the quality of food at Frascati, then the food was outstanding.  Of course, we didn't eat dessert.  I mean, we're not gluttons.
author: Edward K.

description: This could possibly be the BEST restaurant in San Fran. I've been coming to the city for 16 years and have enjoyed some of the best the city has to offer and Frascati is a true stand out. Every one at our table was impressed w/ their order. I had the rabbit risotto and two other had the chicken. You might say, "Chicken?...really?" Seriously, the chicken is that good. The appetizers and deserts were just as good. We all made plans to meet back here next year. I can't wait!
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Let me give you an example of how good the service is at this place:  we order a number of appetizers to share and then entrees and then someone says "let's get the cheese plate for after dinner."  This seems like a reasonable, if ambitious, request, but it's early, and we all go along.  Of course, we are way too full after the delectable gnocchi, grilled bread salad (deceptively good) and excellent entrees.  (I had the steak, which was great, there were raves for the risotto, the pork tenderloin and the duck as well).

When we frantically attempted to cancel the cheese plate order before it arrived, the waiter tells us that he never wrote it down, because he knew we'd never want it.  If it was true, great.  If it was a lie, even better.
author: Matthew R.

description: I don't know if I've ever written a review for this place.   However, I have to say - this place continues to impress.  The food is outstanding. They have a good wine list.  The service is impeccable, and the ambiance - killer.  This is a GREAT date place.  It is also great for taking the parents when they are in town.  Across the street is a cute little wine bar called Bacchus - amazing wine selection.  I highly suggest Frascati for dinner (Did I mention that their dessert is excellent as well?  As is their lattes, etc, this place seriously consistently does everything right)   then Bacchus for a nightcap.  You won't be disappointed.  I recommend making a reservation - especially on a weekend - this place isn't huge...
author: andrea w.

description:
Bravo Frascati. If you want to dine in a charming upscale neighborhood spot, then search no further. 

I would venture to categorize it in the: perfect for the parents, the first date, the anniversary, the promotion, the going away, the getting married, the take the boss/client out to dinner restaurant of Russian Hill. 

The food is excellently prepared in an open kitchen.  Seasonal menu, local ingredients, and regional dishes. Great wine list. Friendly professional front of the house experience. 

Dining in the mezzanine lends itself to the opportunistic voyeur. Larger table in back is perfect for a sizable party.
author: Johnny H.

description: Pretty decent american food.  I would have expected more innovation for the price (3.5 stars).
author: Elijah M.

description:
Upon a recent recommendation from a client of my wife's, we tried Frascati for the first time this past Saturday evening (3/17). Of course, it didn't occur to me, for some strange reason, that it was St/ Patty's Day so getting a cab proved somewhat challenging. However, as has been stated in at least one other review, there was absolutely no problem with us arriving a few minutes late for our reservation (also made on OpenTable).

Before getting down to the food, I should mention that the Frascati is just a great place; it has a wonderful feel with the way it's laid out and decorated and, well, you just can't beat the area it's in on a nice day. Further, I should also mention that the service at Frascati was excellent.

OK, now on to the food ... we started with the steak tar-tare, which was very good. I do not see it listed on the current menu that's on the website, so hopefully (for our collective sake) the site is simply a little out-of-date. Second, our server suggested we might want a salad in between our appetizer and entrees, so we decided to have the mixed green salad. In the incarnation we had, this included kumquats and a pomegranate vinaigrette; this was simply delicious and also an excellent palate cleanser before our mains.

Lastly, for our mains, I went with the duck which, at the time, included mushrooms and huckleberry. Now, I'm not always a huge duck fan; it can be overly rich and fatty (in my humble opinion). However, this not only did not give me this impression, but overall it was an incredibly well balanced dish; I would not hesitate to order the duck here again on a return visit. My wife went with the capellini with prawns which was also very good and had a tomato-based sauce with just the right amount of spice.

In summary, our experience at Frascati was great and I'm certain we will be back. I can simply say; Wow, another great restaurant around the Hyde-Union area (Zarzuella, 1550 Hyde, Luella to name a few)!
author: Matthew S.

description:
Four stars for being able to impress the hell out of an Italian food hater like myself.  Although there's not much point in spelling out the appetizer and entree that managed to knock my socks off since the menu changes seasonally, I'll do it anyway in the spirit of full disclosure.  

The appetizer was delicious duck rillette and balsamic vinegared onion served on crostini.  I did not take exception to the fact that there is nothing Italian about this dish (it's a French pate-styled spread).

The entree was the most tender roasted half chicken served on a bed of fingerling potatoes and vegetables - so tender and moist that the white meat actually tasted like a normal chicken's dark meat (aside from being an Italian food hater, I am also a white meat hater so serving up a white meat dish that I actually enjoy is a feat).  While enjoying my food I was briefly toying with the idea that the chicken was somewhat a mutant - there's no way a normal free range chicken could taste that good, have such a tender texture, and be so freakishly small. 

One additional extra star for accommodating the six of us with less than 2 hours advanced notice.
author: Ange L.

description: This is a great neighborhood restaurant! I passed this place several times before I had the chance to go here for dinner with a friend of mine and I wish I had more excuses to go here. The ambiance is cozy and a little calmer than what you tend to get at some of the larger more centrally located restaurants. The food was good. I spent more money than I normally would but I hope to go back on occasion.
author: Lauren B.

description: A quaint place with excellent food and service. Right off the Hyde cable car line if you don't want to worry about the parking in the neighborhood.
author: ryan c.

description: I came here quite awhile ago, so this won't be a full review of the dishes I had (though I remember the duck in particular is to die for). I just wanted to post this review because ever since visiting Frascati it's the number 1 restaurant I recommend people go to. Check it out, and definitely make reservations.
author: Tanya K.

description:
Very good new american food.  I've been looking for a solid semi-upscale american restaurant and I've found it. 

Food - 4.5.  scallops were awesome and the appetizers were very good.  One of those places where pretty much anything you get will be at least a 4/5

Service / Atmosphere - 4.5 decent service and very nice people.  cool spot in russian hill and a very small but quaint restaurant.  possibly the smallest bathroom on earth.
author: Paul C.

description:
I went to Frascati's last night and luckily there were 5 of us so I got to try a good portion of their dishes.  Here were my favorites in rank order.

1. The Pan Roasted Chicken.  It was really delicious.  Full of flavor and very tender.  I understand why people said it was fit for your last supper.
2. The Herb Spaetzle that comes with the Maple Leaf Duck Breast.  It was savory and I enjoyed the texture of the Spaetzle.  
3. The Grilled Pork Chop.  Very good but I think Nopa's is a bit better.  
4. The black and white bread pudding.  A great way to end the meal.  Don't go home without at least trying it. 

Also good but didn't make the list was:
The Fettuccine with anchovy pesto, the potato gnocchi.  

p.s. the website does not have the most up to date menu.  I didn't see the ribs on the menu. Instead there was a stripped bass.
author: Melanie O.

description: Frascati is the perfect restaurant.  The food is delicious and the service is superb.  Their pasta is the best I have had anywhere is the world.  They are just too good.  They get my vote as the best restaurant in SF.
author: Jim J.

description: After 2 1/2 years of not being able to write Yelp reviews I've had lots and lots of time to decide which business would be my first review! It was a pretty easy decision actually because Frascati is AMAZING! My boyfriend and I are moving from San Francisco and we made the decision months before our actual move date that Frascati would be our last meal in the city. It's only appropriate after we've spent some wonderful nights at this restaurant. We've had a few romantic date nights here and have also brought friends and family to enjoy our favorite restaurant. They restaurant is set on  Hyde street so it doesn't get much more San Francisco than eating while watching the cable cars go by. The restaurant just has such a warm cozy ambiance. The food is also wonderful! I have a major sweet tooth and as others have said, the chocolate bread pudding is a MUST! Basically I can't say enough good things about this restaurant from the delicious food, the excellent service, and charming atmosphere, it is absolutely of deserving of 5+ stars in my book! Frascati, I'll see you on Saturday for my last meal in the city!
author: Kate M.

description:
i wanted very much to like this place but theres just this ONE factor that kind of ruined the night for me. to me, a good meal consists of the food (5 stars), the service (2.5 stars), and the company (5 stars). two out of three is pretty good and the third the restaurant has no control over. however, they do over the service. we had made reservations for 9pm for 6 (triple date). the restaurant was still busy but most people were wrapping up as it was getting late. 

im not sure what it was that the waiter didnt like about us. perhaps that we were young (most people there were in there mid 30's, 40's), that we didnt appreciate good food or that wouldn't tip him as much?? or even perhaps thought we were not world-y enough because we had to ask him to repeat himself b/c he had an accent and b/c i was sitting at the other side of the table and it was hard to hear? whatever the reason it doesnt matter. it affected how my experience was and thats all it counts in my book. don't get me wrong he was never rude. he was just cold. and trust me we tried smiling, thanking, and joking with him, which led to nothing. 

anyways onto the food, we ordered 

appetizers 
- Duck Confit Salad - the duck was very good topped with baby spinach and the dressing was very light and good 
- Grilled Bread Salad - this salad is bigger and thus easier to share but the duck salad was tastier. good if you like a lighter salad with no meat. 

entrees 
- Grilled Pork Chop - "cooked to perfection" according to the waiter and it was quite delicious. they marinate the pork chop for hours and you can definitely taste it. the meat is tender as well. veryy good 
- Roasted Half Chicken - "best chicken in SF" according to the waiter. the sauce for the chicken was to die for. i dont usually like chicken b/c it turns out dry especially in the middle but this did not and the chicken was huge. you definitely get your money's worth with this dish 
- Maple Leaf Duck Breast - very good as well but wasn't as unique to me as the other dishes that we had although it was well cooked. 
- Sea bass - didnt see it on their online menu so its probably a new addition to the menu but it was good. the fish itself wasn't cooked as soft as i would like however combined with the cous cous it was much better. 

dessert 
- Warm Black and White Chocolate Bread Pudding - came with hazelnut ice cream. the ice cream was delicious but the bread pudding was okay. 

the food hands down was great. and i might give this place a second chance with the service but there are just SO many other restaurants in SF. and im usually pretty easy to please, just smile and say thanks is all i need in my book. but didnt even get that. i'll have to think about coming back...
author: Jen S.

description: It was good...not amazing. I made a reservation to come here when my boyfriend was visiting. The dishes were good but not outstanding. We had the Ragu pappardelle, pork chop, grilled bread salad and burrata appetizer. For a nearly $200 check, I wish we would have had a more incredible dining experience. I think the food is mediocre for we can find here in San Francisco. I'm happier eating pizza next door. I'm really surprised the reviews for this place are so high and I wish I wouldn't have trusted them. Both of the entrees tasted bland.
author: Brandilyn B.

description:
I wouldn't call it an Italian restaurant, it's more Mediterranean.
 
However...
The starters were light, small portions and I would recommend the mixed greens salad. The mains were better than the starters. The duck was fabulous, as was the pork tenderloin. 

Perfect for a date or small group. Bring a bottle of wine because they wave the corkage fee if you order a bottle as well.

***PS.  Look at the very bottom of the sign in the closet-sized bathroom. It says "This is Frascati's only restroom. Please no smoking, illicit drugs, or instigation of inappropriate behavior."  

...yeah, that's cool.
author: Ali L.

description:
Fantastic food; amazing chocolate bread pudding; great wine list; really friendly & helpful staff.
Read my full review at: http://sibilous.blogspot.com/2004/08/frascati.html
author: Don H.

description:
Third time's the charm... last night we finally made it to dinner here after making our third reservation in something like 6 months.  Yeah, it was worth the wait.

We got one of the coveted balcony tables with a view... definitely nice, although a little dim and a little loud.  Shared the gnocchi with corn, peas, peppers, and fava beans to start.  I probably could have eaten a bucket of it, yum.  For entrees, we got the duck and the pork chop.  Both were excellent.  What I really liked about the entire menu was that it was lacking all of the dishes that you so typically see these days -- no wild salmon, no ahi (Husband had a hard time dealing with that one), no filet mignon -- yet everything sounded good (and from our vantage point, seeing all the dishes come out of the kitchen, it all looked amazing).  Of course, had to share the bread pudding for dessert, though the cobbler looked really good as well.  

It was definitely more difficult to get a reservation the third time I tried... the word is out!  damn you, Yelp!
author: Nat K.

description:
So my friends and I didn't really have any idea about where we wanted to eat so we ended up checking this place out  without making reservations and got seated at the bar. By the way, street parking is very hard to find around here and we had to park at the garage for $10 per hour.

Now, on to the food.. We started with the carpaccio and it was really good. I was hesitant about the white chocolate on top of it but the sweetness went so well with the beef. Well I was disappointed because they did not have the scallops that I had wanted on the menu, so I ordered the sea bass instead. We also ordered the duck and lamb. They thought we had ordered the chicken but they were nice to take it back and rush order the duck for us. The sea bass was alright and a bit spicy because of the sauce. The fish was kind of dry but that's not the dish that they are popular for. The lamb was SOOOOOOOOOOOOOO good and I usually do not eat lamb. It had this salty spice to it and it did not taste gamey. The duck was very juicy! I would come back again next time for the duck and lamb with my boyfriend. Maybe we'll take the cable car or the taxi next time since parking is such a pain.
author: Shu L.

description:
the appetizer specials were delicious....our entrees were so so.
we were a little bummed.

service was great.
author: Tiger Lily ..

description:
My parents took my here the last time they came to visit. I was super excited - only two blocks from my apartment! Score. Plus, it has always looked so cute from the outside. 

Anyway, as we entered, the staff was very welcoming and friendly. We were seated upstairs in a smallish red room. Very cozy like. The cheese plate appetizer was super yummy - what's not to like about cheese and honey? 

While the appetizers wowed, the main courses fell a bit short. So short in fact, that I can't even remember what we ate. 

One final thing - they only have one bathroom for the guys and the girls. I ended up waiting about 15 minutes to use it, while my food got cold. Yuck.
author: Ava S.

description:
I was taken here for a birthday celebration, and we had a delicious meal!  They were going to seat us right by the door, but we requested upstairs and the host told us it was not a problem.  He led us upstairs, which is a great, dark, semi-private atmosphere, much different than the downstairs.  Both are nice though, it just depends what you fee like.

Our wine was a lovely Point Conception Syrah, recommended by our knowledgeable and helpful waiter.  Between us, we ordered the Mixed Greens salad, Mushroom Soup, Duck Breast, and Rigatoni with Shrimp.  All dishes were delicious, with the salad being the biggest disappointment.  I know, it's a salad, how can you screw that one up, right?  It wasn't bad, but besides the slivered toasted almonds and shaved parmesan (I think), I don't think there was any dressing!  The soup was amazing, and we all finished our plates completely.  For dessert we split the Chocolate Bread Pudding , which arrived with a slender candle and is absolutely as amazing as everyone says it is.  If you haven't tried it yet, you must make it a point to get some!  

Definitely a good restaurant worth checking out, but don't drive there, as you won't find a parking spot for blocks.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
Had dinner here last month on a Saturday night and thankfully although we were late bc of lack parking and our entire party not showing up till much later, they were still cool about keeping our reservation. We started off w/ the 

Artisanal Cheese Plate - 
Brillat Savarin: French cow's milk; soft-white cheese; thick and velvety
Valencey: French goat cheese; spicy and piquant
Urgla: Spanish cow's milk, semi soft; creamy and aromatic
Gabriel Coulet Roquefort: Cave aged sheep's milk blue from France; Buttery 

Awesome, I liked #1 and 3 the best.

The Russet Potato Gnocchi with Sweet Corn, English Peas, Fava Beans and White Truffle Oil is to die for. so light, fluffy, HEAVEN!

The Grilled Bread Salad with White Beans, Cucumbers, Kalamata Olives, Red Onion, Feta Cheese and Champagne Vinaigrette was ok but nothing special, enough for 2 to share. 

My Grilled Pork Chop with Grilled Nectarine-Chicory Salad, Whole Grain Mustard, Pickled Onions and Mango-Papaya Salsa  was really good but I ended up liking my bf's  Grilled Flat Iron Steak with Sausalito Springs Watercress Salad, Mixed Heirloom Tomatoes, Wild Mushroom Vinaigrette and Foie Gras Butter much better.

The waiter highly recommended the Warm Black and White Chocolate Bread Pudding Hazelnut Ice Cream, Caramel and Chocolate Sauce but I didn't care for it, it was super sweet.
author: Theresa X.

description:
It was my boyfriend's birthday so I wanted to take him someplace romantic that he'd never been before.  I had visted a number of times but hadn't been in a while.  I was hoping it was a good as I remembered and had told my beau it would be.  

We couldn't have been more pleased.  As a former restaurant owner and a great cook, my boyfriend can be a little critical of food and I'm just plain picky when it comes to service and value.   He was thrilled with the food.  In fact he said his duck breast was possibly one of the best he had ever had.  My porkchop, while waaaay to much food for me, was perfectly prepared as well.  We topped off the meal with a "to die for"  pistachio panna cotta - complete with a single birthday candle.
