A good place for a special occasion...i.e. anniversary, birthday, parents in town, a date, etc.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
I went there tonight and I just had the most sh*ttiest worst dinner EVER at Frascati!!!  They brought me duck that was sooo over done I couldn't cut it with a steak knife.  I sent it back and the chef said well you need to order something else because that's way I cook it.  Hello???  I've eaten at fine restaurants all over the world and I have NEVER had someone refused to fix my order. I also have never had duck I couldn't cut! What an arrogant jerk!!!!!  Frascati in SF sux major!!  Stay away!  What happened to good customer service??  Sorry for the strong language but I just couldn't believe what happened.

ps...  I hear the normal chef isn't there on Monday's and when he's there its really good.  Unfortunately I will never go back again.  I hope the owners, head chef etc....  read yelp and make some changes because this was my worst experience ever and I will be telling everyone I know to never go there.
author: I B.

description: Hands down the best Italian food I have ever had.  Everything about this restaurant is simply perfect: from the attentive staff to the incomparable wine list.
author: Lisa N.

description:
I've had my eye on Frascati for quite a few months now, as I've heard wonderful things about this little Russian Hill gem. And being in the heart of the adorable restaurant row on Hyde street, there was only so long I could wait...
So I planned ahead (this place is popular, call in advance if you want a table on the weekend) making a reservation for my family for Father's Day. We arrived at 6:30, and were immediately seated at an upstairs table on the edge of the balcony. Although the space was relatively small, the noise level was not terribly deafening (I recently read an article in the Chronicle as to the atrocious noise level often found in SF restaurants) and we were able to carry on a normal conversation without shouting. Digesting the menu is a task in itself- so many delightful sounding choices! We decided on sharing the corn and morel risotto garnished with mache as an appetizer, my mom having the roasted half chicken with artichokes, fingerling potatoes, and onions, the father having Alaskan halibut, and me going for the lentil soup and gnocchi with fava beans and peas for dinner. The service was incredibly slow- I don't know if it was just our particular waitress (although she was perfectly friendly when she actually showed up at the table) or the restaurant in general. This is my only complaint for the dining experience. We probably didn't get served for about an hour after seating, which was mitigated by the copious amounts of levain and french baguettes they provided during the wait.
And now for the culinary experience: the risotto was tasty- not the creamiest risotto I've had, but definitely flavorful and light. The corn was incredibly sweet, even though it is not full blown corn season just yet. The morels were earthy and intense, and the rice was not completely mushy, so a slight crunchy texture was evident. The gnocci was also a treat- fava beans are a definite springtime favorite, and they definitely starred in this particular dish. The potato dumplings were the perfect consistency, slightly chewy and melt-in-your mouth delicious. The roasted chicken was seasoned well with rosemary and lemon, the skin crisp, and the meat tender. The artichokes and fingerling potatoes were a great accompaniment. As you may know, I don't eat fish, so I cannot comment on the halibut, but my dad did lick his plate clean, if that counts for anything. Portions here are not huge, so we had room for dessert, a definite must if you find yourself at Frascati. We ordered the black and white chocolate bread pudding, which our waitress assured would be enough for the three of us to share. Maybe she didn't know how much we love chocolate. Or bread pudding. Oh my god, this pudding was amazing. Not as custardy as some, but intensely chocolatey  with crisp bits on the outside and gooey chocolate seeping from the inside. Chunks of white chocolate were interspersed throughout the concoction. A huge scoop of home made vanilla bean ice cream garnished the dish, which was subsequently drizzled with chocolate and caramel sauces. Pure heaven. We wolfed down the entire dessert in under a minute, all of us wishing we had ordered two. But enough is enough, and since I at least, hadn't done my ritual 6 mile morning run, figured it was best to stop. In summary, Frascati is a charming upscale restaurant with delicious five star food and a five star neighborhood. However because the service was so slow, I must remove on of the stars...but don't let that stop you from checking this place out, I am sure you'll enjoy it as much as we did.
author: Kate A.

description:
My sweet lord is this place great.  I have been twice now--once about 9 months ago, and then just this last sunday night.  The first visit was really good--the food was great but I just wasn't blown away.  Everything else though--from the wine to the atmosphere to the service was top of the line.  
Took my fiancee and her sister and brother in law recently, and was blown out of the water by the food.  We all sampled each other's, and there was not a bad dish in the lot.  I had the pork and it was top 3 on my all time favorite pork dishes (top pork goes to a pancetta wraped and goat cheese stuffed tenderloin Cafe Kati made a couple of years ago...wow).  I also tried the duck, the risotto and the ahi.  All incredible.  
Not to mention that the waiter was phenomenal and the owner/manager just a great person.
I am now a frascati lover--5 stars no question.  
Bring dates, family, visitors from out of town, or locals who have not been indoctrinated.  This place hits the mark.
author: Blake W.

description:
umm.. YES

the waiter proclaimed we had the "coziest" table in the house.  that means small, but it was possibly the best seat in the house.  and here we are on a monday night and all the other two-tops are actually full so lucky us.

appetizer consisted of a stone fruit salad which i found to be a perfect pairing of vegetables and fruits from all over the taste spectrum.  for mains we had the duck and the risotto.  the duck could've been slightly less cooked, but it was still delicious nonetheless.

word to the wise.  $20 corkage is probably worth it.  the wine selection is expansive, but a little steep if you consider what other wines you can get for the price.  if you've got something you want to drink and it's under $40 i say bring it.

service was great to boot.  i'll be back again and again.
author: Steven C.

description: This is simply one of the finest restaurants in San Francisco.   From the quality of the food to the service- everything was a 5 star experience.    My only complaint has nothing to do with the restaurant- only street parking is available in the area.
author: Fred X.

description: Although they took the Meyer lemon, lobster risotto off the menu, sigh, this is still a great little spot. Good, interesting food, smashing wine list, and not too loud. Call and reserve the window seat.
author: Roxane S.

description: I already reviewed Frascati and LOVED it, so my fiance and I went back for a second time... and it remains my favorite restaurant in the city! Among the highlights this time were the delicious cheese plate (as usual), the gnocchi, the lamb that--not kidding--melted in my mouth, the waitress informing us that we could purchase our favorite wine just down the street, and the candle in our bread pudding with warm wishes from the owner because we mentioned it was our anniversary. As we dined, we realized that many of the customers at Frascati visit the restaurant so frequently that they are known by the staff. If I had a job (other than being a grad student!), I would aspire to become one of those customers. I just cannot say enough good things about this restaurant. If you're checking it out on yelp to see if you should go or not, stop hesitating and GO. You won't regret it!
author: Bridgette A.

description: Came here for a nice dinner with my boyfriend and was not disappointed! We had the salmon bruschetta and brad salad to start and both were great.  For our entrees we had the pork chop and sausage risotto.   The pork chop was cooked perfectly and the sauce it comes with was delicious! The sausage risotto was top notch, I probably ate a third of my boyfriends order! We had the chocolate bread pudding for dessert, so unusual and so good!  Overall an amazing meal, definitely on the pricey side, but well worth it!
author: Amanda M.

description: The wine list is da best. I can't review on the food. I was too drunk to tell if the food tasted good. I still have a hangover but got to yelp about it.
author: Michael K.

description:
i have wanted to try frascati for ages, and finally got there last week - yum!  i enjoyed everything - from our choice table by the window to the food to the wine to the service.  and of course the company!  i got there first and they sat me right away - always a plus when the restaurant doesnt have a large waiting area or bar.  we started with the cheese plate and gnocchi appetizer - both were delicious.  i had the pork chop for my dinner - wow, so great.  one friend got the same, and the second got the chicken which i tasted of course, and it was great too.  dessert was the chocolate bread pudding - now i dont always like bread pudding, but i am always willing to give it a shot, and this one was worth it!  so delicious!  
i will definitely plan to go back to frascati again - i loved the charm of the place and everything was sooo good!!
author: Carolyn B.

description: Where to start?  The lamb?  The bunnie salad?  Great service, wonderful food, intimate warm atmosphere.  I recently asked some semi-famous foodies where I should take a hot date and. . . they directed me here and called ahead for me.  A great place to: propose, seal a deal, take the parents, hatch an idea.
author: Gil S.

description: Cute little place with a nice menu. There was nothing exceptional or out of the ordinary that would wow me or make me want to bring friends or a lover to a quiet little place like this. Now that I think of it, maybe my grandma will enjoy it.
author: Dee C.

description:
Had dinner there last night. 
In a nice neighborhood but not at all easy to find street parking. There is parking garage right next door. 
Very good ambiance but is slightly cramped...they have to tried to maximize the # of tables in the space the have. 

It was a simple menu. Not great for vegetarians/vegans - don't not have a whole lot in the menu. We ordered "Sauteed Brussel Sprouts" for appetizer, carrot-orange bisque and double the size of the Gnocchi for the Entree....both the Entree and the Appetizer portions were decent but neither of them had enough salt - I have definitely eaten better Gnocchi elsewhere. I would say both of those dishes were average. The soup was very good. The overall service was good.
author: L C.

description:
my friend and i came here for dinner last night, and i LOVED it.  the experience from beginning to end was lovely.  my friend said she called for reservations, and they were very nice on the phone.  when we arrived, we did not have to wait at all and were seated right away.  while perusing the menu, our server suggested some wines by the glass and explained each of them in great detail.  my friend and i both ended up w/ the pinot noir from willamette valley.  

for dinner, we decided to order a bunch of stuff and share.  we got the scallops and gnocchi (both apps), bread salad, and duck.  we thought about getting the frutti de mare risotto as well, but our server didn't think it was the best dish on the menu and told us not to get it.  i really appreciate that, b/c instead of telling us to order something else (and hence having us spend more $$), he thought what we ordered would be good enuf and told us to stop right there.  i even told him that i would only be eating the apps and salad and not the duck, but he said even that was enuf food.

all the dishes were fabulous.  i am not even a gnocchi fan, but i LOVED that dish, and the beans, corn and peas were so fresh and tasty.  the bread salad was huge, and every element of the salad was perfect.  

after the salad, there was a slight lull before we got the duck.  to make up for it, our server brought each of us a complimentary glass of cab, which was soo nice of him!  we then got the duck, but i didn't try it.  

after reading all the yelp reviews, we HAD to order the black and white bread pudding.  OMG, my friend and i both opined that this was one of the most memorable desserts we have had.  it was huge, and it came w/ an AMAZING scoop of homemade hazelnut ice cream which was to DIE for.  i would definitely order this again.  

overall, a wonderful experience (except for trying to park in russian hill!), and i can't wait to come back!
author: Helen T.

description: We visited on a Tuesday evening, which is the best day of the week dining out to avoid the crowd and test the restaurant's consistency; while the service is good and the wine list interesting, the food tastes average the dessert a little disappointing.  3 yelp stars, and I would rate a Zagat 21-22 for food maximum.
author: J S.

description: Frascati is a beautiful little restaurant on a lovely tree-lined street. I bet it'd be the perfect spot for a stroll both to and from, and of course dinner by the window, on a beautiful spring day. Of course the weather was rather horrid today, but that didn't detract from the excellent food. The italian sausage risotto is amazing! Such a perfect blend of flavors and textures. And the freshly made pappardelle with such tender boar, mmmmm! The filet mignon too was cooked to perfection and very tasty. Even the table bread was excellent!
author: Will A.

description: What a perfect place to have a night out.  The house is cozy and welcoming.  The staff is so friendly and competent.  And the food is absolutely delicious.  We have come here time and time again, and find it difficult to try other restaurants.  Really, one of the best in the City.
author: Judith S.

description:
Frascati is wonderfully quaint (not quaint like those doilies that your grandma shrouds her tissue boxes with, but quaint like sweet and intimate) and romantic--a perfect place to go to with, say, five of your girlfriends and one mom of a girlfriend.  Which is who I went with.

I had the Russet Potato Gnocchi, and more than my fair share of our two cheese plates (as it turns out, honey drizzled almonds are actually sort of good--who knew), and loved it all.  

I also loved how nice the host was when I showed up to the restaurant 20 minutes ahead of the rest of my lagging party: He offered me wine, which I declined, fearing the friend's mom would think me a lush, and instead chose to stand alone on the street corner like a fancy-dress hooker.  

And more than anything else, I loved that Frascati had the tiniest little bathroom in the world--it gave us all a good laugh, and made me very happy that I hadn't worn my fancy-dress-hooker full-skirted ballgown.
author: Hannah J.

description:
Thank you Yelpers for this fantastic recommendation. This was by far the best meal that I have had in a long time. Service was friendly and atmosphere was very comfortable. We originally were seated by the door and it was cold every time the door opened. Luckily a table was clearing out and they moved us upstairs with no problem. 

What we ordered:
 - Tuna tartar: This was good, not the best that I have had, but very good. Sauce was not overbearing. 
 - Baby beet salad: Loved this dish, beets were deep red and juicy
 - Octopus salad: Very good, lots of octopus and delicious greens
 - Duck confit salad: Perfectly cooked and tender, great salad
 - Roasted parsnip-pear soup: Didn't have this one but it looked great
 - Maple leaf duck breast: Duck was tender even when "well done" Maple leaf gave it a very subtle sweetness and also a smokiness. 
 - Frutti di mare risotto: My FAVORITE! Lovely risotto with wild rice that really gave it extra texture
 - Grilled pork chop: Great flavor, huge pork chop
 - Fresh parpadelle: Parpadelle was perfectly cooked
 - Alaskan halibut livornese: Butter good, great sauce
 - Vanilla bean pana cotta: Amazing, wonderful creamy texture, great flavor, MUST ORDER FOR DESSERT
 - Affogato: Lots of espresso on the side, tasted great with the gelato

Overall, food was FANTASTIC. I will definitely be coming back to Frascati.
author: Matt K.

description:
I've been begging  to be taken here here for months since I live right down the street...and it was definitely worth the wait!   We came during the pre-Christmas season and it was decorated so nicely...very cute touch!

The staff is extremely welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable.   We made reservations and were seated right away in the great little "nook" table right in the front window.  Started with the cheese plate...wow, this is a MUST.  The waiter had some great back-stories to the cheeses, the locations they are from, etc.  Served with delicious sides (almonds, dried apricots, figs).  The sommelier came right over to our table with suggestions and prompty brought our drinks (key element on a Friday night after a long week at work!).  I couldn't decide what entree to get and the waiter steered me in the direction of the pork chop, while my boyfriend got the lamb shank.  Both were DELICIOUS.  Cooked to perfection, served on the perfect amount of polenta & mashed potatoes, with delectible sides of brocollini and tomatoes.  I've never wanted to eat so slowly so I could savor each bite longer!   We had heard from here that the bread pudding was mandatory and we weren't disappointed.  It was VERY rich (and after all that food, we were pretty stuffed) but we managed to eat almost every bite.  Finished with a glass of port that came recommended.  

All in all, Frascati deserves all five of the stars!

Great service
Great food
Great wine selection
GREAT atmosphere
author: Kathleen B.

description: I chose this restaurant for it's location and menu.  I was not disappointed by any part of my dining experience at Frascati--an intimate place in the Nob Hill/Russian Hill area..  I recommend reservations.  The sound of cable cars rumbling added to a great SFO dining experience!  The first floor seating area is shared with an open kitchen--which made me that much more hungry from the delicious aromas; additional seating is available upstairs and the bathroom is about the size of an airplane restroom and is in the basement.  The wait staff was so pleasant and friendly!  The water and wine were never low in the glass(Red Zin, Neal Family '09).  The food was prepared quickly and WELL!.  I started off with the Bay Sardines appetizer--these are large and not the small ones I was expecting; however, no complaints!  I thoroughly enjoyed the Duck Confit Salad as the dried cherries were a surprise & absolutely paired well!  My first impression of the entree--Frutti di Mare Risotto-- with Prawns, Mussels, Clams, was that it was a small serving.  Wrong, very filling and amazingly succulent with all the flavors and textures blending yet each splendidly distinct!  Absolutely Delicious!  I ordered the sorbet and found it to be heavy and overly sweet for a sorbet..I did not finish it because it was too sweet.  This did NOT detract from my enjoyment of Frascati.  I will be going back for another evening of fine food and wonderful dining patrons!
author: Jive T.

description: this is one of my most favorite resturants EVER. been here for two birthday occasion and have always left with the sense of wanting to come back as much as i can. the dishes were made perfectly and omg...the dessert is to die for. i have never had chocolate cake that was crunchy on the outside but so moist on the inside. the host and server were so nice. this is a perfect date spot. the parking was never an issue for me. it also seems to be the mayors place to eat too since he was there also. ever want to take someone to a great place to eat? this is the spot!
author: Tuan D.

description: Excellent service. Recommendations spot on and a willingness to please. Food is very good. Not the greatest ever, but very good. The chicken entree is fantastic. If you have parents in town, and need a non hip, very San Franciscan experience, this is the place.
author: Sir M.

description: Frascati is the bomb.  The Bomb!!  Their bread salad is the stuff of dreams, and so is the gnocchi.  I am not the type to order the same thing every time I go to a restaurant, but I can't help it, I'm hooked on this culinary heroin.  The service is perfect - so nice, helpful, knowledgeable yet still with a very personal touch, and you always feel like you are in a neighborhood spot.   I had a birthday there and even with 16 people, the food and service never faltered.
author: Melissa G.

description: Twas' a typical Fall San Francisco night...crisp, cool and clear.  A friend in town from San Deeeago (It's German for...) and I needed a good eatery.  I turned to Yelp, picked Frascati and the reviews were spot on.  Started off with a glass of bubbly and some gnocchi.  Followed by some butternut squash soup which was ridiculous.  Entrees were the rack of lamb and filet....I'm still drooling.  Amazing.
author: Jason G.

description: Finding parking was an aggressive task; My boyrfiend was making skid marks to secure our parking spot or so it felt like it. And doing so up and down hills is no fun. Our reservation was at 6:30 pm but we were held up in traffic and John, the host and, as we later found out, the owner, was gracious and reserved our table until we came. The place is quite lovely and quaint on a corner. The weather was just perfect and some people were seated outside. I noticed those who were not dressed as formally were seated outside but i'm not sure if this is always the case. The upstairs was not open yet, but from the looks of it it would've been lovely and even more romantic to sit there. Overall, the ambiance was pleasing, the server was attentive but not overly so, and the food was served in a timely manner. We ordered the Russet Potato Gnocchi (pronounced NO-KEY) and it was by far the best thing we had there. My boyfriend and I shared the Maple Leaf Duck Breast and the Grilled Pork Chop. We both agreed my Duck with the crisp salad on the side was a 4-4.5/5, but the Pork Chop is more of a 3/5 because of it's lack or flavor and dryness. We expected a bit more I guess because of the great yelp reviews. I had a glass of sparkling wine and I wish I had more but after the Pork and noticing the couple next to us order what we were planning on ordering (the bread pudding dessert) and not finishing it, we skipped dessert. I'm planning on giving this place one more try but we'll see...
author: Kristine C.

description: Very nice restaurant in a quaint part of San Francisco - Russian Hill.  The food is excellent, especially the pork.  Good wine list.  The service is great.
author: Dan L.

description:
Cute & sophisticated Italian restaurant nearby my favorite ice cream shop, Swensen. This is what we ordered:

Starters:
Gnocchi & Steak Tartare
Entrees:
Pork chop, rack of lamb, filet mignon, & halibut
Dessert:
Affogato & blueberry peach cobbler

Both starters were equally good. My favorite entree was the pork chop & rack of lamb because they were so juicy & tender. The filet mignon tasted a bit dry & tough for my taste. The halibut was good but not amazing. The affogato was quite delicious and the cobbler was very good.
author: Xuyen H.

description: I've been here several times and each time, I was extremely pleased with both the service and the food.  The wine selection is wonderful and the bar tenders, very knowledgeable.  If it is on the seasonal menu, try the gnocchi.  YUM.
author: Hiromi N.

description: Frascati, by far, is my favorite Italian restaurant ever. Everytime I've gone here, the service and food has been excellent. Situated across the street from Swensen's ice cream (granted, you will be too full to eat ice cream), the restaurant is intimate but not stuffy. The charcuterie is really yummy, wine selection is good, and their pasta dishes are great. Take a taxi or walk, because you will not find parking anywhere.
author: Karen L.

description: This place was a slam dunk. I went last fall with a bff from out of town and we were so completely charmed by this place. The food was fantastic, the atmosphere is cozy and intimate, the service was very good - and we were even tucked way up above in the loft -- I was sure we would be neglected. I think this is worth going any time. It isn't cheap, but what is these days? It's also great because you could wear jeans or you could get decked to the 9s.
author: Andrea S.

description:
I've lived a block from this restaurant for over a year and last night finally got a chance to eat there. It was a spur of the moment decision and we walked in with no reservation fully expecting to be turned away. We let the man at the door (I think he was the owner) know that we didn't have a reservation and we were totally fine with being turned away but he was totally accommodating and asked us to give him a few minutes to check to see if he could squeeze us in. That was the beginning of the impeccable service for the rest of the night. He mentioned that another couple was really late and he was going to give them a call to see if they were going to make it and if not that we could have their table. I was really surprised that a restaurant wouldn't just give the tardy couple's table away but just then they walked in and we were prepared to be disappointed. However the host managed to squeeze us into another small table upstairs which was very generous of them since they were obviously packed and had many more reservations on the books. 
Now to the food, the food was incredible. It was everything we'd hoped for and more. We started with the tiger prawn risotto and a torchon of foie gras with a sauterne gastrique and some sauteed apples. The risotto was the most perfectly cooked risotto I'd ever had, the rice was creamy without being too heavy and dense and the cheese did not overpower the freshness of the tomato and spinach that was mixed in with the risotto. The foie gras was delicious, rich and buttery served with excellent toast points and the gastrique was the perfect counterpoint to the richness providing a light, sweet note to the dish. Both dishes were superb. Then for our main course we had the duck breast with herbed spaetzle and huckleberry sauce, hearts of palm and mushrooms, and the seared day boat scallops with crispy parsnips and a potato puree. My fiancee said the scallops were quite good and my duck breast was cooked perfectly medium rare with crispy skin. The huckleberry sauce went really well with the duck as it was sweet and tart at the same time cutting the richness of the duck. Lastly we had the white and dark chocolate bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream for dessert and it was incredibly decadent and delicious, even though I was stuffed I ate the whole thing. 
Throughout the whole night service was great and it really felt like the staff enjoyed working there and took pride in the food and you could really tell. Overall it was a great experience and I highly recommend dining here.
author: Cathy T.

description: This place is a fantastic local Russian Hill restaurant that fails to do less than impress. Friendly servers/ownership guarantee a quality dining experience. Lobster bisque and Pabst Blue Ribbon is a must! I have recommended this place to people the world over and only hear sparkling reviews. I guess I should stop that.. Enjoy.
author: Sven S.

description:
My beau brought me here for our 1 year anniversary.  It was a special night and everything was perfect.  We came back here again with a bunch of friends and they liked it alot too.

Service:  Our waitress was very attentive. She was the same one we had the first time.  All smiles and made good recommendations.  We were running a bit late looking for parking and they were kind enough to accomodate us.

Food: We ordered duck, lobster risotto (as appetizer), lamb,two different types of  fish, pork,  and chicken.   We all LOVED the lobster risotto.  If you are not that hungry, you could order as your entree.  Duck was smokey but juicey.  Lamb is not gamey.  Pork was tender and flavorful.  Fish was cooked to perfection......not mushy and not overcooked. 

Portion size:  Pretty good amount.  It was pretty filling if you had the pork and lamb. Very meaty.  

Ambience: Cozy and good for small groups of people.
Price:  Average price $20+

Parking is hard on a Saturday.  Your best bet if you still can not find parking is to go down to Polk/Broadway and park in that Walgreens parking lot.  

Yeah I would come here again. It's within walking distance. I didn't know of this hidden gem!
author: Dee L.

description:
The gnocchi were as heavenly as everyone said.  The skate wing was unexpectedly, lightly battered (menu said "seared"), so it heavier than expected - but very tasty, though slightly oversalted.  Meyer lemon cake was decent but could have been more lemony; it had lots of whole blueberries in the sauce.

Very good service and wine.  The cozy atmosphere allowed us to hear our conversation without shouting.
author: Sumomo O.

description:
Took my boyfriend here for a going away dinner after searching for "romantic" restraunts in the city. Intially I was dissapointed as althought it is very nice inside with white table cloths, candles and classy decor, I wouldnt call it romantic. It is very small and the tables are close together. Luckily I had read previous yelp reviews and knew to request a table up on the balcony. They accomadated this, so our table was more secluded and we had a perfect view of the kitchen and were able to smell and see all the yummy food as it was coming out!

The food was hands down the best I have had in the city or anywhere else for that matter, in a very long time! For app we got the gnocchi and it was fantastic. The sauce was so flavorful and the asparagus and peas were a nice touch. Salads I ordered the duck confit the bf ordered the waldorf. Well I must say I won that round. The duck was delicious, so cripsy on the outside and juicy inside. The cheese and dried cherries added perfect flavor to it, it was divine. Main course my boyfriend got the half chicken and it was AMAZING! Some of the best chicken I ever had, I actually ended up forgetting my meal (seared char) and ate as much of his as he would allow. Trust me-order the chicken, nothing else can compare! 

Overall a great dinner exp, I will definitley be back!
author: Tracy B.

description: It was a dinner for two and we sat upstairs by the window and totally enjoyed a warm & cozy dinner. Had gnocchi & lamb, the friendly staff and extensive wine collection make the experience 6 star worthy.
author: Divya R.

description:
Oustanding. This is my favorite restaurant ever so far. I place it above Spaggo in Beverly Hills. 

We chose the steak tartare (which was very simple, with a hint of chili sauce on the side) as an apetizer. My wife was disapointed to see that the prawn risotto she saw on their website wasn't on the menu anymore, and explained to the waiter that she didn't eat meat. He offered dozens of alternatives, offered to accomodate pretty much all the items on the menu to her taste. He finally offered to make a wild mushroom risotto with truffle oil, which was OUT OF THIS WORLD. This was only billed $19, down from the original $30 fillet mignon risotto! I chose the duck, and had the best duck breast I've ever had. Cooked perfectly, slightly rare, with berries and cooked salade, and gnocchis... I mean really, words don't do it justice. 

I chose the least expensive wine on the card and it was amazing. 

Great service, good vibe, and out of this world-food. And great wine too!
author: David K.

description: Without a doubt my favorite restaurant in the City.  Always my first recommendation to friends from out of town.  Start off with the Russet Potato Gnocchi.  The lamb and pork chop have been perfect each time.
author: Ryan R.

description:
I feel like I dined at a different restaurant from other reviewers here. How this place garners 5 stars is beyond me,but  maybe I just ordered the wrong thing and had the wrong waiter. Maybe it was the result of having eaten at the FAR superior A 16 a few weeks prior. 

The salads were fine, but nothing that I could not put together at home. I felt the same way about my pasta dish. I had a puttanesca with shrimp. The shrimp were a bit tough and the pasta was... nothing special. 

I asked the waiter to help me decide between two dishes. He read aloud  the list of ingredients from each of them... Not exactly the guidance I expect from a great restaurant. 

When I am paying over $100 for two people (1 glass of wine each, no dessert), I have what I would consider reasonably high expectations. There are far too many great restaurants in SF to pay that price and not walk away very happy. 

It wasn't bad. It just wasn't great. It was a solid 3 Star restaurant.
author: daniel p.

description: Well, as an Italophile and a NewYorker/Hobokenite, I take my Italian food seriously.  The "duck three ways" was more French than Italian but who's complaining.....it was fabulous!!!! Pate to die for, but have it with the table bread instead of the brioche. Ask Albert and Tony to heat the bread....they were the life of the party, so to speak. Service was perfect and these guys know their wine. The gnocchi and pappardelle were both insanely light and tasty.  They forget to bring grated cheese, but a minor faux pas. Salads were nicely balanced and a cheese course could have made the salad an entire meal.  The chef cooking in the actual dining room gave a homey, sweet atmosphere to this-would-be-my-favorite  neighborhood haunt  if I lived there. I'll be back  and everyone else looked pretty happy leaving there, as well.
author: Lucienne D.

description: Four star review based on average of two times I have been.  First time was hands down 5-stars.  Started tossing around rage calls like, "best gnocci in ever".  Problem is when you have something that good it sets the bar pretty high.  So last night we went and had a good meal.  But they have changed the gnocci recipe (just as I have changed the spelling of the word to something a 5th grader might phonetically sound out) and it wasn't that great.  The rest of the food was very good.  Service was friendly but super slow.   We ate late and it still took over two hours.  and really, conversation with friends and family is over-rated when you are eating your sock to quell the hunger pains...
author: Michael N.

description: Wow, impressive.  We went here with friends, and had an amazing meal!  As my main course, I ordered the chicken (which is something I never do in a restaurant), and it was nothing short of spectacular.  I really couldn't believe chicken could taste that good!  Our entire meal was fantastic and would love to go back.
author: Jenn K.

description:
I found Frascati on yelp and from the rave reviews, I made reservations for J's bday with high expectations. I booked the reservations on opentable and the only available time showed 5:30pm. This was a little early but I thought that I would plan a day in the city and stopping off at 5:30pm seemed reasonable. In the comments box, I noted that it was my bf's bday.

At around 2pm on the day of, we were at Fisherman's Wharf when Brian from Frascati politely called to confirm reservations. When we arrived to the restaurant at 5:30pm, it was completely empty so we thought we would walk around a bit and go back a little later since we were still full from lunch. We walked in at  around 5:40pm and the 2 tables by the window were taken. We met Brian who was deligihtful and wished J a happy birthday. We were seated in the upstairs balcony overlooking the kitchen and the dining area. I think this is the best seat in the house.

For starters, we had the veal sweetbreads and the cauliflower soup, both of which were very good. For our main course, I had the duck breast and J had the pork chop. I thought the duck was good but J really enjoyed his pork chop.

Now, for dessert, we went for the chocolate bread pudding. Initially, I was a little disappointed because I was hoping that they would put a candle on the dessert but they didn't- oh well, no big deal. However, when Brian came upstairs to talk to one of the waiters he must have noticed that we didn't get a candle and he ran downstairs and immediately brought up a scoop of vanilla ice cream with a candle! He wished J a happy birthday and said "... in case the bread pudding isn't enough..." We thought this was wonderful of him and it's gestures like these that leave a lasting impression and distinguish a 5-star restaurant from all the rest. The vanilla ice cream, by the way, was absolutely delicious! Many other reviews have mentioned it, but the wait staff here really is excellent. I have been to other restaurants where the food was great but the service was stuffy and boring- you won't get that at Frascati.

Thanks to everyone at Frascati for making it a special day.
author: Vitamin C.

description: Awesome! One of my top 5 favorites in SF. Great food, nice atmosphere, nice neighborhood feel. Wine list is excellent and servers are knowledeable. Rich always remembers me even if I haven't been in several months. Echoing others, the chocolate bread pudding is a little slice of heaven.
author: Mike B.

description:
Absolutely amazing.

I went here on a Friday night at 8:45. Perfect time to go and perfect location. We sat upstairs literally next to the wall and stairs in our own little place. It was perfect. I looked at the reviews and I believe the people who did not like the place did not order the correct dishes.

Appetizer: Grilled Asparugus with Poached Duck Egg
Mmmmmmmmmmm... I never knew poached duck eggs were so delicious and the asparagus were cooked really well (usually places cook them too soft for me). 

Main Courses: Pork chop with Grilled white peaches and Flat Iron Steak.
Hands down the best steak I have ever had at a restaurant (and I love my steak). It wasn't marinaded in something gross but seasoned perfectly with salt and pepper and came with a delicious panzanella salad. However, the PORK CHOP was the best thing I may have ever tasted. They somehow cooked it so that it was so moist and flavorful. I could eat it every day of my life. 

Dessert: Peach and Blueberry Crumble (?) with Vanilla Ice Cream.
Delicious! It tasted so fresh. It was the perfect size to share.

If you are still debating whether or not to go....GO!!!!!

Be careful: Parking is a b! Get there early enough to drive around looking for parking for 20 minutes.
author: Becca P.

description: Glad i live up the street....awesome place. Nice owners. Sit at the bar and watch....great place. Try the squid....as tender as you will ever find it.
author: Brian B.

description: Rich and Rebecca are the best restauranteurs in the city of SF and have made frascati a must. The wine list is wonderful and the food is a perfect pair. If you need to impress someone take them here you will never be disappointed. Love this place.
author: yada m.

description: I love Frascati! Romantic atmosphere and food that is sure to please!Everything is fantastic! I highly recommend the maple leaf duck breast and the bread pudding for dessert. Make a reservation early, this place books up quickly! If you plan on having wine, an appetizer, an entree, and dessert, plan on spending closer to $50-60 per person. Well worth it!
author: Erin R.

description: Probably one of the better efforts I've seen in the city thus far.  Both the atmosphere and menu lacked a certain amount of pretention I've come to expect from other spots.  The gnocchi and the grilled bread salad were well executed.  The herb roasted rack of lamb chops were perfectly cooked and delicious.  For desert try the affogato.  Good service, great food, not dry and sterile.
author: Matt S.

description: I took my friends from IL  to have dinner here . the foods were great. the service was pretty good, totally enjoyed with every single dish.
author: Kathreen L.

description: Have been back several times over the past 3 years and this place never fails to impress. The gnocchi is so tender and flavorful, the duck was delicious and the wait staff give great recommendations. I *might* be biased... got engaged here and just had our anniversary dinner here. YUM.
author: Bret W.

description: My two favorite entree's at Frascati are the deboned chicken and their brined pork chop.  It's by far the best pork chop in the city in my opinion.
author: Mike S.

description: The one restaurant I try to go to EVERY time I am in San Francisco. Amazing food, ambiance, staff, everything. Bring your friends, bring a date- bring me!
author: Alexa B.

description: You feel like an honored guest and no detail is missed on the changing menu and the wine list. Recently one of desserts featured fresh blueberries brought in by a neighborhood regular. You can come alone and sit at the bar, but you'll likely leave having made a new friend.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
Everything about our experience here was fantastic--the unbelievably gracious service, the small intimate table on the balcony overlooking the open kitchen, the impeccable wine list, the flawless preparation of well-paired and subtle flavors on the menu, the warm lighting.

When we arrived for dinner, we were immediately seated at a table on the bottom floor, which may have been just fine, but yours truly was feeling a little chilly and wanted a table farther from the door (what can I say?  I'm a delicate flower, damnit).  The host informed us that he had a perfectly romantic table overlooking the entire restaurant, but that a reservation had been made for it in 2 hours time.  It was perfect.  We had to have it.  We agreed to dine efficiently and vacate the premises in under 2 hours time.  Well.... so much for best laid plans....  A cheese course; an appetizer of warm figs coated in a balsamic reduction and served with maytag blue cheese,; and half way through a scintillating conversation held over maple leaf duck breast and pork tenderloin, we realized that the party who had reserved our table should have been seated right where we were... right then.  Oops.  Sorry, nameless and faceless couple...  we really did want you to have the table...  really.  Anyway, we called over a server to inform her of our dining faux pas and she graciously informed us that the host had made do and seated the couple elsewhere... and then she whisked our worries away by offering another fine wine selection for our meal.  Now *that*, my friends, is service.

Fantastic.  Simply fantastic.
author: vicarious c.

description: LOVE this place!  Everything was delicious.  The three dishes that we had all were simple and elegant, dishes that truly showcase the food.  Nothing was fussy or heavy.  Every bite of literally everything tasted good.  The wine list also was perfect.  They have an incredibly diverse wine list, with a very good selection of wines in many different price ranges.  We sat at the bar to eat, and it was very comfortable.  If you have any claustrophobia issues, ask for a table downstairs, not in the tiny alcove.
author: Amme P.

description: We were looking for a quaint, cozy, romantic restaurant that had great food the locals love....we found it at Frascati!  The food was outstanding, the wine was perfect, the service was attentive and the ambience was romantic.  Thank you Alexander for treating us so well! We are from Colorado -- next time we are in the Bay area, we are going back to Frascati!
author: Deborah W.

description: I always enjoy coming here with the girlfriend. It is one of my favorite spots for a romantic, relatively quiet evening, with some really good food.  They do pretty much everything well (appetizers, cheese plate, pasta dishes, salads, desserts, wine list, espresso drinks)... Not my favorite restaurant in the city - but definitely a good standby that is worth stopping by with that special someone.
author: D S.

description: I just dined at Frascati on Tuesday, and I think this is my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  The food is incredible, the atmosphere is top notch.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  The chocolate bread pudding put me on another planet, and I think may have actually been hung-over the next day because if it.
author: Meghan S.

description: Clearly, Frascati is a favorite of many and deservedly so. The lobster risotto is unbelievable and the service is absolutely perfect.
author: Lisa L.

description: This is a side of San Francisco I don't experience in my dump near the Panhandle.  I've been here twice (once with the stepmom, once with the real mom) and the food blew me away both times.  Great locals vibe with a hilarious old-people mixture of tipsy Nancy Pelosi clones and tipsy businessmen, in addition to a few dewy-eyed pretenders like myself.  If I had lots of money, there would be a standing reservation in my name.
author: S P.

description: Best Italian in the city. Great staff and wine list. We spent our anniversary here. Request to sit upstairs in the backroom. It's super romantic and tends to be quieter than the main dining room.
author: Marianne s.

description: My wife and I go to Frascati every year for our wedding anniversary and we are never dissapointed.  It is cozy and the food is amazing.  The only problem is parking, but even that won't scare us away.
author: Lewis C.

description: Started with the Foie Gras Torchon (w/ apple-currant compote, sauterne gastrique and toast points).  Being a carnivore, my main course was their Grilled Pork Chop (with bacon braised cavolo nero, baked polenta, roasted cipollini jus) - I think this is one of their signature dishes.  The food was definitely good, but for me the service is what made this place stand out.  I sat at the bar and one of the owners, my server, and the bartender were all very friendly.
author: Mark K.

description: Awesome food, nice location, decent service.  The gnocchi are absolutely delicious!  The only thing preventing a 5-star rating was so-so service.  highly recommended for any and all foodies looking for a new neighborhood spot.
author: Albert B.

description: Intimate feel, great food.  Went there a while ago but what I can remember was the AMAZING panna cotta.
author: Nate H.

description: My boyfriend asked me to move in with him at this place and it was so romantic. They gave us a window seat and the food was absolutely delicious! They surprised us with a complimentary glass of "bubbles" when they heard the good news. The atmosphere is warm and rustic - a real italian gem. So charming that it is right on the cable car line so you can have a romantic ride on the car and not have to worry about parking!!
author: Courtney B.

description: This is great find in a great neighborhood. They really care about service, the food and wine list. Staff is knowledgeable and experienced. I heard that they have "date" table that you can reserve. Be sure to make reservations!
author: Stephanie I.

description: This restaurant is so beautifully charming and the food is absolutely delicious.  This is the type of place you should go with someone you really care about.  It is not the cheapest place in town, but not Michael Mina either.  Albert is very helpful with selection of wines. Ask for one of the front tables by the window and enjoy the chimes of the trolley car going by.
author: Anna S.

description: Cute location on Hyde Street, with cable cars rolling by.  Tree-lined sidewalks and a quiet neighborhood-y feel.  However, truth be told... food was average and service was rushed.  Even though we had reservations, it was near closing time and they weren't that good at hiding their feelings.  "Here's your table... are you ready for the check?"  ;-P
author: Ryan L.

description: Yum Yum.  The cheese plate was delicious.  The lamb was fantastic and so was the duck.  All the side dishes are yummy too.  Especially the asparagus.  oohh.  FYI, the lobster risotto was just a little too heavy.  Other than that, everything was pretty damn good.  The wine selection was super tasty, the service was oh so friendly and the atmosphere cozy and cute.  Check it out.
author: Marla L.

description:
On the whole, Frascati deserves a solid B, which is a combination of A for ambience, B+ for service, and B for food. 

Typical of many Russian Hill's "new" restaurants like Amarena and Luella, Frascati delivers solidly on romantic nook-like ambience and low table volume, however, comes short on inventiveness of cuisine. All dishes generally are expertly prepared variations of the standard protein (usually lamb or chicken) on carbs (pasta, lentils or rice) plating. A dish to recommend would be the bass (if they offer it).

If your tastes run on the milder side (ie you're more of a meat and potatoes person), then these may be your ticket. However, if you are looking for real foodiness, you will probably be disappointed.

Also, smaller point, but I did find the service to be a tad bit rushed for a romantic dinner place (my wife barely finished her salad and appetizer before the plate was cleared out and entree brought in). Normally, speedy is good, here its bad, as you're partially paying for table time.

In sum, great place for first dates, dinner out with mom/dad  visiting from the midwest, etc  that calls for good locale and an easily predictable fine dining menu.
author: Deuce B.

description: Don't go there or tell anyone about this place. If word gets out - I'll never be able to get a table there again. And neither will you, so be careful...(pssst, the chicken is the best you'll ever eat. And I don't even like chicken).
author: Jennifer B.

description: Went there for dinner last night and it was fabulous. The space is so cute and cozy. We started with a bottle of wine off of the extensive and very good wine list, the Pei mussels, squid, shrimp app was delicious.  The broth that it was cooked in was delicious.  For our entree I had the salmon which was sauteed with blood oranges and served with parsnip potatoes which was great.  My husband had the pork porterhouse that he enjoyed, but I found dry, but I got to imagine it very difficult to cook a piece of pork that large.  For dessert, the bread pudding.  I personally am not a bread pudding person but that was fantastic!  The staff was delightful and we had a great time.  We will definitely go back!
author: Jaime C.

description: MMMMMMM. This is the best romantic restaurant in San Francisco. My husband and I sat up on the second floor balcony, overlooking the kitchen wizardry going on below. The smells rising from the kitchen were incredible, our waiter impeccable, the food delectable.
author: Sahra H.

description: Amazing.  Never knew this place even existed.  RIGHT IN MY NEIGHBORHOOD TOO, I'm excited!  Had to review it as soon as I got home.  Everything was wonderful, the atmosphere, the music, the staff, the wine, the food, the dessert.  (Oh wow the dessert!)  I ate so much.  (Ouch, I probably ate too much.)  Cozy, friendly, etc.  As for prices, I wouldn't know, I didn't pay.   Can't wait to visit again. ^_^)b
author: Mary R.

description: Food and service were both great in a cute setting (tables are close).  Don't know how I missed the much raved about decadent chocolate bread pudding --  I've come to terms w/ my penchant for bread pudding after years of trying to steer clear of it so I'm definitely heading back to satisfy my curiosity.
author: Jeannie C.

description: I am in love with this place. We went the other night for my ladies mothers b-day and it was awesome.  The Pork Chops are to die for and they are the best that I have had since my mother made them for me last.  I cannot wait until I get to go back.
author: Bryan M.

description: the staff were all so nice. we didn't have a reservation and it was so crowded (not that much room in there) and they found us a table. They recommended a great bottle of red wine and the gnocchi was amazing!
author: shadi m.

description:
very charming and enjoyable neighborhood restaurant. food was excellent all around from the appetizers to dessert. the grilled bread salad, and the duck confit salad were tasty, entrees were just right, the pork chop seems to be popular, i saw several dishes pass by and was tempted to order it as it looked quite tasty but i ended up having the duck breast. if you have room for dessert, bread pudding is a must here.

since the space is fairly small, make reservations if possible. the upstairs area is cozy and intimate, and I can see it being a good area to host a small dinner group, or to share a romantic date. downstairs its a bit more lively and open.

the only negative is the parking situation around this area. no valet so if you're looking for a spot, you better start praying to the parking gods before you head out here.
author: helen l.

description: Went here about a year ago and I thought everything was great.  Amazing duck salad and if I recall i had some pretty bitchin' lamb chops.   I thought the service was one of the best parts though.  I love neighborhood places like this that make an effort to provide an accommodating experience and great atmosphere.
author: Katie M.

description:
good food, service was WACKed OUT 

tuna tartar-boring, stay away

figs appetizer- pretty good, the fig and the cheese were the best part

waldorf salad- good contrasting flavors. the apple and cheese go well with the lettuce

halibut- pretty good, fresh, delicately and properly seasoned. i liked the potato more than the fish though. but thats just me. i really like potatoes. and i really like fish. but this time potatoes more.

braised short ribs-ok, nothing too memorable.

two glasses of wine

service: toward the middle of our meal our waitress had disappeared to attend to 3-4 other tables, and by the end of our meal the waitress was ignoring us. so when she brought some plates to the adjacent table (1 foot away) i asked for some boxes, and in an irritated voice said "sure just a minute" then she came back with the boxes and said "Did you need to go somewhere?!OH, I THOUGHT YOU NEEDED TO GO SOMEWHERE!". basically i was shocked, and in fact should have withheld all gratuity from that lash at my benign request.
author: Porkers T.

description: 4 starts bc my bf loved it so much, he had the half chicken and said it was the best chicken he ever had. i tried it but didnt think it was anything special, i had a fish that i dont remember much about. it was just ok for me but the bf loved it.
author: Iliana B.

description: This is the perfect date place.  It is romantic and cute and the food is delicious.  I went with girl friends on a monday night once...not that romantic, but we had amazing wine, amazing food, and the most delectable dessert!  Boys, take your ladies to this place.
author: Tracy M.

description:
For all those chocolate lovers out there with carb issues, the chocolate bread pudding here is definitely worth splurging on.  It's more cake-like than pudding and it really may be chocolate in its most ideal form.    
The rest of the food ain't too shabby either.  Almost more importantly, the service in this classic well-established Russian Hill italian is above and beyond the competition.  They take great car of you in that perfect friendly way without being solicitous or overbearing.      
The food ... well ... yeah ... it's good.  We had steak and pork chops this weekend.  Both were spectacular.  Cooked absolutely to perfection and nicely flavored.  The triple duck appetizer was an experience.  The pate was a bit earthy and strong for my taste, but the duck prosciuto (they make it themselves and it takes 8 years) is fantastic - not too salty and a layered deep taste.  The third duck thing (I forget its name) took the cake though.  wow.  kinda like a tampenade, and very tasty.     
Highly recommended date place, or great for a small group of friends.  Upstairs is nicer than down, and the back room upstairs looks great for a small party.
author: J P.

description: Maybe it was all the hype, but I didn't think Frascati's food was superb.  The cheese plate was good, as was the much touted chocolate bread pudding; but my food (I had the pork chops, my dining companion had the duck breast) was way salty.  I'd definitely go back to see if it was an off night, especially since the space is really nice (a definite date night).  Still, for that much money, there shouldn't be an off night in the kitchen.
author: Helen C.

description: Growing up on Italian food.. I have a high standard for the cuisine and Frascati not only meets the quality standard but exceeded my expectation.  The food. the staff and the wine are always spectacular.  Whether eating at the bar or sitting down to a romantic meal the place always delivers.   Not the most cost effective place in the city but worth every nickel.
author: Tom C.

description: Consistently excellent food, welcoming ambiance,  and outstanding service.  It's a perfect place to bring people from out of town (you can arrive by cable car) for fresh California cuisine,  friendly staff, and a great wine list, including wines by the glass.
author: Alison C.

description: Great date place. Very warm, and the food is amazing. I remember the foie gras being outstanding, and the wine list tasty. The only bad thing is parking. I've tried going here 3 subsequent times and got so fed up with finding parking. I guess that's what you get when you drive to a restaurant that's a 10 minute walk from your house. Karma.
author: Carson H.

description: We had a dinner party for 13 here last night and the service, food, atmosphere were spectacular. I have been here on many occasions with varying party sizes and I have never left unimpressed. The gnocchi was amazing as a starter and the filet minon could rival any of the steakhouses in San Francisco. Beware, there is no valet parking and the closest lot is at Broadway & Polk  which also doubles as the Walgreens parking lot. The Bread pudding for dessert is amazing, so save room.
author: Miles T.

description: This was one of the first great restaurants I tried in SF. I liked the ambiance of the little room tucked away upstairs since it made it intimate and special. The food was capital D Delicious, but maybe that's just because filet mignon naturally sways my vote. My boyfriend, who would not normally even try steak tartare actually enjoyed it after a little coaxing. It's a great place for a date, and I'm yearning to go back.
author: Shannon R.

description: Love the ambiance of this place - really cute and quaint.  Food was great - I had the much-heralded duck breast, gnocchi appetizer, and cheese platter.  All were good, but the duck was my favorite.  The bread pudding was delicious although it seemed to be more of a brownie than bread pudding.  Service wasn't outstanding but nothing to complain about.  Two quibbles I have with this place: 1) there is just one bathroom for the entire restaurant which means the wait can be irritatingly long; 2) we sat in the upstairs area which was directly above the kitchen and as a result, *extremely* hot.
author: Melinda C.

description: Food was tasty but sevice was so slow.  I went on a Tuesday night and it took over an hour to get my entree.  Nice setting but there are other places in the city where you can get more bang for your buck.
author: Jose C.

description: Good thing I live close by and I can just walk because parking is NOT easy but boy is it worth it. Great service and great food. I like to sit downstairs because the atmosphere is so nice and I like to sit upstairs so I can look into the kitchen and watch them cook, but that's kind of my thing. The people who work here, Jesse, Brian, John, etc. are all so wonderful and have great personalities. The food is ALWAYS delicious, the chicken, the gnocchi, EVERYTHING. I love this place because it's fine dining at a neighborhood restaurant.
author: Shelley M.

description: I want to cry...we just went back this weekend and it's changed.  I was here about 3 months ago and the food wasn't as amazing and the whole vibe felt strange but I figured it was just an off night so we went back this weekend and it's official - it's different.  I'm not sure if the owners have changed or what's happened but there was no joy in the place and the food wasn't that great.  The old staff, who always made each meal there so fun and interesting, seem to have disappeared and the food isn't as delicious like it once was (sea bass carpaccio was sliced way too thick and there was hardly any sauce so it was just kinda fishy, risotto was very al dente, watermelon salad was ehhh, but papardelle with broccolini was good). The place used to feel warm and cozy but now not so much.
author: Jean C.

description:
One of the best "neighborhood restaurants" in San Francisco. Warm atmosphere with cable cars going by out front. Staff is very friendly and John and Brian always remember repeat customers. I have been dining here regularly for over 5 years. 

Pork and Duck are my two favorite dishes. Bread salad and black mission fig appetizer (in season) are the two best starters. Best desert is the white and black chocolate bread pudding; all deserts are worth drying. Friendly corkage policy (buy a bottle, get a free corkage) is a plus. 

Only critiscisms are 1) the menu does not turnover as much as I would like to see and 2) one bathroom downstairs can be a bit akward. 

One of SF's best.
author: Mike S.

description: Outstanding-- the perfect little romantic restaurant. I went here recently with a couple of French friends who have high expectations with food and they were extremely impressed. The waiter even spoke French which was a fun surprise.
author: Derek S.

description:
great restaurant, food is quality and is not overly expensive.  

they have a very attentive waitstaff and are always friendly.  

very cozy place with a nice atmosphere for a nice but not too formal dinner setting.  

the fact it's right around the corner doesn't hurt...get yo self there!
author: Aaron M.

description: This is probably one of the best restaurants by far in SF. their steak will melt like butta in your mouth. their rice pudding desert will make you forget about all your troubles. on the pricey side but worth it for a special occassion like a birthday dinner.
author: Sanaz E.

description: Truly one of the best dining experiences of my life.  White truffle gnocchi, and chocolate bread pudding... mmm.
author: Sarah T.

description: Okay, this place is off the hook. First of all, the food is excellent, everything down from the house gnochi the duck with wild mushrooms to the incredible chocolate and coconut bread pudding was impeccable. But even better than all of that is the great atmosphere and the totally friendly, cool and non pretentious staff. I think this place is my new favorite restaurant!
author: Nicole S.

description:
very good. filet was... well...perfect. not chez spencer perfect ..but was pretty close. my date had the fussili with rabbit bolognease. wow. 
its in my hood so...i try to only go once in a blue moon to keep it special. :)
author: Dave L.

description: A finer restaurant is hard to find, that dishes up incredible food in a comfortable and elegant atmosphere, and delivers it with panache. The place stayed busy, but cozy never became crowded. All four courses arrived in harmony, fresh silver in place, and wine glasses full. Everybody's said it and I will too... do not miss the chocolate bread pudding! Mike, the new chef, has not missed a beat.
author: Jeremi M.

description: I went here for my birthday, and it was a lovely experience. The food was solid, especially the bread pudding for dessert. Service was wonderful - attentive, but not intrusive. Atmosphere was very cute and homey, like others have said. Location is ideal for a romantic dinner - just come early for street parking!
author: Carolyn M.

description:
Minus one star because of the noise level. Too many tables packed into such a small dining space.

The food was great, the service was great, and the bread pudding was phenomenal. 

Good place for a first date, although I took my parents when they came to town. Average age must have been 45 in the place.
author: Jenna F.

description:
i have passed this small place so many times on the cable car line, i finally made it in. we got a small table right in the front of the door, which isnt the best location, but it was our fault as we were a bit too late for our reservation, so at least we got a table as the place was packed.
the wine list is small but real nice, but they were out of the glass i wanted, and it was only 7pm at this point. that is pretty bad.
fortunately the food made up for this transgression. i think we had foie to start. quite tasty.
we then split the swordfish and the wild boar sugo. both were perfect. the swordfish was one of the best pieces of fish i was had in sf, though maybe a bit small. and wild boar sugo was fantasticly tasty. i was tempted to give only 3 stars, and thought about 5 stars, so 4 stars is the way to go. taste trumped all else in the end. and i was tasty food
author: Rich B.

description: Perfect in nearly every way: great food with never an off-note; welcoming, professional, personable service; and a cozy atmosphere. This place is a stand-by for us; we just keep going back. I always wonder why Frascati doesn't make Bauer's Top 100. I suppose we should count our blessings, though, because it's still relatively easy to get a table here.
author: Arley L.

description: I went to Frescati last week, later without a reservation on a Thursday.  3 of us were seated immediately.  I thought that the place itself is great.  I actually liked that the staff were somewhat hands off, but I could have seen that being a minus in the opinion of others.  As for the food, I had the gnocci appetizer and duck for dinner.  I thought that the quality of the food was very good and well prepared, but it didn't quite have as much flavor as I would have liked.  I thought the chocolate bread pudding for dinner was excellent.  Overall, I thought that this was very good.  I suspect that others might enjoy this even more than I did.
author: Daniel R.

description:
Eh. I ate here about 6 months ago and ordered the grilled pork chop that everyone was raving about. It was served to me raw on the inside. Cool to the touch and raw. It looked like uncooked chicken on the inside and really grossed me out. Do people eat rare pork? And even if they do---shouldn't I have been asked how I wanted it cooked? I would not have chosen rare. I was embarrassed to send it back (my fault-which is why I still give it 3 stars) but now I really wish I had because I think I would have liked it. Instead I just ate around the edges...I could tell it had potential. We also got a wild boar parpadelle that was very good. We were seated right by the front door which kept opening and letting a very cool draft it. I would probably have a totally different opinion of this place had my pork been cooked and we were seated upstairs overlooking the kitchen. 


I would like to give it another shot but there are just so many good restaurants in this city I'm not sure I'll ever get around to it.
author: Sara S.

description: I'm hear for lunch now, trying to order.  I was scolded and told I had to wait my turn by "Becky".  That was 10 minutes ago.  No matter what the food tastes like, I won't be back.  Don't come unless you have 2 hours for lunch, and like to be treated poorly.  By the way, she is the only server here in her defense.  Too bad I have to cross this off my list, not much on the hill to choose from.
author: Jane D.

description:
I checked this place out on the advice of yelp. It was dead on. This is one of the best casual restaurants I have ever been too.

The food overall was excellent. However, I found it ranged from good (The cocoa bison appetizer) to awesome (the lamb or watermelon salad). They know their wine, and the recommendations were greatly appreciated.

Service was excellent and fast.

Ambiance was very good with a open kitchen that lets you smell the food the chef's are cooking.

You cannot go wrong giving this place a try.
author: Jason R.

description:
I was prepared for this to be a great meal but it exceeded my expectations and hopes on so many levels. First, our table was perfect, upstairs right over the first floor/kitchen so we could view other diners and the chef...not your usual booth in the back, we loved it. A very cute restaurant with so much charm and a family run feel. We brought a bottle of fabulous wine and that was also a blast to drink. In terms of food, we had:
Hubby: Bread Salad-very good, but with more greens than I would have thought. Rack of lamb entree, he loved it, cooked perfectly, medium rare. Everything on the plate was superb.

Me:Octopus Salad-delicious, I'd never had octopus but decided to try it and it was soooo good. I had the gnocchi appetizer made into an entree, and it was phenomenal. Usually gnocchi have a cream sauce but this was a very light parsley, truffle oil, and I believe lemon sauce. It was so good, I ate every last one because it wasn't as heavy as most gnocchi. Delicious!

For dessert we had the bread pudding which was good, but the real star was the peanut butter ice cream...unbelievable!! Go now, don't wait! Its also reasonably priced for what you get, I was beyond happy when we left and so was my husband. Can't wait to go back!!
author: Kristin L.

description: This place has all the charm and appeal that Russian Hill has to offer. It wasn't easy to get a prime-time reservation, but it was definitely worth the wait. Great food, attentive waitstaff and cool ambiance.
author: Scott C.

description: I love this place!! The food is impeccable and the service is personable. I always take my good friends and family here when they come visit. I only wish this place wasn't so popular. I almost want to give it a bad review so it would be easier to get a table.
author: Matt K.

description: Friendliest wait staff in SF.  Solid dishes, great dessert.
author: James B.

description:
The service here is top notch, friendly and informed.  Food is quite tasty -- on par with any other fine dining establishment in SF.  But not quite 5 stars.  Didn't blow my mind -- but i was loving my duck with huckleberries and porcini mushrooms up to the last bite and spoonful of herbacious foie gras broth..    Gnocchi appetizer was stellar.  Deserts come in large portions -- a bit too much!

Atmosphere is lacking here for me -- just didn't come across as anything special.  I  wouldn't take a date here if i wanted intimacy and ambience.  Although other reviewers seem to like its intimate possibilities -- it just wouldn't be my style for a hot date.   In my opinion, it's more suited for  friends to catch up over dinner.  Or a fun night out to sample some good food with the old man/lady.
author: gabriel f.

description: Nice intimate space. Excellent quality food, though my specific dish was a combination that didn't quite work, at least for me (a nicely done piece of halibut, paired with way too may kidney beans). Huge, gargantuan, enormous, unfinishable chocolate bread pudding was really good, but way big. I normally can finish any dessert, but not this one (shared, even).
author: Bruce C.

description: One of the best restaurants in the city as far as I am concerned.  They cook their fish not 10 sec. too long or too short.  This says a lot esp. in a city where turnover and a lot of overlooking goes on in nice establishments.  Their foie gras, if you swing that way, is excellent!!!!!!!  T. Keller says the best thing about foie gras is that it is foie gras.  That being said, just try it once.
author: Susan K.

description: Frascati was a bit of a disappointment.  We had been told it was a good proxy to Quince, perhaps this bar was too high.  The bread salad was simply romaine with large croutons - too much vinegar in the dressing (doesn't hold a candle to Zuni).  The gnocchi was not fluffy and light (as one would expect); the sauce was overpowering (too much/too rich).  A tuscan bean soup was over salted, just a simple broth with beans.  Meat dishes (sea bass, pork) lacked anything special.  Would we return for any of these dishes?  No.  Ambience:  cramped, unromantically dark.  Service: mediocre, slow.   Overpriced for the quality of food/service.
author: babsie g.

description:
Excellent meal. I had a sea bass with mushroom & asparagus salad and a sort of Italian white vine. Everything was great including the lemon cake dessert. For a restaurant its caliber, there was just something missing to take it up to the full 5* level.  I do not know if it was the presentation or seating or what, but there was just something missing. The food was great though.

But please, understand this much: it was a great dining experience.
author: Rahul T.

description: The food is delicious.  We had the duck and the pork chops and we enjoyed both.  I wouldn't recommend brining a vegitarian here, and most of the selections contain meat.  They don't offer a cab or merlot by the glass, which is odd, but otherwise have an extensive wine list.  After reading the reviews on Yelp, we had to try the bread pudding, and I can't say it lived up to its expectations on Yelp, but it was really good.
author: Steve W.

description: We've been walking by this place in our hood for a couple years and had been meaning to go. When we finally got around to checking it out we were pleasantly surprised. It was a school night so instead of getting a bottle of wine we each just ordered a glass of the wine du jour. For an appetizer we got the cheese plate, which complemented the syrah nicely. Everything was excellent. I was particularly pleased with my entree of locally caught salmon, which was served on some kind of mediterranean salad. Everything was excellent. We're definitely going to have to go back on a weekend and try something from the wine list. I've got my eye on the 2002 Sean Thackrey Orion...
author: Clay J.

description: This little neighborhood restaurant amid cable cars and lit trees is one of my favorites in the city. The service, atmosphere, wine list, and menu can't be beat. I've been twice and have never been disappointed. Save room for dessert!
author: sarah s.

description: This could very well be the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco, and perhaps the best restaurant period in Russian Hill. I'm not a huge Italian food fan or anything, but I'd go back again and again. The food is remarkable. The restaurant is quaint and romantic. Definitely a good choice for a special occasion.
author: anjali k.

description:
Used to live in the neighborhood, so never faced the parking before dinner challenges that other Yelpers have complained about - but I definitely feel your pain on the parking situation. If driving - allocate EXTRA TIME (yes, even more than your SF norm) for parking. 

Great food. Wonderful asset for the neighborhood. Love the duck and the lamb. Is a little pricey, but at the time I was working too hard and this meal made me feel like a human being again.
author: Aman H.

description: Bland food + pretty poor service = I won't return. Foie gras is inherently delicious, but even the foie gras torchon had too much cream, not enough foie gras = not enough flavor. Each waiter was nice...but we rotated through four different waiters during the course of the meal. I have a severe nut allergy so had to inform each waiter about my allergy and still, Waiter #3 served me a dish only to have Waiter #4 remove it when I double checked. Not really acceptable.
author: Marc F.

description: I like to come here off hours so that it feels more intimate, and I've always had great food and company.  Fantastic place for a family dinner or celebration.
author: lesley b.

description: This just jumped up to my top 5 favorites in the city. Every single meal we ordered was excellent and the service was spot on! You can't go wrong here.
author: A D.

description: Excellent food and service offered in a charming, non-pretentious atmosphere.  The staff was very accommodating to our party of 12 and allowed us to order freely from the main menu.  Many restaurants of this caliber require a party of this size to order from a fixed menu.
author: Cynthia P.

description: This is by far one of the best meals that I have had since I have moved to the city...I had the Salmon (which was an addition to the menu that night) Sauted King Salmon with Parsnip-Potato Puree, Shaved Fennel, Basil, Braised Endive and Blood Orange Beurre Blanc ---was cooked perfectly and tasted perfecty.  The person I was dining with had the short ribs, which I was told were also fabulous.  The 2 salads, mixed greens and bread salad were also delightful. And yes...the Chocolate bread pudding was to die for.  They also feature a very good wine list.
author: Rita M.

description:
If you're in the mood for an intimate Mediterranean style dinner I would definitely recommend Frascati. I've been there three times now and have been very pleased every time. The service was outstanding and very accomodating. On my first visit we walked in around 9PM after a seating debacle at Cortez and although the place was packed they were able to seat us within 15 minutes. The restaurant itself is very small so seating might be an issue if you don't make a reservation. It can get a little loud, but the overall ambiance is very intimate. This is a great place to take a date. The food was not out of this world but it was certainly up there. I would certainly recommend this place especially if you're bringing a date.



*Update*

Just went here tonight again. I'd have to give this place a solid 4 stars as opposed to 5. Zagat rates their food as a 26 (quite high) but I'd honestly have to say they're more around the 24 range. Honestly it was a monday night so there were no 'specials' and some of the food may have been less then fresh. For example, I had the rack of lamb dish that they were currently serving and the spinach tasted as if it was a little over the hill (it was rather tough and chewy). The lamb itself was excellent but a bit gamey for my taste (they did not trim it too well). Granted I can sometimes be a bit picky with lamb... The appetizer was quite good (had the russet potato gnocchi). They did a rather good job not over doing the truffle oil as many places often over-do it. The dessert was nothing special but still quite good. The service was very attentive and polite. They started off serving our dishes rather fast so I requested to slow things down a bit and they were more than willing to do so. 

I've been to this place 4 times in my last 3 years in SF and chose to go here as my final restaurant (I move back to Boston tomorrow). I was pleased, but not particularly impressed. Nothing really stood out despite the fact that the food was very solid in regards to its quality overall. This is certainly a place worth stopping in if you enjoy food with a Mediterranean influence. It seems as if things may have gone a little downhill since the first or second time I've been there, but I would still certainly recommend them. The atmosphere is great as is the food.
