It's important to note that when I review I do it far more subjectively in regards to the particular cuisine/restaurant. I may give a hole in the wall sushi restaurant 5 stars and give a location such as this 4. That is not to say that one is better than the other... rather when compared to other restaurants that hold themselves out in a particular manner 'this' particular restaurant rates somewhere around 'here.'

Great place. Certainly worth giving it a try. I've been happier, but still most certainly very satisfied with my dinner there tonight.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: One of our favorites that we re-visited for a special night, Frascati let us down a bit.  The gnocchi app was very tasty...light fluffy gnocchi that were pan seared with a buttery sauce and veggies.  The lamb and pork were good as well, but the bread pudding dessert was dry and forgettable.  Worst though was the service.  The nice manager couldn't make up for being forgotten about by our waiter, who ignored us even after we had given him some of our wine!!!  Not cool.
author: Adam D.

description: I have been going to Frascati for a couple of years and have always been overly pleased with the food.  The service is always very good and the restaurant has a great atmosphere.  The only problem is difficult to get a table without a reservation.
author: Paula F.

description: Frascati is so super dooper cozy and quaint. People riding by on the cable cars wave at you from the street. The service was perfect - attentive but not overly so . . .the gnocchi, halibut, iron steak, spring salad, bread pudding, strawberry shortcake . . . . . . all seriously delish.
author: Leslie D.

description: Practically perfect in every way.  We had the cheese plate, Ahi Nicoise, Rack of Ribs, brocollini and fresh apricot sorbet for dessert.  All of the food was sooo delicious, the service was attentive and charming, and the atmosphere allowed you to relax and exhale.  I also liked how it seemed to be a neighborhood favorite with the host chatting with passing pedestrians and people coming in wearing cargo shorts and flip flops.  We sat upstairs and were treated to a floor show of watching the chefs in the open kitchen prepare our meal.  A definite must - you will not be disappointed!!
author: Carrie B.

description: What a great neighborhood spot.  It's got all the charm you need if you're looking for an intimate place to catch up with a friend over a glass of wine and some dinner.  The wine selection is great and most servers seem knowledgeable about food pairings.  I'm sure they'd accomodate you, but it seems more like a place for groups of 2-6 than larger parties.  Of course, take a cab or walk and avoid parking headaches.
author: Danielle B.

description: Do not eat here! Because if you do, I will have to compete with you for space, and I don't want to! The food at Frascati is delicious, inventive, and well-matched by their tasty wine selection. The service is excellent, some of the best I've experienced since moving to SF last summer. We had a rotating staff of servers, yet never once did we feel intruded upon or neglected. I highly recommend the cheese plate, and also the A-mazing apple cobbler. The atmosphere is cozy, but the dining area is large enough so that you never feel crowded. I'd recommend it for a romantic date or just a night out with good food.
author: L R.

description: One of the most consistent restaurants in the city.  John runs the front of the house, never forgets a face.  Most of the crowd seems to be from the neighborhood, with a few lucky out of towners.  Reservations are highly reccomened, however we got lucky with a walk in last night.  No real mistakes on the menu however, I have found the duck overcooked as well.  I thinks its the maple that dries it out.  Other than that its amazing!  Dinner for two as follows: Split the steak tartare, soup, salad and an entree.  Everyone says the bread salad is a must order, its really good, liked the pear salad last night though.  Also had the rabbit risotto last night and it was just a wonderful dish.  I would have preferred it a bit more gamey, most folks would not.  Finally, I am not a huge dessert fan however, the BREAD PUDDING is amazing!!!! One of the few desserts my wife has to split equally with me.  Another great date spot, neighborhood gem etc...
author: Tom W.

description: I went here for my birthday dinner and can't praise this place enough.  We had a reservation and they were a little late getting us our table, but the host was very nice and attentive; he let us have a drink outside while we waited.  Our server was unimposing but always available whenever we needed something.  Last but not least, the food! It was by far some of the BEST I've had in San Francisco.   Be sure to try the gnocchi for an appetizer if you come here, and finish off with the bread pudding for dessert.  Your tastebuds will thank you!  I can't wait until I get to go here again.
author: Erin F.

description: Love this place.  Service is impeccable and the food is delicious.  It's the perfect place for a date or to take out of town guests.  If you are lucky enough to get seated by the window you can watch the cable cars.
author: Janet L.

description:
Friendly host/owner notwithstanding, this place is teflon.  

How did it ever get the Zagat rating that it did?

Overpriced, food uneven.  And an astronomical corkage charge of $20 for the 1st bottle, $25 for the 2nd.  

We are not going back.
author: Michaela S.

description:
I have been here twice.  Once on a first date, and once with my girlfriend and another couple.  Both times the food and service were excellent.  I particularly like that if you walk away from the table to visit the bathroom, when you come back the napkins are refolded and waiting for you.  Both times we came here we came by cable car and stopped at Bacchus for before dinner wine which sets a great mood.

The staff were very nice about ensuring that our dining experience was delightful.  For example, they weren't trying to turn around our table quickly, rather, they expect that you stay for a while.
author: Joshua M.

description:
Went for dinner last night and LOVED it!  An intimate, charming little establishment in a lovely setting.  Jesse was our waiter and was friendly and attentive.  Recommended a very nice red wine to go with dinner.

Husband & I split the salmon bruschetta -- very tasty -- and a mixed green salad with stone fruit, goat cheese & coriander vinaigrette dressing, which was very refreshing and delicious.  There were peaches, bing cherries, apricots, and the combination of fruit, cheese, & greens was perfect!

I had a pan seared halibut which was cooked perfectly!  Husband had the lamb which was also very delicious -- he thought it was the best he has had.

I must admit that I was initially disappointed in the dessert menu as I love chocolate & cake and didn't really see anything that met either description that looked satisfying (they had a bread pudding, but I'm not a bread pudding lover).  I tried the Affogato, however, and it was very good (vanilla bean ice cream w/ chantilly cream, espresso & a biscotti) -- never had Affogato before, but now I'm a fan.  Husband tried the peach & blueberry crisp which he enjoyed (large portion) and subbed the vanilla ice cream with a chocolate-nut ice cream which he raved about.

Can't wait for another excuse to go back to Frascati!
author: trish l.

description:
From the moment you walk into Frascati, you feel like you're entering a family dining room.  The host opens the door for you and ushers you to your table, every waiter says hello and welcomes you with a smile.  Ordinarily, I don't believe that service can make or break a restaurant- but the first impression absolutely set the stage for the divine meal to follow.

The place is small, cute, cozy.  I'd recommend trying to get a reservation on the second floor so you can look out at the trolley cars- it's quintessentially San Franciscan.  

The wine list is superb and my hubby and I asked the waiter to pick our red.  We ordered the heirloom tomato salad (with olive tapanade to give it a slightly different kick) and the waldorf (very good although if you don't like blue cheese I'd opt for their argula with fresh pears) as starters.  Service was prompt (in fact I wouldn't have minded having more time to dig into the bread basket!)  

Our entrees really blew us away -- I ordered the halibut which was prepared PERFECTLY over a delicious wide rice and butter sauce (light, not heavy).  My husband ordered the pork and literally polished his plate.  It was served with a grilled peach, which he generously offered me half of and I quickly gobbled before he could retrack it - sooo delicious!

For dessert, we split the blueberry cobbler.  It was heavy on the brown sugar but who complains about brown sugar?  It was delicious although I think next time we'll try something else.

Bottom line:  this place is a wonderfully romantic little secret in russian hill.  It's ambiance is cozy and friendly, and the food, although not surprising, is done perfectly.  I highly highly recommend this place for a special occasion.
author: Casey M.

description: Four of us went for dinner here earlier this week, and it was superb! We had the foie gras and steak tartare to start - both were delicious. Wine list was good, and we all shared a nice bottle of Turley and were attentively waited on the entire time. The service was terrific - not too overbearing, and our server made the night fun and entertaining. We had the pork chops, duck, and chicken...everyone was very pleased - the food was outstanding, and we will definitely be going back for more next time in SF.
author: D. O.

description: Possibly one of the worst meal I've had this year. My short ribs was tasteless, tough and dry. The bread pudding for dessert tasted like it just came out of the freezer and was not reheated properly. The person sitting next to us left more than half of her appetizer and entree untouched. Can't believe there's 4 stars rating for this restaurant on here. Maybe we went on when the chef was out sick.
author: W L.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat.  It is so cute and romantic and the food is great!  I highly recommend it.  A great spot for a romantic date.  I seriously need to move to the neighborhood.  Cheers!
author: J N.

description:
So, a really wonderful and solid "nice restaurant." Homey and unassuming, on a great corner in Russian Hill (watch the cable cars go by and sit outside on warm nights), great food, great wine. I was most impressed though by the way our waiter (Jesse) made up for forgetting our salad. He was straight-up and said he screwed up, apologized sincerely, and then promptly came back and said "save some room for dessert, I'm going to bring you something great and chocolate."

I've been given free "apology desserts" before but you know... sometimes they don't tell you they're bringing it for a while... or sometimes you feel like you have to check the bill and see if they charged you... the responsiveness and warmth we felt here was like being at a friend's place. CLASSY!

And, the chocolate bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream was rockin. I'll be back!
author: Rachelle M.

description: When we went, the service was a little slow, but very polite and attentive. All of the food was good and prepared well and ALMOST perfect. The risotto was too much of a bite, but the flavors were put together very well. The apples in the cobbler didn't taste fresh, but the topping was nice and crumbly. Even though the chocolate bread pudding wasn't as decadent as I expected, it was full of great chocolate flavor. Overall a very good dinner.
author: Trisha P.

description:
I absolutely love this restaurant - I've taken my parents there when they come into town and its always a hit.  Also great for a romantic date.  The atmosphere is so cute and warm - the lighting is soft and inviting.  The food is great and the staff is always eager to please.

The apple cobbler/tart dessert is amazing!
author: Clair S.

description: Beautiful location, good atmosphere, attentive staff, fresh simple dishes, knowledgable about the wine selection.  A solid place.
author: Meghan G.

description: AMAZING!!!  Definitely my favorite restaurant in the city.  They have the best chocolate bread pudding I have ever had!! The scallops and halibut were also amazing.  I always take visitors here, but you must make a reservation!!!
author: kara S.

description: Terrific.  One of my favorite restaurants in the city.
author: Kimberly G.

description: Our experience here gained momentum (or perhaps goodness) as the meal went on.  Wine to start was way to hot for a red (mine) and my wife's was like it just came out of the freezer.  It peeves me when you pay for a nice glass of wine but it's so cold you can't taste it.  Then the hamachi tartare - good quality tuna but too many onions (or scallions?) drowned out the flavor.  Second appetizer was this fig dish with some blue cheese, balsamic glaze and prosciutto - very creative and equally delicious.  For the entrees we went with duck and pork; both were really special.  I don't think I've ever tasted such a perfectly cooked, tender and well seasoned pork chop.  The duck breast was also fantastic, and the bed of treats under it had me polishing the plate.  For desert the black and white chocolate bread pudding is very worthy and plenty sizable for two.  Definitely recommend and will likely return for the cuisine and good service.
author: Matt C.

description: FANTASTIC! The food, the service, the wine, the dessert...everything was perfect for a wonderful date night. The gnocchi starter was absolutely mouth-watering...so was the duck salad. The chocolate bread pudding is a must-try. We'll definitely be back for more. 5 stars across the board!
author: M Z.

description: We stayed in SF for a week and ate here twice. Even though they were busy, they managed to fit us in. Great food, great service, and we even found a good wine to add to our list at home.
author: Eric M.

description: Overall a wonderful experience.  The service is top notch.  We had a reservation for 4 on a Friday night at 6pm and we were seated right away.  Our server was friendly and knowledgeable and very attentive.  We had four different starters, all of which were outstanding.  I had the duck confit salad which was fantastic.  My dining companions raved about their mushroom bruschetta, smoked salmon salad, and the waldorf salad.  For our main courses, we had one fish dish which was good but not extraordinary, the duck entree, a fresh pasta special with pulled pork and papardelle, and the short ribs.  The pasta was the highlight of the entrees - perfectly seasoned and piping hot.  Large portion too.  The short ribs were the lowlight.  Too fatty to eat.  My mom had ordered this dish after raving about her mushroom bruschetta and couldn't eat the fatty meat.  The waiter took it away and insisted on bringing her another dish on the house so a few minutes later, he appeared with a gnocchi dish which was delicious.  They also didn't charge for the short ribs - super classy.  For dessert, we all shared the chocolate bread pudding with hazelnut ice cream and it was a dream!  Large enough for sharing and rich and delicious.  Atmosphere is nice and cozy, but a touch noisy.  Great place to take my parents from out of town.  I'd go back just for the bread pudding!
author: Carrie L.

description: Rude staff and very ordinary food.  We live in the neighborhood and eat out 3 or 4 times a week - well after three tries at Frascati they are out.  The food was fairly nice, not bad not great but oddly enough even after having returned three times in a short period of time we were still being treated as if they were doing a favor by letting us eat there. The waiters were without an exception condescending and finally when we stopped by to confirm a reservation while on a walk we were treated to a waiter who decided that it was more important to talk to a favored customer than even deign to acknoledge our presence while we waited in the door - sorry three strikes you're out - we're off to Luella's across the street where the food is much better and the staff very professional.
author: RJ M.

description: I hate to go against the grain, but I wasn't super impressed with this place.  The starters were great--had the gnocchi and brussel sprouts, both of which were very flavorful and yummy (the gnocchi is pretty heavy on the garlic).   Upon the waiter's suggestion, I went with the sea bass special (instead of the ahi--prolly a good thing for me b/c I'm not a huge fennel fan).  The sea bass was lightly pan fried, and served above a light mix of greens and barley, which were in a broth of clams, calamari, and sausage.  It was good, but not spectacular.  I was super excited about the much toted bread pudding...again, it was good, but both my dining companion and I thought it seemed more like a warm brownie...the hazelnut ice cream was delicious, though.  I liked Bix's chocolate bread pudding better.  Finally, service...well, it really wasn't there.  I'm okay with not-so-attentive waitstaff, but I do appreciate a good demeanor when they do approach you...I just didn't feel that here.  And, the hostess had to come clear our plates b/c she saw them sitting there for so long...anyway, decent restaurant, but didn't live up to the hype (for me).
author: Joyce L.

description: if i could give this place more than 5 stars, you better believe i would!  my date and i went here and we had probably the most romantic table in the restaurant (which i'd requested when i made the reservation).  the service was impeccable and the food was just as oustanding.  i had the filet and i can't recall what my date had because i didn't write this review immediately after we went (which i should have done).  but i can't rave enough about everything we had.  and we were cheesy tourists and came in with a camera and the waiter was very obliging and took some pictures of us (i know, i know....).  i would recommend this place to anyone visiting or living in SF.  and if it's a romantic date, ask for the romantic table!
author: Emily B.

description: Okay, I broke my 'no chicken, except at luna park' rule. The waitress would not stop raving about it and I wasn't in the mood for meat or fish and my 2 friends were already ordering the pork chops. So I went for it and it was SO tasty!! Good pick Miss Waitress. But first, the apps - we had the cheese plate and gnocchi. The gnocchi is a signature dish and it did not disappoint. It was perfectly rich with sweet corn, peas and a touch of truffle oil. The cheese plate was good, but I wish they were a little more generous with their portions. My 2 favorites cheeses were the Idiazaba,l a spanish sheeps milk,  and the Roaring 40's, a bleu cheese. For the entrees we had the chicken and pork chops. Like I said, the chicken was a huge hit. A bunch of other pple in the restaurant were raving about it too. The baked garlic peels were lovely. I smeared them on bread, on my potatoes, on my chicken! I sampled the pork chops too and can't wait to go back so I can order it as my entree. They do something with it for like 24 hours...marinate? pan roast? I can't remember, but they definitely take very good care of it. And for dessert, the chocolate bread pudding. I love bread pudding and this was one of my favorites. My only complaint - not every bite was rich & moist, there were a few bites in there that were a little stale/hardened. Overall, lovely russian hill spot. Try to get the window spot - it's a bit more private and has a nice view of the hyde street passerbys!
author: Samira S.

description: I booked a reservation through open table for this place for me and my boyfriend's anniversary. I received the second floor just as I requested, that was nice. The service was great, numerous waiters serving you, so as soon as you need something or think about it, they're there to help. Well, the place was a lot smaller than I expected, that didn't matter much, but just wanted to point that out. To the food, we ordered the Salmon Bruschetta for an appetizer. I didn't know the salmon was raw... a few bites out of the raw salmon made my stomach hurt. I don't what the hell that green pasty stuff was, but it made Olive Garden and Red Lobster's bruschetta taste so much better. Then onto our meal, we both ordered the Pork Chops, because that was the only thing on the menu that appealed to us and exactly what we've been craving for. It looked delicious! Eh, it was okay. The only thing that I can say was bomb was their chocolate cake a la mode with hazelnuts and caramel. SO GOOD! Other than that, though, won't be returning.
author: Elle C.

description: My experience at Frascati can be summarized in just one word: PERFECT. I selected Frascati for a very special dinner with the love of my life. They delivered the perfect combination of great food & wine in a relaxing/casual and romantic/intimate, yet stylish/cool atmosphere. We were lucky enough to get one of the tables in the window - absolutely charming! Pedestrians with dogs and cable cars added to the uniquely San Francisco ambiance. What was so stylish/cool was that the food, service, decor, and atmosphere felt so relaxed and effortless (nothing overt or trying too hard) yet flawlessly executed. Service was attentive but not intrusive and professional but not stuffy/snobby. Thank you for a wonderful evening!
author: Janet H.

description: Looking forward to an anniversary dinner, imagine our surprise to find a server sneezing repeatedly on the service floor and not washing his hands as he proceeded to serve food to guests.  Even more surprising, when my husband pointed it out quietly to a wait person, the entire front of house staff including the manager, proceeded to glance at our table while they shared some internal joke.  Still upset, my husband  addressed the sneezing server. More attitude.  The manager finally approached our table saying, "I understand you have a problem with how we handle California Food handling practices and proceeded to argue with us, possibly the worst service experience I have had in a restaurant.  A sincere apology would have done it; none was offered.  They were glad to see us go, but I assure you, not as glad as we were to leave.  Did we have a right to comment?  Absolutely.  Did we deserve to be treated like the problem because of bad sanitation practices in the restaurant?  Absolutely Not.  And I hope when the owners and staff read this  they realize that the worst thing you can do in our business is lack humility when addressing a genuine guest concern.  Great food and wine will never make up for  disdain for your guests dining comfort.
author: Catherine R.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant. The atmosphere is warm, the lighting is great, and the wait staff is awesome.  The food is delicious (the chicken rocks), but my favorite thing is the chocolate bread pudding.  Being a bread pudding freak, I can tell you that this is the best bread pudding in town! One night I was running home and stopped to pick up a piece of bread pudding for my fiance's birthday, and they gave me a packaged up piece of cake without charging me.  That is excellent service!
author: Rachel C.

description:
i love love love this place.

the food is great.  the wait staff is wonderful.  
i had the sardine (fresh) appetizer, watermelon salad (you have to order this!), duck entree (very good), creme brulee and the macademia ice cream.  i would have the same exact meal again.  the potato leek soup is very good as well.  i have nothing but praise for the food and service.

the lamb looked really good while i was in the restaurant.  the fish and mussels did not look special.

parking is difficult, take the hyde cable car there if you can.  definitely make reservations.
author: tc h.

description: I can't shake the feeling that this restaurant should be on www.stuffwhitepeoplelike.com , but my second trip was so much better than my first that I feel the need to write about it. Wine list not spectacular, but solid. Service is very good. Standout cheese plate in a town with a lot of cheese plates. The food was great. Not particularly inventive, but quality. This would be the best restaurant in a lot of  America's smaller cities, and that's what it feels like to me.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Dined here twice.  First time, great experience.  Second time, bad--simply because  their wine list went ridiculously expensive.  Wrote e-mails to their website, no response.  Inexcusably lame.  How 'bout just an acknowledgement to a customer who took the time to write?
author: Tony M.

description: Must give a shout-out for one of my all-time fave SF restaurants, which just happens to be in my hood. Ownership changed a bit ago, but the food is still amazing. Fantastic soups, AWESOME bread salad, and a good entree selection await you after exiting from your cable car, cab, or 45 bus in this no-parking-in-sight location. It's hard to pick THE perfect main, but the flat iron steak is always super, chicken is consistently wonderful, pork is phenomenal, halibut amazingly flaky and light. But the reason I'll ALWAYS go back is for THE one perfect creation on this planet...the chocolate bread pudding...sigh. Ambiance is charming, intimate, and very SF. If you can manage a weeknight reservation, you'll find it to be a less busy, take your time affair...weekends are VERY booked generally and require advance planning, unless you want to drop in for seating at the teeny tiny bar...but hey, sometimes you got to do what you got to do for the perfect mid-to-high end indulgence.
author: Julia C.

description: How to culminate a weekend with mom visiting along with her friends? all of whom had completed the Nike womens marathon earlier that day. Rather than go with an easy default that I had been to before I always love to try new restaurants (new to me at least). The easy middle point between her hotel and my pad would be Russian Hill where there is a plethora of good eats. I have heard for a while now about Frascati on the corner of Hyde and Green. When the weather is warm and the Indian Summer is in effect Hyde street is not a bad place to waste some time. This is definitely a restaurant you set foot in and say to yourself, "ahh, San Francisco". Just the way it is put together, the cable car track steps outside the door, the camaraderie of the patrons and the small loft upstairs was uniquely San Franciscan. As I walked up to our table of six on the second story I over heard a man say, "this is one of the best restaurants in San Francisco." Normally I would dismiss this as bystander banter but this man had a sport coat . . .  with elbow pads and we all know nothing says dining connoisseur like elbow pads. Not only was the food excellent from top to bottom but our waiter was the perfect complement to a good meal. They must send their staff to adjective camp because this guy could have been describing mud and I might have ordered it. No Pinot Gregio? Ah well, lets just get the one the waiter recommends, damn that was good. I had the Pork Chop and was not disappointed one bit. Decent size and excellent (I think I need to go to that camp) taste. The salient menu item of the night though was the bread pudding for dessert. You know when you bite into something and it tastes so good that your jaw locks for a half second? I think that is the eating equivalent of casino bells and whistles going off. Basically the restaurant was  saying, "Congrats Mr. Papageorgio, you are the winner tonight." Seriously one of the best desserts I have ever had. Lets put it this way, it would take a very rare restaurant to get me to Tivo Game 7 of the ALCS and not be paranoid all night about the score. Granted food and family were involved but Frascati came through with flying colors.
author: Chad B.

description: I just took my aunt to Frascati for her birthday and we both loved everything about this restaurant. The food and the service were outstanding. I ordered the linguine w/ sausage and thoroughly enjoyed each and every bite. My aunt ordered the duck and soaked up every last ounce of it with the extra bread the waiter brought over.   I would definitely recommend going to this quaint neighborhood restaurant.
author: Erin R.

description: if you have not had the chocolate bread pudding from Frascati - then drop everyting and pop in there for a decadent treat.  sure - their dinners are fabulous - but the bread pudding is incredible.  i often go just to share with a friend (it's perfect for two) and enjoy a glass of dessert wine.  it's the perfect way to celebrate anything and feel special.
author: Kate F.

description: adorable place. even better food. staff is incredibly knowledgeable about their menu and wine selection. fabulous for a cozy (but expensive) date or special event.
author: miss lisa k.

description: Went to Frascati last night.  Had a nice meal. Ordered a great bottle of Pinot which one of the waiters picked out which was very good, not extravagant though.  We had the Asparagus which was cooked nice, but nothing special on the flavor.  I had the mussels which were in a broth with sausage.  I found it to be not that hot so I felt I had to eat it quickly because by the end it was getting cold.  Overall, a good dish though and the mussels were very fresh.  The main dishes came too quickly.  Probably only a few minutes after we finished our apps so part of my 3 star rating is because of that.  I had the Halibut.  The fish was cooked perfectly.  The fish was the best part of the dish.  The sauce was great but not enough to go with the fish.  The salad below it didn't make too much sense.  It didn't really go well with the fish and the octopus was a little tough and chewy.  The octopus had a nice flavor but it needed to be heated.  The place is great though.  Very quaint and a great place for a date.  Get the table upstairs next to the stairs.  The bathroom is tiny and quaint just like the restaurant ;)
author: Mitch A.

description: Excellent neighborhood restaurant .  I went on Saturday night and loved it again. I had the pork with sausage and could barely give it up to share my meal. But then my BF ordered the chicken which I thought wouldn't be much. I was wrong! It was amazing, so moist and tender with the most amazing crispy skin. The wine list was great but we took the waiters suggestion of the daily special wine which was great. The waiters and the host are gracious and friendly. Can't wait to go back.
author: Cbr A.

description: Absolutely phenomial from start to finish! The service was top of the line, the wine was incredible, and every dish was my favorite because they were all ridiculously delicious! I would give more than 5 stars if I could quite honestly. I will definitely be back ... SOON!
author: Patricia M.

description: Had Dinner there on thursday - 9/24 /09 - special bday .. Was late by 1/2 hr -- no problem - held the table - and the food .. OMG ..  I been a new york boy all my life - never have I eaten better italian food then here .. Italy included .. Cant  go wrong with anything on the menu -- bread pudding .. at the end will knock u out .. !!!
author: JOSEPH R.

description: Great Service! Even though its two floors, its very quaint. We heard good things about it previous to coming. It was a great experience. Our server was attentive. The food was delicious. We had a great tomato salad, I had the pork chop. It was big, so I had some yummy leftovers the next day. The food was very flavorful. I was stuffed but it was all good.
author: Master C.

description: I have been to Frascati twice. The first time i had a very good meal(cant remember what it was). The second time was last week. For an entree i had the halibut. It was an average piece of fish, a bit overcooked and dry. I concur with other reviewers about the bread pudding, my guests said it was awesome. Normally i wouldnt mention service unless it was outstanding but on this particular occasion it was perhaps the worst i have ever experienced. The only thing our waitered delivered with any forethought was attitude. He made my out of town guests wonder what the hell was up with "your town". The guy(tall reddish hair) disappeared on us half way through the meal and we were left with having to ask another waiter to assist us(which he did and provided impeccable service).   I would have given this a higher rating had it not been for the crappy waiter...Needless to say, i wont be going back any time soon which is too bad because this is a very quaint place in a great location.
author: Not M.

description: Finally dropped into this place after walking by it every day for the last few months. It was as good as everyone told me. The meal got a little bit hazy by the 4th bottle of wine, but I remember the gnocchi was excellent. Apparently the cheese plate was good as well, as we found a second one in a to-go box on our couch the next morning. So many restaurants in this city to try, but Frascati may deserve regular status.
author: Pfeif E.

description:
Headline: Warm, cozy neighborhood atmosphere with excellent and fresh food, fine variety on the menu and service with unbelievable timing

Atmosphere: I have to say I love Hyde Street.  What a charming street with the patently SF architecture and cable car tracks with street-lining trees and a nice mix of quiet and Saturday gentle nightlife buzz. Set on the corner of Green, this little enclave is a joy to step into. It's a really warm, quaint, cozy feel with a nice vibe to it. The small wine bar and open-air kitchen give it a streak of modernity/trendiness I liked. Got there a little early but were seated nevertheless on the balcony overlooking the main dining area and kitchen. A fine spot to look around, enjoy the food and chat. Thanks to a very nice host.

Food: I think the real critics would call this a "well-appointed menu."  I consider the menu to be a awesome variety of entrees and clever assortment of appetizers and soup/salads. To wit: the entrée list contained one of each type of animal (is that crass?). One steak dish, one venison, one chicken, one duck, one sea bass, one halibut, one vegetarian (sorry, folks), etc. Sure I missed a couple of 'animals.' I love this variety and I understand it changes as the website says so and its menu is different than the one currently in use. For apps and salad, went with the gnocchi platter and grilled bread salad. Normally I'm not a gnocchi fan but had a craving and found Frascati's to be in the upper echelon. And with truffle oil drizzled on it, what doesn't taste good? For entrees, went with the unique dish in the venison (double checked with our waiter and got the affirmative "it's excellent) and partook in the rib eye steak of my companion.  Both were very tasty, reasonably-sized in their portions, and comprised of quality ingredients. I won't go delve into the taste details Iron Chef style as I just can't. Dessert: none.

Wine: Like the menu, the (by the glass) wine list is a good variety of types of wine. Well-selected. Like the food, wine critique is a shortcoming of mine, but the four different glasses of red wine we had and the remarks by our waiter were very good.

Service: I just can't believe these guys' timing. I was looking around for a little table cam they use. Drink order requested as soon as we were ready. Appetizers ditto. Entrees ditto ditto. Water, wine and bread refills done on point. Plates cleared and dessert menu placement swift swift.  Jesse was our main water and found him to be friendly, not intrusive, and very attentive. Good wine knowledge to boot. These guys work together well, are pretty cool, and have this meal service thing down pat.

After this fine meal, which was a fair amount of food between every course, we were still able to make it down to Harlot and spend the rest of the night in comfort. I like that. Thanks Frascati. You inspired me to write my first review.
author: Al B.

description: i love the location and the setting of the restaurant.  the service and decor definitely provides a warm and intimate ambiance.  was able to try the quail, duck, pork, and lobster risotto. the food is pretty standard but sufficient for this type of restaurant. the experience and ambiance is what makes this restaurant a 5 star place to me.
author: Molly C.

description:
Probably a strange thing to say about this type of restaurant but boy do they know what to do with a potato.  Every part of the meal we ordered seemed to have potatoes with it and that is what we continually oohed and aahed over.  The pan fried gnocchi was hands down the best I have ever had.  My husband had the duck for his entree and it was prepared in a way that made us really question if it was duck.  I don't know how to explain it, it wasn't bad, just different.  My husband adored the spaetzle that came with it and I think he would come back just for that.  It's been awhile since we were there, but I think I ordered the filet, which was great but pretty standard.  The potatoes that came with it were also excellent and very different from the other two we had tried.   For dessert we had the Warm Black and White Chocolate Bread Pudding but we got it with the vanilla ice cream because my husband doesn't like nuts in desserts.  It was a satisfying end to the meal.  

We went to this restaurant to celebrate our first anniversary in CA.  We were not disappointed.  I told the host when I called that day to make the reservation and he gave us the one table that sits next to the window so we could clearly see the cable car coming and going.  The neighborhood is cute and we enjoyed riding the cable car to and from the restaurant.  The wine list seemed reasonably priced and we were able to find a wonderful Châteauneuf Du Pape in our price range.  The place is small so I recommend reservations, but I don't think they are hard to come by.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Was in SF for one night only on a Saturday Night. Called Allegro but was shot down, we were gonna maybe just do  a few apps and drinks at the hotel bar when I decided to try Frascati at around 6pm, they said they were booked but we could come down and give it a shot but  they stop seating @ 9:45.  After a nap and a couple in room cocktails we realized we were starving and decide to try to make it there by 9:45, taxi only took like five minutes but when we rolled up the host first told us they were done for the evening, (it was almost 10)  I was  glad to see that the restaurant was actually full, I then noticed a couple leaving a cute table upstairs, he must've have seen me notice cause he then said "you know what, if you can order kinda quick we can take you" . They cleared it quickly and sat us with urgency but we never felt rushed or pressured at all. 
    We had immediate service picked an app and two entrees on the fly.
We had the bison carpaccio which was awesome, so tender it literally melted, seriously like changed sizes, couldn't really taste the white chocolate flakes but all the other flavor was amazing. After we finished the gf summed it up by saying "Can I get  a stack of about a hundred of those?!"
   My girl went with the seafood fettuccine and I had the venison. Both were awesome! I hate pesto, yet I kept grabbing bite after bite of her fettuccine and every bite had several pieces of calamari, so much she even left some. My venison suggested rare to medium rare and was absolutely flawless. I'm so glad I didn't notice on the menu that it came with garbanzo beans cause I'm not usually a fan but the beans were even amazing. For dessert we had the white chocolate bread pudding cause I heard it mentioned on this site and it was  so good.
 One of the best meals I've had in along time accompanied by really friendly and helpful staff.  Went to a highly recommended restaurant in Napa the next night and felt so disappointed. We both agreed later that there was nothing really wrong with the place it just wasn't Frascati!
author: Derek S.

description: well finally ventured out that ways to try the 'in'famous bread pudding to celebrate my new years..we shall get to the bread pudding in a bit, the food was good - the gnocchi and the ahi tuna - which i should have tasted first before adding the wee bit of extra salt on one side. the only thing i didn't like about the entree was that they paired the ahi tuna with the thinghy belonging to the raddichhio(sp?) family - and yes the bread pudding was realy really good, one of the few good ones i've had thus far. it's close to the best ones. and the staff was excellent - albert and scott were friendly and hospitable. No it was not a date night as i went 'solo' and would recommend going alone also if ur new in town.
author: jigi s.

description: Excellent service (by Scott), risotto cooked just right, pasta dish was spicy, but tolerable, gnochhi appetizer was spot on (with favas and english peas), Ridge wine (not the high end) matched the meal and lastly, even I liked the mixed berry dessert.  Any problems?  Yeah, while a good menu, it is ltd.  I believe it changes often, but it is very small.  Not that that's a bad thing....
author: AJ L.

description: At 350 for 2 on Valentine's Day, the food  and service should have been good, but it was not even close.  The only thing that was memorable was the cold lobster bisque with no lobster in it because I truly couldn't believe they would serve that.    How about a complimentary glass of champagne on such an occasion when charging 95 a head?
author: emily g.

description: Amazing! They also have a small room on the second floor where we had a group dinner for 12 that we perfect. The food and service are terrific.
author: W D.

description: We have been to Frascati three times and it is always great.  On our last visit we had the pork tenderloin and it was wonderful.  The servers are great and the space is cozy but cute.  The best seat in the house is upstairs looking over the kitchen.
author: B K.

description: Just a really fantastic meal in a great ambiance.  The staff is very friendly but not intrusive.  A great place for a get together or a date.  The gnocchi is fantastic...and the halibut was very good.  The mango sorbet is just heaven for us lactose intolerant folks.
author: Roy K.

description: I am fortunate to live nearby, as it's not only a great neighborhood spot, it's one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  The food never disappoints, the wine list offers a great selection at not so outrageous prices, and the service is phenomenal.  John and Brian are very welcoming and Basilio knows his food and wine.
author: courtney c.

description: Right across from Luella and just as good.  The chicken was tasty and well cooked.  Not dry like most restaurants.  The food was fresh, retaurant clean, and staff was very friendly.  If you can't decide on a wine, they let you taste a bit of everything.
author: K T.

description: This place is the best, I wish I could eat here almost every night. It is perfect for dinner with friends, a date, a celebration, with parents, whatever! The shortribs are always delicious as is the famous bread salad. The service is very friendly too. A great idea too is to grab one of the few bar seats for dinner.
author: B.M. B.

description: Absoulte LOVE!  This place has great food, in a great neighborhood and exceptional service.  I definitely recommend as a great date night or when the parents are in town.  YUM!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I have to add my two cents about Frascati.  I love this place!  I have eaten here a few times and the food and service are both excellent.  We went here for my birthday last year and every staff person wished me a happy birthday (in addition to the candle on the dessert).  Last time we ate at the bar where, at some restaurants, service takes a dive, but again we had an excellent experience.  I appreciate the good wines by the glass as well. Highly recommended. 
A word to people who complain about parking -- I know that some places are difficult to park near and, after a bad experience outside the restaurant it may be hard to wind down and enjoy the meal, but you need to toughen up or stay out of the city.  Maybe you had to feed the meter every 20 minutes and for that reason wiil never go back, but don't make that a reflection of the restaurant itself.  Be an adult and pay for valet parking or a garage, or leave the house early and wear comfortable walking shoes. Thank you.
author: Kryss A.

description: This is a great little neighborhood restaurant!!  Great food, wine, service and atmosphere!
author: Amy B.

description: Every time I have come to Frascati I have been impressed with the knowledgeable staff. The menu is small but each dish is perfected. The wine list is very extensive offering a wide variety of reds, whites, and champagnes. The only difficult thing is getting a reservation. It is next to impossible to just walk in and be seated.
author: Jennifer A.

description: The old neighborhood restaurant, the romantic getaway or the warm place to catch up with old friends?  This restaurant dabbles in all these categories.  My dad happened to be in town on business and decided to drop by and take me to dinner.  We ate at Frascati, an excellent choice!  The ambiance was very comfortable, intimate, a good mood setting in order to get to know your fellow diner.  A great place for my dad and I to catch up.  I started with the Smoked Salmon Bruschetta...AMAZING!!!!  The salmon practially melted in my mouth.  The bread was grilled, the outside perfectly crunchy with an exquisite avocado spread.  The bread was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, perfection!!!!  The salmon was smoked perfectly and had a creamy white sauce on top.  I cleaned my place to say the least!  I followed with an asparagus salad, it was good.  Nothing special or memorable about it.  I would go with something else.  My main course was the Halibut.  Perfectly seared and perfectly seasoned!!!!  It is served with beans and green beans, they compliment the fish amazingly!!!  I once again cleaned my plate, if it weren't for the other diners I would have been licking my plate clean!!!!!  We finished with the bread pudding.  Born and raised in the South I know my bread puddings and this one is one of the best I have ever tasted.  The hazelnut ice cream it is served with has great texture and to die for taste!!!  The chocolate bread pudding has a hint of coffee or espresso in it and really does the pudding good!!!!  Try this dessert because you will not regret it!!!!!  All in all Frascati is a place I will go back to time and time again to catch up with old friends and enjoy romantic dinners.
author: Katii S.

description: My wife and I eat here often.  Oozes charm and always a great meal with friendly competent bright staff.  We like to bring out of town friends here.  Mostly a local crowd, right on the cable car line and it screams "Yes, you're in SF".
author: Peter S.

description: Favorite Italian in the city.  Rustic, cozy, excellent service.
author: A A.

description: i went here for the first time the other night and wasn't impressed. word on the street was that they got a new chef. the food was okay - i've had much better. i really enjoyed the wait staff - recommended a couple of good wines. if anything, i'd come back for dessert. i had the apple dessert - very very good.
author: Miss O.

description: Went here for an anniversary after reading the Yelp reviews. We probably won't be going back. The manager was great, checking on us and making recommendations. The waiter was a bit pretentious, though I'm sure his french accent didn't help. We had foie gras to start (with chenin blanc), it tasted like pate, cold on the inside, unremarkable. A mixed green salad, bitter greens and stinky cheese, good, but nothing special. We had a bottle of zin which we were a bit disappointed in, but we didn't ask for recommendations (since I was sure he'd try to sell us something expensive), so it wasn't their fault. Then lamb shank, very tender, but dry at the edges and quite fatty, with a flavorless sauce, and duck breast, too burnt on the skin side, with delicious spaetzle. Affogato for dessert was good. Ambience was fine, sat by the window, watched the cable cars roll by. After tip, $185 for two people. If I'm gonna be spending that kind of scratch, I want better.
author: Matt G.

description: We have always loved, loved this restaurant for years but we recently had a notably bad experience, in service.  We have our daughter's birthday celebration dinner and we brought a little cake.  Our waitress offered to cut the cake and add ice cream to serve.  I expected that we would be charge for the ice cream and some nominal serving charge.  We were charged $9 per person for the service charge PLUS the scoop of ice cream at $4 person.  For six people, we were charged app $90 for serving of the ice cream!  I mean buying separate individual desserts for 6 people would of been less costly.  I mentioned this to the manager, that we had been patrons of the restaurant for years, and I thought the charge was a little over the top, considering this was a small cake, just for six people to celebrate our 8 yr old daughter's birthday dinner.  He basically admonished me for not knowing the BRING YOU OWN CAKE policy!!!  I told him that this was a little last minute request of our 8 yr old daughter and basically, he was not accommodating at all.  I told him that this entire process left a bad taste in my mouth, especially considering that I had told him when I made the reservation that Frascati is one of our favorite places where we often have dinners there to celebrate big milestones in our family.
author: L J K.

description: This place was excellent. We called on a Thursday night and they were able to fit us right in. They reserve the front 2 tables for walk-ins and there is bar seating. The host was friendly - ran out the door as we were leaving to wish us a good night. The waiter was friendly and attentive as well. I'm not sure if the menu changes daily/weekly. We ordered the Risotto with Italian Sausage and it was excellent to start as an appetizer. We both ordered a salad to start off - mixed greens with goat cheese and persimmons. Perfect portion and the persimmons were a nice touch. We got the rack of lamb - cooked to perfection and the cod, which was buttery and creamy. For dessert we ordered the chocolate bread pudding - it was to die for. It came out gooey and warm with a nice crust on top and some hazelnut ice cream. Can't wait to go back. Would recommend getting a reservation to avoid the wait on a weekend.
author: Renee C.

description: yum yum yum!  amazing food. excellent service.  pleasant atmosphere.  if they have the wild boar pappardelle on the menu when you go, order it .  Very filling  - good for sharing.  the butternut squash primi piatti was also phenomenal.  enjoy this neighborhood treasure.
author: K M.
